review_body: 0880611 They are advertising staycations, but the pool is closed due to the Coronavirus , how dumb are they, chlorine is the only thing that will kill the virus. They should make everyone go in the poolI think we are going to far as to cancel everything, yes you have to take precaution, wash you hands and don’t touch your face, but to close down the one place where there is no virus is just plain stupid

This was our home away from home for 4 nights. The room was clean and up to date. Bed and furniture comfortable. Elevators clean. Nice view. Pool area nice. Staff friendly. We never heard our neighbors, if we had any. We were driving a rental car and there was plenty of parking in garage. Located towards the Diamond Head end of Waikiki Beach. Short walk to beach, zoo, and various restaurants, even a Domino's and Denny's within walking distance. Bus stop close by. If we are back in Hawaii we would stay here again.

We spent 24 nights at this condo some of the great things about this condo front desk is amazing whatever you need they will look into it and you end up getting it before I got there I asked for a higher room and we ended up getting the 27th floor overlooking the ocean the condo is about one block away from Waikiki Beach it's a good 4 to 7 minute walk depending on how fast you go it's in the centre of all the locations and eating areas that you'd like to do my wife and I like walking a lot so we could actually walk from there to 90% of the places that we ate a lot of food trucks probably have a block away Diamond Head the aquarium the zoo shopping and some of the famous restaurants that are in that location and when we did go to Waikiki Beach we stayed where the wall was in the ocean to prevent the wave so it was a lot calmer and also the saint was a lot better it wasn't on a slope it was flat highly recommend going in that area you're right the fish to snorkel to see in that area and cross the street tons of places for a family to eat we did rent a convertible Mustang for 3 days highly recommend doing this the vehicle was great on gas which we only filled up half a tank in 3 days getting back to the condo Big Daddy's on the 5th floor have a pool hot tub BBQs cook food if you want been with the family there before family of 6 at the time and it still felt okay huge fridge stove eating area we hit Costco for a bunch of food that worked for us if you have any questions just send them to me I'll try to answer them for you

I am completely happy with my recent stay at the Aston! Not only were the rooms great, but the customer service was exceptional. Both the front desk agent and bellman went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. The rooms were great (we needed two for the six of us) and the pool area was really nice. The kids also liked the little play structure by the pool too. To add to it, the location was great and we were able to walk everywhere we wanted. Can’t say enough great things! Would definitely recommend.

The Aston banyan has been our go to place every time we have been to Hawaii, the units are very clean and comfortable with great amenities.The location to everything is great and local transportation is just around the corner.We have stayed 4 times and each tome they look after us due to loyalty.The staff are awesome and happy to accommodate your needs if possible.

Location is very easy to access for the beach. They have bbq place, swimming pool but not big and Jacuzzi in outside. They have some DVD rental service but I didn’t use it. When I check in they give free small bottle of water and some beach bag sets. Because they under construction for jacuzzis so I couldn’t use it. At the ground floor has small shops and small cate. Food and drinks were not bad and at cafe staff are friendly. My room was sea side and also mountain side. Honestly, I liked mountain side. Can see some rainbow and beautiful sky so I like it. Sea side was can see tiny ocean from between high buildings so mountain side is better view.スタッフに日本語は通じません。私は海側より山側の景色がいいと思いました。アクセスが良くて食材を持ち込んで外でBBQもありと思いました。値段を見ると満足でした。

We have stayed at Aston Waikiki Banyon many times in units managed by Koko Resorts. This year it seems they no longer supply BEACH CHAIRS. Instead they offer heavy metal Camp chairs which are too heavy to lug to Waikiki Beach. Baffling. And it is not much fun sitting in a high Camp chair at the beach.Too weird for words. The prices here have increased significantly in the past 3 years and now no beach chairs.... unacceptable....We spend weeks here, retired snowbirders, so besides the usual tourist activities, we enjoy R&R in a beach chair.

Room/Hotel is well located in the Southern end of Waikiki. 1 block from zoo, beach, restaurants, coffee, etc... Room itself left a less impressive imprint with very dated kitchen, broken drawers (at least the ones you could open), Broken cable on TV so neither TV worked, mold in shower corners, broken slider on bedroom divider, and hotel hallways never cleaned by staff (ie, vaccumed) the entire 7 days we were there. (dirt, food debris, small pieces of glass, etc.. all on floor the entire time we were there without ever being cleaned up). Beds were hard and creaky - felt more like cheap Motel beds. Room basically needs a full update. Pool was busy, with only 1 out of the 2 hot tubs open for use without explanation. And if you are in a rush, even with 4 elevators, you will need to be very patient. Can be waiting more than 10 minutes at times mid-day. Still gave it a 3 out of 5 simply due to the location, and the minimal time spent in the unit.

We stayed here for 11 nights in January 2020. For the price of the room, location and amenities, it fit the bill for us.The room was large, had a full kitchen, and the bed very comfortable. The decor was tidy, if not a bit tired. The wall above bathroom rail looked as though the rail had been ripped off the wall and hastily re-patched. The pool and spa area was simple and appeared well used by all guests. Unfortunately for 3 days during our stay the pool/spa area was cordoned off without notice. Noise from the road was incredibly noisy in our room on the 21st floor. I think this is just a Honolulu thing - the streets were busy almost around the clock. The soundproofing between rooms was great, we didn't hear any guests during our stay.Location of the hotel is good - one block from the beach & Waikiki strip. Great restaurants nearby - check out Lulu's for dinner and happy hour.

Condo style accommodation very bright and spacious. Has a living room, full bedroom, kitchen with oven, dishwasher, full size fridge utensils, coffee maker and lots of storage space. Washroom is a bit older in terms of features the water pressure was just ok. TV, wifi, safe, iron and ironing board all in the room.Location is very convenient only 2 blocks from Waikiki beach and 2 blocks to all types of shopping: Nordstrom’s Rack, Macys, Ross and even upscale shops such as LV & Omega within 10 minutes walking distance.Many good restaurants close by as well as ABC stores. There is a convenience store and coffee shop located right in the facility.There is a pool, tennis court and laundry facility right on site.

We stayed as a family having booked the apartments many months in advance. Having seen mixed reviews we did have some concerns, but found the staff friendly, the location great and our apartment being very roomy, clean, good quality fittings with a great outlook. Housekeeping staff were always prompt, friendly. We opted for the King & sofa bed option. Sofa bed was good quality queen which was very comfortable. We were on the 23rd floor, overlooking the pool etc. Just a few minutes walk to the beach, also many food outlets in immediate vicinity by including Burger King, McDonalds, Denny's, Domino's and a very nice 24 hour restaurant across the road at the Hilton Waikiki. In house coffee shop and convenience store. Waikiki Trolley stop around the corner. Laundry located on each floor $2 per load. We loved our stay, would highly recommend and would stay here again.

First time staying here. I just picked it from the internet. There are great and very helpful! I had a problem with my bill at the end of our stay. The manager came out and let me know what had happened and adjusted it for me. (It was a typo.) Beautiful hotel!

I was waiting in the lobby for the 3PM check-in when the security suddenly took away my bags, opened them without my permission and threatened to call cops on me because I "might have a bomb." The concierge was loudly laughing at me when I confronted the security about this. I told the security it is racist to make such an assumption and they said they were "sorry that I felt that way." I called the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in my country, which told me to wait for a call from the Embassy in the US. The hotel saw this and gave me a full refund. This is easily the worst hotel I have ever been to. I would not recommend this place to anyone. I also stopped using hotels.com after this incident because of their unwillingness to help. 150자 가까이 썼는데도 계속 50자 이상 쓰라는건 뭐죠? 한국어가 아니라서 인식을 못 하나요외교부까지 부르게 만들었던 호텔입니다 절대 가지 마세요

I write this review the night before we leave and we are all very sad. We took our 3 children 18, 14 and 6. It's not a five star hotel if that is what you are after but very comfortable with self contained kitchen and great staff all round. Close to everything and we very much enjoyed staying here. Will definately be back to stay here again.

My husband and I are celebrating our honeymoon as we just got married a few days ago in Kona and decided to come to Honolulu for the rest of our honeymoon and it was the worst mistake we have ever made. I did thorough research online and thought that this hotel had decent reviews and the pictures looked nice enough. However after checking in and coming to our room (1-2411) we realized we were essentially catfished by this hotel IT LOOKS NOTHING LIKE THE PICTURES!!! The room looks like something out of the 70’s and the furniture is completely falling apart, the bed is hard as a rock and has springs popping out and the shower looks like it is literally under construction and leaks. There’s bugs crawling around the floor I don’t even want to open my suitcase in fear they will enter it. We tried to talk to the front desk about possibly upgrading room or getting a refund and they refused and said they sell the room “for the view” what a complete RIP OFF. Besides that they also said the resort fee can’t be refunded and neither can the parking. This place is literally the worst hotel I’ve ever stayed at and I’ve only been here for 2 hours. I expect a refund for the rest of my stay so I can go to a decent hotel and a refund on the resort fee and the rest of the parking days I have not used. The amount of time we have wasted trying to figure this out and stress from it merits this. I called Expedia to see if they can assist me (since I booked through them) in possibly getting a refund and they attempted to contact the hotel multiple times to no answer. This is my worst nightmare and I’m literally spending the first night of my honeymoon in Honolulu crying instead of celebrating. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!

This review is specifically written for Saudi. She was the front desk receptionist when we arrived. From the very first impression, she was rotten. No warm greeting, only a miserable "I hate my job" kind of attitude. I think the both the hotel and herself would benefit from her switching to a position that doesn't require a professional and warm personality. The hotel room was so far from pictures provided, we went right back down to just check out as soon as we could and get a new hotel. Saudi was the most unhelpful "customer service representative" we've ever encountered. She insisted on dismissing us to just "come back in the morning" because apparently, according to her, all of the managers were off duty and there was no way to contact anyone higher up than herself to resolve our issue. Saudi didn't even offer to take our hotel keys or make note of our early check out. I had to tell her to make note that we returned our keys only hours after checking in and were not going to be using the room, so the management had record of our check out activity. As an employee in the customer service industry, her attitude and unprofessionalism completely threw me off and disappointed me.

Hubby and I took our 4 kids then aged 18, 16,13,12 to Hawaii for 2 weeks. Upon arrival we could not check in as the check on company for us was not in the main reception but down a corridor by the janitors room. We then got to our room and the pin to the door was not working, so had to get that sorted. I booked the room for 6 of us. It was tiny. 2 double beds that were so hard it hurt our backs first night. The other bed was a fold out couch where you could feel every bit of metal and wire it hurt my son. We ended up buying blow up beds from Walmart and setting those up. 2 weeks of that. The bathroom. Was so tiny you could not breathe and it constantly had a weird smell. The hotel itself was OK. Great balcony view, pool and spa. And cafe by pool. Location is good to buses beach etcOther than that. Would not go back

We are staying for two weeks. We had two different reservations but the staff did some things and kept us in the same place for two weeks which is much appreciated.. Our mountain view was nice. the pool is heated and too warm but the beach is close by. Overall looking forward to our second week.

At arrival front of house staff were pleasant, luggage storage available if you arrive early as we did, lots of seating in the lobby. Very close to the Pink Trolley bus stop, Starbucks and the beach only a few minutes walk also an on-site shop for last minute essentials. Rooms were spacious, we weren’t able to get rooms next to each other, 1 room had 2 double beds which was perfect for the 4 of us and the other room had 1 king bed which did not suit the other 3 members of our group, however each room did have a foldout couch, not so comfy! The rooms had a full kitchen with utensils etc which was great and a balcony and the Aircon worked a treat. Swimming pool was great, however you need to hire the bball court/tennis to use. amenity fee is additional. Overall stay was pleasant not super flash but suffice for our group.

We are here at the moment in the middle of a 12 night stay. Our daughter us just beginning her study at University of Hawaii so have made this our holiday. Fantastically located in Waikiki, we are on 32nd floor with great views of the ocean and the mountains.The staff have been extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean, functional and the beds comfy. Great pool area on the 6th floor with loads of loungers. It was a long journey from the UK but glad we are staying here as it is so close to everything. Beach is literally 2 minutes away. Definitely recommend.

We were booked into this accommodation for 10 days by a very reputable travel company only to discover upon our arrival that there wasn’t any condominiums available! We weren’t given any explanation for this other than the front desk person telling us that they had “lost” some inventory. Asking why they didn’t contact me the reply was that they didn’t have our details. Why wouldn’t they have contacted the travel company to inform them of the conundrum? Very unsettling and disappointing to find out that you have to scramble to find accommodation elsewhere even though you have paid for it months in advance! After several phone calls to our travel consultant in Australia to inform her of our situation, we were eventually directed to a property for our stay some 3 hours later.No real concern was shown by the Manager but we were thankful that we had a great consultant back home that came to our aid.

I recently stayed at the Banyan in May 2019, we had a 1 bedroom condo with an ocean view on the 7th floor, the room was clean and comfortable with all the amenities including a washer dryer on each floor. Cant wait to get back in November 2019. Its close to everything Waikiki has to offer.

We showed up at 9PM after a long day of travel with a small child, with a reservation that had been in place for months and a deposit paid, and were told there was no room for us! Due to an 'overbooking' our reservation had been switched, without any notice or consultation, to another hotel on the far other side of Waikiki. We had been in touch with the hotel as recently as five days before our arrival, and there had been no mention any problems. The staff people had no information about the alternate hotel or what kind of room we had. With no time to research alternatives, we had to schlep our stuff back outside and wait for another cab. The Banyan said they would pay for the cab (how generous!), but they underpaid the route, leaving us with an ugly situation with the driver on the other end. Now we're spending our vacation in a hotel we had no input in selecting, on the end of Waikiki we didn't want. (We had chosen the Banyan in part for its location near the zoo and its tennis court.) We've stayed at Aston properties literally a dozen or more times. Never again.

Our room was old, outdated and uncomfortable! Nothing like the photos show. The only things they have going for them is location, price and the pool deck. We arrived at 2:56 and were told we had to wait until 3 to check in because our room wasn't ready, it took more than 4 minutes for the actual check in but whatever. Upon check out they tried to charge me for a roll away bed and when I said we didn't use one they made me wait for someone to physically check my room like I was lying! No ice machine but there is a bucket, the rental kiosk wouldn't let return my movies so here's hoping they don't charge me for those later because I had to return them at the desk and so far they proved to be pretty incompetent!

We stayed here 4 years ago in an ocean view room and decided to change it up to a Diamond Head view ( which still gets ocean views anyway) It meant the afternoon sun wasn't belting in on the room and you could enjoy a drink on the balcony later in the day.We were on the 34th floor and traffic noise was minimal, besides the never ending emergency vehicles that frequent Waikiki.Theres a coffee shop and a convenience store on site, and all other shops are within walking distance. The lifts can be damn slow though in Tower 1, often waiting well over 5 minutes to get a lift up or down.Not sure why, there are 4 lifts in operation.Our kids loved the beach being so close, and they are already looking forward to our next stay.Car park on site which helps.

My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the Banyan. Our room was clean, comfortable and the whole staff was great. We would definitely stay again. The Banyan is just a short block up from the beach. This property has a self-serve washer and dryer for convenience. Don't miss the Banyan Breeze coffee shop on site. Excellent coffee, muffins, service and fantastic strawberry dole whip.

My family and I totally loved our condo at the Aston at Waikiki Banyan! Accommodations were clean, comfortable and quiet and everything was in walking distance! We visited the zoo, Hard Rock Cafe, International Marketplace and of course those wonderful beaches! We enjoyed breakfast and lunch in the condo most days and eating out for dinner most evenings! It was a fun week for the whole family!

This was a quiet resort even though it was only a block from the beach. I traveled by myself on this trip to Hawaii and everyone was quite helpful and courteous at this resort. My room was clean and met all my needs. I walked a great deal and loved the convenience of the resorts location. Will be staying here again this year or next.

My wife and I together with two adult grand children enjoyed our stay at the Banyan.We booked separate rooms for the grand daughters.The people who run the front desk were always so nice and friendly. Very accommodating and helpful.The rooms were very clean. The rooms could both use some maintenance as they were getting a little worn out.The pool was closed for maintenance. Parking is an additional cost. The workers at the front desk helped us to get a discount on the parking...just another example of how nice they are.This is probably one of the best locations for seeing to all that there is around Waikiki. Plenty of places nearby to eat, shop, visit. Public transportation is very close and inexpensive.We liked it well enough to book a room here in October on our lay over to Tahiti.

We had 2 units booked for a 4 day stay. Both were 1bd/1bath units. The first unit was slightly updated, aged but clean "enough". 2nd unit was old, not updated so there were stained counter-tops, stained bathtub walls, stained couch/sofa bed, dirty shower curtains, dirty walls with chipped paint. It was unbearable to look at and you feel dirty just being in the room.We asked why it's such a difference between the rooms, and I was told that it depends on each condo owner, some may want to update it more often than others, and they can select different levels of house-keeping services too. We got switched to a higher level room, it looked a bit better but the sofa bed was broken so we had to get a rollaway bed - you can feel every spring on that thing! the beds looked clean 'enough' but they were also very uncomfortable. I think the best place to sleep in that room was the actually on the couch cushion where there were no springs. The 3rd unit's bathroom door doesn't close, so it's always ajar when someone's in it - good thing it was just the family and we've established that if it's mostly closed with light, then knock first.The price is great, but apparently the airbnb standards varies a lot in Hawaii vs other places. I'd NEVER book this place again.Oh yea, it's 2 blocks from Waikiki beach. Great location.

We arrived at the BANYAN after a cruise by coach.easy access waited to book in room not ready till 3 OK.When we arrived in our room great surprise very big great view to mountains fully self contained room every thing you need. very central to transport and shoping.

This Hotel is confusing and NOT good. Meaning there seems to be several different accommodation businesses going on. Some private.....some Hotel....some through a tour company. We would never stay here again sadly, not through the Hotel anyway. There are private condos in the building you can rent through elsewhere that are updated and much better just be sure the Hotel staff does NOT have aces to your room as we had travel documents stolen right out of our room.BEWARE AND LOCK UP YOUR IMPORTANT PAPERS AND MONEYTHE NOT SO GOOD THINGS: The first room we were given had only a double bed and looked like a homeless shelter There were 3 of us and we are all tall and had booked Queen beds.I should add we booked this hotel far in advance and were supposed to have a Queen size bed. When we went to the front desk to ask for a different room, the front desk lady actually told us when you book there are NO GUARANTEES? like WTH does that even mean? In what universe can you not book a hotel of your choosing ? Isn't what size bed you would like a standard choice when booking a hotel? They gave us a different room, it had a Queen size bed and a pull out couch. The bedding however was only double so we had to ask for a second set so we could at least have a blanket each. The room was grungy....carpet badly stained, crappy old kitchen. Crappy old bathroom, the whole place was sub par as far as cleanliness went. The sofa was torn and dirty. It was actually laughable how horrible the room was. Both beds had terrible mattresses....The pullout bed especially terrible....we had to make a decision to sleep on the thin mattress with the metal bars sticking into your back OR pull the mattress onto the disgustingly dirty carpet? choices you should not have to make when your paying for your accommodation.If I thought I could get a refund and stay elsewhere we would have. AND to top it all off our water was turned off for a day with no compensation given AND they wanted to fumigate in our room WHILE we were staying in it? Claiming it would be of no harm to us? Last time I checked the kind of poison to kill bugs is rather harmful. There are MUCH Better hotels in the same area at a similar price point. Elevators not reliable broke down several times during our stay. At least theres a bunch of them...lol...however I was honestly afraid every time I got in if it was going to break down.THE GOOD: Location was great walking distance from everything really. Our second room had a decent viewLobby is niceThe pool area was nice and seemed well maintained. Pick your pool time wisely though there was a LOT of children...Not appropriate if you are looking for quiet poolside reading...lolThey have an awesome deck with BBQs ( Electric not gas) and a Tennis court etc.... also a cute little cafe I think must be owned privately. Really good cafe style food. The lobby was nice and the staff for the most part other that the lady when we first checked in were friendly and helpful. Even though the kitchen was disgusting it was nice to have a fridge and a coffee maker.Overall....we wouldn't stay here again. A massive update is needed, I get when your in Hawaii most time is spent outside of your room, but basic cleanliness and a reasonable comfortable sleep should not be set aside.

This is a C grade operation in need of an injection of everything! The rooms are large and comfortable and the hotel is ideally situated in Waikiki but that is about all it has going for it! We would not stay there again with so many hotels in the area with comparible prices.

Great location, all week parking available for a price, twin towers with mixed views, pool and amenities. The room we had was nice, spacious and well equipped, with a balcony. The only downside is everything is old, and they charge you $25 a day for internet, which is useful, and a (free ?) newspaper, games console and 2 TV's that don't work - which isn't useful. So we basically paid $25 a day for intenet access, which is just a rort as everything else is completely unnecessary. Front counter staff could use some customer service training - I asked to borrow a calculator and was met with the response 'what do you want that for ?' errrm, I don't know, dry my hair perhaps ? Would I go back ? Yes I would despite the annoying surcharges at holiday end.

Check in was swift, but we had twin beds and I was sure I had booked a double. We asked to switch but the alternative room was of a poor standard, with rucked worn carpet and a dated kitchenette. We accepted the original room as it was the only option. Rooms are large and well equipped there is a mini mart and coffee shop on site. Given the prices in Waikiki it was great to have a kitchenette with fridge. The air con was a was a modern quiet unit. The pool/rec deck is good. Great place for a family stay. Location is excellent, only 2 blocks from the beach and near local bars restaurants shops etc. There is a garage for car parking too, but it’s expensive.

Family of 5 stayed here 6 nights. Great kitchen to prepare meals, saves money on eating out which can be expensive. A supermarket is a 10 minute walk from hotel only, super easy, and lots of buses pass by every 15 mins. Hotel is a little dated but who cares, rooms kept clean and pool area serviced daily. Pool can get busy during daytime so pick your times wisely! Friendly hotel staff and the little shop on site is great for everyday items.Would I stay again & recommend, definitely!!!

We stayed here twice in one week. The first 2 nights, the room we had was fine, a little dated but adequate..except for the mattresses, they needed replaced. The 2nd 2 nights we stayed, we paid for a slightly upgraded room and the mattress was better and the room looked more modern, but not really worth the extra $. Nice place but beware of the $25/night 'amenities' fee and $30/day to use their parking garage (not really another option). Also, a TV in the bedroom would have been nice, there's only 1 fixed-to-the-wall TV in the living/kitchen area.

I chose the Banyan because of its central location at Waikiki and low price but was pleasantly suprised how good this hotel was for me.All the necessities in the room for business and pleasure. A spectacular view, tea, coffee, toiletries and comfortable furnishing. This room had a fully equip kitchen should you feel like cooking a meal and sitting with a glass of wine watching the scenic view.More like a 4 star than a budget.Highly recommended for business, families and adventurers.

When you go to paradise, it is not necessarily to spend a lot of time in your room but this hotel banks heavily on the fact that you will not care about the condition of your room...because they do not. I have attached several pictures that show damaged furniture, stains/burn marks/holes in multiple places that have not been repaired, and even some sort of fluid on the walls. If they show so little attention to basic maintenance, I certain shudder to think what I would have seen with a black light. There are no staff elevators so every time I got in the elevator I had to stop on the staff floors and often they would go 1-2 floors (without a cart). The hotel is 10 years past due for a renovation but assumes that just because they are in Waikiki that they can continue to operate on the cheap and fill up due to their location. This was a motel 6 at a luxury hotel price. A dirty Motel 6.
user_name:
Dominic L
Allen, Texas, United States

review_body: Overall this was a good place to stay for 5 nights. Not luxury,but comfortable. We had an ocean front room on the 36th floor - great views!Pros: Location - we were able to walk to most places or a quick/cheap Lyft ride to places that were a wee far away for walking.Clean - The Room was outdated - but it was cleanStaff - Always helpful and niceAmenities - Room was stocked with everything we needed. Daily cleaning service was good.Pool/Hot tub - Nice WARM pool. 2 Hot Tubs. Area was kept cleanCONS:It's a bit run down. Our room was outdated (I think probably depends on unit). The sofa bed needs to be replaced. It was actually pretty gross and was terrible for sleeping. Waiting for elevators at times was a BIG PAIN. We ended using the stairs a few times. This may seem trivial, but almost every time we were in the elevator - construction workers or staff were always trying to squeeze in with us with a lot of their stuff - was hard for guests to get in a lot of times.Would have been nice to have a decent restaurant/coffee shop on property. Again.. not a huge complaint - just what makes it a decent place not a luxury resort.Would I come back? Yes.. It was a decent price for a condo and the location was good.

This spacious and fully-equipped apartment is in a great location, just a couple blocks from the beach, closer to the less-crowded part of Waikiki. We had a corner unit that had nice views of the mountains and even the ocean. The room is spacious, with a large living area, comfortable bedroom, fully equipped kitchen, and openable windows that enable a cross-breeze. Laundry facilities on every floor are convenient and even use the PayRange mobile app for payment without having to worry about quarters. In that sense, it's a great place to live with the convenience of being able to cook and do laundry, and currently a great value for the money.The trade-off is that the living spaces are very worn and tired, as the other reviews note. This may depend on the unit you get, but ragged window coverings, worn carpet, and the sliding doors and kitchen drawers and cabinets don't really operate smoothly. We also had to get rid of a few small bugs. The safe is old school with a key. It all works, but not attractively. Management responses indicate that a renewal plan is in the works, but that would still be a long way off. But of course, prices would likely go up after the remodel.Some things they could work on even before the remodel is the service--folks seem rather detached, and understaffed in the evenings, when there seems to be only 1 person who often gets backed up.We would stay here again, for the value and features, but it's currently not the most attractive place.

We stayed one night at this hotel and It was good for the money. The room although dated was very large and the bonus of a full kitchen is great to save money on eating out. I wouldn’t suggest a long stay for more than 2 people as my kids found the sofa bed very uncomfortable.

Aston is located in a great spot. This hotel like a lot in Waikiki is showing its age. However it doesn’t stop it still being a great place to stay. We reiceved early checkin and a free upgrade to Oceanview (Thankyou ) the too. Was equipt with everything with an amazing view. Pool area and with hot tub and tennis court were a great place to relax. Will recommend as an option for my clients for sure

Our family of 10 stayed here for 10 nights, splitting up into 2 X Standard Rooms + 1 X Deluxe Room. We enjoyed our stay here and no issues!! It's in a good location. Close to the beach and to Waikiki Zoo and about a 10 minute walk to the main shopping areas in Waikiki. We just caught a taxi back if we were too tired to walk. The lobby area was beautiful. I loved how it was open with a nice water feature / koi pond. There were 4 elevators in each tower so we never had to wait too long for an elevator. The rooms were a bit rundown, but they were still clean and well equipped. We also had a great selection of channels on the TV and the free wifi had a really strong signal in the rooms. Standard Rooms:One standard room had a great view of the mountain side of Waikiki, while the other overlooked the pool area. Both had a good size balcony, 2 x double beds, a sofa bed, full kitchen and bathroom. They were good sized rooms, so we were able to fit 5 people in one and 3 in the other.Ocean Deluxe View Room:This room was basically a standard room but on a higher floor. It was alot quieter on this floor though, but I personally wouldn't pay extra just for the ocean view as the view is obstructed by the Marriott Resort & Spa next door. You get similar view from the standard room at a more affordable price.The hotel offers parking, but we weren't able to use it as we hired a 15 Passenger Van which was too high for the parking lot. The pool and spa area was excellent, as well as the outdoor BBQs and the tennis / basketball court. We didn't have much interaction with staff during our stay, apart from checking in / out, but the staff we did see around the hotel were friendly and helpful. Each floor also has a laundry room with coin operated machines, you would have to bring / buy your own laundry powder. There's a small convenience store on the ground floor where you can buy powder otherwise there are plenty of ABC stores in the area.Overall we enjoyed our stay here! We would definitely stay here again if travelling in a large group.

Absolutely terrible!! Disgusting, rundown, dirty, old... After we first walked into our room, I started calling neighborhood hotels to get out of there. Kids were crying, parents disgusted...we couldn’t imagine staying there. Unfortunately all other hotels were completely booked and it was midnight so we had no other choice than to stay 2 nights. Nightmare! We showered with our slippers on, killed several cockroaches and tried not to touch anything we didn’t have to. Our quick getaway in Oahu was ruined! Front desk staff was also not helpful regarding any of our complaints, blaming lack of “power” to do any changes for us. The worst part was knowing that beautiful Sheraton Waikiki is only $15 more/night! Unfortunately they only had the first night of our stay available (it was already midnight) and then we’d have to go back anyway. This is a $50/ night “hotel”.

We stayed here to bookend a week long tour.OK the positive is the location. Right in Waikiki at the zoo end and an easy walk from Diamond Head to The marina. Check in staff were friendly but unable to help save us from an abominable room.1410 was an old run down room facing the north leaving us enviously looking at the Hilton across the road. The beds were incredibly hard and the sofa bed was so old the padding had gone leaving us lying on what felt like bare springs. The room itself was old but relatively clean... except for the chips in the sofa bed mattress discovered in opening it.Unfortunately we had a week away and then another two nights here. 2211 was a slightly better fixed room overlooking the pool. BUT the beds were still atrocious. We resorted to getting every blanket and duvet in the room and putting that on the sofa bed as a mattress to make the sleep tolerable. The bathroom was slightly better maintained in this apartment however the towels supplied are so small as to be unable to wrap around yourself.We were in the west tower and only 3 years of the 4 elevators was working. With nearly 400 rooms being serviced this meant a long wait for a ride.We thought the over night fee was slightly high but hey this is Waikiki. What is super annoying is the $25 a day resort fee. This gets you a dvd movie a day and access to the pool deck. This area is old and basic with one of 2 spas out of service meaning a cramped time in the only small spa available. The pool was busy so no laps able to be done without dodging kids.Wouldn’t stay here again and told our travel agent that if she respects her customers she would steer them elesewhere.

This was the worst experience I’ve ever had. The sofa bed was broken and we had to fight to get two rollaway beds for us to sleep in. The apartment was dirty and rundown. It was such a dissapointment The young lady at front desk while not to blame was unhelpful. Never again.

此飯店雖然離waikiki beach 有段距離,但大約5-10分鐘腳程罷了. 地點較清幽,也提供很大的停車場,出入非常方便.整棟大樓裡都是一間間帶有living room + kitchen 的 1 bedroom condo....2 double beds in a bedroom , 空間適合一家四口入住. Kitchen 也非常夠大,我們幾乎每晚在condo內自備晚餐. 房價CP值我覺得還算適中, 假如把餐餐外食費用一併算入,其實房價倒是合理價,非常值得推薦. 整棟大樓內有各式各樣不同的房型,都是隸屬於每個投資的個體戶,1樓的櫃台則是提供管理之責及房客服務的, checkin & check out可經櫃台,但基本上,我們都會email to the host for its check-in/ out.

It was our first family trip to Honolulu and staying at the Aston Waikiki Banyan for the entire stay. It was a fantastic stay. We stayed in the standard room which included two twin beds and the sofa bed in the living area. It was big enough for our family of five. It got to the point where our kids just wanted to laze about at the hotel and enjoy the pools. It's not your five star hotel, but it was great for us and we enjoyed our stay. We in fact loved it. The beach was a short stroll down the road and is in walking distance to shops and restaurants and even the Zoo. There is a bike hire stand in front of the hotel too. I would take our family back there.

We visited again in September 2018 as we found the Aston pretty good in 2017 and we were still not disappointed considering what some hotels are like. the first thing I would note is the staff were again awesome, we flew in again from LAX so our check-in is always late, the room we were offered was not suitable for our family sleeping arrangements but being that time of night the man on the desk advised we sleep on it for the night and he would shift us the next morning which was really nice of him and even though he was not working the next day he had already organized us a new room by the time we had gotten up. The only thing we find with this hotel is the rooms are a little dated but other than that as previously stated the staff are AWESOME, they bend over backward to accommodate and that is my main thing when traveling, i can deal with an average room but I can't deal with crap staff which is something you will not see here, the location is also great, would stay there again no worries.

The unit had everything you would need for a week in Waikiki. The A/C was quiet and cold. There was a parking garage and good security. The location was right next to Diamondhead park and within walking of the beach (2 blocks). There was a main road that takes you to the interstate quickly. Lots of restaurants and shops within walking distance. Our only complaint was the check in process. We were there at check-in time but nobody was in the office. We called the support number multiple times before we got a call back. Waiting with our luggage after flying for 10 hours was not comfortable. It took almost an hour before we got into our unit. Otherwise, the condo had good amenities and I would consider staying there again.

The hotel description was not accurate. We stayed in tower 1-2411 and it was a dump. Things are falling apart, bed had Springs poking through, cords all over floor creating trip hazard, shower leaked all over, owner of that unit should be made to update or lose privileges to rent. Also elevators take forever. Also pool and hot tubs closing at 9pm was way too early. Overall this property not good

Our family of 5 stayed in the hotel. It was perfect for our 3 small children and 2 adults. The check-in was quick and staff were friendly. They provided our children with sand buckets with shovels which they loved! The rooms seem a little dated but clean and comfortable. The kitchen had everything you need to cook, which helped a lot. We had a great view to the ocean. Parking was $30 a day, so we found parking by the zoo, which was walking distance, so we saved $140 (discounted rate). Location was perfect and convenient to shops and the beach, only 1 block away.
user_name:
Love to Travel S
San Bernardino, California

review_body: I stayed here with family so I had no say in the hotel booking just want to make that clear. Stayed on the 21st floor in the second tower. Dated room and furniture, 90s maybe? Noticed some of the rooms on the floor must be privately owned and looked a lot nicer. No breakfast or anything included but full kitchen so if you go for a small shop can have breakfast there. We had DVD rental included from a kiosk in the tower but the movies we rented kept pausing and skipping (probably from overuse). Location is ok, little bit of a walk to the “main” Waikiki area but if you don’t mind that it’s fine. Didn’t have time to use the pool area but had a look at it, again, average and a bit dated. If your not going to spend heaps of time in your room or the hotel then it’s a good enough stay I guess. Beds were firm and pillows were super thin.

I rarely leave reviews. I own a hotel & know that a guests satisfaction level is based on so many factors & personal expectations. I know first hand how hard it is to please everyone but this is far beyond personal expectations not being met therefore I felt compelled to write a review. We entered our room and the microwave was beeping with an error message that the panel needed to be replaced & front desk suggested unplugging it but the plug is locked behind a cupboard door. To make the beeping stop we had to turn the breaker off leaving us with a silent microwave but no functioning fridge. When accessing a plug to charge our phone, the lamp plug/cord exploded, split apart & shocked my husband. Went for a drink of water & the tap was spraying everywhere. This all happened within 30 minutes of checking in. The thought of having to spend the next 14 days here horrifies me. Nothing within the four walls of our room is inviting or comfortable or built/manufactured before the 1980’s. Hard beds, a pull out couch that is 8 inches higher at the bed head than at the foot of the bed, an air conditioner that is loud and totally ineffective. Went to front desk to speak to someone and after waiting over 5 minutes just walked away. Will try again in the morning. I’m sure that over the 37 floors there are some nice units but this definitely is not one of them. Thanks Waikiki Banyan for making my first night here memorable for all of the wrong reasons!

I recently spent a week staying at the Aston at Waikiki Banyan. To say I enjoyed my stay and was treated well is an understatement. This is my fifth stay at the Banyan. I find the staff are consistently polite and especially helpful. The staff who attended to me this time were Min, Nita, Cliff, Jonathan, Jasmin, Ozzy, Amado and Suafa. Each time I stay I find that there is always plenty of amenities, the Banyan is close to everything yet quite enough to enjoy a rest. Any requests o made were attended to promptly and attentively. I highly recommend the Banyan. Thanks for a wonderful stay.

From check-in to check-out the whole experience was 6 days of frustration and attitude.This Hotel/serviced apartments is old and in need of a lot of maintenance. No where in any of the advertising does it say this property is PET FRIENDLY for owner occupiers. Barking dogs was a regular occurrence.We drew the short straw and was checked in by Nina. Clearly this lady does not like her job and it shows with her attitude. On check-in I advised that we had just come from the Aston Banyan Maui. I further explained that I had left my medication at the property. There was no offer for Nina to contact the property and arrange for the medication to be sent. I contacted Maui on Tuesday afternoon. I was informed that housekeeping had not found my medication when the room was cleaned. I explained that I left it in the drawer in the vanity. As there were people in the room housekeeping were reluctant to disturb them. Clearly they did not understand it was prescription medication or they did not care. The following morning I spoke with management who told me they had recovered the medication and provided I agreed to pay the postage they would send. I explained that it needed to arrive on Waikiki by Friday as we were checking out Monday. When there was no of dispatch by Thursday I called again only to be told it would go to the Post Office that afternoon. I was told it only takes 1 day. Bottom line no medication and no charge to my credit card. Congratulation to the staff of Aston Banyan Maui for the apathy. I realise it was clearly my fault for leaving the medication however when reaching our for help it is expected that people in the service industry would be happy to help.We were given apartment 913 on check in. The owner of this property is not house proud. The furniture was old and uncomfortable (see photos). We asked Nina for a change of apartment. Her response was, doubtful we are fully booked. To avoid any further interaction Nina disappeared. We waited for her to returned and asked again. Nina advised that she would look at our request. She asked for a contact number and when told we only had our Australian cell phone number she said we would have to contact her as she can not call an overseas number. We were finally changed to apartment 2407. Not much better in terms of cleanliness however the furniture was a little newer and a lot more comfortable. We were told that this property become available as a guest of the owner had just cancelled. Apparently owner do not receive a daily service and someone at the front desk forgot to tell housekeeping and we did not receive service on day 1.Cliff provided fresh towels and toiletries however there was no offer of compensation for the lack of service. Servicing of the apartment is:Bed made daily and bathroom towels replaced.Rubbish removed.Bed linen changed every 3 days.There is a "Resort Fee" payable at the rate of $US 25.00 + tax per day which is payable in addition to the tariff. This fee covers tea and coffee, when they remember, DVD rental and use of Play Station, daily newspaper and WIFI. (Recommendation, refuse the items covered and do not pay the fee, there is no value. We had 2 days where the pool was closed. Attitude from the front desk was basically "can't help bad luck".WIFI not working one morning. A call to the front desk resulted in "Yes we know, we are waiting for the manager to come in and re-set the password. He should be in around 10am. I asked they call me when the password was reset. No call by 1020am. I called the front desk requesting an update. I was informaed that the password had been reset and the call was terminated. The term reset indicates the password was changed. I called back only to be told it was the same password.With the exception of Cliff the entire team on the front desk need to trained in customer service. Cliff at least displayed empathy. The management of the Aston Banyan Waikiki need to ensure that apartment owners maintain a standard of furniture and cleanleness. Overall I have given this property a terrible rating as Trip Advisor do not offer a lower rating.Thank you management and staff of the Aston Banyon at Waikiki for making our holiday and stay stressful.

Aston at the Banyan is a great choice while visiting the Waikiki area. It is economical, in a super location and is surprisingly large room. There is a full kitchen, bathroom, separate bedroom and a living area. Each unit has a private balcony. Ours is a balcony overlooking a direct view of the ocean. It is a block away from Kapiolani Park and the zoo and aquarium. It is very comfortable with lots of amenities for the guests: laundry, small grocery, coffee cafe, swimming pool, BBQ's, playground, tennis courts, free DVD's, WiFi and a island-style open air lobby. This is really a very comfortable hotel that isn't fancy but very well taken care of. We love it here. I would recommend it if you want a quiet place in a great location. If you have kids, I think this would be an ideal choice. It's like having your own apartment right in Waikiki!

This hotel has a fabulous location. Just a block from Waikiki beach and Kalakua Ave. It has. Fabulous pool deck with two hot tubs and lots of barbecue areas and a snack bar. The only issue I had was with the room itself. It was very run down and badly needed refurbishment. It did, however, have a great view from 29th floor. Good value for money with a bedroom, bathroom, living room, kitchen and Lanai. The aircon was great and the desk service was excellent.

Stayed in an apartment ocean view for a family of 5. Originally they gave us a room with a double sofa and a fold up bed and 1 bed in the bedroom . Was far too squishy so I asked if I could have a room with 2 doubles in the bedroom . They let me have a look at the room first and it felt so much bigger with the 2 beds in the bedroom . If you have a family of 5 make sure request room with 2 double beds in bedroom

1st, the view we had from our family room on 35th floor Tower 1, about $145/night, was just ate our hearts. Morning till night, anytime the view was just gorgeous, the mountains with clouds on our right pan through the Waikiki town then to ocean with surfers view. I was at lanai with my drink whenever we we're in the room.2nd, Facility and hygiene we're all good. Yes it was old building but renovated full kitchen, living room with sofabed, and a king bed. The interior was coordinated nicely calming color. I wasn't familiar with "resort fee" but I guess no tipping for daily bedmake, wifi from room, towels etc for. Only thing I want to ask was we don't care computer games and wished to be able to choose for the item for the resort fee. I liked their hygiene sets and coconut oil based products were good. It was so good that I took them home.3rd, staff were welcoming. Check-in&out was fast.Overall, not cheap to our standard but it was money worth staying place.

Always a pleasant stay when in Honolulu with great rooms and views. The kitchen is the added bonus to your stay if you do not mind cooking for yourself! Very airy and staff at front desk has the aloha spirit!

This is our 3rd stay at the Aston Waikiki Banyan - the past two stays were in 2012 and 2013. During this recent stay in 2018 we went through the Aston directly vs. VRBO - big mistake! The room is something out of 70’s. Single beds (hard as boards) had to be pushed together so we could have room for us plus our little one. (They don’t offer pack n plays or high chairs at the hotel). The kitchen was just abismal - furniture is heavily worn and unsafe for infants as it’s not stable and can easily tip over - appliances would be outdated in the 90’s - now they are just sad. The standard here continues to decline. Would recommend looking elsewhere if you want to enjoy your family vacation in Waikiki.

We were close to everything & the hotel had great amenities.We were able to loan beach towels to take to the pool or beach.They had a coffee shop & a small convenience store on site.Also washing machines & dryers on every 2nd floor.We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

We stayed here many years ago and we’ve enjoyed staying here again.The rooms are comfortable and with special dietary needs, having a full kitchen is important. For familes it’s really a good idea even if you don’t have dietary requirements!The beds are comfortable, staff very friendly and helpful and the views from the balcony magnificent, whether towards the sea or mountains.

On the good/great side, the rooms are very comfortable, clean, very tidy and the view is amazing. So amazing we didn't like to close the curtains at all. We stayed on the 22nd floor. Everyone was very polite and very helpful. The pool was excellent and of a good size. On the down side, the bed was hard. But of course that's just my opinion. Would happily recommend this motel unless you`re wanting a very posh hotel/motel.

The resort itself is not bad but the rooms are pretty dated. Bit like going back in time. What is annoying is that they would have made so much money over the years but don’t invest back properly.The curtains had holes from sun damage and did not fit so you couldn’t make the room dark.The apartment was ok for plates and cups ect so we could breakfast in the room ok.I wouldn’t stay here again but would pay a bit more and stay somewhere else.Staff were helpful though, but you could tell they are not happy deep down but they are ok with customers.

We booked a room at the Waikiki Banyan because they are nice and roomy and have full kitchens.Our room was on the 31st floor and was very quiet with amazing views of The Ala Wai canal and hills behind Waikiki.Reserving the room and communicating with the property manager was easy. The complex is quite quiet and this made for a very peaceful stay. The furnishings were up to date and the beds were comfortable. The kitchen was well equipped with everything we needed. The room also came with some boogie boards, sun umbrella and chairs to use at the beach. As this was a private rental, there was no daily cleaning and no linen exchange but we had plenty of spares supplied in the wardrobe if required.The room came with a parking pass which really helped as elsewhere you can easily pay up to $25 per day. The Banyan is located a long block away from the beach and it is a manageable distance from the hustle and bustle of central Waikiki which we liked. The room cost was very reasonable, particularly as the parking was included, and it's hard to find another hotel with kitchen units and great views at this price.

We stayed in this Condo as part of our family trip to Canada and the US. The location is great and within easy walking distance of the beach and other places of interest. The condo was quite well equipped with all the basic essentials you need for a comfortable stay. We would definitely consider staying here again.

This is the second trip to O’ahu island, and our second time staying at the Aston and the Waikiki Banyan. The staff were absolutely amazing, the room was spectacular once again and the location is in a perfect place. 100% would recommend this apartment for any one staying in Waikiki. Room was stunning, so clean and very spacious. Well worth it!!!!!!!!!!!

We rented our condo through VRBO so we did not have any dealing with the front desk other than asking for the key to the restrooms in the lobby or begging for change for the laundry since we did not have linen service. We had a room 3014 on the 30th floor facing the south so you have a great view of the ocean. It has a full kitchen and was advertised as sleeping 4, but it was tight for all of us to fit. The extra bed that was included was a "futon mattress", but looked like a patio chair pad. The cost of the room was great compared to others that we looked at and the price has since been increased, but still better than other options out there. One long block away from the beach. Pool was closed for our last two days due to a leak. The VRBO arranged another pool for us to visit right across the street. Parking garage is tight, but is included in the rental. Easy access, not like those hotels that require valet parking.

My husband, daughter and I booked a 5 night stay in a one bedroom condo. Rooms very small and quite dated but the main problem was that whilst it was marketed as being able to sleep 3, the third bed was a blow up mattress!! Also nowhere to put the blow up mattress so had to move furniture around to use it and as we didn’t want the hassle of pumping it up every night, we had to stand it up against the wardrobe during the day which made access difficult. Quite good location and nice pool area, close to beach and near bus stops. If booking for only 2 people would be fine, but if looking for room for a third look elsewhere!

So over priced for very old and dated property. Paid up frount in Australian dollars in October last year.On arrival asked to pay another $25 US per day for resort costs. E.g. Wi-Fi to room and safe. All things that should be included in cost as NOT a resort at all. No restrants,bars. Pool closed for cleaning during day. Twice in 10 days.Arrived at 6am check in 3.30 pm. Although I had flights out at 6am of departure. Very poor organizing that they could not organize cleaning staff to have rooms ready for overseas travellers. Good by Hawaii. Back to Asia next time.

The pros: location, parking on site ($20/day), and very friendly and helpful staff in all areas of the property. The cons: property has a decent lobby but room we had and amenities (pool area) are rundown. The room decor and furnishings were very dated and worn. Kitchen had old linoleum tile. The bathroom also had old linoleum tiles that are separated due to water damage so moldy in the seams. Tub was so old and worn it looked dirty. (Totally gross - I do like to have a clean room.)Bottom line: I would not recommend to anyone unless you have no other options.

This hotel is in a great location, but is starting to show the wear and tear. Repairs in the hotel room are a bit rough. Holes in the wall have been roughly plastered over, but not sanded smooth. Then painted over but not in an exact matching paint. Sliding doors that separate the bedroom and lounge area are a bit worn and rattle. Bathroom is very compact. If you are looking for a cheap overnight accommodation this may suit, but would not recommend for a longer stay.

Our group stayed in two different rooms. One on the 15th floor and one on the 12th floor. We rented through KoKo and they were very helpful. Nice condos with everything we needed for our short stay of three nights. A big plus....parking was included in the parking garage. We were able to walk to many restaurants, Waikiki beach, and shops. Convenient location to restaurants and shopping without using the car. And elevators were fast and got you to your floor quickly. Eight of us were here and we all agreed this is a great place.

Arrived early off our flight, headed to hotel arriving at 730am. Handed over all our details to reception where the gave us directions to the bathroom services to freshen up after our long flight and to hold our bags while we went out for an explore until the room was ready. Came back and had a little sleep by the pool then checked in at 3pm. Room was dated, definitely nothing flash but was much bigger than expected. Full kitchen with large fridge. Lounge that folded out to a sofa bed, balcony, dining suite and two double beds in seperate room with bathroom. Daily cleaning. Great location one block back from beach. Was a well priced hotel for what we got. Would stay again.

nice quite hotel...a little dated....but near the beach(one block)....had to go someplace else to eat....as just little snack bar and a mini mart in hotel....not even a bar...room was ok.. as it was a suite. the beds sucked....too low and pulled you to the middle...looked out on the mountains....be warned it also holds rescidenents ....was an issue w/hot water one day but they allowed us to use other room to shower...lobby is nice....if your 1st class...try some place else....you want place to stay that don't cost much stay here

This hotel is clearly not what is pictured when reserving. Floors were dirty, gaps around all doors, elevators didn't function on multiple occasions. Had an evacuation alarm with no explanation on how to evacuate a handicapped person staying on the 36th floor. On the day of departure they turned the water off for the day so was not able to shower or use the bathroom. Door locks kept jamming but was not addressed. I do not believe the sheets were changed the entire week I was there. Desk staff were not responsive to this. Will not go back.

My family and I have traveled to Hawaii on a number of occassions. All of the hotels that we have stayed at have been fantastic until now. Our experience with staying at Waikiki Banyan was a disgrace. Hands down the worst hotel we have stayed at. The service was disgusting, the hotel staff at the front desk were rude, non helpful and made you feel very un welcome. The Hotel is in a great location but that’s the only positive I could find. The Hotel is run down, old and stuck in the 70s and I would not recommended this place to my worst enemy.

The room looked NOTHING like the pictures posted by the hotel. The furniture was thread bare and actually had holes in it. We were with a group and I was too embarrassed to invite friends to the room. Mold and broken furniture were common elements. Do not stay in room 3514!!!!!! great view but lousy furnishings. I don't think they updated anything since the place was built in 1979. Complaints to management was useless. The real question is "would I stay there again?" and the answer is a big NO!!!!!!!!!!

Got here after a 14 hour flight from NY. Got to the first room and it had a funky smell. When we went to setup the sofa bed it had roaches living in it. We were moved to another room and it had the same issue. DO NOT STAY HERE.

This was a great hotel for a big family. Travelled with a group of 10. Our rooms accommodated to 5 people.Rooms have a kitchen with everything you need (kitchen utensils, microwave, oven, dishwashing liquid etc). There are towels, shower gel, shampoo etc which are replaced every day by house keeping.Yes the rooms are outdated but if you're not fussed on having fancy accommodation, this place is really great! I loved the location, only a short walk to everything and it is closer to the 'less busy' side of the beach.The pool area is beautiful and relaxing, great for families! Theres a nice bbq area, playground & tennis/ bbal court (about $5 an hour to hire gear). Theres a nice little coffee shop (with free wifi) downstairs and a convenience store on the ground floor.We really enjoyed our time here, the mountain view us BEAUTIFUL, highly recommend getting a view that faces the mountain.It wasnt all flash and modern, but it had everything we needed, the air con worked and we had no bugs whatsoever. Overall, this hotel was great and i would stay again! Thanks to all the staff for contributing to our great stay! :)

We booked a room at the Waikiki Banyan because they are nice and roomy, have great views and most importantly have full kitchens. Half way though our stay I was going to be running in the Hapalua Half Marathon and I wanted a kitchen to be able to cook meals prior to the race. Our room was on the 30th floor and was very quiet with terrific views of Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach. Reserving the room and check in were very easy and communicating with the property manager was prompt and courteous. An added bonus for us what that this unit was so quiet. When you combine the peacefulness of the room and the amazing views, we truly enjoyed our stay. The furnishings were up to date and the bed was very comfortable. The kitchen and bathroom were very functional and anything you needed for cooking was provided. As this was a private rental, there was no daily cleaning and no linen exchange. It would have been nice to have more towels but there was a coin operated laundry room just down the hall. We looked into using the outside grills but they required $2 worth of quarters and we didn't have them so we elected to just use the oven for our ribs and they turned out great. The room came with a parking pass which really helped as parking can be as high as $35/day elsewhere. The Banyan is located a long block away from the beach and closer to Kapiolani Park (Zoo) so it is a little removed from the hustle and bustle of central Waikiki which we liked. The room cost was very reasonable and it's hard to find another hotel with kitchen units and great views. We will be back!

Wow, they took out the cement planter boxes and replaced with aluminum fencing. Enhanced the open felling of the “open” deck. More lounge chairs everywhere!!! Room was great (T1-2204]). A very excellent value. Full kitchen was definitely a plus.

We checked in and after they explained that everything that was stated to be included in the ‘resort’ fee in fact wasn’t, we went up to our room. The first words out of our mouths was ‘what a dump’. The carpet was threadbare and wrinkled up, the curtains were ripped, the floor around the toilets creaky had not been cleaned and the bed had a definite dip in the middle. We left it for the night as we were too tired from our long flight. The next day they moved us at our request. This room had slightly more updated furniture and was cleaner with an ocean view and a much better bed. Still, there was repaired plaster everywhere and water damage in the bathroom. The next morning we didn’t get the newspaper included in our resort fee, nor did our room get serviced.That night we went to bed early as we had to be up early for a flight. In the middle of the night we heard someone trying to get into our room. Shortly after, the front desk called our room, asking for our names and that we shouldn’t be in that room. My husband went to the desk to have words with them, and got no apology or explanation. At checkout in the morning I refused to pay their so-called resort fee and listed my reasons why. The only response I received was ‘okay, thank you, okay’. I have not seen such abysmal customer service in a long time.The location is excellent, shame about the rest of it. This was by far the worst hotel experience I have ever had.

Very good place in Honolulu.... difficult to get good places in Honolulu.... LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION... 1 1/2 blocks from beach, shopping all over the place, near Zoo, free parking... good deal.Check in at Tower 1 Fourth Floor... timeshare is in building with hotel and other timeshares. 1 bedroom suite is really oversized studio with sliding doors... but very good especially for a couple.

Conveniently located 1 block from the beach, shopping and restaurants abound within walking distance. Our condo was spacious, clean, tastefully decorated and had all the kitchen necessities for preparing a meal. The bathroom was on the small side. The balcony offers a limited view of the ocean and more of the city, which is very scenic at night. Two double beds and a pull out sofa can accommodate 5 or 6 people. Beds were on the firm side, we didn't use the pull out sofa. Extra bedding and towels were available in the closet. Light colored drapes ensure that you are up with the sun so you don't spend vacation in bed! They are definitely not room darkening drapes. Washer and dryers were available at the end of the hall. An outdoor recreation area is on the 6th floor with outdoor grills, picnic tables, pool, hot tub, snack shack, tennis court and children's playground, there's probably more that I overlooked. The Banyan is one of the few properties that offers parking included in the rates, in the attached garage. A big plus as parking on the street is impossible and parking lots can be pricey. This was my second stay at the Banyan and I would not hesitate to book it again.

Clean, convenient and spacious rooms for families. We had four of us and they supplied an additional cot so our teens could sleep in the living room while we slept in the bedroom. Everything you need in the kitchen and bathroom. The pool and two hot tubs (hot and searing hot) were well kept. The DVD options were best in one tower over the other, so you might want to check each tower for their selections. Many things in the room needed to be 'fixed' while we were there, but they came immediately to deal with each issue. We were sold a package from the travel agent that said so many extras, but then when we got there, they claimed that they had never provided such things as slippers, or robes. Even the photos showed a very fancy room with granite kitchen top, but we got a room still functioning from the 80's decor, etc.  However, the travel agent claims they only sell what the properties provide info on, and therefore, we paid for and were expecting something that was simply not even offered. Whose fault is that??? We still had to pay the $25/night resort fee, which is pretty standard in Hawaii on top of what is paid to the travel agent. In future, I am booking directly rather than through Flight Center Travel Agents.

This hotel has certainly seen better days. The sofa was so threadbare that we were afraid to sit on it. The lampshades are broken, the furniture is shabby, the carpet has buckled so badly that we tripped on it several times. The staff was great, but someone cooking in the next room set off the fire alarm and the building was evacuated (like, 8:30 at night). That was quickly rectified, though. It is one of the cheaper hotels in Waikiki (in fact, one of the few available at that time). But you pay extra for parking, you pay an extra resort fee...maybe not such a bargain after all. I spent the night sitting in the chair...

This hotel was part of a package.The rooms were clean, but very dated. Two of the four had a mildew smell. We requested a handicapped accessible room. It was a bit larger than the other rooms, but had no grab bars in the bathroom. It had a regular size tub that had to be stepped over for a shower. I asked the concierge what restaurants delivered. She told me to use GrubHub. There was a small coffee shop just off of the lobby. Simple but good food. There was a small store onsite. The hotel charges a resort fee even if you don't use any thing it covers- game console, news paper, wifi.

Poor quality resort. Poor quality rooms and furniture. Everything very old . The bed was terrible to sleep in. We would not return to this resort. Save up your points and go to another resort if you want to go to Oahu.

Nice place, convient location, bus system a great way to get around. Aloha Hawaii North Shore tour with Ian and Dennis was fantastic. The Chatholic Church a block away was a plus as was the restaurant MAC 24 that was across the street

This hotel should get a 2 but I'm giving it a 3 for a few reasons.Upon check-in they upgraded our regular room from floors 6 to 12 to the 25th floor with an ocean view.We liked the layout of the suite and the brightness too. It features floor to ceiling glass windows along one side with a lanai in the living room.It has sprinklers which are important in case of fire.The sink and mirror are outside of the bath and toilet area so it is convenient when 2 people are getting ready in the morning. There is only the one mirror in the suite which seems surprising. The kitchen area is well equipped but there is no kettle.The location is very good as it is only about a block from the Beach.The staff is helpful and courteous when you are actually dealing with them directly.We have done our best to give a balanced review of our recent stay at the Aston Waikiki Banyan Hotel.Now here is a detailed rundown of the negatives we experienced. Please see the photos to see what we mean.We're not certain if they have any renovated rooms but if you are considering this hotel then that would be a good question to ask.We had considered asking for another room but decided against it as the view was very nice and we had no guarantee that another room would be any better.1. The fridge is very old and disgusting where you open it up on the door handle and side of the fridge. The inside was clean and operational.2. There is no business office to use a computer but you may use the one computer and printer for a fee in the cafe on the main level of tower 2. It's only open until 5:00PM. The people in the cafe are helpful.3. The furnishings are very old and marked. The sofa, chair and kitchen seating were newer and clean and comfortable.4. There were no grab bars in the shower/tub. The old tub was oval shaped on the bottom and slippery so one of us used the rubber tub mat making sure that all of the suction cups were pushed down to prevent any movement. There were rust looking marks on the bottom of the tub. There were black mouldy looking areas along parts of the tub and wall and beneath the soap holder. There was deep ground dirt in the corner next to the tub. The shower curtain touched us as they have not installed the newer semi circular bath curtain bars. One day we noticed no hot water in the shower so we called the desk. We went out of the hotel and upon our return the problem had been fixed.5. There was a hole inside the microwave at the back. We just didn't use it.6. There were bugs seen in the bathroom late at night which had to be caught and disposed of into the toilet. There were bugs found almost daily on the kitchen counter and on the kitchen floor. No food was left out and everything was kept clean so we don't know how they got to the 25th floor although it is the tropics.7. The carpet has rolls in several areas.8. There was water built up next to the bathroom sink faucets all of the time. We kept mopping it up with paper towels.9. The bed had the old style bedspreads. Most hotels have had white bed covers for years now.Summation: The hotel has a wonderful indoor/outdoor lobby with lovely pictures of Hawaii and a waterfall with Koi fish. There is a cafe on the main level and a convenience store. On the 6th floor there is another fast food cafe, swimming pool, hot tubs, tennis courts and barbecues for rent. The house maids were nice and they did what they could. What these suites require is a very deep cleaning and to be renovated. Please note that parking is no longer free. It is $20.00 per day. Another convenience is that you may leave your luggage with the hotel after checking out on your last day.We would not stay here again for the many reasons given above but it would be a whole different scenario if they renovated the rooms.

It’s important for visitors booking this facility to realize it would be rated as 3 Star or less to avoid over expectation. The condos adjoin the Aston Hotel but share common facilities. The condos are privately owned and managed separately from the hotel. We chose it because we wanted a bit more room than a hotel would offer.The condos are ‘animal friendly’ I understand, which probably explained the strong smell of carpet deodorant in the hallway approaching our apartment. However, first impressions showed the apartment as clean. There were welcoming chocolates. It has a new fridge and stove and was supplied with abundant towels. All communication was by phone. The apartment was not serviced.Furnishing were cheap and chipped in parts. Curtains had been hung by amateurs. The air con was noisy which added to the disadvantage in our location just above a busy corner.There were only 3 non matching wine glasses. One cup was heavily chipped and cracked. The kitchen bench drained away from the sink. The bath/shower was slow draining. We learnt to live with this wishing we were back in a better hotel.The Banyan has 2 towers of around 35 stories yet little had been spent on the vast pool/recreation area which was shabby. A barricade had been erected around the pool suggesting some renovation pending but with this number of rooms, a vastly bigger pool complex is required.Overall, disappointed but we should have checked further before booking.

Fantastic location close to everything Shopping Beach Nightlife.Spent 3 weeks here with Family including Grandkids.Nice activity deck Pool Playground BBQs.Staff very nice.If there was anything negative to say would be the 2 rooms we had were very Dated. A little bit of upgrading would go along ways.Rooms are like a 1 Bdrm with Full kitchen

The trip was great everyone was great very helpful. I thought they had a gym. But other than that it was very good. We had ocean view room. Beautiful view of Waikiki . If you stay here go by the pool to the snack bar and get the Dole whip! Delicious!

Nice space, but desperately needs re-done. Tired old look to everything, completely worn out; rotting curtains, no finish left on the furniture or Formica, carpet backing separated and rippling under the remains of the faded, stained carpet, fabric dating to the late 1980’s. This could be great room, but right now it looks like the 'before' photo of a re-model job.

“Deluxe Ocean View” translates in reality to ocean view obstructed by other high rises. Interior is tired, old furnishings, with cracked paint in bathroom. Room service is truly minimal. Hugely overpriced for what you actually get. All of this thanks to Pleasant Hawaiian Holidays.

We stayed here for 1 night before our flight home. I thought it was a reasonable price when I booked but on arrival I am glad I didn’t pay anymore. Although the staff were happy, helpful and caring the room was a HUGE letdown. Where do I start, the room was dated, some would even say it was stuck in the 80’s. I booked a queen room BUT we ONLY got a double. Even looking at the bed you could see it was old and dipped in the middle. Not only that, it didn’t have a fitted sheet and the bottom sheet on it didn’t even reach the bottom of the bed. I found this very annoying as I’m very tall and could feel this as my feet hang over the end. Luckily the saving grace of this hotel was the lovely service I got from the evening reception attendant. I didn’t get his name but he works 2pm to 10pm. It was very busy and he dealt with it by himself exceptionally well. He alone earned this hotel an extra star!!!

The room fit my family of 5, however the room looks nothing like the online picture. The sheets smelled funny but we were upgraded to an ocean view which was great.  When I booked I wasn’t told that if we wanted to park in the hotel parking garage it would be $80 or that parking daily was $20. We also weren’t told that when we checked out we would be charged $190 for “amenities” that we didn’t use like the daily paper that was sent to us. My husband argued w the manager and we were grateful that they didn’t make us pay it.  Be careful if u double park cuz they will tow ur rental like they did us w out a courtesy phone call. I suggest u rent a car so that u can drive URSELF and visit diff beaches.  Overall, the Aston Banyan was a decent stay. It’s close to shops and restaurants and u can walk to the beach. I dnt know if I would stay here again though but it was nice for our first time on the island.Mahalo
