My wife and i stayed at the Aston at the waikiki banyan from 21/10/2017 till 28/10/2017 and stayed in room 2 2606 staff were lovely and place was kept clean but the unit let it self down due to the fact the room was dated and needed a re furb i will note we did not approach the staff due to fact it did not stop us from enjoying our holiday but it does need to be look for future clients would i stay there again yes and no but maybe after they updated everything

this was a great condo. stay at Waikiki banyan back in the late 80's. still much as I remember. we had everything that we needed at the condo comforts of home. will go back again some day. Debbie the owner was awesome to work with

We arrived early and was told that our room wasn't quite ready they did offer us another room but we decided to stay with the one they had already had for us, they held our luggage so we could go out and explore Waikiki, we return to find that the hotel room was better then we imagined we would get, we had a room on the 36th floor so the views were amazing, the pool was refreshing and the little café shack had everything you could want to eat at very affordable prices, I was short on one trip to the shack and the lady put her own money in for me, although I did return to give back what I was short on, but the room was clean, the kitchen area was updated and had everything you could need,the maids done a wonderful job cleaning our room everyday and the front of hotel staff were very helpful and gave you great advice and also maps with directions, the lobby is open aired with a pond and waterfall which is relaxing to just sit there and watch the fish swim around while you wait for shuttles etc....

My in-laws booked this hotel through Booking.com for their 30th wedding anniversary and were under the impression their room would look like the pictures advertised to them (updated kitchens, beautiful wood furnishings, clean rooms, your typical ammenities like shampoo and conditioners, etc). What they got was a dirty room, a creaky uncomfortable mattress with no headboard, and a kitchen so old they were afraid to use it. Disappointed was an understatement. If you are looking to pay around $300/night for that, then this is not a bad option. But know you are not going to get what is advertised on the websites. My in-laws ended up paying less per night to switch to the Marriott across the street and were given a free upgrade, too. I would recommend the Marriott over the Aston Banyan 10 times out of ten in every category.

The rooms are very well Appointment noted and has a full kitchen and most can easily sleep 4 - 6 people. The pool is very clean but late afternoons are full of children. New signage throughout site for drivers!

Great sized rooms, great location, friendly and helpful staff. If there was a problem, staff was onto it ASAP. Definitely recommend for those travelling with larger families. Fully equipped apartment style rooms are always great when travelling with kids.

Stayed four night at the Waikiki Banyan in a 1-bedroom condo 29th floor. Stayed here before 3 years ago. Here are the positives and negatives:PositiveHad a nice modern unit with grant countertop and modern furnishingsMaid service was a plusLocation of building is central to beach and downtown waikikismall mini-market on 1st floor for conveniencesmall snack shop with shave ice and lunches on pool levelgreat self BBQ's, basketball court, tennis court and swimming pool with 2 jacuzzisFriendly front desk staffNegativeUnfriendly ground staff walking the pool/bbq/tennis area. They need to provide customer service training to these 2 male attendants as they came across very condescending in speaking to us about the use of the pool and basketball court.In our unit, very very slow Wifi conniption. Felt like the old "AOL" days. Bandwidth could barely support one user and constant disconnects when multiple users online at same time.Overall, a good experience and good value. Being a repeat visitor to this property I already set my expectations for this "middle of the road" condo facility. I would stay here again as the cost is important to us as well as the extra room a condo facility provides is generally greater than a standard hotel room.

Great location. Great parking. Great coffee shop. Very nice employees and very nice residents. Many live here 6 months or so. Nice swimming pool area on 6 th floor so windy and not very sunny our unit had a couple of beach chairs and beach towels so came in handy small kitchen perfect to fix meals food pantry in walking distance

Usually get a condo at the Ilikai at the opposite end of Waikiki near Hilton Hawaiian Village but decided to try a unit at the Waikiki Banyan. Great location two blocks away from Waikiki Beach about a block away from the Honolulu Zoo, Kapiolani Park, and the Ala Wai Canal. Mountain view 1-bdrm. 1-bath rented by Kai of Waikiki Rentals was comfortable, well-appointed, and quiet. Air-conditioning unit came in handy, internet and parking are available for a minimal daily fee.

This family friendly hotel has 2 towers: one with mostly condo/timeshare owners and one with hotel rooms so quality of rooms can vary widely depending on whether the owner has upgraded or not. Dont expect lap of luxury, but rooms all have kitchenette and a patio or lanai, but the view depends on tower, height and facing direction, Service is decent but check in line can be long. Pool, hot tub, playground and grilling facilities (bring quarters to pay for grill use) is on 6th floor so expect noise and somewhat worn rooms and carpeting on that floor. On-site coffee shop and mini mart are decent and convenient.Location is excellent - on south end of Waikiki district and only 2 blocks from Kalakaua. You can walk to the zoo, walk to Waikiki Beach or take the bus to Ala Moana and points in that direction. Parking is self service and $20/day and reasonably accessible although the parking garage entrance is tricky the 1st time. Most tours dont stop there but at nearby larger hotels..

If you are lookin for luxury, then be prepared to pay a ton more and stay elsewhere. If you are looking for a great family value and plan to be out on the beach or in town most of the time, then this is great. It actually was clean in the room, and that apparently is saying something for Hawaii. It was really nice to have a full kitchen too. A little crowded once the murphy bed was brought down and the roll away was set up, but when you have three kids, you are used to it in a hotel room. The nitty gritty? Looks like it all depends on the room you get when talking about the details--this room needs to update the bedroom TV. A tube TV? A flat screen that size can't be over $200, even in Hawaii.

We were a bit worried about staying here after reading some of the reviews but were pleasantly surprised and enjoyed our stay. We were on the 36th floor room 3606 with fantastic views of the ocean so we didn't get street noise.The housekeeping was great - it was very clean and tidy. It is a bit old we knew that before going. The staff at the reception were very pleasant and helpful. The location was fine as it wasn't far to walk anywhere. We would recommend The Food Pantry in Kuhio Avenue as a good place to get provisions in stead of the ABC stores as cheaper and recommended by Lonely Planet guide. We would stay here again as liked the convenience of having an apartment instead of a hotel room.

We checked in an given room 3706 and could not sleep as the noise was very bad from a motor on the roof above the bed we had to change rooms and moved to a smaller room in level 14 with no view !House keeping were rude and demanded we leave room to get cleaned and front staff "min" apologised but with out feeling or care! I asked to speak to manager but he was unavailable and the supervisor had not started work yet!I have stayed here in the past but this was the last time!

After researching hotels for what seemed like weeks and weeks, we finally decided on this Aston property. We get a good discount via a travel industry rate which helped. We just returned from a week stay, 2 adults, 2 kids aged 12 and 17. PROS: Very easy check-in, conveniently located to Waikiki Beach, 3-5 minute walk to stores and beach and restaurants. Easy to get into/out of parking garage. Large suite with separated bedroom and kitchen with dishes,etc.CONS: When I booked there was NO notice on their website regarding that the pool or hot tub would be out of service for our stay. We did not find this out(even at check-in, not mentioned) until our second day when we happened to see a note in the elevator. After the pool re-opened on our 4th day, the hot tub remained close for maintenance. It is advertised that they offer pool towels AND a snack shop. Neither of these were available so we had to go to Walmart to purchase towels to use at the beach and the pool. This was disappointing to say the least. I based my extensive research on hotels that offered a pool and chose this one only to have it closed for half of our stay.Maid service: We are typically low maintenance and only require a full room clean 2-3 times during a week stay. So, with that being said, one would think that when they maid did clean, she would do a better job then what was done. She LOVED leaving washcloths and toilet paper, we had accumulated probably at least 10 washcloths during our stay. But,little things like dusting and sugar packets for the coffee were neglected. When we made our boys beds up(1 couch and I loveseat that folded out), one of the sheets had a bright yellow huge stain on the sheet which we had to return to get a clean one. One of our master bed sheets had blood spots on it. All in all, I am unsure if I would stay again. Dated rooms but convenient, hard to choose. For us though, the price was right but most people would have to incur the $20 parking fee PLUS the $20 amenity fee.

This hotel was not as I expected. The pictures looked good, but the room did not. I did hear that they were renovating and that our tower (Tower 1) was not upgraded yet. They charge a fee for housekeeping which was unbelievable. We had to call just about everyday to get towels, toilet paper & soap. A family of four goes through this quickly.The pool was only open the first three or four days we were there (we were there for 10 days). They closed it to re-water the pool & to paint the patio area around the pool. They still were not done by the time we left. There was a false alarm one night about 11:30pm at night which they said was due to a new system. The whole bldg had to evacuate via the stairs (we were on the 22nd floor). They then made three more announcements in the room throughout the night. I think the last one was around 3am. There was a fight in the hallway late one night by other guests down the hall which also woke us up. The old degraded curtains woke us up at around 5:30 every morning to begin with because so much sunlight gets through them (see pics).Finally, the check filter light came on, on the A/C the last day we were there. Thankfully we were leaving.

We stayed there 7 nights. The room was clean and kitchen quite good with all utensils provided. If you needed anything else housekeeping was obliging. Nice view from one street back from the main beach road. Walking distance to all the main street shops , beach etc. Waikiki is an expensive place so the place was good value for the price.

A visit with family and we had two rooms. We were on the same floor but different end. On arrival foyer is nice and staff are pleasant and friendly. Fors - has a kitchenette which is great with the children, laundry was available on our floor. Had a room with a view to the ocean. Only a five minute walk to the beach. There is a small shop for supplies and coffee shop and at the same prices in the Main Street. Also Starbucks at the end of the street along with cafes, Burger King and ABC stores. Against - the rooms are in bad need of an upgrade. Kitchen and bathroom cupboards are falling apart. Curtains have holes in them. Carpet is well worn. My sons rooms has had part of a bathroom renewed. However his air conditioner was not working very well. At one stage there was water on the carpet from the air con. He told the staff and were sending someone to look at it. Yes they did. Did not fix the air con were more interested in the wet carpet. Complained again and again it was not fixed. It made it very uncomfortable to rest or sleep at night. The young children were taking turns sleeping in our room for comfort specially during the day. Some of the railings on the balcony were also loose. We would not let any of the children out on the balcony unless there was an adult present specially being on the 28th floor. Overall I feel the accommodation is expensive considering how dated the rooms are. I would not stay here again nor recommend unless the rooms have an overall.

Condo - Well equipped - Sleeps 4 to 5 people - 1 block from beach - Great pool deck with hot tubs (2) - Snack bar also on pool deck - Barbecues available (coin operated)Convenience store and coffee shop on ground floor - Units are clean and neat -

We stayed two nights with my adult daughter, who slept on the fold out couch. Whilst not a super modern suite, it provided all required amenities and an ocean view at a reasonable price. The location was great as we were just a few minutes walk to the beach and all the shops and restaurants. Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms are serviced daily. Definitely value for money.

On Sunday September 25th I booked a stay at the Aston at the Waikiki Banyan in Honolulu, Hawaii for the same night. This was the last night of a trip to Hawaii with my wife and two friends why we wanted to make it a special one. Our friends who are Americans had made several nice arrangements during the trip why me and my wife wanted to return the favor and treat them with a nice last hotel stay by using a free hotel night earned as Hotels customers. We found the Aston which was discounted from USD 300/night, it looked very nice from the pictures, it was in our desired area, and it had received good reviews. With the discount the price was USD 180 which we paid using our points and direct payment through Hotels. After booking it we we're frankly thrilled to take our friends there.We arrived after flying in from another island around 7 pm. The entrance didn't look quite as expected from the pictures, but was fine. Already in the hallway to our room we got a bad feeling as it did not at all reflect the standard we expected from our booking. Entering the room we got a very unpleasant surprise. The room was far from prepared for guests with dishes in the sink, unmade beds, trash left in both the kitchen and the bathroom, and generally not cleaned. It frankly looked like a dump. Even worse, though, aside from the room not at all being prepared for our arrival, it was absolutely nothing like the pictures in terms of standard. It gave the impression of an old, outworn, dark xxx rather than anything else.When we got back to the reception the representative explained that the "hotel" consists of privately owned condominiums that are being rented out sort of as a hotel activity. Booking it through Hotels marketed as a hotel, this was not what we expected. Getting keys to a new room, our friends tried to comfort us saying that as the standard of condominiums can differ maybe this room would be nicer. It wasn't. Although the room this time was prepared, it far from reflected neither the pictures nor the price. We felt completely fooled and this was not at all how we've planned to spend our time in Hawaii before our afternoon flight the day after.We went back to the reception and explained that we simply couldn't stay. When asking for a refund, they informed us that the resort fee of USD 20/night would be refunded by them, but that the hotel charge would be between us and Hotels. When asking for our USD 20 parking fee back, they informed that the parking was separate from the hotel and something we would need to take with that company. So we did, but as that company had nothing to do with the hotel, it couldn't refund us although we only had our car parked for 40 min. Also a very unexpected turn of events as the information on Hotels stated parking for the hotel.As it was getting late and all we wanted was to get the situation resolved, we called the Hilton that has several resorts in the area and managed to get a room at one of the beach resorts. It was more than we had planned to pay, however, affordable if comparing with the ordinary rate for the Aston, and with a completely different standard both for the room and other hotel facilities.We've been quite frequent Hotels customers over the passed year, and have stayed at hotels with a quite diverse range in terms of pricing, standard, and US locations. Never before have we felt deceived or fooled, and yet we did quite a bit of research before making the booking in question.Due to the above, we expect to be refunded the amount charged for the booking, and also credited the free hotel night which value was used. Although we understand that Hotels would have no legal obligation to do so, we would also appreciate to be refunded the USD 20 parking fee (amount confirmed on Hotels sight for the Aston). Considering the additional charges for hotel and other parking, time wasted, and overall inconvenience of all this, it seems like a fair request.

We stayed here for three nights, while the location is great the room we had was a little dated and was not the cleanest, however it did have it's own kitchen which was handy. We were in tower 2 on the 36th floor so the view was fabulous. the location is great with only a 5 min walk to the beach. The staff were friendly, there is a little food shop and café type place on site which is handy. The pool and spa area is nice so overall not a bad place, the only downfall was our bedding arrangement with a king bed and a pull out sofa which was really uncomfortable. The hotel does charge a $20 per day fee for wifi, dvd's and a paper which I found to be a little steep as the only thing we really used was the wifi and we stayed in two hotels on the mainland which gave us free wifi without a charge. Would I stay again, probably but would make sure I asked for a different bedding arrangement next time.

This is an older style hotel and apartment block. I was very disappointed for the price we paid. We have normally stayed in an ocean front hotel in an Ocean front or view room at either Sheraton Waikiki, Outrigger Waikiki or Hilton Hawaiian Village - so we traded location for a larger room with a 1 bedroom apartment. I wished we hadn't far prefer being in a smaller room with greater facilities, right on the ocean front but that's me. The hotel/apartment is old and worn looking. We did this last minute via VBRO - so although a renovated apartment - it felt dirty and was small. in fact so small that in the middle of the night when I went to the toilet I slipped and fell backwards and hit my head on the bath. Dark, dingy corridors and dark reception area - not warm and welcoming like you would expect. On the plus side does come with a car space, the pool is a decent size, the coffee shop at the bottom does great coffees and you can find good deals via VBRO - but as ours was last minute wasn't such a great deal.I would not go back and would compromise on size and go for a hotel room with 2 x queen size beds and fold out sofa at Outrigger - just a step away from the Ocean.

The unit has been updated with new stove, flooring and microwave. Has view of Manoa, Ala Wai Canal, golf course and of course the beach on the Lanai!!! the elevators are high speed. Pool area has been renovated!!

Customer service was friendly. It's nice that the parking garage next door is easily accessible from the hotel as well the location was great with just a couple of minutes walk to Waikiki Beach. The condo that we had was on the 29th floor and with a slow elevator it always seemed like a wait even though there were 4 elevators. I know that each of the condos are owned by others and not directly with Aston so I knew not to expect great furnishings but I was really disappointed with the unit that we had. The sofa bed was so thin and uncomfortable. We ended up using the bedspreads from the beds as extra cushion to line the sofa bed. The kitchen was poorly stocked with only 1 pan, 1 pot and 1 cutting knife. All the furniture looked warn out. There were little odds and ends like loose toilet paper holder to dust and dirt build up on everything from paper towel dispenser to dirt on walls. Plus bathroom accessible only through bedroom which means you end up waking up the people in the bedroom when you have to walk from living room through their room during the middle of the night.

Spent 6 nights with my mother in law and friend, even though our room 3404 was a little outdated it was clean. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Great location, walking distance to beach and transport.

Stayed here 4 nights family of 5 in room 2802 walked in the room nothing like the picture of rooms on the website so outdated. Curtains falling apart, kitchen outdated, coffee machine leaked everywhere, no dishwasher ( oh that ended up being me), just everything old. Even no wine glasses. Didn't complain only staying 4 nights most of the time we were out. Could see the ocean that was nice not far from the beach and front desk people were nice. They did supply pool towels. Would I stay here again? Answer no.

We stayed here as a family for 3 nights. We've stayed here before, two years ago. At that time we stayed in this hotel under Airbnb umbrella. We had such an awesome stay that we thought this time we will see what the hotel is like and booked a room for 3 nights. In future we will never choose to stay in this hotel as their guests. We would choose to go Airbnb. Disadvantages of staying as hotel's guests:-1/ You're up for a amenity fee - $20/ day on top of the room rate. The amenity fee covers a lot of things we didn't use like in-room complimentary tea & coffee; parking facility (if you choose to park overnight - the hotel will charge you for actually parking); safe in the room (this we used); wifi; daily newspaper; use of poolThis amenity charge is ridiculous. A lot of hotels around the US and world would not charge an amenity fee. We paid $850AUD total. Surely we shouldn't be subjected to an amenity fee when other hotels don't charge for use of a safe in the room, pool, complimentary in-room tea & coffee etc especially when the room rate isn't cheap. Amenity fee is definitely a turn-off and is a rude fee. The room (rm 2510) looked very, very dated. Given, we paid $850 for 3 nights, I would expect a fairly decent looking room. For a start, as soon as we walked in, there was a roller bed at the door. The furnishings didn't look professional/ nice as you would see in a hotel. Spot lights in the main room of the hotel room didn't work. It was dark. Thank goodness for the kitchen lights - They were bright enough to compensate! The table lamp in the lounge wasn't bright enough. Looking at the furnishings, we believe that this particular hotel room (2510) may have once been an Airbnb room but is now part of the hotel's. The bedroom was dark, there was only one table lamp to light up the entire room. Again, at least the lights at the vanity compensated a little. The safe was in the corner of the built-in wardrobe. But there was a big wardrobe in front of it, making it less than convenient to access. You have to squeeze yourself between the built-in wardrobe and the wardrobe. Crikey! The kitchen cabinets looks worn with tired wall paper covering it. Only good points about this hotel - its clean. The cleaners do a good job! Its close proximity to Waikiki main strip, Honolulu zoo, Honolulu Aquarium, beach, shopping and restaurants. I would return to this hotel only as an Airbnb user, not as a hotel guest! Then I would not be subjected to the amenity fee nor parking fee if we choose to rent a car for more than one day. Note: we had such a good stay at this hotel as an Airbnb user. It had better furnishings too. As a hotel guest, it was a total let-down. Maybe we had high expectations from the previous stay. The amenity fee is rude. You are not up for this fee as an Airbnb user (well, I didn't in our previous stay)

Front desk, female clerk, very unfriendly and even assigned us a wrong room reservation, even though we had made them, and paid for them, two months in advance. Parking is horrible and the walk to the elevators is life threating with all the traffic zooming by! Room was mildew smelling and very old and the furniture was hard as a rock. Had to put two cushions together to sit on sofa or small chair in room. Old refrigerator, no ice maker and the stove was unleveled and the burner grills were ill fitting so we didn't use the stove. Small TV for such a large area and limited stations???

These apartments are very very dated as is the whole hotel. For a family this was a good option as it has a full kitchen.Bathroom was average but shower was crap, pressure and size way to small for unit. "Sofa bed" was old and not support in mattress so ended up on the lounge made up! Great position from main drag only 2 blocks back. We are splurging at turtle bay at the back end of our trip so this was enough as we are on the go and barely in the room. Housekeeping daily so can't fault that and the Wireless was good. View of diamond head nice at night.

Staying this condo was very good. Great location and nice view. However, disappointing experience at mini mart located on main foolr. I purchased laundry detergent and received paper change. A few minutes later on I realized I needed more coins for the laundry machine, so I went back to ask if I can get coins instead of paper money and the man said I have to pay $1 for the exchange. So I end up paying $1 for $2 coins. His rudeness really made for a bad start to the day.

We booked last minute and struggled to find exactly what we wanted on such short notice that had a nice ocean view, was close to the beach and was in our price range. This condo had it all! It was a beautiful little gem that looked exactly as it was described. It was clean and had a fully equipped kitchen. The view was breathtaking and we even saw whales from our deck! We are a family of 3 and it suited our needs perfectly. There were beach chairs, floatie devices, beach mats, towels, cooler, free parking, etc. Everything we needed for our time in Waikiki. I did give this property a 5/5 but I should mention that we did our own housekeeping and towel laundry. I can't remember if there was an option for housekeeping to come in or not. We did NOT mind this at all. Some might but it does not take away from how nice this condo was. We were also able to use everything in the hotel like pool, hot tub, tennis courts, basketball, etc. and also was able to book excursions through the concierge. I should also mention that Sean was always available through email and answered all my emails quickly. I have already recommended it to a couple of friends. Would stay here again.

Searched the net for weeks to find cheap parking in Waikiki as we hired a car for the week and the hotel we stayed in was $38 US per day,found the Aston Banyan for $20US per day,and its only 1 block behind the beach front.

When you walk in the first thing you see is such an amazing view and when you open the windows, you can get the cross breezes, so you don't need the air conditioner which is somewhat too noisy to have on when you want to watch TV (which is a very small one).The pros are: Very well equipped with everything, even a dishwasher, and a Japanese toilet! The Koko people are very helpful, friendly and available. The elevators were quick, even tho' we were high up in #3701, Tower II, it wasn't a problem. There were lots of towels, along with beach towels available.. The pools is in the sun, and there is a hottub and sauna.The cons:no view of the ocean, no lanai, the beds are old and very small (and no mattress cover ).Pillows needed replacing, as do the quilts.! However it's a great location, altho' it's a couple blocks to the beach, not one block. But the beach location is great for swimming, as it's has a jetty that keeps the water flat. It's a very safe beach, especially if you have children.

We were fortunate enough to stay only one night in this location. The curtains were torn (letting sunlight in), the room looked as though it needed a through detail and the staff were rude. Many of the housekeeping staff were lovely, but those on the front desk were extremely unhelpful and unaccommodating.

Less than a 5 minute walk to the beach, shopping and nightlife, it is ideally located one block off the main thoroughfare. The beautiful lobby is warm and welcoming and tastefully decorated with a pond full of fish. The friendly staff at the front desk made check in a breeze We had a two bedroom apartment with a fold out sofa that slept 6completely furnished and a kitchen equipped with everything needed (other than food) to prepare meals if you prefer. There is a pool, hot tub, barbeque grills and tables for outdoor dining on an upper floor. Being on an upper floor we could hear sirens reverberate off the surrounding buildings but other than that noise was minimal while we were on the balcony and heard nothing when balcony doors were closed. Beds were comfortable. Indoor parking was included with the room rate. The garage is attached to the hotel but also offers public parking so it can be challenging finding a parking spot at times and spaces are small. Our daughter paid for the room utilizing her military discount and got a reasonable rate for the proximity to Waikiki beach. There are several upscale stores and restaurants on the main thoroughfare all within easy walking distance or a short trolley/bus ride away. Better shopping deals are found on the side streets as are unique restaurants offering a variety of cuisines. We enjoyed our stay very much, can't think of a thing that went wrong. The hotel, staff, location and amenities offered were all great.

Tried to check in 1 hr early . "Not possible, all rms are being cleaned, check in is 3:00 . " After 3:00 ( when all rooms are suddenly clean ) we checked in . I was told that I was given a "complementary" upgrade to a ocean view room . This upgraded room was outdated, filthy , and unacceptable ! When I went back to the front desk and complained , they told me there was nothing else available ( even though all available rooms were just cleaned.) After I persisted, I was given the key to another room which to check. This room was no better than the first ! Again, I was told nothing else was available but there was a possibility that another room would open up the next day. So next afternoon we were assigned another room . We lost a couple of hrs of beach time to go back and change rooms and btw, this room was adequate but nothing special for the price. To summarize, this property is in a good location, parking is plentiful but expensive, wifi is free ,and from what I saw the rooms need some heavy cleaning and upgrades. Not even up to Motel 6 standards. I definitely wouldn't recommend this property.

The lobby is peaceful with a Koi pond and waterfall,welcoming after a long flight. The staff is wonderful and gracious. The Coffee shop in the lobby is a perfect way to start your day and I'm fussy about my cup of joe.Fastest elevators! The hallway to your room may make ya feel like oh oh was this a good choice? It is clean but not updated. Our room was great,simple,well thought out CLEAN!! Room for 5 adults. Big closet with plenty of hangers,a kitchen with all we needed. A view worth an 11hour flight. I woke to diamond head and sunrise. A quick dress and full blown sunrise a short walk to beach. The pool is simple and again clean.This hotel is right in the heart of Waikiki next to the big name places. The Aston Waikiki Banyan is authentic and has Hawaiian soul.

We were re-routed to this hotel our first night in Waikiki in January 2011. We had booked with the newly renovated Aston pacific monarch for that reason and location. Upon arrival we were met saying they'd given our room away which we'd paid 2 nights deposit on and had called the hotel at time of booking we were on an evening flight and we'd be late arriving, but we were definitely staying there. The staff at the banyan was very friendly and gave us a reduced rate. Have an Internet cafe since no wifi in the room. Starbucks is a short walk if you want free wifi. Close walk to the beach. Kitchenette was good for cereal, milk, juice, and fruit we'd picked up at abc store. Furnishings were very outdated and bedding too and seemed to be the same as when we came to Waikiki as kids in 1988. Pocket door into leaving room fell wouldn't slide properly and fell off hinges. Living room. Bathroom door connected to bedroom and another door in the bathroom connected to the hall near the kitchen. This was handy when the other person was changing in the bedroom. One could change there and the other could eat breakfast or change in the bathroom or living room area. Close to restaurants and short walk to Prince Kuhio hotel to catch the trolley.

We stayed here at the Banyan in August of 2015, and at its sister location across the street last year. The location obviously isn't beach front, but its certainly close enough! The beach is a mere five minute walk away and the location proves to be worth the money. The hotel itself has the essentials - an internet cafe, mini store, tennis courts, a pool and hot tub that we used in the evenings. The staff were friendly and efficient. As far as I know, the rooms can vary greatly especially as people own their own vacation rental properties in the building. Our room had a kitchen which is exactly what we were aiming for, but very outdated - which was fine anyway!Great stay, would aim to stay at the banyan again.

My husband and our two daughters stayed here for five nights in September 2016. We were a little put off that check in wasn't until 3pm after we had just gotten off a nine hour flight with two littlies and all we wanted was a shower and a nap. The receptionist made us wait three hours before we could go up to our room! Once allowed upstairs the room was clean the A.C was amazing and we had beautiful views out to the ocean. The full kitchen was the highlight. The beds were comfortable and the sheets clean and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We are planning our next Hawaii vacation and plan to stay again.

Stayed here with 3 kids under 6 and 2 adults and seemed to have enough space for us. Kitchenette worked well functionally for us. Pool is good but can get quite busy but beach is an easy 10min walk for the kids. I would stay here again.

We stayed in a privately owned apartment here in October 2016. The room was great and had plenty of space for us (and all our shopping). The location is pretty good, about one block back from the beach and not a far walk away from everything, with a bus stop just around the corner. The only downfall was reception staff, as soon as they found out we were staying in a privately owned apartment they became quite rude and wanted nothing to do with us. I understand we hadn't booked an actual hotel room but it doesn't take much to offer a smile and a little info about the area (what bus to catch etc), which would've been helpful.

I stayed here 3 times over the years and keep on coming back.Would be nice if they upgraded. their beds more often.. The daily car parking is a bit steep if u cannot find place to park.It was very dark and hard to see where i parked

We stayed in 2 apartments here over the course of our travels in Hawaii recently. Rooms vary greatly in quality, fitout, views and maintenance but If you need a large size to spread out for a family and are on budget they are fine. We had 3 teenagers and 2 adults and its very expensive to find accommodation that has the size, a kitchen for eating in etc Just don't expect too much and you might be pleasantly surprised (if you snag a good one). Id say if your happy for a comfortable place to sleep (no such thing as a comfortable sofa bed but when my kids pay for holidays they can demand better), maybe eat in for a night or two and an easy walk to the beach and the heart of Waikiki go for it. If you just want a nice hotel room for 2 then the Marriot and others are the go. I agree with the comment on the downstairs convenience store owner being unhelpful and rude. Don't waste your money, go to the plentiful ABC stores just down the street. If you want to wash and dry clothes have lots of quarters handy $2 bucks a load from memory. If you get parking included then that is also a bonus as parking at most Hotels range from $30-$50 a night. I don't know if there is such a term but when I thought about size/location/budget and with a family, I would have to say "pleasantly average accommodation" with great location.

It is a very old building ,very ancient fittings ,it is a timeshare complex, dogs are permitted into the rooms, convenience store manager in the complex rudest you will meet, reception and office staff very helpful, the only upside, very convenient location the only two things going for this complex is the staff and the location, would I stay at this timeshare complex again the answer is NO

We rented two rooms through VRBO/Koko Resorts for late December/early January. The Banyan has a great location and the public areas are old but functional. Parking was included with the rooms. The elevators are very slow and smell. They do not provide luggage carts to haul your bags to and from your rooms. Plan to wash your own towels becasue its $15 for towel exchange and $70 for full maid service. There is a laundry room on each floor which is helpful. We had a bad experience with a miserable parking security guy that was extremely rude but that is likley isolated to that one jerk. When toilet paper, garbage bags , etc were required the Koko people in room 501 provided it easily. The 10th floor hallway smells like smoke. Not sure if smoking is allowed but its not pleasant to have to walk though several times a day. The doors to our rooms slam and squeak because they are old and the closers need to be replaced and the hinges serviced. They said they would have somoene repair one of the rooms but 10 days later no one has shown up. Its fairly easy to do and would prevent them from disturbing our neighbors. All rooms should have a drying rack in them. there is nothing to hang wet things on and you cant put anything on the Lanai. Room 813 has not been updated,other than the bathroom, but its in decent shape. It looks on to the pool. The hide a bed is horribly uncomfortable. This kitchen is lacking in utensils. When we arrived there were not adequate sheets for either room, even though we had indicated our needs in terms of single vs King beds. We arrived late and had to make due until morning when we had to go get sheets from Koko Resorts. No fitted sheets were ever provided so when they get pulled off every night you get to see the matress stains underneath. Gross and preventable. Room 1014 has been updated and isnt too bad but it has mold in the shower, the towel bar falls down if you put two towels on it, the interior doors dont slide properly, the bathroom door wont close properly, the king bed is back breakingly uncomfortable, but worst of all you are located on a street corner and the windows are single pane and you hear everything going on. The late night drunks , the big trucks in the morning, the Harley's that roar by keep you awake and disturb relaxation. This room's kitchen is well stocked with utensils, it looks not too bad and it does have a decent partial ocean view. Overall the place is an OK value for a budget conscious choice but there are a few fairly simple cost effective things they could do in the rooms to make it acceptable and cause people to return to these units every time. Firstly clean the mold, provide the right sheets, fix the doors, provide a drying rack,provide adequate amount of cheap hangers and put a decent mattress in

Our room is on the 28th floor and it captures the breathtaking view of the ocean. We had very comfortable one bedroom condo. Great location and only one block away from the beach, close to all premises, highly recommended

Good location amongst the buzz of Waikiki. The buildings themselves are pretty dated and I wouldn't consider the rooms to be up to the standard of a three-star hotel. Very 70s/80s-esque decor; generally bland. If you care about aesthetics or comfortable couches, this isn't the place for you. The rooms were clean and functional, though, and spacious enough (except the bathrooms, which were cramped).The $24/day amenity fee is extremely unfortunate but getting sucked dry for money seems to be par for anywhere in Hawaii.

great location and price if you are not fussed about this place not being modern .. 90 % of the hotels are old and this is one of them. Remember of you have a flight arriving any time before 3pm to try book the room the day prior so you dont have to wait 8 hours like we did. The pool areas great and the playground is great for kids under 10. Wifi in the room was the best thing ever ! Maybe BYO washing powder and shampoo conditioner and soaps as they pretty much only provide you 1 days worth , and toilet paper they only give you 3 rolls. The mini mart downstairs is very over priced. nice views however of mountains and beach.

We've just returned from a week there and our view out over the golf course and city was lovely especially at night with all the lights. Our unit was of a good size, plenty of natural light also with it's own small balcony.Only negative is our unit could do with an update as it was a bit dated.

Pros- 1 block from Waikiki beach - 2 min from zoo, 5 min from Diamond Head- very central - comfy beds- reasonable rates Cons- dated decor- small bathroomsIf you don't plan to spend a lot of time in the room this could work great. If you do, note the nits above and see if you can something nicer for a similar price nearby. Plenty of choices.

The location was excellent, one block away from the beach and far enough from the main road not to have to much traffic noise but close enough for buses and walking into the main shopping area.The apartment we stayed in was tired but had everything we needed. The chairs were worn as was the kitchen and bathroom but everything was clean and comfortable and perfectly usable.

a friend and i stayed at this hotel last month.we reserved through a travel agent. i think that the hotel is managed by one company and you can rent in this building a number of ways.we were not impressed with the check in which didnt give us a nice first impression. i just dont get how you can walk up to a front desk agent and be ignored by them.our room was what we ordered, and we did get a nice view on the 33rd floor, corner unit.the suite needs renovating the kitchen is small and closed in the bathroom is tiny, it consists of a toilet and tub in one room and a sink just outside. the tub area needs new tiles and the sink adjacent to that room that has a unusually low sink and counter.the hide a bed was, i suspect, first installed when the building was new.we were impressed with one conceriege, mary ann. another one had ear buds in her ears when we asked her a question.there is a small cafe on the main level which is suprisingly nice.

We were so disappointed with this dirty run down and badly in need of some money spent on it hotel. Our room was dirty (crumbs and unidentified stains on most surfaces, benches carpets,bathrooms, table and furniture). We had booked this as a few nights of self catering in between a couple of resorts and we couldn't cook or eat here it was so dirty and didn't have enough crockery for four people or any cutlery at all. We didn't want the kids to be on the carpet and the water out of the taps was brown. So had to buy bottled water to clean teeth. The bathroom had many hairs and sand still in the bottom of the bath on our arrival. So disappointing, yes the location was good one block back from the beach but that was about it. We even found the staff to be tired and seemingly over it all too. So disappointing and really impacted on our first impressions of Waikiki.

great location, close to beach and transport. Hotel apartment very very dated, kitchen and bathroom in much need of face lift and in desperate need of new furniture, carpet and curtains etc. The lift and hall ways very hot and stuffy no air flow or a/c, and had a real strong unpleasant smell. Staff not always willing to help or assist View from room was great, but couldn't sit outside on balcony and enjoy because outdoor furniture was rotten. Overall our stay at Waikiki was still pleasant.

My room was out of date. But had all kitchenware needed including rice maker the staff at the front desk are fantastic . these rooms are individually owned so old carpets trickeling shower was not so cool, I'm in construction so I can live with that kind of stuff but what I can't live with is to find roaches in the room so I imediatly checked out and never looked back. Hopefully they have taken care of the problem after my complaint.

The rooms are spacious with a full kitchen, wonderful views from our room. This time we were on the top floor looking down to the beach and the other view was toward the mountains over the Ala Wai Canal and golf course. Front deck staff very good and helpful.

Firstly, the good points regarding the Aston at the Waikiki Banyan. The property is in a good position - only 200 metres to the beach. The view from the room was stunning. You could sit on the balcony and watch the Sun set over the Pacific each afternoon. The pool is small. The one hour that has been given over to people who would like to swim laps was a lovely bonusThe staff at the Reception Desk and the housekeeping staff were very helpful.However, the room was very dated. The carpet was significantly worn. It is time that this room ( and probably many others ) had a complete makeover. Recent cosmetic jobs ( such as a recent painting of the apartment ) were not enough. New kitchen and new furniture are desperately needed. It was also strange that there is not free wifi in the building.Still, the stay at the Aston Waikiki Banyan was a pleasurable one.

This would have to be the worst hotel ever. There were dogs peeing in the lifts, the carpet stank and you could smell the sewer. The pool area was very sad and depressing. I will never stay here again nor would I recommend it to anyone.

Arrived exhausted, no porter for bags, into room and was disgusted by not just torn curtains but shredded, 2 single beds (we are married), mouldy bathroom painted over, stained and dated furniture. Paid 230 Australian not including taxes thus asked to be moved to a more suitable room with a queen bed, also asking for porter. Staff arrived took our key - gave another and walked off. New room had queen bed, but was also substandard, curtains with holes (NOTE-in tower 1), bathroom mouldy and same painted over. Left next day to discover they charged another 258.72 Australian - appalling.

Stayed in a one bedroom unit with our children (21, 16, 14, 5) for three nights. One bedroom unit had a full kitchen, two queen beds in bedroom, one bathroom which had to be accessed through the bedroom, living room had a sofa sleeper, and we also requested a rollaway twin bed. We prefer staying in units with kitchens over the typical hotel room since we prepare a lot of our meals and find it easier to have a full breakfast 'in' while everyone is getting ready for the day. Units are clean but I knocked off a star because the units are in need of an update. There is no washer or dryer in the unit, however, there were washer and dryers at the end of the hall on our floor, and we used these the night prior to our departure. The pool and hot tub was out of service during our visit and we were allowed to use the pool at another Aston property near by. There is a playground which my 5 year old loved, and there are barbeque grills (fee to use grill). Friendly staff, great location to access H-1 freeway, and Kapahulu Avenue for grocery shopping and eateries. We are residents of Hawaii (kamaaina) so parking was at no additional charge. The price per night ($150) can't be beat!

Stayed with two friends in early October. I have to say even though lots of reviews state how dated the place is, I have to say I actually loved the building. And yes the building is very dated, very seventies, however the aircon worked fine and didn't make a noise, stayed on 33rd floor in tower 2 and the mountain view was just beautiful, the view changing constantly. Great location easy walk most places. Room was so quite, no building or traffic noise. "BUT" the issue was the people working there, no one seemed happy working there. Generally I would say staff were uncaring, unhelpful and lacking in any empathy with no interest in the customer at all. Arrived after 12 hour flight from Australia (at 6.45 am Sunday in the morning) The girl on reception was totally vacuous and uninterested, said we would need to come back at 3pm, that's fine so we come back at 2.45 pm and the girl says no room isn't ready, we sit in a corner like good guests. Taxi after taxi arrives, guests are checked in a shuffle off to their respective rooms. Finally we ask at 3.15 and are told "housekeeping has a problem" but we can go up .... the problem was a light bulb needed changing.After numerous poor interactions over several days with unhelpful, uninterested staff I finally vented to a nice young man on the desk one evening who was kind and did listen to me and treat me with empathy. He arranged for me to see the manager (Ivory) the following day. Ivory was also responsive and caring, and I am grateful for her response. However it shouldn't escalate to that level The guy in the coffee shop also needs to sell the business or get another job, another unhappy camper under the roof!

We arrived on a Monday, had a note slipped under the door saying water would be turned off Tuesday between 9am and 4pm for repairs, got to be kidding right? said something to front desk, he looked at his computer, and said yes water would be off, we let that go, next week it happened again, but this time they were testing fire alarms, Went back down to front desk said this is not acceptable, he offered a room for the day to use, so the next day went down to the room to take a shower, fire alarms going off all the while, being on the 35 floor and have a disability stairs would not be an option, so disappointed with my first trip to Waikiki

Stayed at Banyan with family of 4 and inlaws in another unit. Booked trough Hello Relaxation. Both rooms were very dated, very, basic. No kettle in our room or desert spoons, with inlaws having 2 kettles and no forks. 2 glasses only for a family of 4. Very little to cook with as in pots, pans etc. Couch ripped and stained, basically all decor very old. Linen, towels very old and worn. Room smelt old & worn. Air conditioning loud and only really provides comfort in the lounge area. Inlaws unit very similar, very old and worn. Communication very poor from Hello Relaxation. Very unprofessional, would not recommend Hello Relaxation. However the Banyan itself if in a great location, and great place for families. I would stay at the Banyan again, just not in a room operated by Hello Relaxation.

we went on a staycation during fall break. This is a great property in Waikiki if you have kids . We had a full kitchen so were able to cook for the kids and not waste too much money eating out all the time. The 6th floor has a large pool, Jacuzzi, play ground and bbq area. You will not find this in Waikiki. A wonderful spot to let your kids get all their crazy energy out. The rooms were a little outdated but very spacious and we were able to close of the bedroom area when the kids went to sleep. We were also able to walk to the beach, zoo and aquarium. There are a lot of other great perks for being a local resident. We will definitely go back! The front desk staff was very warm and full of aloha.

Stayed here for a week in September on the 10th floor, arriving at the lobby it's beautiful open air lobby with a large water feAture in the corner, checkin was abit slow.However when we went up to the 10th floor what was most noticeable was a gross smell in the corridor (which was what I assume to be stale cigarette smoke) it was foul and was present initially when we entered our room.The room itself was average, it had all the ammenities one could want however it was quite old, and this was evident , everything was perfectly clean but you did get that distinct 'dirty because of age' impression. During our stay, the hotel was in an absolutely brilliant location (don't make the mistake though of asking taxis for the Aston Waikiki because you get taken to another hotel) Probably wouldn't stay here again, it was somewhat pricey for what you got and Waikiki is still a fair distance from the shops. But would definitely to people who are willing to compromise new and fancy for location.

Always a great place to stay for families. Room booked on VRBO. Have stayed here several times and have always enjoyed it. Close to the beach and swimming areas. Zoo & Aquarium close by. Several places to shop.

It was a clean and quite hotel. It has the amenities that works well for my family vacation. Swimming pool was not that big but my children enjoyed it. It also has 2 hot tubs, which was nice. It also has a playground for toddlers, which was nice if you have young children. It has tennis court and a basketball hoop. The only thing is you have to rent the equipment. Room was very nice. Had a good working kitchen. Enough room to move around. We had a great view of diamond head! The decore is a bit dated and need an update. But for the price, it's good. Room service was daily. The hotel has a laundry room which was useful and we did not need to go out to wash our clothes. Also it's close to the beach. Just 2 blocks away. Right where all the action are. Close to the zoo and the shopping center. We love the location and hotel. We would definitely come back to this hotel.

Our little one bedroom apartment was really discusting. The carpets had not been cleaned in a long time, mold on the walls, refrigerator, and bathroom. The kitchen cabinet came off the hinge when I opened it. The pictures fell off the walls and we're just tucked behind the dresser. The faucet in the tub was Brocken. After two days we even ran out of toilet paper and had to get another roll ourselves. Stay away from 1405. The company that runs it Shake vacation rentals or hello relaxation will nickel and dime you and they do not return your deposit. Crooks!!

My son turned 16 during this vacation, it was a blast! We came with another mom and her son who is my sons friend. They have family in Oahu and used to live there, now in California. My friend picked the Waikiki Banyon for location! It is literally a 2nd block up from the beach, close to Diamond Head. Right behind the Marriott. Perfect location! I read many reviews and saw both good and bad ones. This is my take....this is a huge condo complex that is managed by owners and property managers. Don't expect luxury, but expect clean and comfy. The bad reviews were people who booked directly through the condo complex or other obscure people. We booked through Koko Resorts! Highly recommend them!! FREE parking....FREE internet! Well kept up condos, not runned down or worn out. I noticed that a lot of the bad reviews were because of that. Not Koko Resorts! Great experience, great time.

The best thing to say about the hotel is it is in a convenient location not far from the beach. My room was a generous size and I had a good view over the mountains. Other than that it is ridiculously expensive and incredibly run down. My room wouldn't have had a makeover in 20 years, not pleasant and well below the expectations set by the price.

Wish I could give a 2.5 rating.We stayed here for 10 days in September as there are not many serviced apartments will full kitchens in Waikiki. We have a young family so really need to use facilities where we can cook meals.The positives of the banyan:- it was in a great location for what we needed; only 2 blocks from the part of the beach where we normally take the kids (near the break wall where it is calmer for the kids to swim). We were about 2 mins walk from the trolley and bus stop too which was good. 10 mins walk to the food pantry (only supermarket in Waikiki) and just around the corner from the Marriott where all the tours pick up and drop off from.- the view from our room was great; we were on level 27 of tower 2 straight up the mountain so at night time the kids got to see "fairly land" and of a day the clouds over the mountains were beautiful. Got a great breeze.- the little minimart was convenient for water and late night snacks - they also had a cafe but we didn't use it but they served some healthy options like chia porridges etc- pool was very basic but the kids loved it, small spa, BBQ facilities and a small playground (all old and in need of a facelift but useable)- kitchen facilities were in working order and there was enough of everything to cook a meal and eat it.- we didn't use them but there was a PlayStation and also you could get DVDs to watch from a rental desk at no charge.Negatives: - The hotel itself was way overpriced for the quality of the hotel. It is in major need of a facelift. It smelled like my Nan's holiday house - old and smelly, the furniture had burn marks in the fabric, the carpet was old and dirty with burn marks in it.- the hotel staff were not really friendly or welcoming and spent a lot of time talking to each other or on their mobile phones- the tour desk operators were ok at booking but were really bad at customer service and were not very friendly, clocked off at exactly 5 and were annoyed if you were still there trying to finalise a booking. There was no follow up from them when you returned from your tours to see what you thought. They too spent a lot of time on their cell phones texting.- the room configuration was a bit odd. The bedroom had a door to separate the bedroom from the living area but the aircon was in the lounge area, so if the door was closed (which we had to do every night to give the kids a good sleep) it was stinking hot in the bedroom. There were no fans in the bedroom- the bathroom was like being on a cruise ship (toilet almost in the shower), small bath/shower big enough for a child to bath.- the bath towels were about the size of a tea towel and really poor quality- the block out curtains in the bedroom had deteriorated so there was no blocking out of sun - up with the sunrise for us- at 8 am in the morning on the 2 days we managed to sleep in (the first two days) we were greeted with drilling next to our bedroom wall. Apparently they were doing renovations and fire alarm upgrades which we only found out when we asked them about the noise. They did blame the building owners and wouldn't take responsibility ( they however did waive ½ the amenities fee of $100).

We travelled on a family holiday with a group of 15 (4 families). Trying to find accommodation that was reasonably priced, close to all the main attractions and so that we could all be together proved to be a little challenging. The Aston was perfect. Self contained condo's and in a great location. One block back from the beach and a great price. Friends had previously stayed there and recommended it to us. We all found our accommodation very comfortable and we were very happy with our choice. Great for family and large groups.

This is an apartment block - a bit old and tired but clean and had all we needed. Spacious with a full kitchen (big fridge/freezer - a must for those much needed ice cubes) good sized living area plenty of room in the bedroom. Lou and shower over the bath was very small but the vanity unit just outside door was fine. On arrival we found reception to not be very helpful - we arrived about 8.30am and could not get into our room until 3pm - hot tired and very overdressed the most they offered was to store our cases. Found out later there was a coffee place on site where we could have collected our thoughts and the pool area where we could have stretched out on a sun lounger. There is a good sized pool which is well maintained, with plenty of sun loungers. A tennis court for anyone who has the energy and plenty of barbeques with seating and tables available. Tea/coffee was replenished daily when the room was serviced.

The location of this hotel is very convenient. It is a block from the beach and in the quieter section of the beach close to Diamond Head. We found the staff at the front desk to be friendly and accommodating. Our room was a one bedroom condo with a terrace. The room was very clean, but could use an update. The entire hotel was clean, but seemed a bit old. A fresh coat of paint would work wonders. However, it was a nice place to stay and was always very clean.
Had a great stay at Waikiki Banyan. Great location, fantastic views from some apartments, friendly and helpful staff.

This is my favorite place to stay in Honolulu because it is like and apartment at the beach. The staff is great and the hotel room is more like an apartment with a full kitchen, living room and separate bedroom. It is only a couple of blocks from the beach so you are close enough to walk there, but far enough away to avoid the madness when one of the many festivals comes thru town. It is a great place to just relax and enjoy Hawaii.

The hotel is in a good location, easy to catch the buses from there and a 5 minute walk to the beautiful Waikiki Beach. Desk staff were very helpful when we needed it. The pool was lovely and we always had loungers for our use. The only downside of the hotel is that our room decor was very dated, as was the furniture. My friend stayed here 20 years ago and from what she said the decor hadn't changed. The sofa bed was not very comfortable. I would stay here again with my family but would ask for a more modern room.

This is my first time staying here. I was a bit unsure about it because I didn't know if it was big enough for my family. However, I was quite surprised. The room we are in has two double beds and a pull out sofa. It's kind of dated but there's enough space for the four of us. The parking pass was included in our stay. There is coin laundry available onsite.Access to room is quick and easy. You get an access code to enter room and the key and parking permit is left on counter. Kitchen has fridge, coffee maker, and microwave. Room has air conditioning.

Mostly I like this condo, but there was only one thing I felt unfortunate about it.We decided to stay here because their on-site parking fee was cheeper ( $15.00 per day at the time; $20.00 now ) than most hotels and condos around Waikiki area. Regular price was $25.00 per day in Waikiki.I went there with my wife in late November in 2014 and stayed for 8 nights( Sort of an old story ).They offered us a very nice room on the top (38th) floor faced to Ala Wai Canal. It was gorgeously furnished. Dining table was so large and it had a beautiful brown marble tabletop.We were so happy to spend time in the room until 'IT' happened.The first night, when we were preparing our meals and were almost ready to eat, I found something was moving at a corner of the tabletop, and I realised it was a tiny little roach! Oh my gosh!After we found one, they appeared one after another. We gave up eating on the GORGEOUS LARGE table.Only one drawer below the table was locked with key, and we couldn't open, which we thought the owner of the room used it. I was sure THAT was where the roaches came from.Thus, we fought roaches with my whole body gooseflesh and caught over 10 of them. All of them were shorter than half an inch.Next morning, I told the story at the front desk, and they told us they would clean the room during the day when we would be out.When we went back to the room, quickly I found one on the ceiling. I called the front desk and they sent a room-keeping guy. The guy brought a bottle of insecticide and stood on the table with his SHOES ON and caught it with my help. Since the tabletop was brown, tiny roaches were hardly visible and I had to look tangential to the tabletop to find them.I asked the guy wether they had cleaned the room on the day or not. He called the front desk and asked about it. The answer was, ... "They FORGOT." "WOW!" I was at a loss and didn't feel like becoming angry. I asked the guy to leave the insecticide, and he left it with a piece of advice. That was like, "It has a strong smell. So you'd better use it before you go out." I couldn't help using it when we were at the room. They appeared in the kitchen and the bathroom.Thus and thus, I fought them with a strong chemical weapon over night. (The 2nd night)Again, next morning, we requested the front desk to clean the room during the day, and we went to Waikele Shopping Center for the Black Friday bargain.We went back to the room early in the next morning and we fell asleep soon.........I woke up late in the morning and I found a roach in our bedroom. OH MY GOSH! They finally INVADED our bedroom! I could not put up with the situation ANY MORE! I was exhausted from "the Roach Fight".I called the front desk and requested to change the room.They told us they would offer a grade-up room, and we packed our baggage and moved. But we didn't think we'd got a grade-up room. Because, the first room where we fought roaches was on the top 38th floor with beautiful mountain view, but the second room was on the 33rd floor with PARTIAL PARTIAL ocean view and was much smaller.Anyway, we were released from the fear of roaches and could eat and sleep with ease after spending our precious 3 days of our 8-night stay in Hawaii struggling with roaches.The second room was based on white, so we would be able to find roaches easily if they appeared. But they never appeared this time.Otherwise, we love this condo very much and made a great Hawaiian memory of our life.I think I WILL stay here again next time if I can afford to.Thank you!MAHALO.Share review Edit review Delete review

Visited Honolulu while attending conference. I stayed here for a week with two colleagues and my room was 15th floor. The room were spacious and clean. The hotel says this room is for 5 people but I think this room is for maximum 3 or 4 people. There were one queen sized bed, one rollaway bed and a sofa bed. The queen bed was good but the sofa bed doesn't seem to work well so in our case, beds were suitable for 3 people. Others were good. The room had microwaves, oven, tablewares.. good for making some foods. This room also had the PlayStation 3. If you want to play some game with others, bring some game DVDs from home. This hotel provides coupons for PS3 title and you can get movie titles somehow but there weren't much choices for games.The view was not the best because some buildings blocked the view of ocean but pretty good for that price. I could see the part of Waikiki beach and part of the Kapiolani Regional Park. And I could get to Waikiki beach within almost 10 mins by foot, so almost all others were good.

The Aston at Waikiki Banyan has been recently under gone quite a complete renovation. The rooms are really nice. The kitchen has a full-size refrigerator, stove, microwave and coffee machine. This was perfect for our needs as our daughter was getting married. We needed the refrigerator to keep her wedding flowers chilled. Love the new furniture and a family of four would be very comfortable. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. The hotel location is good because you can get access from Kapahulu Avenue. You don't have to drive in Waikiki traffic! Easy on and off the freeway, which is what we needed for a wedding weekend!!! Within walking distance to Zoo, Waikiki Aquarium, Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center and of course only a couple blocks form the beach.

We had a self contained room, very spacious, had a balcony, which we could just see the ocean.The rooms like others said were a bit tired & needs revamp, but to me personally they were clean, cormfortable & everything we needed, each room I think are actually owned by people who lease them out, so it's up to those people to fix them up, not the hotels.We were hardly there as we are on holidays to explore Hawaii, which we certainly did.Rooms were attended to every day with fresh towels, cleaned, beds made.The place was very central, a block from beach & main drag, bus stop around corner, if you want luxury there are other hotels right smack bang in Hawaii, but of course there's $$$. We were happy ... Loved Hawaii !!

I stayed here for a month while on business. There was really only one plus with staying here - the location. It's pretty handy to Waikiki. There were a lot of minuses, unfortunately... The rooms are all extremely dated and very worn & tired. While everything is still (mostly) functional, it's also ready for the scrap bin. The furniture was very well worn and smelled a little funky and the bottom of our lounge chair broke when it was sat on. The carpet was horribly stained - it looked like a Jackson Pollock painting and a full bottle of red wine had been spilled on it at some stage.Every time we cooked, we set the smoke detector off. The extractor fan over the stove is pretty much there for decoration only. We even set the smoke detector off in the corridor once, luckily it didn't force an evacuation, although this did happen one morning (somebody in another room burnt their toast apparently).Although an oven is provided, no oven-proof cookware is, so you either have to buy your own, or cook on the stove-top. We also had no kettle for boiling water.We used the outdoor BBQ area a couple of times (mainly to avoid setting the smoke alarms off!), but the security guards are particularly over-zealous in policing the "no bottle" rule. The second time we used the area, we were forced to leave as we had a glass bottle of salad dressing. At the same time, a Japanese family were also forced to leave (the wife in tears) as they had a bottle of wine. I can understand the need for safety, but a little common sense and courtesy goes a long way and the BBQ area is well separated from the pool area.Coin-op laundry facilities are provided, but are expensive at $2/wash and then $2/dry and they only take quarters.The elevators also became a nuisance - they were slow, one of them constantly malfunctioned (which the staff were aware of, but it never got fixed while I was there) and the cleaning staff also used the guest elevators - not really an issue (I realise they need to move between floors too!) but their carts took up the entire elevator and they used the elevators a lot... The water pressure in the shower was non-existent - we had to use the pulse setting on the shower head, otherwise the water just dribbled out.The rooms are also extremely noisy - road noise and sirens go on 24/7. Even on the 26th floor, the sirens woke us up. There was also a lot of maintenance going on, with somebody on the floors above using a hammer drill most days, starting at about 0800, which wasn't appreciated. The curtains are also pretty ineffective at keeping light out, so sleeping during the day was difficult (we were on shift work).Overall, this place needs some serious work and I wouldn't recommend staying here until it's done. There are nicer places for a similar price in the same area.

The rooms we had were very dated and definitely needed a makeover. The beds were comfortable and clean. It's a great location with only a short walk to the beach. It's away from the hustle and bustle of the beach front so a lot quieter.

This property has all the basics and more: pool in good sunlight;food service near pool; several BBQs and picnic tables; kiddie playground, hot tub; mini mart; parking on site; several elevators. The location is only 1 block away from the beach. Walking distance to shops and restaurants.

We are a family of four, my husband, my grown daughter and my teenage grandson. Stayed over the 4th of July 2016 holiday for 5 night and 6 days. I agree with a few of the other reviews, the hotel is in need of renovations and it is a bit outdated but the location is the best! We absolutely enjoyed having a full kitchen, we had a great partial view of Diamond Head and the hotel pool. The staff was very helpful but at our arrival I didn’t feel a warm welcome but after that everything was fine. We enjoyed the pool area and wish we would have taken advantage of the BBQ pits that they have available on the hotel premises. If I would have known I would have requested a renovated room which would have been a lot nicer. The cleaning staff was always very helpful. We had breakfast on our lanai almost every day or at least some coffee. There are a lot of plusses to staying at this great hotel, including the great location and all the surrounding convenient stores, shops, restaurants and activities in the area. We would definitely stay here again especially if we had a renovated room. It’s about making great memories and we certainly did!
user_name:
Veronica N
Houston, Texas, United States

review_body: The rooms in this hotel were very much in need of renovations. Every cushion on our couches had holes/rips. The bathroom had patched holes on the wall. The carpet was old and stained. But the location is excellent. The size of the rooms were good. Full kitchen in the room. Great kids playground and pool onsite. Good convenience store and coffee shop in the foyer area. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. With renovations I'd rate this 4/5 but they are long overdue.

I think this property is great for families and longer stays, but it was just too old and outdated for me. It's a few blocks to Waikiki, and they have a little convenience store next to the elevators. The view from my first room was incredible, Diamond Head and partial ocean view, but the room itself was bland with tacky furniture. I checked with the front desk and they said I could look at another room the next day. I received excellent customer service from the following employees: Ihilani, Jasmine, Cliff and the property manager. I moved to a different room the next day which was better than the first. I guess I was expecting a more 'resort' type place. Went to the pool one day but left after a few minutes because there is a playground right next to the pool and the kids were yelling (just being kids) but it was just too noisy. Again, I think it would be a good place for families since there is a full kitchen in the units, but for me, I wouldn't stay again.

This is an average hotel that is showing its age. It is located just a short walk back from the beach and the area is quite quiet. The curtain in our bedroom consisted of simply a net-lace, which failed to block out the light. This meant we woke at sunrise when a bit more of a sleep after a long flight would have been welcomed.

I stayed 10 days at the Banyan Waikiki end of June 2016. First time in Honolulu.Familly of 5 (3 adults and 2 kids - 8 and 10 ). We loved the great location which is 1 block from the beach. It is located on a more quiet area of waikiki which is great for famillies with kids.We took an ocean view room on the 34th floor which was great to wake up to I was disapointed that my unit was not a renovated one. Everything inside was old and dated. The sofa was smelly and half broke. I did not even want to sit on it. The unit had carpet that was so bad, I had to keep my sandals on the whole time. I could not walk barefoot.Beds and pillows were not confortable and should be replaced as well. When you book make sure you ask for a renovated room.(Not sure if this is possible)Services was great, every request we made at the front desk was taken care of immediatetly. Everyone at the front desks was very nice and helpful.The pool area is on the 6th floor with some BBQ to rent was quite nice and we did enjoy it.Wifi was included with our 18$ a day resort/amedities fee. Parking was 20$ a day extra.  The location and the service from the front desk got them the 3 stars but the room itself would deserve 2 star only. I would only go back if the furnitures and and the floor get a complete reno.

we go to Hawaii every year to be with family. We tried several places until we went to the Banyon. We have now been there the last 12 years. The rooms are large, full kitchen, wifi, parking, views, bbqs and more. Location is great one block from the beach and two blocks from the zoo. With the full kitchen we save heaps. But there are many places to eat nearby. Parking seals the deal. It is a place I am happy to be at, as a former local it is a place my ohana loves to meet at. Sometimes when you find a great place you don't want to tell too many people because "it's your spot". Well after 12 years, I've shared my spot.

Great location to get in and out of Waikiki. Within walking distance of Kuhio Beach (safe shallow swimming area, no rocks, with lifeguard station and seawalls), Queens Beach with shallow swimming area and rocky area (lots of fishes). The Honolulu Zoo and Aquarium are also within easy walking distance. 1 Bedroom, 1 bath, 1 small full kitchen and living room. Lanai to sit out on. We faced the Ala Wai Canal. No access to computer or printer. If you are leaving, you have to printout your boarding passes at the airport.Staff friendly. Condos are showing their age.Parking structure is $20 a day. I have stayed here several times and the parking is getting expensive. They also charge an $18/day "Amenity Fee" for the wifi, gym, BBQ and pool facilities on the 6th floor. You are suppose to be able to rent free DVDs during your stay (but this is Honolulu, why are you watching a DVD ?)Located towards Diamond Head. Go up Kapahulu to find Leonard's for Malasadas and for the Rainbow Drive Inn. Airport is 11 miles (25 minutes) away. Costco is located 7 miles away, about 20 minutes. Try Don Quijote for groceries or Hawaii goodies about 2.5 miles or 15 minutes away.Ala Moana Shopping Center is 2.5 miles away.Hanauma Bay is 10 miles away.

Pros:This properties are in great location. Right off Kuhio Blvd and two blocks away from Waikiki beach. Close to a lot of good restaurants and local dives. This properties is located on the south end of Waikiki easy in and out of the area to Kapahulu blvd & the freeway without having to meander through Waikiki traffic.Love the lobby has a beautiful waterfall and koi pond. Hotel staff were very accommodating and helpfulGreat view from our balconyThe condos here are fairly spacious (roughly 600 sq ft) with a full kitchen & balcony.Great pool but too crowded & nice towelsFree newspaper daily, videos & laundry services every floorCons:Aston itself is pretty old & very datedBe forewarned, the resorts & rooms look nothing like the pictures on the website. The resorts and rooms are very dated and in need of a significant renovation.
