Carpet is worn and beds and furniture are old, cheap and uncomfortable.The A/C too noisyBed bugs!!!No water pressure in the shower!Housekeeping for full services clean every 3 days (should be daily)The machines in the laundry room are super old and need to be upgraded!Extra charges: Parking $20/day & $18 amenity fees if you want to get high speed internet & BBQs (coin operated!) & no gym

We loved condo 2003 in tower II. The whole process was quick and easy for renting it and getting in on the first day. Inside it is large and welcoming. The newly remodeled unit is light and bright and stylish. The air conditioner is a nice touch too. It was a quiet location with a great view day and night. My family liked the location, and we walked every where. The other things I liked were free parking, free wifi and no resort fee. I spent a lot of time trying to find something like this in Waikiki. The Waikiki Banyan has a nice 6th floor deck area with a pool, bbs and bathrooms and saunas. This will be our go to condo for Oahu visits.

This was a perfect location. We made this our "base" and walked and drove the entire island of Oahu. We were on island for 6 days. Spectacular mountain side view-tower 2.The staff was wonderful. we stayed in tower 2. There was laundry on every floor. There was a mini mart. Parking available but quite spends! $20 per day. We stayed in a room with kitchenette which was stocked nicely with most everything we needed. We went to Safeway which was about a mile a way and got our evening meals, snacks and breakfasts there to make in our room. There is a pool nice area with barbecue grills and picnic tables and a snack bar as well. Pool, tennis court, and basketball court.We walked to the beach a half a mile away and watched the sunset every night. The room wasn't cleaned until late in the day 3-4pm. We came back and they were wanting to clean it. That was a bummer.

We had an apartment which was a bit " dated" and "tired " in need of upgrading...nevertheless the beds were comfortable and we did have a bath as well as a shower .The kitchen facilities were also good ,the daily housekeeping was just to make the beds and change towels with full vacuuming etc done only every 3 days !The highlight of staying at this facilities is the close proximity to Waikiki beach and trolley stop.... beach 5 minutes walk and trolley 2 minutes ( just around the corner ) Unfortunately the pool was being upgraded during our stay so it was closed .I would certainly stay at the Banyan again in spite of its ( tiredness)
user_name:
Maureen L
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: It was a stay with my family; 3 adults, 1 kids of 3 year-old, 1 baby of 5 months.I had reservations of 2 rooms. One for us of 4 , the other one is for my mother. Our room was the nearest(same position in opposite side) as I had requested. This hotel doesn't have any connecting room.Our rooms were on 23th floor. I requested them to have higher floor.My room had twin bed. My mother's room had double bed(connected one). It was different from my request. I asked reservation staff to have double bed for us of 4 so the front staff seemed to make a mistake. By the way my mother's room wasn't ready at 3 p.m.(check in time) so she had to wait for check in at our room.Rooms was relaxing.Clean(not perfectly but no problem at all), good view, enough size to spend time with 4 members(2 adult, kid and baby).Baby cot was available for free.Kitchen was also good.It has everything we needed; dishes, glasses, catoraries, cooking tools, gas stoves(IH, 4 spots) and a big oven.Although there were some problems to setting the room up(no flushed toilet, un-connected wifi, don't know how to change the water to hot water in bath tub faucet), staffs helped us as soon as we requested.The view from the window was great.P.S. BBQ corner isn't good. It wasn't ready yet at 1215 p.m. The lady in Front desk answered me on the phone that it would be ready at 0130 p.m.  Is it too late for lunch?とてもよかった。リラックスできて楽しい時間を過ごせたワイキキビーチまでのアクセスもとても良い家族連れにはピッタリベビーベッドは無料貸し出し

The initial impression was pretty much a "wow". The lobby is all that we expected of a hotel in Hawaii-open aired with a Polynesian feel and a waterfall. Even the elevator was classy. And our view was stunning. That's where the impressiveness ended. Although the room was large and had a mini kitchen, I wouldn't have used the appliances. The light switch was dirty, the floor was dirty, and everything had a less than clean feel to it. Maybe it was because the furniture and decor were so outdated, The shower fixtures and linoleum flooring were decades past their prime.To add insult to injury, there's a resort fee. This was no resort. That fee included the wi-fi, which is fee in most other places we have stayed in the last few years. The parking garage had old outdoor chairs and other junk against one wall. I'm sure anyone could find a nicer place to stay. Paying a little more would have been worth it.

First, let me say the managers were really nice! and they did everything they could to make up for the horrible room that was given to us the first time!!! This place needs upgrading!!! The elevator had plywood on the floor!!! what???! uh! low budget!!!!! They gave us a room that was on the 25th floors that had amazing views but.... we walked in the door and it was horrible!!! The floor had vynly flooring that was blue and white/turning yellow!!! The carpet must've been original because it was blue.. turning yellow!! I was not taking my shoes off in this rat hole!!! Sorry!!! The furniture looked like it was about to fall over! it was nasty! the bedding!!! the yellow nasty bed spread was Hideous!!!!! I had to take it off the bed just not to look at it! The drapes were white, and you can see the bunched up cotton through them, they were nasty!!! My husband had to play with toilet to flush it!!! Nasty!!! again Nasty!!! The lamp was being held up by masking tape!!! its was just horrible!!! The view was the only thing amazing about this room! I was on hotels. com ready to hit the enter button on another hotel when my husband said let's go ask them if they can help us at the front desk. I said ok. They showed us 2 more rooms, my husband said lets just stay here on the last one so I said fine. I was still totally over it. They were again very nice at the desk!!!!! Location is fantastic! But so is the Marriott, Hilton, Hyatt and Nicer Hotels!!!!! Sorry! Remodel this place!!! #lowbudget

We arrived at 8am and were not able to check in until 3pm. Not happy. We had travelled from NZ for 8 hours so were very tired. I don't know why we had to wait for 7 hours to get in. We were able to leave our cases at the hotel but then had to find something to do for that time. Tired, grumpy and very very hot. Surely they could clean our room faster than that.

We stayed here for 5 nights. This hotel accommodated our family of 5. The hotel was walking distance to the beach aquarium restaurants ect. The front desk staff were very polite and helped us book our tickets for various activities we wanted to go to. Overall the room itself was a little outdated but we barely stayed in there anyways. It was a great family vacation and thank you to the staff at Waikiki banyan for your great service.

Loved my stay at the Banyan... a short stroll to the beach in one direction or the zoo in the other. While in Oahu, there were a lot of construction sites happening in the more central part of Waikiki, so we were lucky to be on the outskirt of all this noise!! The room was comfortable, a bit outdated in décor but the beds were extremely comfy and our room was kept clean for us, it was, after all, just a place to sleep as theres so much to see and do! Our room was on the 33rd floor and the view was AMAZING! especially of Diamond Head Crater :-) The staff were very friendly and helpful... I would definitely stay here again...Mahalo :-)

Enjoyed our stay near waikiki beach-one block away. Lots of restaurants and shopping and close to diamond head.You can also take the Bus anywhere for $ 2.25.Hawaii's beautiful and has a good vibe.The condo was ok not super but had a great view-choose a higher roomonly the apt was a bit dated not too shabby though.

We got hit with hidden fees including a mandatory extra per night charge for DVD rental + other standard amenities. This bumped our (already expensive!) advertised nightly stay up by 20% - 30%. Watch out for this!Not once did the valet pick up the phone when I called (4 times).The rooms are horrible. They look and feel like they're from the 90's. Further, our room came with two single beds when we specified a double, queen or king. You want tea or coffee? Enjoy the milk powder. No mini bar fyi.TV? You'll have to walk to a DVD kiosk on another floor - their pamphlet boasts newer releases than Blockbuster...what year is this?!There are much better and cheaper options. Look elsewhere.

This hotel is well situated just two short blocks from Waikiki Beach and the shopping strip in one direction with the Zoo and Aquarium in the other. It had the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. As I was travelling with a friend we had single beds which was a bit of a problem for space as my bed was up against the wardrobe and had to be moved to get at the clothes or the safe. The rest of the unit was spacious enough with a living room area, dining area and a galley kitchen. The kitchen was a bit old and tired but everything worked.The airconditioner worked very well. The soundproofing in the rooms was excellent. We were right next to the guest laundry which also housed two huge electrical boxes which hummed loudly but we didn't hear any of it in the unit, nor was there any noise from the corridor or other rooms. I was very impressed with that.There was a small balcony that overlooked (from 13 floors up) the pool area and provided a great view across to Diamond Head.The staff were friendly and helpful and I would happily stay there again.

good location..close to beach..5 min walk..kitchen facilities..apartments a little dated but do the job for a busy family!!Laundry in the building.We stayed in standard room as well as ocean view..the only difference was the view.

Stayed here for three nights while in Honolulu May 4-7. The room we had on the 16th floor had a galley kitchen, living room and bedroom that could be closed off. The room was clean, bed comfortable and furnishings ok, but outdated. The bathroom was clean, but the shower has been re-calked so much it would be better and look much better to put in a new shower. The lobby area is nice, staff helpful/friendly and there is a small store and small breakfast/lunch area serving food that is quite good. There is a guest laundry facility on each floor. The pool and tennis courts are on the 6th floor and are nice. There is an area with grills (which cost) and patio furniture for guests who wish to grill their own food. The location is two blocks from the beach, the zoo and a very short walk to nice shopping/restaurants along Waikiki Beach. We drove to Diamond Head to climb the trail and this drive is literally 5 minutes from the hotel. If you are looking for a clean place in a good location, this is the place for you. If you want a resort experience, go elsewhere.

Upon seeing quite a few negative reviews beforehand, I was scared that my family would end up with a "bad" room. To our surprise and delight we were upgraded to the 38th floor with a wonderful view. Staff is great. Our room was great, still a little dated but definitely is kept very well and was made a little modern. We had all the utensils and equipment we needed for the kitchen. Although, there was no oil, and salt and pepper, but Safeway is just a 3-5 minute drive away. There is a $20 accommodation fee per night, but it's alright. Towels were changed daily, and bar of soaps were provided and left when needed. Towels can be borrowed on floor number 5. Wifi connection is 8/10, but sometimes buffers. Parking is not part of the hotel fee and is $20 a day, but apparently that is the cheapest around here. We bumped into a couple who said their hotel parking is $30. There is free parking along Ala Wai, and Ohua if you're lucky, might need to make a few rounds to try to score one. This hotel is only a couple of blocks away from Waikiki Beach. Really close to Leonard's, Zippy's, and the Rainbow Drive-In. Would def recommend this hotel!

Overall I would recommend to stay here, we had a positive experience. My husband and I stayed at the Aston Waikiki Banyan April 2016. We stayed for one week. We had a great experience with the hotel, everyone was friendly and helpful. The particular room we had was older style with no upgrades however we were told each room is still individually owned by people so that is not up to the Banyan to control upgrades. The only down side was our room was missing a few basic items and one element on the stove was broken. The room only contained one frying pan, no spatula only large spoons for cooking, no toaster and one pan for the oven. It was fully equipped with all cutlery, dishes, cups, rice cooker, cutting board, chopping knifes and can opener. The bed was comfortable and the air conditioning worked very well. We never used the DVD rental which was part of the resort fee. Housekeeping did a very nice job of cleaning and we always had fresh towels. We did not have a recycling bin only a garbage can. Loved the location of the building it was near the beach and beach walk and quieter as it was not on the beach. It's very close to bus stops. We were on a higher floor so we also did not have much noise from the pool deck.

When you stay with a family you want a kitchen to prepare a couple simple meals a day. You want a laundry room down the hall. There should be a pool, and a beach within walking distance. This place has all of this, and with a larger suite style room to boot. We were so glad that we stayed here. Everyone at the front desk was helpful too. Thank you for the anniversary wine & chocolates too. Mahalo!

I love the location of this hotel. It's a two block walk to the beach and is close to many different types of restaurants.When we travel to Honolulu we are there to relax and spend time with family. This is a kid friendly hotel with a pool and playground.I really liked the coffee shop on the main floor. They have a really good cold brew coffee along with baked goods and deli sandwiches.We were there with relatives so we were in four different rooms. One if the rooms had been completely updated. New kitchen, floors and bathroom fixtures. The other three were in need of being upgraded. The carpets and curtains really needed replacing and some of the furniture too.The hotel rooms were all very clean and set up for cooking with stoves and full refrigerators. Had all of the rooms been upgraded I would have given 4 stars, mainly because of the location and staff.We will most definitely stay there again.

Great location, clean room, fantastic ocean view. My husband and I stayed with our 13 year old and 8 year old. We felt well taken care of, and the mini-mart and cafe were convenient. The only drawback was the comfort of the beds, but I would highly recommend the Banyan. Great value, and customer service was excellent. Loved our kitchen facilities. And again, the location was superb.

We booked a one bedroom apartment. We got a one bedroom apartment, the flooring, curtains, furniture, kitchen were old, broken and dirty. The room across from us spotless, all new furniture. It is pot luck staying here if you get an acceptable room, we complained via email to general manager as reception staff were not friendly. No response. The beds were very uncomfortable. The bathroom cramped, outdated. Repaired very badly so it looked worse and dirty. With a family we wanted an apartment so we could eat in, apart from breakfast we ate out. Kitchen covered in micro ants that bite. I went to buy my own kitchen spray for benches, they were filthy.

We have stayed at the banyan on a number of occasions at various times of the year, as a couple mostly and once with our daughter.It has everything you need. The area is quiet compared to other parts of Waikiki. If you are a bit older and/or love shopping a bonus is the bus almost at the door. There is a good little shop and a coffee shop. Quick walk to the zoo and the lovely park. Also a nice quiet area to swim this end and not the squash like other end near the higher end hotels. Can't wait to go back. Entering the foyer always feels like we are home. We went earlier than may 15 but wouldn't let me put any other date below.

We travel to Oahu several times a year. with friends and family, We use to stay at hotels, but the prices, and resort fees, and parking fees are just going up and up, So we started looking at condos for rent, about 6 years ago, we found this property, The unit are huge compared to a hotel room, at the fraction of the price. and you kinda feel like your at home, away from home. Parking is almost always free with each condo, which can save you a small fortune,Great location, only 2 blocks from the beach, and no traffic noises.NIce views of the ocean, and diamond head as well. We love it !! And are heading back there in 2 weeks for our anniversary.

I recently stayed at this hotel with another adult and two children. This is not a newer hotel, but this is an ideal hotel for anything we wanted to do; ie two blocks from Kuhio Beach; across the street from the trolley stop; etc. Although there is no restaurant on-site there is a small coffee shop, convenience store; plus a magazine called "Room Service Waikiki"..this includes menus from various restaurants where you can order and have the meal delivered for a nominal fee. Our room had two queen beds; hide a bed, kitchen and bathroom and was perfect for our family. The facility includes a play ground, pool, tennis court and barbecue area. There are also laundry facilities on nearly every floor. ALL of the staff were friendly, pleasant and helpful. I would most definitely recommend this facility; and will stay there if I am ever fortunate enough to return to Waikiki!

Fully stocked ℅ dos where you can cook, relax and enjoy in a very convenient place, downtow, only one block from beach. Pools, snack bar, good parking, comfortable. Modern, clean and affordable. We have stayed here for years and enjoy it very much

We loved our stay at the Aston Waikiki banyan, it felt like a real home from home throughout the whole two weeks. From the moment we arrived to a room upgrade and bottle of fizz to celebrate our first anniversary we knew it was going to be the perfect trip. The room was clean and the balcony gave us a lovely partial sea view for catching the last few rays of the day. We used the pool area most days and the BBQ area was a great alternative to eating out. The staff were all friendly and helpful and we used the shop/coffee shop on site most days. The location is perfect to get to everything you need in Waikiki and there are two bus stops really close by. The only tiny criticism we had was the limited cable channels - we stayed at the Aston Waikiki sunset last year and they seemed to have so much more. When you're in paradise this isn't a huge issue but with a young family we were in the room early most evenings so more choice would have been appreciated.We would definitely stay here again and really hope we will be back soon.

We stayed overnight while waiting for our cruise. The staff were friendly and provide great insight to finding a breakfast spot. Hotel was clean and well kept. Was surprised to hear that not many people outside Hawaii stay here. The staff assisted us with taxis and guidance for site seeing.

My family of five stayed for 7 nights. We enjoyed it and it was just the right size. We had the laundry just across from us. Well equipped kitchen and lovely service. Would definitely stay there again.

This Condo was dated & small, more like a studio suite the way it was set-up as opposed to a one bedroom. The kitchen was small as well, but well appointed.Overall the room was clean, a little dated, and tight space for the 3 of us, but suited us for the 4 days we stayed there.We stayed on the 34th floor & had a corner unit with views of the city & diamond head.The fees for the wi-fi & dvd/PS3 game rentals was part of the 'Amenity Fee' but there was a good selection of movies & the wf-fi had a decent speed.The hotel was only a couple block walk to the beach which was great.The 'window shaker' a/c unit could not cool the bedroom once you had the sliding doors closed for privacy... We would probably book there again if we ever go back to Honolulu (though we have no plans to go back, we preferred the Big Island)

The suite was a bit small but kitchen was nice (outdated but good size and served my purpose - fridge for beverages, coffee pot and counter and chairs to eat snacks at) The beds we hard but okHousekeeping was minimal at best. Each day they came after 3pm and were rushed because they get off shift at 4 The room was never completely clean. They either didn't do the bathroom or the kitchen. The were rude when asked for extra towels (4 people in one room at the beach with a pool will require more than 4 tiny cheap towels per day) The front desk was a joke. Every time I went to the concierge (3times in one day to get trolley tickets) they were on a break and no one else could help. After waiting 15 minutes the last time I called the hotel from my cell and asked for her/him. They took so long I missed my tour bus and had to take the last of the day (there are only three and the passes are only good for one day - she sold it to me she should have known that)The front desk were rude and unhelpful. Always seemed to be put out by requests.

This building has a great location! Just 1.5 blocks to the beaches The hotel is ok, a bit dated but clean and the staff fairly friendly. There is a nice store on the ground level, to pick up some eggs and milk etc, it's open fairly late. They were kind enough to store our luggage for a late check out, which was great. Now I would like to talk about the condo we had.Sadly this had some disappointments.Firstly, it was dated, we expected that but it was relatively clean so that was ok.However, the pull out couch was aweful, the mattress was so worn, springs were felt, really? A new mattress wouldn't hurt the owner! My son slept on the couch instead as a couch. Good thing he's little.The bed was ok, a bit hard for me.Kitchen: This area really needs some tlc. If all the condos are as poorly equipped as this one, don't plan on too much cooking.1. No pizza pan to be found.2. No non stick frying pan.3. Limited pots and pans4. No kettle5. No salt or pepper, I would expect this at minimum.6. The worst, the coffee cups are about 5 oz. I had to go buy paper cups for my coffee.They did not supply any pool towels, or beach chairs would sure have been a bonus.The cleaners did clean daily and did a good job.The pool is ok, wish it was open later than 9pm. Seems like we just got back from dinner at 9 and it would have been nice to use then.View:We were pleased to be upgraded to what they said was an ocean view, I would call it more a city view but it was nice. However, if I had paid the $500 more for it, I would not have been impressed.The Wifi was good, no problems for us.ps. If you use the phones, in Hawaii, you do not need to dial the area code, took us some time to figure that out!Overall, great location, nice complex, just a few misses in the condo.But for an affordable place to stay and a location you can't beat, definately a good choice.

The Banyan has become a favorite of mine. As with most condo rentals, a lot depends on which one you get. Some are very well appointed, others are a little sparse. It's a comfortable, well located property. Good staff and all the amenities I need.

We stayed at this Hotel/condo for 6 nights. We were pleasantly surprised with the price, location and amenities'. A bright roomy condo with the facilities to make prepare/cook your own meals, taking the expense of dining out daily. Parking is available at a reduced cost if you have a car.Everything is in walking distance. Waikiki beach is a 5min walk and the same with the main tourist shopping precinct, BUT it offers you the quietness of not being in the middle of all the tourists. There are BBQ, facilities on the 6th floor where you an enjoy an evening meal. A swimming pool, spa, sauna, tennis and basket ball courts as well. Also a little kiosk if you wish to purchase a refreshment.Only negatives..... the floor covering were in need of an update and the room smelt a little musty, due to the aircon and being closed.( we found this smell in many premises through out Hawaii) We did not need the use of the aircon.. Opening the balcony door allowed pleasant breezes into the room. We did not need to use the aircon

We have enjoyed our stay here! Lucky enough to get a room with a view of the mountains... spectacular, especially at night with the lights. But you will need to be in the upper floors to see around the other buildings. Service has been great. Our kitchen knife was dull so we called and a new one was delivered in a couple minutes. Lots of room in the apt, and like the huge counter between the kitchen and living room. Balcony is wonderful, large with table and chairs. Good service at the front desk. We were here with a group, and our price was very reasonable!

We chose our hotel on the Internet, not choosing the cheapest, as we were only there for one night. The room we saw advertised what as we'd expect for the price, however the room we received was a dirty dive that had not been renovated since the early 1970's at best! When we asked about this, we were told that rooms were individually owned and it was up to the owners to renovate. However the pool facilities were nothing compared to advertised photos either. The only part tat looks decent is the foyer.... Nothing else. So beware, don't go by the Internet photos, the prices are at least three times what you'd expect for the quality.Just don't go there!

This hotel is very old and very basic. Many things need updated settees , kitchens. Staff were helpful. Not value for the money we paid. Location is not bad Pool was okay but loungers need replacing. Would not recommend it to friends

We stayed for 5 nights, and really liked it.Pros: Very close to Waikiki Beach, just one block with 5 minutes walking; south-faced with quite good ocean view; reasonable price compared with other properties close by; a lot of grocery stores, coffee bars, restaurants, and parks; free parking (if you just stay within Honolulu core area, you don't even need a car); full kitchen.Cons: A little bit too old, but acceptable; no washer or dryer (but it's okay because you don't really need one); spacious room that can easily sleep 4 (queen bed + queen sofa bed), and pull-door can separate for privacy.We will definitely consider here again next time.

We've stayed at the Waikiki Banyan several times. Rooms are owned by individuals who are responsible for the furnishings and upkeep. Carpet was a bit faded, part was replaced, didn't match. The mattresses were cheap and hard. Yucky rattan, when new wasn't nice, now a bit old. Sometimes we've had great rooms, sometimes these rooms are low dollar showing lots of wear and tear. Note to Aston, set minimum standards before you will rent them out.The building is quiet. Our room was next to and behind the elevators. Never heard them, not even a whisper. Our room was 1-2606. Nice views. Nice size room. (Suite). The bed spread color choice was awful. The cloth on the couch was warn through! It had a kitchenette. Oven temperature dial numbers were worn off. Temp. was anyones guess. Nothing to put in the oven to reheat pizza. Nothing. Not one pan to use in the oven. Only one medium frying pan. I don't think the Banyan is trying to be a cheap low priced hotel, but this room was not that far from that. This room wasn't cheap, and was far from the beach and center of Waikiki, so for the price it should have been a bit nicer. I should add that the location is as quiet as it gets in Waikiki. I guess I was a bit negative, this is a nice place to stay. Will we stay again? Most likely. Still will price other places. Just a little bit of new furnishings, this would have been great.Internet was fast and no issues with it. Our condo in Kapaa was iffy. Staff was very friendly and helpful. A maintenance person showed me the way to housekeeping to trade in towels for the beach so I didn't have to go to the lobby and switch elevators. I like the location, a little cheaper and a little quieter. On last note. Water was off one day from 9 to 4. I wonder when they knew about this. Perhaps they should not have rented the affected rooms if this was scheduled more than a day earlier.Perhaps ask to see the room first.

I have been traveling to Hawaii for 42 years and stayed at the same place for over 30 years and this year we decided to make a change. We were there for 3 weeks and we loved the Banyan. Our room was on the Mountain side and it was gorgeous. It was big and very roomy. We actually had a third person stay with us for 16 days and it was nice not to trip over one another. My husband especially loved the coffee shop in the lobby and took advantage of it and got a special coffee every morning. The little shopping we did, was done in the mini mart also in the lobby. The staff at the front desk was friendly and very professional. They greeted us every time we walked by them. On the 6th floor, there are barbeque grills, tennis/basketball court, play ground for the children and the swimming pool area with two hot tubs. We normally would go to the beach every day but this time we stayed by the pool. Some of the people there daily were owners and they were very pleasant and spoke to us all the time. There is also a small snack bar that opens at 11AM daily. That helps instead to going to your room for a drink. I met some people for the first time and they have helped me with reservations for years. They were so nice to me and I am thrilled that we finally got a chance to meet. I am looking forward to my trip in 2016 and I definitely will book the Banyan. Can't wait to go back.

This place met our needs. We are a family of 5 and it is not easy to find a hotel to accommodate us. This hotel fit the bill. Room needs to be updated with new carpet at least. I paid extra for a mountain view room and it was worth it. The view was stunning, especially at night when the city is all lit up! Great location; you can walk to everything. Never heard any noise from neighbors. Hotel staff was very helpful. My only complaint is that the kitchen was not well-stocked. I think there was one pot in the cupboard! We enjoyed the pool and two spas, and the little snack bar which sells shave ice.

After finding a great deal on airfare from Calgary, a total of 14 of us headed down to Waikiki. We decide to book 5 condo units at the Banyan. The units we booked were through Aston Hotels & Resorts, but all units are individually owned and decorated. I did have a chance to visit all 5 units and definitely different décor, but all good quality.All the one bedrooms have a full kitchen, with some having an island and some a table with 4 chairs. Our unit was well furnished with two twin beds (larger ones tho) and a pull out couch in the living room. Ceiling fan in the bedroom and air conditioning unit in the living room - not the most effective, but glad we had it.When we first arrived, we were greeted by a baby cockroach....overall we saw 3 in the first 2 days and nothing after that. They do have a good program to control these and really....we are in a tropical climate so we were ok. Had there been more moving forward we would have said something. Obviously all food items went into the fridge!Bathroom was good and we had enough towels. The biggest negative was the wifi.....there is wifi in each unit and is included in the nightly amenity fee you pay (which also gives you access to dvd/video game rentals). The wifi was so awful that there was no point in using it.....all 5 units complained about the same issue....there was no resolution....just the way it is.The adult and kids enjoyed the pool deck on the 6th floor. You can get pool towels on the 5th floor of tower 2. The pool is nice as well as the two hot tubs. We never made use of the many barbeques on the deck, but saw many families enjoying bbq dinner. We did make use of the basketball court....they have a basketball you can rent for $3.00/??hr....we ended up going to a local Walmart and buying one for $6.00.There is bank machine, little coffee/snack shop and small convenience store on the main floor near tower 1.I would definitely recommend an early visit to Costco to buy food, liquor and even souvenir chocolates kona coffee, etc at killer prices. It's worth renting a car for the day or even cabbing it.Overall we enjoyed our Ocean View unit in tower 2 and the Waikiki Banyan. Having the kitchen gave us the flexibility to eat in if we wanted to even if it was just for breakfasts.

We booked this hotel rather last minute, and due to honolulu marathon (and perhaps being December) we paid premium price (about 30% more than usual).We booked it via Expedia for 5 people (2 adults 3 children) and this particular room, 1 bedroom superior or something like that was being suggested as suitable for our group.We went ahead for it.Check in was non issue, that's where it ended.The corridor to the room was dark and had unpleasant tobacco smell, some part of the carpet was wet due to water leak from the ceiling, adding dampness smell.The room was 'old' with 70 style decor bathroom & kitchen.Being a 1 bedroom apartment we understand that we have to use sofa bed to accommodate our party and I believe that's the reason why this room is deemed suitable for party of 5. And there is one single fold out bed readied in our room. So the number tallied.We came back from dinner late with 3 young children and just when we were ready to put them to bed and set up sofa bed, we found a big writing on the bottom part of the sofa bed 'broken do not use'.because the kids were tired, we made a makeshift bed on the floor using sofa cushion.Not long after, we discovered the toilet was blocked and didn't flush.We didn't report this as we were tired and didn't want to have anyone fixing toilet when the kids we're asleep.We waited till morning to use the toilet at the lobby. Only to be told by this rude concierge lady that I had to get the key from the front desk (front desk being the same long desk that she was standing at but minded by different ladies that happened to serve another customers)I asked if she can get it for us instead and told her that our toilet was blocked since last night and that we have waited till morning to use the lobby toilet. Her answer 'I understand that, you just have to ask the front desk' I don't think she understands the duty of concierge !!!! She wasn't serving another guess or anything just staring into her computer screen.As that happened, one of the front desk lady finished with the customer and when I asked for the key, she grabbed it from the desk, the same desk that concierge lady could take few steps, grabbed and gave it to me.We reported the problem in the morning and they sent additional 2 fold out beds to make up for the broken sofa bed. And they did unblocked the toilet.Despite that I'm still giving this place terrible rating as the price, the facilities, and the service just don't match.We stayed at the sister hotel Aston sunset (next door to banyan) a week before and was very happy !!! Newer and better room, better service and cheaper too.

This was my sixth visit to Waikiki in the last 25 years! I have stayed at different hotels and resorts including 5 star resorts. This hotel was one of the best I have stayed in. Great location, one block away from beach, close to Zoo and public transport (2 min walk). Comfortable, clean, great rooms, great kitchen. Plenty of room for a family of four with teenage children, could have fit a fifth person comfortably. Room service impeccable.Would happily recommend and also would definitely stay here again.

This hotel was a great location.Appreciated that it has a kitchen unit and that they also had a laundry room on each floor.The only downfall this hotel had was the housekeeping. (all said w/o prejudice)Compared to other hotels I've stayed in, I felt they didn't commit 100% in their cleaning. I felt they could have done better.Overall it was an average hotel. Only minutes to the beach and close to stores, market and bus stop very close.

We found the hotel great couldn't fault it. Yes it is dated but we knew that and the price was great. Awesome location and we got upgraded and had views of the beach, just beautiful. Staff were really friendly and helpful. Only a 2 min walk to the beach. It is a bit of a walk into the main shops and restaurants but we loved the walk and walked to Ala Moana shopping centre and back. The pool was great. We had a lovely time and will definitely be back to stay at the Banyan

Compared to the hotels nearby, which charge extra for parking, and $50 a week for a microwave it was a good deal. It was not overly large for a one bedroom condo, but for Waikiki a great price and location. Albeit, a bit dated, but did not go to Hawaii to stay in the room. Staff was great...

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Banyan during October.The apartment was an older style but very spacious and comfortable. Full kitchen full size Oven and Fridge.Each floor has its own guest laundry ( services 8 apartments) Great bench space including a large breakfast bar with stools. Also a 4 seater dining table. We had a one bedroom apartment with a Californian King bed. We were on the 35th floor with a lovely view of the Ala wai canal and golf course and mountain range. The reception staff were really helpful and the daily service was faultless. We did find being at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki was a little inconvenient, but did enjoy the walks up Kalakaua Ave in the evening most enjoyable.

Hard to beat a location like this one - just a couple of blocks from Waikiki Beach, Kapiolani Park/Honolulu Zoo, with easy options for transport, dining and entertainment on every corner. Front desk, bell staff and concierge were consistently helpful and friendly (Nancy at the concierge desk provided us with some excellent recommendations). The room featured an expansive kitchen with all the mod cons, (the first hotel room I've ever stayed in that came with a full-sized oven...). The pool and dual hot tubs were great, although the pool did build up a bit of a sunscreen film as each day went on. We didn't use the barbecue area, but it seemed very popular and was well-utilised.Our party was of three adults - the master bed for the couple was huge and very comfortable, but the fold-out couch provided for the third person was very uncomfortable and a bit of a challenge. The room could get very hot during the day but the air conditioning unit was quite noisy - a tough choice at night.Overall, there were a few drawbacks and quirks, but with a location and price like this, we'd definitely be back.

Let's start with the positives. This place is in a great location. Right off Kuhio Blvd and two blocks away from Waikiki beach. The front desk people were great. Our first time in HI. We have traveled in Europe, China, most of S.A. all of US and I have never seen a worst room. The best thing I can say is the room was clean. It was so shabby. The furniture was so bad that it could never be donation to the Goodwill or Salvation Army.The couch had three cushions that had 5 inches slits in each cushion. The end tables and dressers were falling apart. Unit 3206

Our family of 5 stayed here with 2 adults and 3 boys. Location was great. One block and we were at the beach which meant we could come and go all day. Yes the rooms are a little dated but the price was brilliant and the rooms were comfortable. We had booked a city view room but ended up with ocean view. I very much appreciated this as was a lovely way to finish off a month long USA holiday with 1 week at the Banyan. Transport was just near the Banyan such as the shuttles that took you to Ala Moana Shopping Centre/around Waikiki and the bus line which could get you to Pearl Harbour/Arizona Memorial. My boys enjoyed the basketball courts and all the extra's the hotel had to offer such as free Playstation game hire and free dvd hire. We loved that a nice cool breeze seemed to flow around the Banyan and then walk a block and it would be very humid. Would definitely stay here again. Great stay and very helpful staff. The wifi was also great, no problems at all with dropping in and out.

Each room is a condo privately owned and managed by Aston. The sleeping arrangements vary. You can sleep two or up to six.. There are smoking and non-smoking rooms. Kitchen in condo are spacious with all the cooking and eating supplies.The pool is great with two hot tubs, Banyan Coffee in lobby is excellent and much better Starbucks. One block to Waikiki Beach!!!!!

We stayed in one of the condo style rooms, which had a kitchenette, and had a bedroom which could be separated from the lounge. Decor was a bit dated, but this looks like nothing out of the ordinary in some parts of Waikiki. The room was great, very functional, and suited our needs to a tee (couple with three kids 6 -13). Location was excellent - a couple of blocks from the best part of the beach at Waikiki (IMO), and only a couple of blocks from the Food Pantry - which makes Waikiki affordable. Of course, also close to all the eateries, which was great, and not too far to walk on a Friday night to see the fireworks. Again, the pool area was a bit dated/basic, but heh, what more do you need than an open space, and clean water (and a jacuzzi!). Kids loved it. It's also worth noting we had an oceanview room, which gave us wonderful views of Diamond head and the end of Wakiki beach. Beautiful lanai to sit out on and feel the breeze.

Our family of four is staying at these days in one of the condo of Aston at Waikiki Banyan. We booked through Booking.com and it belongs to the management of Hawaiian Sun Holidays. The management office is on the 4th. Floor of the building 1. We arrived at late evening and there was nobody in the office , but we had no problem, because we found an envelope stitched on the door with our name and contained everything what we needed ( Infos and key code, etc.). The condo is a one bedroom condo, which is very convenient for us to stay for 3 nights. It's location is phantastic. Beach is only a street away. We found a very convenient grocery store within walking distance ( Food pantry) but there is a little grocery store too in the building. The bus station is at the corner. There are a lot of restaurants with various prizes.The condo is very clean, we didn't use the towel changing.You get beach towels too. There is a complete equipped kitchen. WIFI is free and working very well , because we had the router in room.We had some problems with using the shower and the lady at the office was very helpful to solve our problem.The pool and the jacuzzi are very convenient, we tried it. All in all we were very satisfied and we would recommend this condo for everyone, who wants to spend some days in Honolulu.

This resort was chosen as part of a cruise-resort package through an RCI-affiliate - the only that was available for our time allotment. We booked two rooms, which were not exactly the same - one had a queen and the other a double, and the furnishings varied. The rooms were very spacious with a bedroom, a living room and full kitchen; coin-operated laundry machines were available on our floor; we were on the 25th of 37 floors. The resort is not new, but the facility is very well-maintained. Restaurants, shopping and transportation are within walking distance. Waikiki Beach is 1 block away. The staff was friendly and helpful. We would consider returning to this resort.

This place is worn out and remains in the 1970s with the fittings, furnishings and carpet recognizable from my youth. The furnishings were pretty dirty and well used/scratched, the carpet was filthy, skirtings were disintegrating, paint was splattered on chrome fittings, sinks were cracked, taps were leaking, the air conditioning unit was held together with sticky tape, and the curtains were ripped and dirty. We moved to a second apartment when they started drilling to renovated the room above. We couldn't believe the same deficiencies from the first apartment persisted with the second apartment. This place is over priced for what is on offer. Don't bother unless you want to relive the seventies.

Aloha! Well, we read a lot of the reviews on this condo complex and at first I was kind of afraid. But after we got there and checked in, the first room was a total dud. The owners of the condo have not kept it up well and it was a total disappointment to me. But the next day we went and talked to Larissa at the front desk and she explained each room is privately owned. Unfortunately some of them are not kept up to modern style and the owner I guess doesn't want to put money in to the room which is really too bad because this place is the perfect location. She then showed us a new updated room which was perfect and we moved right away. The rest of our stay was easy! Great kitchen and appliances and the beds were comfortable. Air condition worked perfectly and as I said, perfect location for us. One block from the beach and restaurants and tons of shopping. Ten days of paradise! Would definitely go back again! Mahalo :)

We stayed here with our 9 and 10 year olds. We booked our room via VRBO and that process all worked out fine for us. The location is fantastic being a quick walk to the beach, shops, food, buses. Our room was very comfortable for 4 of us. Beds were great. Balcony was lovely with view of golf course and mountains. Pool area was very nice. Pool is an ok size but popular. Good playground for younger kids. Little kiosk. Front desk staff were helpful when asked questions. Our room had a small kitchenette with some items for limited cooking. All up good value for the VRBO price.

This was our 4th time staying at the Banyan and the most disappointing room experience. The queen bed was not a queen bed, but rather a double bed. If having two adults on a dbl bed for almost two weeks doesn't sound uncomfortable enough, the fact that the springs from the mattress kept digging into every part of our bodies should. The pull out sofa bed was bigger than the bed in the room, but in worse shape. Our poor 8 year old was even more uncomfortable then us. The stove burners had issues heating up. Just took forever to simply boil water. Seeing as we've stayed here 3 times prior to this stay it's safe to say that we've had decent experiences. Yes the rooms decor have always been dated and we have never cared. However after the very uncomfortable stay this time I regret to say I don't see us returning and risking a repeat experience. I would also like to add that my sister and her family stayed in a room down the hall from us and they also had similar bed issues. The carpet in their room was disgusting and their room had a smell that despite my stuffed nose from my cold still invaded my sinuses and made me want to gag. I once recommended to people that this was an average place worth considering. Now I'd be hard pressed to recommend the Banyan. The reasoning given is always it's the individual owners, but why would you even put guests up in a room with beds that are nothing but springs??.  I will say that my encounters with the staff was very pleasant. Front desk personnel, Maintenance, housekeeping, parking and coffee shop employees all very friendly and helpful. However I'm sorry to say Banyan serious changes in what should be acceptable for your guests need to be greatly considered.

First impression was service was extremely unwelcoming which is a rare thing in Hawaii. Price to stay was expensive and not worth it. Arrived in the room to have problems with the Internet. Then turned on the shower which was leaking and sprayed all over the bathroom. We had previously stayed in a condo at the same location and that is definitely the way to go

It appears that many of the units are individually owned. We ran into several people who were living full time in the building. We had 3 rooms and all were very different, but all of them needed upgrades. It is a great location, but I would not stay here again.warning - we were hit with a hidden fee of $18 for newspaper and wifi, which we did not want but were forced to pay for.

Let's start with the positives. This place is in a great location. Right off Kuhio Blvd and two blocks away from Waikiki beach. You're close to a lot of good restaurants and local dives. This hotel is also on the south end of Waikiki which means it's an easy and out of the area to Kapahulu blvd and the freeway without having to meander through Waikiki traffic. They have two towers here. Tower 1 will give you much better water views. Tower 2 may, unfortunately, give you a view of Tower 1. If all you need is place to lay your head at night and you're not looking for a lot of great amenities, this place is for you. Because it is a timeshare, not all units are the same. Some are better than others. We booked 3 rooms during our stay and while they weren't all uniform, they were all decent and adequate. They have a nice common area with a pool, sauna, and BBQs (coin operated!) but it gets pretty busy with kids. Also know that if you book with Aston, you will need to pay $18/day in amenity fees if you want to get high speed internet. The coffee shop offers in-room access for less but we didn't get to try it. For the value, and because we're interval members, I would stay here again.

After seeing some of the negative reviews I was hesitant and a little anxious prior to our trip. Once we arrive there, the staff was very nice and friendly. The lobby area is exactly as shown on the photos...The room was nice, clean and large enough for our group of 5. The beds unlike all the negative comments were very nice and comfortable. I was personally very happy with my choice and will definitely stay there again. My room in fact was one from the pictures with some updates. Either I was lucky to get a room from an owner that cares about his/her unit or the negative comments were exaggerate. Not sure which but I am happy with what we got and will be back. The hidden fee is not hidden, they tell you before booking that it is due at check in or out. $18 per day.

After I booked this hotel I sent them an email enquiring about the possibility of an early check-in as our flight was arriving in the morning. Their reply stated that it would depend on the bookings at our time of arrival. When we arrived at the hotel I enquired again at reception and was told no straight away without any check of the current bookings. So we stored our luggage and went off to see the sights. When my son returned to the hotel to check-in, he was given a room that did not have enough beds to sleep the 5 of us so he had to return to reception to ask for another room. The room was okay but it looked a bit dated and could use some renovation. There was an extra charge for parking the rental car. This hotel is a couple of blocks from the beach so location is good. It is also close to catch local buses.

Travelled as a party of 4 and had a great time and experience staying here. The rooms were fine and the amenities excellent. Would highly recommend the aston banyan to anyone especially families. Kids loved the pool and tennis court, basketball court.

I'm a dad travelling with 18 year old twin boys. We took a lot of effort to find accommodation that had three separate beds, as nobody wants to share a bed with anyone else. So when we turned up at 11 pm after a very long flight to find a room with two large singles pushed together to make a big bed and a rollaway bed, something had to be done straight away. To the hotels credit, another rollaway was found and the next day the smaller beds were separated.The unit was large and had a very well equipped kitchen.What rankled was the $18 per night "facilities charge" which covered the internet, a daily newspaper, the pool and DVD hire and a PS3. Interent access is standard. Don't charge me extra for it. The newspaper was $1 per issue. The DVD rentals skipped sections of the movie, and as they were from as machine and some clown had put the wrong movie back in the wrong slot wouldn't give me the movie I wanted. The PS3 handset was broken so I couldn't play some of the DVD's I wanted anyway, and if you happened to choose a BlueRay disk needed a degree to figure out how to make it work.All in all, I was charged for things that didn't work, or I didn't need or which are standard. I had thought I had prepaid everything and it was a bit of a shock. I'm not sure what would have happened if I had declined to accept the charge at check in.The hotel needs a bit of a spruce up in general. The rooms were spacious but tired.

We stayed the first week across the street at the Sunset. This was also part of the Aston family and well it was nice, but the other side was better for us.The front desk was helpful. The room was great. We has another ocean side view. The room we were in had just been renovated and was on the 23 floor. House keeping did come by daily to check on trash and stuff. It was great to have a full kitchen because we wanted to make breakfast some mornings and have a real pot of coffee.Another plus is that the beach is right down the road a few blocks. There is a nightly parking fee. (as expected with most hotels in Honolulu) They did have a laundry room at the end of the hall with only one machine. 6th floor is the pool floor (which we did not use because the beach is right down the road). Downstairs near the lobby they had a snack store and coffee shop.

The hotel is in a great location close to the beach and shopping. We stayed in a one bedroom appartment, it was dated but comfortable and clean. The room had a balcony over looking diamond head, two single beds with sofa lounge and large kitchen. The lounge was huge, which we loved with AC which cooled the whole place, oh and wifw in our room. The only disapointing part was one staff member at the front desk when we first arrived, she was very rude regarding our deposit for the room. She wasnt helpful and couldnt help us with connecting to wifi so we could check our bank. We were directed to the cafe and were told we had to make a purchase to connect to their wifi. When we returned to the front desk we had a different employee who was wonderful and helped us out amazingly. Overall we enjoyed our stay, I would recommend, great location and good facilities.

It was a good place to stay. Just two blocks from the beautiful waikiki beach. It has it's on parking area so that was a plus since parking is a big thing in hawaii well at least in the Honolulu area that we've been. Our room was nice, had enough space for our family of four. It has its own kitchen, nice appliances and everything. No hassle checking in or anything. Would surely go back and stay at the same place again.

I had read the reviews about this hotel needing an update but I looked at the pictures and after staying at another Aston resort in Maui I honestly expected more! My first impressions were very disappointing! I soon got over it when I saw the view from our balcony! The staff was very friendly and accomadating. The pool area was nice and open a little later so a night swim was a good way to end a hot day. The location was perfect! A block from the beach, everything was in walking distance.

Arrived with a few other families for a soccer tournament. We were told that our rooms would not be ready until after 3pm, that's fine, sometimes that's the way it is. The main reason we stayed here is because of recommendations about the great recreation and pool area for the kids. Well, we check in and get to our room, it's nothing fancy, but clean. Kids can't wait to get to the pool... Here is where it all goes downhill! We get to the pool 4 adults and 7 kids, security is patrolling the pool like hawks... I've worked hotel security, including at the 5 star 4 Seasons and wonder what is going on, because it almost seems like the pool is under a lockdown. They come over to us and tell us our kids can't jump or dive in the pool. We tell security that we see the two boys jumping and diving, and they are not in our party. Security tells us, well we are telling everyone. Ok, a little odd, but we let it go and brush it off. Next, the security guard stands close to us for 10 minutes watching our kids swim... Not a very relaxing feeling. We just informed them that the two boys doing it, are NOT with our party! Guard then returns again and tells us that our 9yo son needs to leave the pool and can't swim because he has scars and a few open sores on his legs. Really??? He has an allergy to grass and has some scars on his legs. No "open" sores, but maybe 2 small spots where his skin is lighter in color because it's healing. All adults in our party are in disbelief! This is a soccer team and some of the kids have bumps and bruises.., it happens during sports! Are they all not allowed to swim? I'm sure they can find a cut or wound on every single person in the hotel! We have spent over $800 dollars and my son is now crying and heartbroken. Because he has to sit and watch the other kids swim for 4 days? Not to mention that he had an allergy that has been treated, but is now made to feel like he is some sort of disease carrier or criminal? If we weren't so busy with the upcoming tournament, we would checkout immediately and demand a refund. This kind of blatant discrimination against a child was appalling and unacceptable!!!

Aston is fine, very average, but for Waikiki it's also reasonably priced. Solid 3 star property, many apartments are privately owned and rented. Facilities OK. Pool is good with nice views of the mountains. Tour desk very helpful. Our room had beach view from the balcony, short walk 2 blocks away. Main bed had a sliding door to lounge so offers privacy for sofa bed in living room.You are only a 5 minute walk away from the centre of Waikiki so shopping, restaurants, bars etc are at your doorstep. Easy to get a public bus to Outlet Centres and Shopping Malls.

My husband and I and our 2 kids stayed at this property late April for 9 nights. We rented Unit 1211 Bldg 1 through Jackie at Hawaiian Vacation Condo. While her pricing seems a bit more than other rental agencies, she was a delight to deal with and always responded to my emails, issues and questions promptly. The unit we rented was exactly like in the photos and was nicely updated with a view of the Rec Dec. It was very clean and also had a beach bag and cooler and a few lawn chairs and if you are a golfer there were golf clubs there as well. The only negative of this unit was that it is advertised that the condo has beach towels yet we were only supplied only 2 of them - but we were a family of 4? Had I known this prior to arriving I would have packed some vs having to go buy more towels that I didn't need. No biggee but a tad annoying. Also the pull out couch of this unit is advertised as being brand new but it was atrocious and about an inch thick. My husband ended up just sleeping on the sofa itself and we put each of the kids on a blow up mattress in the bedroom as we like to stay up later than them so it wouldn't have worked to put them on the couch. Again we didn't pay for a 5 star so you get what you pay for. The building itself is dated and the rec deck was fine - we just used the pool in the afternoon and never visited the snack shack. It was nice being in building 1 and being close to the pool as well. The location was also just a quick hop skip and a jump into town which was great and close to the beach and the free parking was a real bonus. I'm not sure we would chose this property again only because I enjoy an ocean view and the sights and sounds of the ocean. But for families with young kids on a budget you can't beat this property and I highly recommend Jackie at Hawaiian Vacation Condos!

We stayed here from 1-12 June. The room we had was pretty dated (80s style), but it was clean and comfortable. We had requested a crib but it was awful. It looked like something from the 1960s and would squeak every single time our 1 year old moved, waking all 3 of us up. I asked for a replacement and it was no better. We gave up and bought a portable cot from Walmart which worked a treat. Not happy that my extra bag I purchased for the trip home has to be used to carry that home instead but we wanted to enjoy our holiday rather than be exhausted.

Excellent location, only 5 minutes walk to beach. Great value for $$. Excellent customer service. We were upgraded to ocean view... beautiful. The condo rooms are very dated. Definitely needs updating. Linens and housekeeping excellent.

Bad check-in service. Rooms are extinct. There's hair in the shower. If your traveling this far there should be standards as far as lodging. Would definitely be back to Hawaii but not at the Aston Waikiki Banyan.

First off let me say that I have stayed here two years in a row, both for 6 weeks at a time. I stayed in the same unit managed by an outside condo rental agency as some of the units in this hotel are privately owned and not managed by the hotel. That is my disclaimer, now for the review.First off do not expect posh, posh here in Waikiki will cost you about $500/ night. This hotel is very nicely located 1 block from the beach and there are many dining and shopping options within easy walking distance. The Zoo is about 4 blocks away, easily walkable and there are trolly stops all over the place so getting around is really not an issue. There is an attached parking garage which will cost you $20 / night if you have a car unless you rent one of the privately owned units with a parking pass like I got. The hotel itself is in good condition and is clean throughout though a bit dated, which is fine by me. There is a nice pool area with a basketball court and pay electric grills (yes I said PAY electric grills) which cost $2 for an hour., REALLY Banyan? Ridiculous. Overall I have been happy with the hotel in my 12 weeks there but I am pretty easy to please. I am not really sure what the hotel charges per night directly through them but all things considered I am sure its a good value and bang for the buck probably one of the best spots in Waikiki.

Hello all you readers............hope you are all doing well!My beautiful daughters and I just returned from an eighteen day stay in Waikiki, Hawaii...........a place we just adore. We enjoyed the beach and went swimming as much as possible while we are there. A short block and a half away and we were on the beautiful sandy beach in Waikiki. The hotel room was exceptionally large with a separate area for the double beds. This area could be closed off to the rest of the condo which was great. The kitchen area was new with granite counter tops and all new appliances. The bathroom sink and vanity were separated from the tub and toilet which made if very practical for all of us. The room was an end room facing the beach............we didn't noticed this until the next morning and were pleasantly surprised. In short, we liked our hotel, which is older but renovated, and the proximity to beach, shops, grocery stores was great. Housekeeping was done daily but little later in the day which made sleeping in possible. The only major complaint was the we encounter some bugs. In my opinion they are to be expected but my daughters weren't fond of them. It's my belief that bugs are common in warmer climate and I would think there was something wrong if there weren't any. The hotel also has a few amenities such as a nice pool deck with a hot tub, tennis court and an area for families to grill. In this location they also had a little snack bar that served a variety of treats including shaved ice. Also on the first floor was a wonderful cafe where many of the foods were made from scratch. We enjoyed the tasty fried rice and the delicious coconut cake. The ambiance there was so wonderful, calm and relaxing, that we found ourselves going quite often. We also had access to a dvd rental machine. We could choose some of the latest releases. We often rented some movies and ordered in, to enjoy a relaxing evening in the hotel. For the most part the staff was efficient and friendly. Whenever we needed anything they were quick to come to the room.I would come to this hotel/condo again and would love to have the same room even though it wasn't on the top floor, the sea views were still stunning.Thanks to the hotel and staff for our wonderful stay!Smiles to you all!!

Condo room makes you feel like your not in a hotel. The view from the lanai was breath taking (could tan right from the lanai!) and the location was perfect, not too far from the beach and downtown area. Only downside... could use in-room WiFi instead of having to go down to the cafe all the time. Me and my family love visiting Honolulu and will definitely continue to stay at the banyan!

We stayed at the Banyan for six weeks. The unit was very spacious with a large kitchen. We were on the 29th floor and had a spectacular view of Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach. The hotel was central to restaurants and transportation and a shirt stroll to the beach.

this was our first time at the Banyan and would recommend it to anyone. We stayed in a unit that was self contained - you had to go to the other tower for clean towels, etc which isn't an issue for us. The unit was clean and had a great view of the pool area. It's close to public transport and the beach. We would definitely stay there Again.

Stayed here in Jan and had great views of the mountains, close to main beach and close to all the shops and restaurants. The rooftop pool is also great with a BBQ area you can use. Rooms are spacious enough as well.

The hotel is a bit dated. The staff was friendly and the hotel is in a very good location only 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach and all the sips and restaurants on the strip. location. The pull out bed was barely useable and the queen bed was pretty hard. Overall the hotel itself is average at best. It suited our needs as we wanted a slightly larger room so we could have the kids sleep in the living room. We didn't need the full kitchen but it was nice to have.The parking is $20 a day and we used that as it is garage parking attached to the hotel and there were always spots available.The internet worked well and our room in the 36th floor had a nice view of the ocean. We would stay here again as a family but i would not recommend as a couples hotel as there are many other options in this price range that are more updated and in the same location.

We have stayed at the banyan many times over the last 15 years and have never experienced any of the concerns expressed. Our rooms were cleaned according to schedule, linens changed regularly and an unlimited supply of clean towels daily. Although we no longer travel with our children we still return to the hotel for the kitchenettes. A quick snack or a breakfast in the room was always our preference. We only received the best service from the front desk staff. Maybe by some standards the rooms are dated but we have stayed in a number of updated rooms over the years. Will return again, hopefully soon.

We stayed at the Waikiki Banyan for one week, with two children and three adults We booked a standard room and asked for an upgrade upon arrival, we went into the room and noticed everything was very dated, the bathroom was quite small and the tiles in the bathroom had a lot of wear and tear on them, as for the room itself the appliances such as the stove and fridge barely worked we had a challenging time trying to cook, we notified the front desk twice that the stove was barely working, the chairs in the unit were made of wicker we were scared to sit on them, my kids sat on them and they constantly tipped over, the sink plug broke so it made it hard to do dishes, there was no dishwasher in the unit so we did them by hand, some of the cupboard door were nailed shut making it difficult to take the plates and dishes in and out, The location and the Recreation deck were nice, kids enjoyed the pool, playground and the BBQ area was nice. We traveled with a baby so we were kind of frustrated that housekeeping did not come after the day we arrived to take out the garbage. If we would ever come back I would say no, but it the room was better it may be a possibility. Advice to any new visitor ask to see the room first!

The good: Close location to the beach and shops. Rented via Koko resorts: had access to lawn chairs/mats, surf board, boogie boards (remnants left behind from previous guests, thus selection can vary), beach towels. The unit was more spacious than a typical hotel unit and accommodated 5 of us. Access to the full kitchen was convenient. Safeway is within short drive. Staff at Koko resorts were friendly. Pool & hot tub on the 6th floor was handy on a rainy day. Parking & wifi were included with the rental fee: all fees were upfront so no surprises at the check out. Had one set of coin operated washer & dryer for the 22nd floor: 2$ to wash & 2.25$ to dry. The bad: Very noisy with combined effects of constructions at nearby buildings, ambulance & police sirens blaring at any time of the day, tour buses loading & unloading people in the middle of the night and constant & heavy traffic noise. Had a partial view of the mountains and the beach between high rises but we didn't spend much time indoors. No housekeeping service. One towel/linen exchange per week. No exchange for beach towels. The ugly: The unit had powerful odor of what seemed like remnants of urine, vomit and perhaps mice & mold. Did not use anything without washing first. The bedroom ceiling had a huge water mark, bath tub was surrounded by dark mold lines, the kitchen cupboards were stained with mysterious brown marks. Old& smelly carpets in the unit. The sofa bed had one sorry excuse of a mattress with springs sticking out all over. The sofa and the mattress smelled so badly that the smell permeated into our clothing: had to use towels to cover over before sitting down. It was too late for us to find alternative lodging without creating extra stress so we ended up staying. The air conditioner in the living room worked but was so noisy that we had to sleep with the window open which meant sleeping with the all the noise from the outside. For an added touch we had chain smokers in a unit nearby that added frequent smell of cigarette smoking blowing into our unit. I took a chance booking this unit without much reviews or pictures to go by before the booking; big mistake. It was one step above camping but that was about it.

My husband and I have stayed at The Waikiki Banyan many times in the past years.However, I have never had the type of experience I recently had.We booked unit #3802 for 11 days over the Christmas Holiday. As we had stayed there before and the rental agent we worked with was so very nice, we did not read the reviews. A big mistake.The unit is beautiful-up on the top floor with an excellent view of Waikiki. It is definitely neglected and is in need of some TLC. The first thing we noticed was the mirrors , glass door, and windows were covered with streaks. I could not even see myself when trying to put on makeup. Next we saw all the counters covered with dust. Shower handle was broken. We could only take cold showers. In addition there was a broken toilet seat and broken ironing board. The unit came with only one set of pily mismatched sheets. Since I did not bring my computer, I did not see their email (3 days after checkin) offering to exchange linens and towels for a fee. Instead we were forced to spend time and money washing the few towels they gave us. This email also gave us the opportunity to have the unit cleaned for a charge. Even though this was the only rental that did not offer housekeeping during an 11 day stay, we would have paid to have it cleaned since we already paid 4 times the price being Christmas.The next day I called the management company at least 4 times. The only answer I got was "we are busy". On the fifth call I finally got to speak to someone. The nice reservationist no longer worked there (no surprise!). The person I spoke to told me that I do not know how to work the shower. How rude! They finally offered to send someone to look at it. Although he could not fix it, he adjusted it to a reasonable temperature. They gave me the phone number for housekeeping. The housekeeper came to clean and dust. They used something on the dresser that turned the wood white. When I asked about pool towels, I was told they did not provide. I have never been to any hotel or condo that did not provide pool towels.On top of this, we were charged a check out cleaning fee. I never heard of this one.This just goes to show. I should have done my homework and read reviews. I would have seen other reviews mentioning how responsive Hawaiian Paradise Resorts are before they get your money. Once they get it, they can't be bothered with you.I fully intend to stay at The Banyan in the future but I will book it through a different company or through the hotel directly.

My family of four stayed here from Dec. 20 - Jan. 1. The location is excellent and the staff were very helpful. Our room had great views but the decor and the furnishings/appliances were right out of the 1990's. We traveled with another family and managed to get them an updated room (which was much nicer) so my only suggestion is that you get an upgraded room if you plan to stay here. The internet (in room only) was excellent. The outdoor BBQ area was also very good.

We stayed as a party of 11 people in 3 apartments over Christmas and New Year, our apartments were lovely with partial Ocean views, housekeeping came in everyday and changed towels, emptied bins and replenished coffee etc. We found the staff really helpful and polite, the location is great as everything is within walking distance and there is a bus stop outside.

Good location and good sized rooms that are clean but many quite "dated" in this "vintage" hotel so choose carefully. Our room was nice with great views and some updates with an enjoyable extended stay. The bedding left a lot to be desired so we ended up buying sheets and a memory foam pad (extended stay otherwise would have roughed it). Building does have plumbing issues; there were several water out notices during out visit for various rooms and areas, and even had to cut into out bathroom wall during our stay to fix a kitchen drain in the unit above (and the pipe was amazingly rusted and corroded!). $4 for a load of laundry washed and dried in the self serves at the end of the hall... If it works (dryer didn't heat so had to use different floor's). Pool was nice but noisy with kids echoing off building (try to get balcony that doesn't face pool!). Hot tub didn't work properly the four weeks we were there.

My wife and I vacationed in one of the condos there from 3/28/14 -4/2/14. It was really a very nice place to stay. It was clean, comfortable and the service was very friendly. We had everything in the condo that you could think of that was needed for cooking washing and even had a store located in the main lobby for snacks and adult beverages. It has a pool...whirlpool... basketball court...tennis court...laundry room...Grills for cooking...parking garage. We were in walking distance from the beach. We even stayed next door to a very nice person that invited us over for a moment. I won't mention his name, but he is known the world over. My wife would would go walking at night 2-3-4 o'clock in the morning. She said that she never felt threatened. Everyone was so friendly. Close to shopping and places to eat. I'll give it a five star rating. The only thing that we did not like was that construction was going on, so we did not have access to our balcony. However, we were compensated for the inconvenience.

I'll start off by saying that it really depends what suite you get. We actually rented our rooms through H.I Paradise. Our suite is on the 29th floor which provides a great view! The room itself I would say is below average for the price we are paying! Everything in this unit is very dated, especially the bathroom where the lino is coming up. Furniture is old and carpets are stained..... Again, just not the type of accommodations I would expect for the price. The pool/bbq area is nice but again could be updated! Bbq's are provided for a $2.00/hr rate (Quarters). I wasn't impressed that they are electric bbq's which smoke unbelievably and take forever to cook, start cooking an 1.5 hr in advance. It's kinda like putting your food under a really hot heat lamp to cook on! A washer and dry is located on every floor for a $2.00 charge per hour (quarters) and again could use updating! On a positive note the location is great as it is close the the ocean, and the people are helpful and friendly.

This accommodation is a great base for your stay at Waikiki Beach. Probably give the room 3 stars by Australian standards – in that it was clean and comfortable but quite dated. The kitchen is well equipped however there is a large variety of eateries nearby.Not that we used it as it was pretty hot but there are great mountains views from the balcony. The Guest Services were able to help us with all our daytrip queries and bookings.Liked; Location PriceDisliked; Unable to access internet services

Pros: My family and I enjoyed everything about this hotel....we used the grills and kitchen to the max. This allowed us to save money for excurisons and etc. The pool and hot tubs were great. The other guests were respectful. April 29- May 8 2014. Location is also wonderful we walked to beach daily and everything you need is right there. City buses run pretty regularly.Cons: Parking $15 a day....hotel fee of $18 a day is cheaper than most in Waikiki. BBQ grills are coin operated as well as washer and dryer

We (family of 4) stayed for 1 week in December. Great location, just one block back from the beach, down the Diamond Head end of the strip. We enjoyed an ocean view 1 bedroom apartment and really it had everything we needed, WiFi included, small, but functional kitchen. The place it a little dated, but you don't go to Hawaii to stay in your room. Close to everything and provides really good value for money.

We booked our honeymoon at Aston Waikiki Banyan through Donna Bender of MauiCalls who is an Aston Specialist. The hotel was dated, but nice and clean with a large pool, hot tub and great views. Our view from the large lanai of our room was of Diamond Head and the ocean - beautiful! The beach was only two blocks away and a grocery store was five blocks away. The kitchen in the room was well stocked for dishes and the like. Everything we needed was there. The management even sent up a box of chocolates and a bottle of wine as a thank you for booking our honeymoon there. Very friendly staff and all the amenities we could ask for.
