Also, Donna gave us her Local Girl’s Guide to Oahu to take with us and we used it several times while there for trying restaurants and finding things to do. Thanks Donna!

Even the rooms without much of a view have a view. The hotel is walking distance from everything we wanted to do in Waikiki. We came for a Hawaii Warriors game and had a great vacation too. Hotel was clean and well maintained. The room was spacious and comfortable. The bed was not a pillow top, but we slept well all the same.

Just spent three nights here, and whilst the location is good, the rooms are very basic and need updating. Tiny tiny bathroom with no room to put any toiletries anywhere. Beige carpet in the living area, need I say more. Stupid daily resort fee, for things you never use such as newspapers and DVDs, tea and coffee, which should be included as part of the room fee. Only thing we used was wifi, which again really should be included in the overall price. Not sure I would stay here again.
user_name:
Wendy S
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: Aston at the Waikiki Banyan – My husband and I stayed at Aston at the Waikiki Banyan for one night prior to our cruise departure. Let me start out by saying that we will never stay here again. We booked our travel arrangements via Hotwire and the star ratings were listed as 3. This is not a 3 star rating hotel, it’s more like a 1 and let me add overpriced. The hotel and furniture were out of date. It was like being placed in a time machine and taken back to the 1960’s. The condo room that we stayed in was not clean or fitting to stay in, we actually checked out before the actual check out time. This was not a pleasant stay and I would never recommend it to anyone. The hotel offers free Wi-Fi that doesn’t work. Free movie rentals with damage movies that doesn’t play, very disappointing.

Unlike many Waikiki Resort Hotels, the Waikiki Banyan is not overwhelming in its size. The rooms are spacious and the 6th floor pool and recreation area is wonderful for families. We had a lovely view from our 33rd floor unit. The walk to the beach, zoo, aquarium, shops, restaurants is quick and easy not matter your destination. There is a coffee shop on site for light snacks. The BUS runs up and down Kuhio, alongside hotel, regularly to just about any destination.This is an older hotel and the age is apparent in the room furnishings. But given the room size, convenient location and facilities, it can be a really good choice.

Location ! Views ! Spacious ! Clean ! Quiest ! Great Bed ! Big Kitchen ! I have been here ( to Waikiki ) 8 times, and this is the best condo ever. We are very glad and happy to have found this listing on VRBO. We are in unit # 1901 ( faces the mountains ) . Its very nice. 550 sq. ft. this building was build in 1970. By the billionaire , Max Ward. He used to own and run an airline called Ward Air, where they served 3 course meals with silver ware and crystal. And all the drinks you wanted. Anyways, that was back in 1974. I will re-book this unit. Nice and close to the beach. Have not tried the pool yet, but really looking forward to it. Wish it had a gym, that is my only request.

Our 1 bedroom with kitchen was on the 15th floor, facing the beach. Loved our lanai, and the facilities and location are hard to beat. Convenient to everything. Quiet and comfortable, and good service. Traveled as a couple, but this hotel would be great for families.

We spent two weeks at the Aston Banyon and really enjoyed our stay in room 1210. Very spacious with a large living room/kitchen and a separate bedroom. Partial ocean view from the balcony was a bonus. Beds and pillows are comfortable. Bedroom had two double beds. We also had a crib, single cot and double sofa pullout. Kitchen well stocked with everything needed. Staff courteous. They have their own parking garage which is very convenient if you rent a car. I've stayed in other Waikiki hotels and this is now my favorite.

I have read a lot of reviews and it always came back to it being old and needing to be remodeled. It does but it's not as bad as a lot of people have put it. If you have a family this is the place to stay! The kitchen is great! Has every thing you need to cook! This place just needs food! It's decent sized! It's clean! Walk away from the beach - 4 minutes with little kids! If we ever come back we will stay here again! The only thing I wish is were on a higher floor - we are on the 25th floor! Still has a nice view especially at night over looking the city!

We stayed in a condo on the 10th floor. It was very clean and had everything that the traveler needs when on vacation. The owner was great, he meets you on arrival and shows you everything in the unit. The Banyan is central to everything the Waikiki has to offer and the amenities on the 6th floor are very good.

We found theLocation and grounds to be fantastic. However service and staff were not good. We had to ask 2x for the pillows and sheets sleeper bed. Parking $20 night. Their lot was full so we were directed to their overflow lot @10 min away walk. This morning we were called 3x and had door knock by housekeeping at 11:05!! She said if we were not out immediately she would start charging!! 5 minutes late due to having to bring car from lot. Upon complaint to Manager, Meagan Heaps, things got worse due to her unprofessionalism and bad attitude toward customers. She never apologized and in fact said we had paid and should leave. Ms. Heaps- we urge you to take a refresh course in hospitality. And potential customers, beware. Not worth expense.

My husband and I stayed at the Banyan 30+ years ago. The lobby is quite impressive, however when we walked into the room it was just as it was in '82..what a disappointment. No updating at all. The couch/futon was very uncomfortable. The girls from housekeeping were very good but they just didn't seem to have the staff. Our room was always made up late...one day 5:00 pm and that was after we chased them down. The pool area was ok nothing special. We did find chair rentals at the beach were over the top at $20 for the day so we purchased 2 chairs from Walmart $12 ea and handed them to others on the beach on our last day. We found lots of good restaurants close by and the bus service was great. We will not plan another vacation at the Banyan.

My family and I stayed at the Waikiki Banyan the customer service was poor and unviting. We paid the amenities fee of $282 dollars with nothing in return, no water bottles were given we paid for parking went we rent a vehicle.The first day we arrived at 11:00 we had two young children with us the kids were hot and the Banyan advised to come back at 15:00, the kids were in jeans and jumper. Once we came back we had to wait for another 2 hours because they advised payment was declined.I believed this could have been deal with better customer service this rating is a zero.

No backing on the curtains which meant lots of light came through at night which meant it was difficult to sleep. single glazing only so lots of noise & heat came though. Air con unit very LOUD.We asked for a king bed, instead we got two single beds pushed together, which weren't even at the same height.Gen. clean & tidy although the carpets could do with a shampoo. Nice and close to the beach and a good view of the mountains and resort pool. Front desk staff where helpful.

This was first time I used my time share for an exchange and was very disappointed with this hotel /condo first the condo is not related to the hotel which sucks the front desk doesn't want anything to do with you even tho your in the same building they wouldn't even break a $5 bill so I would have single for the bus the hotel( if you call it that ) has no restraint and isn't in a area were there are placeces to eat breakfast or dinner you have to ride the bus a few stops or walk 20 minutes to fine a good place to eat we had condo but hey your on vacation who wants to cook dinner the beach is 2 city blocks away from beach and I find it a pain in the neck to carry all my stuff 2 blocks down street to beach being your not a beach hotel you have to rent chairs and umbrella which is crazy high $25 for just 2 hours is crazy rate if you want to stay on beach for a few hours now to our ROOM 2007 tower 2 was a pretty down and out room I wouldn't call it home like I would my main time share in Cabo the room was very old and in major need of refurbishing The kitchen living area and bed room is all nasty white and very old and boring would never pick this place again the view stuck AC window unit on floor could cool the hot humid air furniture looked like it was all from the 70s so if your going to Waikiki Don't stay or use your timr share to stay here ther are much better hotels in Waikiki

First off was check in, although we came 4 hours before check in they gave us a room. Our room was on the 34th floor facing the mountains and the view was amazing, so I highly recommend asking for a mountain view from high up. The hotel is made up of two high towers, some are long term apartments and others are hotel rooms. Our room was still living in the 80's but had a full kitchen and a good air conditioner so we were fine with it. The pool, spas, playground and bbqs were on the 5th floor. The pool was quite big and heated with two spas. The barbeques were coin operated which we thought was interesting. At check in we were told that we had an $18 per day amenities charge but that included the resort charge too. Included in that amenities was two free DVD rentals from their DVD machine. The best thing about the stay was the block and a half from the beach and shops.

We stayed at the Waikiki Banyan from 6-11 October 2014 to round out our family holiday to the US from Australia.Our first impressions were of a nice lobby area and helpful staff. The room was a little disappointing, much more dated than we expected, and the sofabed mechanism was broken and the sofa bed not set up with linen, despite us requesting sufficient bedding for 5 of us. The room was clean and a decent size, and with a full sized kitchen which we appreciated.The staff were always helpful and the location suited us. We had an issue with the ancient stove, with one of the elements burning a hole through a frypan while we were cooking dinner. Sparks flew and we could have been hurt (and our dinner was ruined, as there were bits of metal in it), but the stove was repaired and the frypan replaced.The most disappointing thing for us, and the reason for our poor review, is that my son's ipod went missing from the room one day when we were out. He was quite upset, as being a 13 year old he is very attached to it, and had paid for it with his own money. The staff helped me to submit an incident report, but on our return home, the insurers responded to say that essentially because it wasn't in the security box, they had no liability and it was not covered. We felt that given it was in a locked room only accessible by hotel staff, we had a reasonable expectation that it should still be there on our return, and the fact that there is no consequence for the hotel for its loss, may indicate a culture of acceptance of items going missing.Ultimately I would not stay at this hotel again, and could not recommend it, due to the risk of loss of personal items.

recently stayed at the banyan. the lobby is nice and open with a nice waterfall and koi pond with helpful staff and reception staff.upon arriving my two children also received a free water bottle from the front desk which was a lovely gift. once getting up to the room my expectations were exceeded a lot from what i had been expecting.the room was very large with one queen bed and a queen sofa bed with a large fully equipped kitchen. the room was a bit outdated but much better from other pictures i had seen.the location of the hotel is great with just a short walk to the beach and the main shopping strip that i close by.very good so far and the views from our room were spectacular we had a view of diamond head, the beach and the city lights. some of the negatives which are real fine things but they count. The key card to get into the room sometimes did not work or took numerous times to work one of the light globes in the bathroom did not work,the shower curtain rail was old and rusted and when having a shower and closing the shower curtain you could barley see yourself. the door to the bathroom did not close properly nor lock. the air conditioner was a bit loud also the fridge. the oven and the microwave light up the room with the time display so we had to cover them with tea towels. another thing the door to the balcony was a bit stiff and when sitting on the balcony water from other air conditioners/ balcony's would drip down onto our balcony meaning the tiles were always wet and slippery. also considering it can fit up to 5 people there was only two chairs to sit on the balcony. and one time they changed the sheet it had some sort of stain that looked like glue. and the doors separating the lounge and the bedroom did not move well on the tracks and would get stuck same with the wardrobe. a few tips to improve on would just be the little things as i have mentioned but despite the size of the room the bathroom is to small and i suggest that instead of separating the sink and the shower and toilet that you connect them and make one big bathroom. other than that it was all good and we had an enjoyable stay.

We stayed at the Banyan Wikiki from17-21 September 2014. The hotel is quite large and only a couple of blocks from Waikiki beach. The decor is a bit 70-80s but do not let that put you off. On the first night only two of us were staying. However they gave us a room with only two single beds and a pull out sofa bed. We said that was not the room conifiguration we paid for and our other two friends would be arriving the next day. They said that they would shift us the next day. The air conditioning was very loud. The next day we were moved. The room had two queen size beds and in the lounge the pull out sofa bed. The kitchen was good size with general electric stove and refrigerator. The lounge was a good size and the balcony had good views. On floor 5 the pool was located tennis court and an area set aside for families to barbecue. The rooms were clean beds comfortable and staff friendly.The concierge was a tad wrong with giving us directions for the farmers market and we walked for miles in the heat, good exercise I guess. Overall a good experience and the price was good. I would stay there again and is great for families.

First the positives, Location provides for a short walk to the beach, friendly staff, room was clean and the kitchen was large, beautiful mountain view, comfortable bed. There is a small market and a coffee kiosk. Now the downside, The hotel needs a major facelift, the pool deck is large but the constant noise from work being done drove me to hang out at the Honolulu Elk's Lodge, fortunately I'm an Elk's member. Our room was like walking into the past. Crapy bamboo furniture, smoked glass mirrors, linoleum floors, blackout drapes so worn they don't work. No fitness center. If you are looking for a place to sleep, and a jump off point for other activities this place works.

This was our first time in Hawaii and we travelled with the whole family so we wanted a hotel that could offer us a small kitchen in it and this hotel delivered. It was a short walk to Waikiki beach and the staff downstairs were more then happy to help us book our tours and tell us about the local restaurants as well. It was definitely family friendly, on the sixth level you had a pool, two spas and a small playground. As well as an outdoor barbequing area which we used a few times. We also paid the 10 dollars US to get unlimited local calls, the daily paper, wi fi and a movie card that allowed us to borrow movies and games from a machine. We were provided with a playstation two in our room as well as a tv and dvd player. The only downside is, it was like we were on the windy street or something, no matter what time of day you went out it was always windy but only on our street once we turned the corner it was like a complete weather change haha. Would definitely recommend.

Good option for families - self contained kitchen, swimming pool, playground and lovely koi fishpond in reception. Room was clean and comfortable. There were noisy pool renovations happening during out stay but we still managed to sleep ok. Hotel is about 200m walk to the beach so there are lots of other closer options but this hotel is good value. There is an $18 per day charge on top of your room charge for wifi, daily newspaper, DVDs etc. I wish I knew about this beforehand but it was fine.

My family of 4 stayed at Aston Banyan Waikiki in April 2014. We specifically wanted accomodation where there was an option of separate room. We stayed on 32nd or 37th floor (can't remember exactly) and we had a mountain view (which was beautiful). On arrival we asked for a security lock to be installed on the balcony door so our youger son couldn't get easily on the balcony. Maintenance came to install a lock within minutes.I really appreciated the fact that we could block off (with sliding doors) the living area from the bedroom area. Compared to hotel rooms room was very specious and we didn't feel cramped up in small area.reception staff was exceptionaly helpful and met any of our requests in fast and friendly manner. Deffinitely great customer service.cleanlines were great, i found the room to be exactly what the pictures showed on the website.I did my research to find the cheapest possible price so this was great value for money spent.i found this to be the only hotel (in the price range) that offered it's own playground area for kids and we used it. location: a short stroll down to the beach- 5mins slow walk. facing mountain it was a quiet location, in general it's a bit away from the busy area.negatives: as lifts are used for both hotel service and guests there was a waiting time for them and often used by contruction workers- there was also some work being done on some levels. perhaps a separate service/staff lift would help given the size of the hotel.

We booked a room on 07/08/14 just as Hurricane Iselle was about to land in Oahu.Original our room as on the 35th floor tower 2 which we later learned was renovated. However, I am scared of heights and with the wind requested a lower room. We wound up on the 11th floor of tower 1 and this room was in shambles. Duck tape on the cracks of the linoleum flooring, we had to fix the toilet multiple times as the chain in the tank was detaching from the lever making it unable to flush. The carpet was very very dirty. The furniture on the linai which we were asked to bring in had major staining on it. Also, they did not mention when we booked the room that there would be an $18 resort fee at check out. When asked what this was for, we were told, all the other hotels charge it, it is for your internet.. pool... etc.. This HOTEL is not a resort. I don't like hidden fees as such.They did however call us in the morning and offer us first dibs on a room if the hurricane was to delay our flight. I thought this was super service as it was a possibility, and most of Oahu was booked. They were looking after their customers.

Aston Waikiki Banyan is a great spot for business travel of for a family get away, easy location in Waikiki with parking at the hotel, kitchens give the options to have full meals or snacks and of course to bring leftovers back with you, the beds are comfortable, the staff is friendly and helpful, they have been doing some renovations and updates that are nice and the rooms are clean and comfortable.

Asking staff for help like asking them to donate a kidneyservice terrible rooms below average Pool was closed during our stayCheap accomodation but not worth the headache Don't expect to get your deposit back manager looking for easy moneyStay away

This Hotel/Apartment is idea for families of five, we have used the apartments on our last 3 trips to Waikiki, don't expect all the mod cons of the up market hotels there is no restaurants or bars but there is a quaint little coffee shop on the foyer level along with a convince store that has all the nick- nacks you may have forgotten. The real advantage comes with the fully self contained apartment that also has coin operated washers and dryers in a room at the end of the halls on each level. The pool level as a tennis court, spa's a snack bar and a wonderful barbeque areaThe is a supermarket about 10 minute walk up Kuhio Ave that has everything you need to stock the fridge and bar.On every occasion we have stayed at the Banyan the staff have been wonderful and nothing every seems to be a problem.Simply a great place to stay for the budget minded tourist that are happy not to go out for every meal.

Kama'iana= local. And we certainly felt like locals. This was a return trip to Hawaii and while we have stayed at numerous Oahu hotels and condos over 30 years we always feel a warm welcome with Aston. Upon arrival we were greeted by Jonathan who truly exemplifies the spirit of the islands. He was friendly and professional and was so concerned that we were going to have the best holiday. We stayed in Tower 2 unit 2209. This unit faces the mountains. We got the morning sun and enjoyed the cool shade of the afternoon when the temperatures reached 85+. The unit was an individually owned condo within the Aston inventory of suites. We have also stayed at the Aston Sunset and all 3 times the units were decorated identically. At the Banyan the rental pool of suites does not seem to have a standardized interior. However we appreciated the fact that we had 2 double beds and a fully equipped kitchen. The unit also had black out drapes which really kept the room cool. The location is so handy to the beach and to Kapiolani Park. This end of Waikiki is quieter. We booked with the extended stay package which provides once a week housekeeping but we could exchange our towels for fresh ones anytime by going to the 5th floor housekeeping. This package saves $ and the daily amenity fee is not added to the rate. That saved us $18 a day. No Wifi but free internet available at so many locations nearby (ie Starbucks, Royal Hawaiian centre, Mcdonalds). Nice to "unplug" and focus on Hawaii and not the computer! The Banyan gets 5 * for staff and location. The units need some refreshing (hopefully like the sister property Sunset) so for that reason only 3.5* We will return and hope to stay with Aston again. Mahalo for a great time!

Stayed here for 6 nights on our honeymoon. The staff was very friendly and our room was very clean! The concierge we dealt with was very informative and helped us plan our itinerary for our trip! She was very honest about what excursions were worth the money, and which are the favourite ones on the island. The only frustrating thing was that because there are so many people staying in the condos, the elevators can sometimes be very slow. We were on the 19th floor. Otherwise, it was a great experience. Would definitely recommend it to others and would return to stay there again!

We had a good stay here for our first few nights in Honolulu. However the building and rooms need renovating. If you are after a fairly cheap stay with average rooms then this is your hotel. Would probably not stay again. June 2013

We had 4 rooms on the lower floors, (tower one, floors 8 & 11) for 10 nights as we had the entire family in Hawaii for our daughter's wedding. Just for starters, the service was great, the cleaners did a good job, and the location was great, a 1 block walk to the beach, even with grandkids in tow or a hired longboard under the ram wasn't a hassle. We didn't have a noise problem, but we did find a wind problem on the pool deck, one of the kids water floats actually took off! Where we found issues, mostly niggly ones, was with the building itself. It needs a major refreshing. As others have said, ongoing water maintenance works mean water is shut off from entire sections of the building regularly, the hall outside our room was undergoing repairs of some sort, and looked like a bomb site, the laundry was in pretty sad condition, the lifts were eternally slow, as they couldn't get us all on one floor, despite a 6 months in advance booking, we seemed to be forever waiting for a lift. In our rooms, the wardrobe and dividing doors were forever falling off their tracks and getting stuck, the fold-out beds were very lumpy and the springs stuck out, very uncomfortable to sleep on, although the actual beds were fine. Our TV remote didn't work, so we ended up not using the TV for the entire 10 days. We did make use of the wifi, but agree with others, $18 a night is a bit steep. Still, we had a pleasant stay, and if there was just 2 of us and no need for a fold out bed, we'd probably stay here again, units closer to the beach were just too expensive for us as an extended family.
user_name:
Glen C
Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia

review_body: First off they charge resorts fees. Lose a star right there. Resorts: just charge that rate you need for the room. If you list it as 179 and ad 20 it's a 199 room. Were not dumb.We got there too early, room wasn't ready, and the sink drain had to be repaired, delaying check in. It happens, can't always get lucky and get your room early. Could have requested a different room, but i didn't. Glad we waited as the room was very, very nice and the view even better. This was the 4th or 5th time here at the Banyan. Rooms are independently owned, some are great, some not as great. Some people want a restaurant or a bar in the hotel, and take off for that. I don't want one in my hotel. Too much noise. Do you really want a room above an open bar with a band at night? No.This was as quiet as it gets in Waikiki. It was quiet. AC was quiet too. Elevators were fast, waits were very short. Our room had a memory form mattress. I liked it. About half the furniture was nicely styled, the other half was awful. The worst of the '70's and '80's. The cabinets were solid maple. Very nice. The floor was laminate Koa wood. Fake of course, but it looked great. Real wood would not hold up well in a hotel room, and Koa is too rare anyway. This is the floor I would have put in the room!The best part was the mountain view corner room. 2-3515. Could also see much of Diamond and a bit of ocean too. The mountains are beautiful day and night. Not to far from the beach, or too close either. Not related to the Banyan, but Waikiki has just gotten too expensive, and it just isn't as nice as it was. Maui was actually cheaper this year and spent most of our time there.

After reading other reviews I was worried about my visit to the Banyan-but We were pleasantly surprised. Our room was 2708 in Tower 1 and it was great-could not fault it.Great water views off the balcony, good sized kitchen -four of us shared the room which had two double beds and a foldout sofa which our 20 something girls slept in without complaint.Everything was clean and tidy. It takes about 10 minutes to walk back down to the Cheesecake Factory and all the hustle and bustle-but back up at the Banyan it was very quiet-even on the 4th July long weekend it was quiet!We really enjoyed our stay-even though we did not get the early check-in as efficiently as we wanted we were rewarded an upgrade for our patience.My only gripe is that the $18 resort fee is too high for free wifi and not all of us want to use playstations-so maybe each could be priced and then only pay for what you use??Anyway-highly recommend to all.

My family of 5 (dad, mom, daughters) checked in to the Banyan on 6/21/14 for a weeklong stay. The Front Desk staff and Bell Desk staff were friendly and accommodating. We were informed upon check in that we’d been upgraded so we were pleasantly surprised to find ourselves on the 29th floor with a fabulous ocean view! The room itself, 1-2902, was updated, clean and well maintained. Some of the reviews I’ve read portrayed the hotel as old, outdated and rundown but I’m pleased to say that we did not find that to be the case at all. We have stayed here once before about 8 years ago and found the accommodations quite comfortable at that time. However, this time around we were more than a little anxious about space because our daughters are all adults now (24, 22, 19) and the thought of 4 grown women sharing one tiny bathroom was a bit disconcerting. Chalk it up to being in a relaxed vacation mode but we had absolutely no issues. The beds in the bedroom were very comfortable, but the sofa bed and roll-a-way bed, which was brought in for our 5th person, were not. Our daughters rotated each night so they took turns sleeping on those beds. Back when they were younger this was not an issue but as adults they definitely noticed.We did not have a rental car so we walked down to the Pantry market on Kuhio. A little pricier than the mainland (especially milk…yikes!) but very convenient and they have just about everything you’d need to stock the kitchen for your stay. The kitchen is well equipped with utensils, dishes, pots, pans, etc. One thing our unit did not have was a baking sheet. I made biscuits for breakfast one day and had to improvise so it turned out fine. There is also a little market next to the Tower I elevators that has a nice little variety of grocery items. We made a daily stop there for ice cream and other goodies. We visited the pool/recreation area a couple of times and found it to be clean and well-kept. The water was pleasant…not too hot, not too cold. The hot tubs were full the two times we went so we never got to try them out. The Housekeeping staff responded quickly to requests for extra towels, etc. My only issue would be the inconsistent timing of their daily visits. One day, they would arrive before we’d even left for the morning and the next day we wouldn’t see them until close to 4:00 in the afternoon.We DID have some excitement during our stay. The fire alarm sounded on the afternoon of the 26th, followed immediately by an announcement to evacuate. I work at a high school so I am so used to fire alarms going off that I didn’t take it seriously at first, but the Housekeeping attendant in the hall was quite insistent that this was not some kind of drill. Fortunately we were all together and we proceeded to stairwell. Remember our fabulous upgrade? Yeah, not so fabulous when you have to descend 29 flights of stairs! We smelled smoke (but didn’t see any) at around the 20th floor, but the guests and residents kept their heads and we calmly exited the hotel and crossed the street. One poor lady was in a robe with her head wrapped in a towel…she still had conditioner in her hair, poor thing! There were multiple fire trucks in the street and maybe a couple dozen firemen – that I could see, anyway. I was amazed by how many knuckleheads were still in the hotel, looking down at us from their balconies. The whole event did last very long at all and we were soon given the “all clear” to return to our rooms...by elevator this time! This was our first hotel evacuation and I was very impressed by how organized and professional the Banyan staff were. Kudos to the Fire Dept. as well! Thankfully no one was hurt and all things considered it was a minor inconvenience.I can’t say enough about the Waikiki Banyan staff. Absolutely first rate, every single person we encountered. The location is perfect...a short walk to the beach and shopping, but just beyond the noisy hustle and bustle. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Banyan and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Good location, not too far from the beach and restaurants. Great view on the Waikiki and the beach. The staff was very helpful. They kept our luggages before the check-in and after the check-out.The room/kitchen was alright, but the hotel is getting old. One bad note: We were 4, and they gave us a room with 2 single beds and a "sofa-bed", so 2 had to sleep on that "sofa bed", it was terrible.

Booked this hotel for 18 nights as it was close to the beach and had a kitchenette. The day we arrived we were informed that the pool would close in 2 days time for 2 weeks maintenance and that the travel suppliers had been informed. Well we hadn't so I was not impressed. We were credited 1 weeks resort fee in compensation. However the pool was open again in 1 week. The room itself was badly in need of a makeover and looked like no maintenance had been done in 20 or more years. While we were there the toilet cistern started to leak on the floor and had to be replaced. This was done promptly but with another old one. A table lamp in the lounge had been broken (ceramic base) and then glued together, the curtain rods were rusty and there were small repairs done on the bath edges to prevent water running on the floor while showering. I did notice while walking past other rooms on our floor that were being serviced that they were a lot better than our room. The travel magazine from the travel agent stated that there was a restaurant at the hotel but there wasn't. Also there was no information about how to get towels for the pool/beach. I had to ask reception and they sent me to housekeeping. Not impressed and wouldn't return here.

This is a great place to stay, close to the beach, yet away from the noise and crowds. The staff treated us like royalty. There was construction going on but we weren't near it. The condo was clean and comfortable, located on the 7th. floor with view of ocean and city, when we had only paid the cheapest price so were suppose to be on the first 3 floors.

This is my third time staying at the Banyan , so I have experience staying here. This time was for our 30th wedding anniversary. The lady who checked us in said we had a great room top floor just remodeled so I was excited to see the new rooms. The hall ways and elevator needs updating for sure. The room we got was 3805 an updated room which was very nice on the surface, but upon closer inspection..... the bed was hard and old... bedding very simple and well used. the furnishings have been up dated. The Kitchen was the best part. The TV is on a wall that seperates the kitchen and bedroom , so you can not sit in bed and watch TCV, you have to sit on the couch. The TV even though new flat screen had lines running the length of the picture which made it hard to catch it. I know that air Conditioners are loud, but when ours was turned off so we could sleep in a quiet room.... all we hear was the loud humm of the on roof unit. When asking the front desk - they said I would not get a better room and I should try to live with the loud humming . I was not impressed.

Some of the reviews I read about the Waikiki Banyan before staying there were... off-putting. Thankfully they were all proved wrong by our week long stay at the property. Although the one bedroom apartment was a little outdated, it was well stocked with cutlery, dishes and so on. There was a full kitchen (oven, microwave, kettle, coffee maker), and a quick trip to Walmart (roughly 10-15mn drive) stocked the cupboards for the week. As a family of three (all adults), the configuration that we asked for originally (one double in the bedroom and a foldout in the lounge) was not respected despite giving months of advance warning, but we were able to shift one of the two beds in the bedroom into the lounge area and still have plenty of room to move around. I do understand that it is hard to manage rooms on a daily basis, but I would have thought the advance notice given in this case was enough.We had an ocean view room, and it was simply awesome to wake up to a view of Waikiki Beach and a little sliver of Diamond Head. Note that there is a charge for Wifi and rental of the Playstation etc for movies ($18 per night, I believe), as well as a charge for parking, which can be paid for on a weekly basis (my memory is pointing to the $80 USD mark on this count). The hotel is located nice and close to the beach, and possesses both a pool and a sauna, as well as two hot tubs and a tennis court.As a travel agent (specialising in NZ and Australia, so I should point out that I don't sell or have any professional connections to this property or any in Hawaii/USA for that matter), I would recommend this accommodation to friends, family and anyone looking for a relatively low budget, reliable apartment hotel.A final note, there was a power cut to the block the hotel is on whilst we were staying, the staff handled the event very well with minimal disruption, letting people know what was going on with the speaker system within the hotel itself and directing them to the torches in their rooms.

The location of the hotel is great, far enough to the east of Waikiki to where it's quieter than the center of town, yet close enough to walk anywhere. Very close to the beach, and yet the price per night is relatively fair compared to other hotels. The lobby of the hotel is quite nice, it is conjoined with the outdoors, bringing the indoors out! The lady that checked us in was undoubtedly the nicest hotel staff member I have ever had the pleasure of talking too. The halls of the hotel are very outdated, raggedy old red carpets, strange green walls, and highly humid, stuffy, unairconditioned corridors are not a real comfortable place to be. The rooms are actually quite nice. Nothing fancy, but the size is great, balconies just an added bonus! Now this building used to be a condo complex, changed into a hotel. So all rooms do have kitchens, depending on whether you like to pinch pennies or not, this may be a plus or negative. The plus side is you can go to the shops and buy enough coffee and groceries to make sandwiches and fruit salad for breakfast every morning. The downside with having a kitchen in a place where people come and go is cockroaches. Even though you may not see one on your stay here, they are most likely there, we had a lot in our kitchen, and house keeping had to come and spray twice during our one week stay. It's no secret we were slightly paranoid about brining these guys home, we shook off all our clothes and threw them in the direr before we left, and washed everything immediately when we got home. To Summarize, this is a hotel with spacious rooms, great staff, perfect location, fair price, but comes with the cost of outdated corridors, slightly outdated rooms, and bugs. I would give this hotel a 3/5 but the staff bumped that up to a well deserved 4

The reno's are nice at the entrance, but don't let them fool you... a coat of paint didn't do much to improve the actual rooms. Stayed here 9 days. Took the advice of previous reviews and asked for "high in tower 2". Managed to get 36 floor... and though the view was nice, the 30 year old decor could stand a refresh. We had a family of 4 in the room and the provided a cot so we had the little one on the pull out, another on the cot, and the 2 adults in a queen size. a little cramped, but was fine for the most part. Didn't experience the the construction issues at all. I don't want to take away from the great people that work here. Everybody was very nice, and very helpful. Very professional staff. If i could rate the staff alone, they'd b a 5. Probably the most disturbing part was the bar-b-que's. They're electric and cost $2 per hour. you'll waste the first hour getting heat out of it. And if you work for the hotel and your reading this... get rid of the cockroaches in the cooking area. that will help improve the ratings... Location is perfect. Not every bus stops there, but they all stop very close. we walked to the beach every day... very enjoyable. The coffee shop is an asset. for the east coasters... they open extremely early. had my morning coffee at 5am every morning. better than trying to brew a pot in the room. Overall, we like the location and people... the accomodations need a refresh and a serious scrubbing. Tile shouldn't be sticky!Loved Hawaii and will return at my earliest convenience.

We gave up princess kaiulani as they had no kitchen believing this was same standard. We were charged $500 more for 10 days. Pool area not flash no umbrellas. The room we had been booked into had a bed pushed up hard against wardrobe to fit 2 beds so only access to wardrobe was to stand on bed. After complaining we were given another room which was bigger but rooms very, very old & in need of upgrade. Curtains, sofa, carpets old & dirty. Waikiki now has abundance homeless people hogging beach shelters & seating so none for tourists to use to admire beautiful beach. They are all along streets camping & begging. Not the holiday destination it once was. Such a shame!!!

I stayed at the Banyan from April 5-11, 2014 with my Husband and three kids. My Parents also booked a room just down the hall from us. Prior to our stay, I read some reviews and most of them at that time were not overly great. However, also prior to my stay I had a few questions and decided to email the Aston Waikiki Banyan based on these reviews I had read. I received a response very quickly and the customer service was excellent. When we arrived at the Banyan, were were pleasantly surprised that they had upgraded us free of charge because of my concerns/questions in my previous email. During our week stay, all staff were extremely Friendly and helpful. Yes, the rooms are a little dated, but definitely clean and spacious. The location is great, only a block from the beach and Zoo! I would stay at the Aston Waikiki Banyan again next time I visit Waikiki.

The staff was courteous and friendly. The lobby areas are quite nice. I know that some of these rooms are individually owned (and rented out as time shares and such). We were part of a tour group, and had approximately 60 people staying on several floors. The room that I was in had a sofa that needed recovering. The fabric was so worn through that it was shredded and you could see the cushion material/stuffing poking through. The carpet was worn, but clean. The countertop was chipped, and had been patched. The wallpaper and paint was chipped on corners where bags most likely bumped into them going in and out of the bedroom.Our room had 2 twin beds (which was fine for me and my roommate). They weren't the most comfortable, but were adequate. We were so tired from our adventures that we really didn't notice. We had plenty of towels, and pillows. However, that sofa really bugged me. I asked the front desk to cover it with a sheet or something, as it looked scratchy and uncomfortable. We didn't spend much time in our room, so it wasn't so bad. The hotel is within easy walking distance of Waikiki beach. The bus line has a stop just off of Kuhio and Ohua, so mass transit was easy. The Bus drivers were kind and courteous and rather helpful.The hotel lacks a restaurant, but seeing how as it is more an apartment/condo building(s) than hotel, that isn't too surprising. If the room had better accommodations (wifi $18? Really?), I would have given it 4-5 stars. The state of the sofa and chair were bad enough that it really knocked down the rating. Would I stay here again? If I could have a different room that doesn't beg for rehab, yes.

This place is a mugs joint for unassuming Kiwis and Aussies. Dont be fooled like we were. Prices do not reflect the dim and old nature of this building that may have been OK in the 80's. Ugly entrance, dim and dungy reception and lift foyer. Old fashioned fit out and basic bedding. Reasonably handy to downtown Waikiki. Recommend checking out newer opposition that books out early for good reason.

Hi, stayed 10 nights in March 2014.Too early to book in so cases were stored, no problem.I was lucky to deal with Jason on reception, I explained that we had paid top dollar (Expedia) and asked what he would advise. He booked us into a good room on level 32, tower 2 for 2 nights then up to level 35 for the remaining 8. ( Rooms 8 -14 up high in tower 2 are the best I think)Jason was very helpful and also good for a little chat on way in or out.Apartments are a bit dated, goes with the vintage of the building but very comfortable.Kitchen is a bonus as eating out in Waikiki is expensive so we bought some basic food at "Food Pantry" and had breakfast each morning in the apartment.I would definitely stay here again, apart from the above, the Banyan is in a great position on Diamond head area of Waikiki, walk to Lulu's, Tiki bar, beach, zoo etc also only 10 minutes walk to all the other places, Dukes, Jimmy Buffet, Cheesecake Factory etc. Trolley buses take you to Ala Moana for $2.00 each way.Thanks Jason & Banyan.

You have to do your research. Each unit is individually owned therefore they are all similar but very different. We choose and booked a unit after looking at many units online.i kept my eye on the unit and realized that we would be affected by the stack work going on and reserved another room. I have no significant complaints about our unit. It was renovated so looks lovely, well stocked, had enough comfortable sleeping areas for 2 teenagers & 2 adults, a great view of the ocean to the left, and view of the canal and golf course to the right. We could borrow boogie boards, beach mats, etc thru koko resorts. It is a little walk to some of the higher end shops but a very short walk to the beach, and many of the abc stores, fast food, coffee shops, zoo, aquarium etc. we did not cook in the unit but the fridge, freezer, dishes, microwave & blender were very handy. If I had really had to nitpick I would say it would have been nice to have more areas to store luggage and it could use a really thorough dusting and Clean, not just the hotel turn around wipe down. The outdoor pool area on level 6 was roomy enough with lounge chairs for all of us. We enjoyed our stay and would imagine with young children we would have used and appreciated the kitchen even more. Yes we heard sirens, it's a big city, yes it's expensive, it's an island, yes some of the people were less friendly then others, yes there are homeless people like most all large cities. Overall we felt safe and enjoyed our stay.

This was our fifth stay at this hotel and our best. We had an amazing ocean view from our room on the 38th floor where we could watch the humpback whales frolicking off Queens beach every day and the Honolulu Festival fireworks were simply breathtaking from our front row seat. On arrival, Jason Blossey and his front desk team made us feel like we were returning home and we were made to feel like we were a part of their family. We like the location in the quieter part of Waikiki and everything is within a short walk, including some of the best local eateries like Lulu's Surf Bar, Wolfgang Puck Express, MAC 24/7 and the Banyon Breeze, located in the lobby of Tower One of the Banyon. The pool, the barbecues are wonderful assets for a family and entertaining island friends and families. Some of the rooms are a little dated and not refurbished yet but really, how much time are you going to spend in a hotel room in Hawaii? The one bedroom suites are large with all kitchen necessities and the beds are comfortable and the A/C keeps the room very comfortable. We stayed in the hotel, not a private condo, so my comments are about the hotel and it's staff. The daily housekeeping kept the sand picked up and the rooms and bathroom clean and fresh clean towels every day. The staff are very friendly and make an effort to try and know you and to them, nothing is a problem. We had two minor issues with an appliance and plumbing and Jason had it taken care of instantly. I always appreciate the can-do attitude. We will be back.

Bad-We rented through VBRO and therefore the hotel staff treated us like we were scum.Bed was awful, couch no better.BBQ- pay $2.00 each time to cook a meal? Seriously?$200+ per night way too high.Parking staff seriously need better amenities, how could they possibly be pleasant in that dungeon?Good- koko resorts staff were friendly and helpful when asked. Short walk to the beach or strip. Partial ocean view was a nice change to mountain view at the sunset.Summary- if you pay the outrageous rates the hotel asks you may be treated as a human. Go through VRBO and you are as desirable to them as the beggars on the street asking for change or a spare dollar.

What a dive! This accommodation is extremely dated. Not ideal if there are four adults travelling. Queen size bed is a fold out couch with very uncomfortable innersprung mattress. Glad we didn't take the cat as you wouldn't be able to swing it in the bathroom/toilet. Bathroom floor unclean with several dark hairs, we are all blond. Joinery old and splitting and bathroom window covered in dust and webs. Kitchen oven archaic. We will not be back.

The Waikiki Banyan is a nice place to stay in Waikiki. It's not the most central location but everything is within a 10 minute stroll away. Being travellers from Australia, we took every opportunity to shop and stock up on items that are ridiculously cheaper in the US than back home, so almost every night after dinner, we walk to the DFS, Royal Hawaiian Centre and along Kuhio Ave to shop. Walking along the beach back to the Banyan was nice and is quite safe late at night.We rented a 1 bedroom condo with a full kitchen and felt that it was roomy enough to fit 4 ladies with A LOT of shopping. We used almost half the floor space to put our shopping bags down and still had lots of space to move around. The kitchen is convenient for late night snacks and break of dawn breakfasts that you need to just swallow before leaving for a tour or excursion at 7am.There were minor disturbances from the renovations going on around the pool area (level 6) and the exterior of the hotel. The pool is big enough to do small laps and the spa was relaxing. There's a normal spa and a 'hotter' spa for warmer temperatures which is great! We loved the hotter spa, especially at night. The only downside is that there is no gym in the building. Apparently you get discounts at a nearby gym but that's not the most convenient when you just want a quick work out.The resort fee includes use of the pool/spa, PS3 in your room, a DVD card to rent movies for free, free wifi in your condo (you have your own router in the condo). The wifi was especially great. We had 3 people on skype at the same time and the internet wasn't slow.Overall great experience. Staff was helpful and friendly. Would definitely stay here again!

Stayed 10 nights January 2014, Travelling with others so had a few rooms between us. All rooms very dated with many maintenance issues. Beds uncomfortable, particularly the sofa bed - extremely uncomfortable, had to use couch cushions to layer between 'mattress' and sheet so you could get some sleep. Fold out bed just as bad.Sliding doors on wardrobes wouldn't work. Security latch on door broken. Access to balcony locked as work was being done outside, which resulted in grinding outside early in the morning. When booking accommodation website advised outside work was being done but was due for completion in December so thought all would be done by our stay. Once we got into December website changed, now expected competition in April. No notification to advise that the work timeline would now be during our stay. Charges put onto credit card that were not applicable - reception not helpful in getting this fixed. The good ... proximity to Waikiki beach area. Liked the pool/spa/bbq area, nothing fancy but roomy area for group of people to utilise.Needs updating - new paint, kitchen makeover, update furniture etc., and this could be a great place to stay.

Two families booked 8 months prior to our stay for what we believed was a deluxe ocean view room . Upon arrival we were given an unrenovated room that feel short of our expectations. To the managers credit we were shown a number of room alternatives however each room was much the same . We were told that unlike a hotel these room are all owned by individuals who only update the room if they wish . We decided to leave the Banyan and seek accommodation elsewhere. After many costly phone calls expedia agreed to credit our payment to another place. The Banyan was also under going renovations at the time which involved not using the balcony and having water shut off during the day. This was not known to us at the time of booking . In hindsight it was not really worth the high fee to have a kitchen if we ever returned for a short visit 4 days or less we would just stay in a hotel room .

We had a great room... It was a little outdated but overall it was really good. The need could have been more comfortable and the piloted could have been better. The doors separating the bedroom from the living area should be fixed.

We stayed here for 8 nights in January, with my family. I have toe kids aged 16 and 7. The room was comfortable, except that the sofa bed my daughter was to use was broken so they provided an extra camp bed. Not really suitable for a tall 16 year old, so she ended up sleeping on the floor. The location is ok you can see the water from the balcony, we were on the 32nd floor. The bathrooms are small and dated, but the kitchen facilities were good. Not a great family facility if you want any privacy because if you close off the door to the bedroom, there is no a/c in the bedroom.The staff were pleasant and helpful.

Stayed here with an exchange from my timeshare. It is a solid value at best. Place is excellent for budget traveling but that is as far as it goes. Stayed on the 22nd floor Tower 2, at time of check in front desk was clueless as to where I had to go check in which I am sure timeshare owners stay here often. Loved the barbecue area on the 6th floor. And this is as far as I will go. Will I stay here again? Probably not if I can help it. Location is good but hey being in Hawaii is great so…

The front desk Jason is great! He made our stay at the hotel a pleasant experience. The hotel is very close the beach and everything. We had a room of two beds and one sofa pull-out bed. The room is large enough for a family of 4 or so. It will save you some money by staying in this condo-like hotel. It has a kitchen and you can cook yourself to even save more! Overall it was a very pleasant and enjoyful stay!

My family have been staying at the Banyan every year for about 20 years - always a delightful experience - the staff are always helpful - the rooms are terrific - We had a group of about 20 staying in different rooms for my daughters wedding in hawaii and loved the BBQ on the sixth floor - planning another trip soon

I'm a believer in you get what you pay for and I try to travel on a budget. If you're like me then this is a good place for you to take your family. It's not the Hilton nor is it a run down hotel. It is older but they are making modest updates to the rooms and facilities. I booked my room through RCI which included wifi and free parking. As I understand it, there are several agencies and private parties you can use to book rooms her, all with their own amenities, so don't be discouraged by the various comments as they may not apply to you. Overall no complaints having parking right at the hotel was a bonus and made the trip that much better.

Checked in for Thanksgiving week with a huge party that took 7 rooms on the same floor (level 33 tower 1). No one told any of us anything about renovation work being done on the exterior of the building. After we've settled in, the next morning the drilling starts at 9 am and ends at 5 pm. I'm talking about multiple power drills going into the walls right outside of the building non-stop. You can hear the hammering and drilling like it's on top of your head. Then they offer to move us but can't put us all on the same floor. The service is just terrible and we feel completely unsatisfied with the hotel. I would warn everyone to stay away. I would never stay here again.

The Banyan is located a short walking distance from the beach and it's still within walking distance to everything - the zoo, all the shops, and restaurants. When first walking in, the Banyan has a beautifully updated lobby area, there's even a nice waterfall/fountain with a coy pond at the bottom. They have a cafe and a little store on site with souvenirs and basic amenities. The front desk staff and everyone on the property was very cheery and helpful. I would definitely recommend staying in a higher floor. I had a mountain view room, which I liked more than the ocean view, because at night the mountains are lit up with all the city lights. There was a nice sized balcony in the room with a table and chairs, where I spent a lot of my time. the room itself was a bit dated but it was very tidy and clean. I loved how the bedroom had a large sliding door which made the room feel much more spacious and open. This is a great family property as they have a great recreation area with tennis courts, pools, BBQ areas, and a playground.

We stayed at the WaIkiki Banyan on our 10-day Hawaiian vacation and on Nov 2, 2013 my family and I were trapped on the hotel elevator between the 14th and15th floor and the door won't open. We sound the alarm and 15 minutes later the hotel personnel in charged arrived and told us not to call 911 because the maintenance guy is coming. During the long wait my son, who is autistic had to pooped inside and fainted for lack of air and heat. We stayed inside the elevator for more than an hour before we got freed. In an emergency situation like this, why did the hotel in charge forbid us to call 911.

Stayed 8 days.No problems.Excellent room. Fantastic view, make sure you get "ocean view" room.Close to beach, transport, shopping.Well priced.Will stay here again.Ask at front desk for a bus reference sheet, gives you all the bus numbers and how to get to places.

We really enjoyed our 7 days staying here. We had a really good sized kitchen which we utilised (tip from the front desk was to take a taxi to Safeway rather than shop at the tourist supermarket a few blocks away). Utensils provided were basic, but covered everything we needed. The place was spotless and cleaned daily, which isn't always to be expected at apartment hotels.The bus and Waikiki trolley stop is just around the corner, two blocks from the beach, so just a few minutes walk. This part of the beach has sea walls making it really safe swimming for littlies.There is even a café and convenience store in the foyer, and a tennis court and playground on the pool deck.

it took days to find a place in waikiki on the internet, something reasonably priced and with space to relax. This Hotel had it, a good price and good amount of space, two double beds, kitchen and lounge.our flight from Australia arrives at 6am, other places I've been to have let us into the room, not here, "We were full last night you should have booked a room if you wanted in early" nice reception from the man on the front desk!!other than that the staff were fairly helpful and unobtrusive, everything else was OK too, old air conditioners that kept the room cool.its really just me that EVERYTHING in Accommodation in Hawaii needs an update, the whole place seems stuck in the 70's, perhaps thats part of the charm of the place, but give it another 20 years and it will be way behind the times. up market shops seemed to be the only new things.all in all though, the place is good, lean and comfortable.

My elderly parents and a handicap autistic bother were stuck in the elevator. Management, staff and security refused to call emergency. During the hour of being stuck in that elevator staff would yell to them "do not to call 911"and "just wait!" While being stuck in the elevator my parent's phone didn't work and would cut off so they were not able to call 911 anyways. They got so sick waiting and my handicap bother had to defecate on the floor. People in trapped enclosed and in sick condition should wait for emergency, not wait for lazy "elevator man" to take his time to arrive. I suppose my family is lucky none of them didn't have a panic attack, seizure, or die which could have very well happened thanks to your "just wait" treatment. Even after 30 min of being stuck personnel and staff refused to call the fire department or emergency! When I called security pleading them to call the fire department after 30 min of of being trapped, I was threatened by security James "if we called emergency, you'll be charged over $800.00!" then he hang up.Hotel guests should not be charged forced tortured and get sick in a stuck elevator! By absolutely no means did the management, staff, or security handle the situation professionally. Clearly there was no rush to help these people stuck getting tired and sick in the elevator. Security and management were also trying to blame "traffic" for the long wait. That entire island can be circled within an hour. Clearly there was no rush to help these people stuck getting tired and sick in the elevator. It practically took and hour before some "elevator man" even set foot on the property. The treatment towards my family was disgusting torture and absolutely unacceptable! What should have happened was the fire department should have been called immediately to get trapped people out of a malfunctioning elevator first, then call the "elevator man" to fix the malfunction. Instead security and staff wanted the convenience of fixing the elevator while making my family sick waiting inside it because it was cheaper! Sham on the security management, and staff who were more worried about the elevator rather than the human lives trapped in it. I'm sure if it were your family members stuck in an elevator, you would not leave them to wait for some lazy "elevator man"..

I stayed at the Aston Waikiki Banyan for 10 days in October 2013. Location wise, this hotel is good. It about 1 block from the strip/beach and restaurants. Staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was on the 20th floor. The rooms were spacious, the beds comfortable, the shower was a bath/shower. Bed linen is changed every 3 days. We had a kitchen in our apartment which came in handy (eating out at every meal loses its charm after awhile!). The cleaning of the rooms was a bit iffy - in 10 days our room wasn't vacuumed once, and after spending days at the beach, the last thing you want to do is to have a shower and be walking on sand. Overall though, I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay on Waikiki.

Perfect place for two people who want to be close to beach and shops. Well maintained. Rented from Thomas Edwards. My second time there we were there last July and loved it. Has everything you needed and nice updated kitchen.

My husband and I and two teenage children stayed at the Waikiki Banyan for 7 nights in September. The room was on the 22nd floor, clean and spacious. The bed in the main bedroom was large and comfortable. My son slept on the fold out sofa bed and my daughter on a rollaway bed. The main bedroom could be separated from the living area by sliding doors.The daily resort fee included wireless internet access which worked well for the iPad. We could also borrow free DVDs and play station 2 games.The hotel had a good sized swimming pool and two hot tubs on the recreation deck. There was also a kiosk available for snacks and small meals. On the ground floor there was also a cafe and small convenience store.The hotel was located 2 blocks from the beach and close to shops, eating places and transport.We found the reception staff polite and efficient. We booked a day trip through the front desk and had no problems. This is a very family friendly hotel and we were very satisfied with our stay here.

The trip was a honeymoon. We rented the condo via VRBO. The lady who owned the unit was wonderful to work with. The unit was immaculately clean. We had a wonderful vies of Diamond Head and could see a little of the ocean. We were on the 7th floor. The unit is located one block from the ocean. There no charge for parking. Television sets were in the living area as well as the bedroom. The unit was stocked with everything you would need to start the vacation. The owner even brought us breakfast one morning. Unfortunately, the owner is going to discontinue renting the unit.

Out of all the rooms in this facility they placed us in a construction zone. There were workmen directly outside our room on the outside wall everyday working on our outdoor deck (that was off limits and full of construction materials). We had to keep our curtains closed all day so we could have some small degree of privacy. It was like living in a dungeon. All I can say after making our reservation over 3 months ago is that they must of overbooked because they were not supposed to place guests where construction was taking place. We did not realize until we checked in to our room that our room would be at the very center of the construction activities. When we made our reservations over 3 months ago they should have told that there were no rooms available if all the many others rooms at this location had already been booked before our reservation.
user_name:
Hank R
Kennewick, Washington, United States

review_body: We were very happy with the Waikiki Banyan! Seriously, we loved everything about it. Pretty and clean apt. with a million dollar view and close to everything. Very friendly staff. The only thing that could be improved might be a 'rope line' at the front desk or some sort of way to logically take the next person standing in line.

the location of the hotel was great the room was quite large and the Hotel was clean. the room that we had was 2506 and it had a beautiful view. I would recommend the steak package to others. we would return to this hotel on our next Stay.

Wife and I stayed with a larger group at this hotel The staff were absolutely amazing and catered for every need we had. The rooms were comfortable and the ample size kitchen made self-catering so easy.Only a short stroll to the action along the oceanfront, but back a little so you're not constantly in the thick of activity. Just perfect. Hotel suits couples and groups easily and has pool and spas + bbqs. We are definitely happy to return here again and again.

Stayed here over the Labor Day weekend. Big rooms, clean with a full kitchen and a nice view of Waikiki Beach. Got a good hotel room rate with free parking. Chose this hotel because it is close to Kapiolani Park where we went to the Okinawan Festival. Also very close to my brother's apartment. Was surprised to have two twin beds instead of two double beds but at least there was a sofa bed. Was also surprised at the all tile floors (no carpet) and the old, box style TV set. But the A/C and tile floors made the room nice and cold during a hot, humid weekend.

Nice place to stay and very close to the beach. The room had a movable divider wall for the bedroom that could be opened to create an open-type floor plan. We accommodated 7 in our room and it worked out fine. Nice size full kitchen included. Our balcony faced the ocean and it was a very relaxing place to sit and take in the Hawaiian atmosphere late at night. Everywhere you could want to go to in Waikiki is about a 10 minute walk or less!
user_name:
Logan C
College Station, Texas, United States

review_body: Aloha,Our 1st time in Waikiki we traveled from New Zealand stayed here for 10 nights,a small group 3 Adults & 2 Crazy boy's at 3yrs lol we booked direct soo we could get the best possible rate,we checked in very late 10pm the staff day/night were always helpful they had our room keys papers to sign ready soo it was a seamless check-in so we could get the kids to bed,we had a Mountain View room kitchenette on the 29th the only thing i have to complain about our room was the pull-out bed matress HORRIBLE!!! besides this everthing esle was in working order CLEAN open plan there's slider doors to separate the living & bedroom, a lot of space for the kids to run round,on arrival your given a card so you can hire DVD/Games from the machine on the 4th floor this helped out heaps at bedtime for the kids,Recreation area on the 6th BBQ's that are cleaned every day, Tennis Court,Pools,Playground,Basketball hoop,spa pools, Mini Golf & there's a Snack Bar that have amazing hot meals,as your one block away from the beach we didn't really use these facility's,we had the same cleaning lady for our stay,she was never late 11am she be knocking on our door lol very nice lady! Overall would recommend to others my family are already planning our next trip & will be staying here again fo'sure

With a family of 5 (including 2 teens) you don't expect to be able to stay in one room and be comfortable. Well, at the Banyan you can. We expected to be crammed in with a roll-away or to dish-out or another room.The room was regular price ... it was a suite really. Big open TV room with a pull-out couch another room with 2 full beds and a FULL kitchen. The kitchen was fully stocked with pots, pans, silverware, cups, mugs, corkscrew (most important!!).1 block from the beach.If I want to fight the crowds on Oahu again I'll certainly go to the Aston Banyan - it is an AWESOME hotel!

The openness of the lobby gives you that island feel right away, a great start to your vacation. Additionally, the staff at the front desk not only makes you feel welcome but they are also very helpful, especially when it comes to finding specific foods for someone who has many allergies or directions to someplace off the beaten path. We have already made reservations for my daughter's wedding in November.

We just got back from a 4 night stay at the Waikiki Banyan booked through Aston. We had a partially updated room on the 36th floor. The bathroom was updated, but not the kitchen. We had no problems with construction noise or the elevators. Other than the bathroom, the room was old. We liked the space because we have a 1 year old. Basically you get what you pay for.

We booked this room through Book-It.com and it was absolutely horrible!!!!!! When they said construction, they forgot to mention the men on our deck who were jack-hammering and saw-cutting at 8 a.m. Two days later they moved us to another room and we could still hear the construction. The room was very old and out-dated! We paid for a ocean front view and if you cranked your head, you could see the ocean! Not worth it at all! The elevators were slow andvery hot! Not much on premises for shopping for a few groceries or for souveniors/gifts!! The "Expedia" representative was nice, but "gouged us" for the few trips we took! Do your research before booking a room!!

My wife, 2 teenage kids and just spent 5 nights here. Our room was a "renovated" room on the 25th floor. The room was large with a sofa-bed and sliding partition for the bedroom. The King sized bed we had was comfortable. The bathroom was nice and it had a bidet, which we had never seen at any other hotel. Our room also had a full-sized refrigerator, full size stove/oven, pots, frying pan, toaster, utensils, rice cooker, plates, bowls, cups, mugs, etc. It was very well stocked.The sofa-bed wasn't all that comfortable as the mattress on that was paper thin an you could feel the springs. Aside from that, we were very happy with the room.There are 4 elevators that service Tower 1, where we were located. There's also a Tower 2, but we did not stay on that side. The elevators on Tower 1 are slow, but worse - hot. They are not air-conditioned and if you were not in a full sweat when you entered the elevator on the 1st floor, you would be drenched by the time you stopped a few times on the way up to your room.The Banyan has it's own parking garage that charged $15 per 24hrs. It is staffed 24/7, and we did not have any issues with the parking garage, other than some of the spaces were very narrow.The location of the hotel is just 2 blocks from the main strip along the beach. It is on the side closer to the zoo, but still just a few blocks from the middle of the strip. There's a Burger King and McDonalds nearby for cheap food. It's also about 6-7 blocks away from the International Marketplace. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here and would stay here again, even with the slow and hot elevators.

My fiance and I stayed at the Banyan in February 2013 and were overall very pleased! The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful and the hotel/rooms were always clean. Unfortunately there was a lot of construction going on during our stay so it was quite noisy and there were multiple times during our stay where the water was shut off.Our room was very outdated, right down from the bedding to the decor. There were some stains on the carpet and the sinks/showers leaked and squeaked. The view was spectacular and we were within walking distance to Waikiki beach and many shops and restaurants,We would definitely recommend this hotel and stay again!

Enjoyed our stay in Apartment 911 at the Waikiki Banyon. very handy location. Apartment comes with everthing you need for a comfortable holiday. Very clean and tidy. Apartment overlooks the 6th floor pool and Diamond Head.

The Waikiki Banyan is very well located for getting out and about Honolulu and Oahu. The building is a mix of residents and condominiums available for rent. The rental pool of suits are good, clean and functional; they are not new and yes, they are dated but work fine. The Waikiki Banayan staff are kind and helpful - especially Jonathan. The recreational deck has tennis courts, putting green (not very challenging) a Pool and two hot tubs (one warm one hot). There are also prepared food available on this deck and BBQs available for rent to prepare your own. This is a well run facility - management promptly deals with rule violations, bad behaviour and conflict between users. Great to keep the family busy and the kids with non-stop energy a place to burn it; especially when tropical storm Flossie came by for a visit. We had a 34th floor suit with great Diamond Head and Ocean views. Waikiki beach is not an ideal location for children; but, the location of this accommodation is only steps away from bus service (public or tour) to take you to other locations and attractions.

"Aloha!" Our Banyan Hotel was great! Yes, "older", but most importantly everything worked. Our Room #2201 had a complete kitchen from forks & spoons to a rice cooker. We had spacious living & dining rooms and our beds were comfortable. A/C kept us us cool and a Sony Flat Screen TV with a Sony playstaion console kept us entertained. We also had great views of Diamond Head and also our hotel activity deck on the 6th Floor (swimming pool, hot tub, childrens play area, tennis/basketball courts and BBQ areas). FYI - there is a manditory daily amenity fee for room cleaning, daily newspaper and 2 daily free movie/game rentals on the 5th Floor - worth it. Laundry facility located on 7th Floor.Our Banyan Hotel location was also great! Peaceful family setting, away from the crowds on the beach strip. Walking distance to many restuarants (Oceanarium Seaffod Buffet, Marukame Udon, 24/7, Eggs & Things, Me's BBQ, Tiki's Grill & Bar, Blazin' Steaks), shopping (International Market & ABC Stores), tour buses (Polynesian Cultural Center, Grand Circle Island Tour, Diamond Head Crater Hike) & city buses (Bus #13 Rainbow Drive-In & Leonard's Malasadas and Bus #42 Ala Moana Shopping Center & Swap Meet @ Aloha Stadium) and most especailly Waikiki Beach. Already planning to come back again. "Mahalo!"

We loved the location of our room - easy access to the beach. We also loved that the private owner of our unit provided beach toys for our use. The Banyan also has its own grocery store and coffee/snack shop on site which was very handy after a long day of playing at the beach. The only downside to our unit was that the sleeper sofa was not suitable for an adult to sleep on. The owner promised that he would soon replace this with a new sofa.

We stayed here for our 2 week stay on Oahu. We were very pleased with our condo in tower 2. Very clean and nice. Not happy with the fact we couldn't use our lanai as they were doing construction on them. :( Also not happy you had to pay to use grills. We completely understood paying for laundry facilities. But then if you run out of quarters for grills or laundry facilities the front desk wouldn't give us change as we rented condo via owner not resort but they make the money off grills and laundry facilities. That is very dumb. Very convenient that parking is part of rental. Other than the few issues it is overall a great place to stay. Very convenient walking distance to beach and night life on Waikiki. Close to Ala Moana Canal which is nice for a jog or walk.

We rented a condo here through VRBO, and loved it! Great location, a 5 minute walk to the beach. A 10-15 minute walk to lots of restaurants and shopping. Didn't have an issue with noise. Great little coffee shop. We would definitely stay here again!

I loved this hotel! There are 2 towers. We were in tower 1. Our room was great but had a very damp smell. I asked to have another room and was immediately accommodated. We moved into tower 2 on the 6th floor. It was perfect! The tennis courts, grills, pool and hot tubs were right there. We were a block away from ocean and close to everything. We truly enjoyed our stay here and would definitely return.

We stayed for a week June 19-25 2013 with our daughter,son in law and infant in tower 1 room 3413. Beautiful corner view room of the beach and Diamondhead.  Although the rooms are a bit dated, they are clean and the beds were comfortable. The kitchen had everything to make a meal. We used the grocery service to have food stocked on arrival. The location is fantastic! Close to beach, shopping and great restaurants. Did not need a rental car until we decided to go to the Polynesian Cultural Center on the other side of the island and do some island sightseeing. The closest beach was clean and very nice for a family. They were painting the exterior but it posed no problems. The snack bar was closed on the activity level so you had to take the elevator to get food. The only problem we had was exchanging our beach towels for clean ones. They ran out several days in a row but otherwise housekeeping was wonderful. Great value for Waikiki!

We live here on Oahu. Our townhouse was getting termite treatment so we decided to take a "staycation" in Waikiki. We tried the Aston at the Waikiki Banyan as we needed more of a "condo" type room, than a hotel room.This property was recently renovated and it was perfect for our needs. We had some items from our refridgerator that we had to bring with us. This had a full-kitchen.We received wonderful customer service from the entire staff. It felt so good to be treated as a hotel guest and enjoy Waikiki. We locals don't often do that enough. And it was even better to know that our tourist are treated with equal hospitality.There are washer/dryers on floors, seven (7) and above. This is a great convenience as we had taken advantage of the beach and pool facilities so we had wet suits.The location is also very good as it is right off Kapahulu Avenue. You don't have to go throughthe Kalakaua traffic. It's close to the zoo.We noticed there is a very large recreation area. There are a number of gas grills available for cooking. This is a good idea for families with children. We had a very relaxing staycation and would do it again at this resort.

We stayed here twice (pre and post our holiday to the mainland USA). We stayed in both towers of the hotel.
