Young lady on reception, when we first checked in, looked as though she would have preferred to have been elsewhere. However, on our second check in, the more mature lady, was very helpful. The first room was in the second tower, it was spacious and had a full kitchen and air-conditioner. The second room was in the first tower and wasn't nearly as good as the previous one. The sofa bed in the second room was so uncomfortable, if I was staying more than one night, I would have insisted on a room change, it was terrible. The floors in both rooms needed to be better cleaned, I had black soles on my feet just by walking barefoot. The second bathroom, still had sand in it. The pool and hot tub area was ok, nothing spectacular. There was a man at reception called Ozzy, he was so helpful in checking that our shuttle back to the airport, hadn't missed us. He was a great representative of what hotel staff should be like.

We stayed at the Waikiki Banyan June 5th - 10th 2013. The lobby was nice, very clean, and employees are very friendly and helpful. I was a bit surprised to see how out dated the room was. Though it was cleaned, I felt the pictures on their website are misleading, and we will probably not be staying here again. However, I did love that the room had a kitchen...it helps epecially when you're traveling with 3 kids (to cook breakfast,etc.), and it was a short walk to the beach.

Very friendly. Very clean. They did quite a renovation. We got upgrated to ocean view room for free. Everything you needed, you can find in your suite. Only thing is if they have a fry pan for the kitchen, would be great.Me and my family realy liked our stay at this condo hotel, we had great time.

We stayed for 1 week in tower 1, room 1703. We had a good view of Diamondhead and our lanai overlooked the recreation deck. The condo had everything we needed. It had been remodeled not too long ago with chrome kitchen appliances. The furniture was new, also. The bed was very comfortable. It is very reasonable and the kitchen helps you save money on eating out. I had chosen the Banyan because of Koko Resorts, the property manager for this condo. They were very friendly and helpful. We got a free parking pass and they have towels, beach chairs, etc. It is first come, first serve but they always had plenty of stuff. The location is a short walk to the beach and town. There is a great coffee shop downstairs with computer and printer. Also, a mini mart that is not cheap but convenient. We plan on staying here again on our next trip.

We returned to Hawaii again last week, after spending our holiday there last June. We decided to stay at the Waikiki Banyan again as we really enjoyed it last time and found it good value for money. Like last time, we booked through Koko Resorts which was so easy. The condo we stayed in last year wasn't available so we decided to go a bit higher and booked the Penthouse - Room 3710. We arrived really early from Sydney, so took our bags to Level 5 where Koko Resorts have their office and was told that they would try and get our room cleaned by 1pm and to come back then. The thing I love most about booking with Koko Resorts is that you are given a key code after final balance is paid, so when our room was ready (which was at 1.15pm), we headed up to our room, punched in the code and walked straight in. There is no-one to tip and no front desk to have to deal with. On first impression our room was a bit smaller than last year, but it was clean and neat. It really could do with a bit of a renovation, as it is dated, but overall was comfortable and everything seemed to work. It has a decent LCD TV. The view from the 37th floor was amazing and we spent a bit of time on the balcony. The bathroom was OK, a little small but I think this is the case with all of the condos. The shower was nice though. The bathroom door didn't slide shut but there is another door off where the vanity is so you could close that. Beds were pretty comfy, but the pillows were flat. We used the free parking when we hired a car and the free WiFi is always a bonus. There is also air conditioning in the room. I must also mention the lovely coffee shop downstairs - we love eating here, especially breakfast. Nearly every morning we ordered bagels and the homemade banana/choc chip muffin - so yummy! My sister and I come to Hawaii to shop, so we don't want to spend our money on expensive accommodation. The Banyan is only around 3.5 stars, but at the end of the day its comfortable and clean. Its close to the beach, local buses and lots of restaurants, and its not amongst all the hussle and bussle, which is really nice. There's a food pantry not far away and ABC stores in every direction. Denny's is also a short walk and great for breakfast or cheap meals anytime of the day. We ordered $4 all you can eat pancakes quite a few times :)Overall if you have high expectations, you might be a little disappointed. But if you want a bit of extra space, a fully self contained kitchen and can put up with a bit of dated furniture, then this is the place to stay. I would definitely have no hesitation in coming back again (in fact we are planning another trip next year) and will book with Koko Resorts.

Great location! If you get a ocean facing room, its better than the view inside of other hotel Windows and alleys. Front desk needs improvement or training. I would ask 4 people the same question and get 4 different answers. The tiki bar in the hotel needs improvement as well. If you eat out and spend most of your time out, this is a reasonable hotel for showering and sleeping.

Aloha~ Aston at the Waikiki Banyan is fabulous! Reading the reviews I was leery but happily my personal experience was wonderful. Aston Banyan is in a great location.Close to beach(short 2 blk walk), good restaurants (so many options!), the zoo & Kapiolani Park. We could easily walk with our toddler, surfboard and beach gear and be on my favorite beach location on Waikiki in 5 minutes. Parking was $12 for 24 hrs which is an excellent deal. Our room was 2307 and the view of Manoa Valley, Wa'ahila Ridge State Recreation Area, Kaimuki, & at night the city lights was breath taking. The room was spacious and the kitchen was well supplied with all the kitchen tool necessities. The refrigerator was icy cold and the ice trays in the freezer were frozen and fresh. A nice touch. The room was very clean and lovely. AC was modern and worked great. We had a 2 TV's and a DVD, game station & VCR. There is a $15 per day resort fee. Which covers beach towels, free DVD check out,coffee & tea for your room, & paper at your door every morning. I utilized all they offered and felt it was a good value. The beds were basic but linens were clean and pillows were soft.The kitchen table and chairs were wood and very comfortable. The couch and chair in the livingroom were new and also very comfortable. (I live in Oahu and have had it with wicker furniture, so uncomfortable!) So I really appreciate any furniture that is not wicker...The lanai was roomy and the outdoor furniture was comfortable. Our room was cleaned daily and everything we needed was always restocked. Granted this is not a modern luxury resort, BUT! I also did not find it terribly outdated.The gorgeous art in the Lobby,( huge oil canvases), wood art carving in lobby and in elevators, simple botanical drawings in my room, nice bath soap and shampoo's, all nice touches which I appreciated. What the Waikiki Banyan offers is a great value and convienance. The pool, hot tubs, tennis courts, basketball courts, practice putting green, childs playground were awesome! We had a blast! The BBQ area is so nice. Great grills ($2 per hr, quarters needed), tile countertops, plenty of seating, a great community vibe as family & friends from all over the world grill & wine & dine. The lobby was lovely, complete with a friendly & helpful front desk and a tranquil Koi Pond. The convienance store had a great selection of wine, beer, ready made snacks and lots of whatever you need. The coffee shop in the lobby offered a great selection of beverages and had a good vibe to it as well. We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely return.

We just checked out of the Banyon after a one week stay. As expected (thanks to Trip Advisor reviews!), we were not surprized that the decor was so out of date. We requested Tower 1 as Tower 2 was under renovations (to the outside at least). We were given room 1713 which was spacious, albeit worn and badly in need of an update, but our views made up for it. Our tower was edge on to Waikiki Beach and the end rooms - the 13s and 14s on each floor - had an extra added view of Waikiki Beach from our bedroom, bathroom and kitchen windows. Our lanai faced toward Diamond Head, but the hotel next to ours obscurred our view. We had a kitchen with stove, fridge, microwave and utensils. We made a run to Walmart to stock up on breakfast supplies and had lots of choices of restaurants within a few minutes walk. We were the second block away from Waikiki Beach and could walk it easily in 2 minutes, but found the sand hard and quite uncomfortable to sit in, even with the $2 beach mats we bought at Walmart. I couldn't justify renting a lounger for $40/day. We couldn't resist the great pool, comfie lounge chairs and double hot tub on our 6th floor of our hotel. If you really didn't feel like eating out, you could use the barbeque on the same floor. $2 got you an hour of cooking time. The only complaint we had was that we had an incident with the dryer on our floor. We put in a load of whites the second night we were there and heard the dryer making a horrible racket. We checked on our clothes and flound black marks over most of them. We called the front desk to report the dryer mishap so no one else would wreck their vacation clothes. A security fellow was sent up to take our report, take photos of the clothes and set a value for the damaged clothes. Two days later we hadn't heard anything about the clothes so we checked at the front desk. We were sent to the security office and had to explain the situation again, only to be told no report had been filed and that WE should have asked the fellow that took our information, took pictures and wrote down our name/room number to FILE a report. Seriously ...!!! The maintenance man who happened to be visiting the security men said "Oh, yeh, I checked that dryer and nothing was wrong." so I asked the obvious question, that if a report hadn't been filed, as we had thought it was, WHY would he have gone up to check on the dryer? It was like talking to a brick wall. All we were told was no report was filed and we would have to file a report and did we want to file a report. Duh ... yeh, we did. Minutes later another security man came to our room, took our information, took pictures - just like the first guy - and this time I specifically requested that he FILE the report he just made. We were told to check back the next morning as he needed the night to get the report filed. The next morning we inquired at the front desk where we should go to "check on the report" as the security fellow requested and found out the office was closed all Saturday and Sunday. Hmmm ... we were checking out on Tuesday morning, so at least we still had Monday. Monday we went back to the office to check on the progress of our report and waited for 15 minutes for the receptionist to find the report and check with her supervisor (who we suspect was hiding around the corner). We were told a maintenance man would need to check out the dryer and once they got his report they would see IF we were eligible for any credit. We told them the maintenance man had already checked it out and found nothing and we needed a response from them asap as we were leaving the next morning. The receptionist ducked around the corner and was sent back with the news that the procedure had to be followed and if they couldn't find a problem with the dryer they couldn't do anything for us. I pointed out that the dryer issue happened 5 days earlier so what good would it do to check it out again NOW? What would it prove? We totally felt like we were getting the soft shoe shuffle and they kept stalling the process until it was too late. True to expectations, we never did hear anything from the security department and we checked out of the Banyon on Tuesday morning, minus half our clothes that were too stained to wear. So sad. And such a sad impression to leave with first time guests.

This is our 2nd year staying here & unfortunately this trip was disappointing. We have rented privately owned units bith times ( 1st thru owner ) & this trip a unit thru Koko resorts management company and based on the unit description made our choice. The decription was not accurate with some items on our must have list being so false as to say " watch the surfers from your lanai" when the balcony has been built in and is not in fact a lanai but a railing at the edge of the glass doors. The walls were damaged, wallpaper peeling, cushions on the couch were filthy/stained & smelled, the bed was so incredibly terrible and was not the queen it stated but 2 twins pushed together. I do not exagerate when I say we looked to see if they were actual mattresses and not just a wood box The unit was directly across from the elevator which was not stated & would not have been our choice had we known. The unit was oldBUT the coffee shop in the lobby has excellent coffee and fresh baked goods...the pool has tons of lounge chairs, pool is clean & we enjoyed our mornings relaxing and swimming. IF you are going to rent from an owner I strongly recommend you do just that & not thru the rental company as the personal contact & additional benefits of renting from the owner is teh way to go. On our last trip in 2012 Marilyn & Dennis made sure we knew what we were paying for, added lots of extra personal touched & were available if we needed anything at all. The Banyan is a great location, reasonably priced but is it old, outdated and obviously the units vary alot

After paying $5300 in airfares to spend 2 weeks in Hawaii from sydney I am regretful that we didn't spend a bit more money and book a better hotel. This hotel is a couple of blocks from beach and shops/restaurants. Bus stop is very close too. I would probably like to be closer to the beach but its quiet. Requested early check when I booked and was charged extra on arrival. Also, pool was closed for first 3 days and we were offered $30 off our $2000 bill (big deal) but we didn't use it much anyway. Housekeeping was poor and I had to ask several times for sheets to be changed as i hate sleeping in sandy sheets. Towels are terrible quality. Lounges haven't been cleaned in years. Sheets are torn. Hotel charges $10 per day for wifi which never works. Cafe downstairs has free wifi there if u r buying coffee. DVD player doesn't work. Kitchen is good and has everything you need. Has separate bedroom and this hotel is a good option for those of us that have 3 kids and want to avoid getting 2 interconnecting rooms at a better hotel. Sofa was old and crappybut we put mattress on the floor and our 2 youngest didnt complain.We had a good time but I wouldn't recommend this hotel and wouldn't stay there again.

Just got back from staying 7 nights at the Aston Waikiki Banyan. The location is 2 blocks away from Waikiki Beach and all of the shops and restaurants. The condo has a everything you need to visit with kids and not have to spend a lot of money eating out at restaurants. There isn't anything special about the look.....outdated but that wasn't important to us. It was cleaned daily, had a flat screen TV, AC was in the wall, and had a nice view of Diamond Head. Our room was not ready at 3pm check-in time so they gave us a late checkout at no extra cost as our flight out of honolulu was at 10 pm. Pool was open again however the tennis courts were still closed. There is no restaurant in this place but they have a coffee shop and a small convenience store with basic food and beer selections. The Food Pantry, grocery store, is about a 5 minute walk away.Overall we enjoyed our stay. If you are looking for a modern style condo this is not the place. If you are looking for a great location and a place for a family to stay then I would recommend this place.

We stayed in roon 1807, and could not believe how bad it waw! Cupboards were pressed board, formica countertops in kitchen & bath, no dishwasher, window air conditioning, ratty kitchen chairs & counter, stained ceiliings, all in need of paint! Bedding changed every 3 days! And this was far from the "cheap" rooms. Parking $12 per day or $72 per week, cash only. Will NEVER go back.

Pool slated to reopen on 14 April. So, if this is a consideration I would look elsewhere. Maintenance is being performed in units as well...but they are very considerate about noise. I usually stay in Privately owned condos that I rent through property management and have been pleased. But pool closure this time made me sad! Otherwise good location, property, value.

We stayed at the Banyan in Sept 2012 for 5 days. we had a beautiful renovated ocean view suite with full kitchen. I looked at other suites in the hotel and can tell you that the Banyan is under renovations and that they are working with the owners to upgrade the suites.Great location and away from the noise of Waikiki and only a block from the beach.You are about 3 blocks from the International market and Waikiki but an easy walk with lots to do and see. Stock up on groceries at the food pantry, it will save you alot.They have a great pool deck with 2 hot tubs and they are hot. BBQ area and tennis courts. You can catch the bus right around the corner and it will take you to Diamond Head. We walked back after hiking to the top and it was awesome. Front desk staff was wonderful and helpful. We rented a car for 2 days from Dollar and headed up to the North Shore and Pearl Harbour and Pearl City. Great outlet stores there.All in all I recommend the Banyan for the staff, cleanliness, price and location

Tennis court closed for an undetermined period of time. Swimming pool closed 9 days for renovation. Water supply to room cut off 1/2 day for maintenance. Daily cleaning at 5pm; very inconvenient. Mandatory daily charge of 15 USD for wifi and free movie rentals. However, dvd player in room has parental lock set, so could only be used for cartoon. Technician had no clue how to reset lock. Rooms are good size, but the whole complex is worn-out and tired.

This hotel is a good place to stay if you are interested in being located near where all the action is. Staying here puts you are blocks away from the beach, restaurants, shopping, and nightlife. Rooms are condo-style: simple, with a pull-out couch bed, and possibly a kitchenette. This is more like a no-frills place, but is valuable when it comes to convenience. They have a pool and hot tub also, and you have excellent views of the area if on a higher floor.

I had read some bad reviews about this hotel which had me a little anxious but it turned out to be a decent place (at least the unit I had-1208-managed by Aston)-the rooms were well used but clean and spacious. Roll away bed was cheap and could not support an adult but was good for the kids.One of the sliding doors was off the track but I did not bother to have them come fix it as it could still be used and there were minor "wear" issues with inconsequential things like broken blind/baseboard tiles etc. (I have seen a lot worse and I travel a lot for business). Great location/cheap parking/good kitchenette/decent staff/liked the video rentals for nighttime entertainment for the kids. Would stay there again with the family as price is right for a unit that can sleep up to 6.

We reserved condo #1507 for $130 per night, a very good price for expensive Waikiki, especially for a condo with a seperate bedroom and kithchen. It has a decent swimming pool/hot tub but the gorgeous beach is only a block away. The bed in the bedroom was comfortable, but the pull-out Murphy bed was very uncomfortable. The sliding doors that seperate the living room & bedroom were not connected to each other & hard to open & close. There were water stains on the ceiling and on the 2nd night we found out why. Getting up to use the bathroom at 10 pm I found water pouring out of the light fixture in the ceiling. I called the booking agent who rented us the condo and they sent some one up right away. Apparently the people in the condo above us didn't use the shower curtain and the water was leaking down to us. I've been a dispatcher for maintenance at an upscale hotel so I know this kind of thing happens all the time. It was great that some one came to fix it immediatley, even though it was late. Overall a decent value but next time we may splurge on a more upscale property.

After three years of coming here for Spring Break, we thought we would try a different property. That was a big mistake. You know the saying "you don't know what you have until you lose it"? Well, we quickly knew that we made a mistake and started the process of getting moved back to Banyon. We are now at home and couldn't be happier. The rooms may be a little dated but they are big, with full suites. The amenities are all very good, with a huge pool deck, WiFi and the Banyon Breeze restaurant tucked away in tower one. I would recommend this property to anyone coming to Waikiki. Oh, and this is the quiet part of Waikiki and away from the drugs, the prostitutes and the homeless.

This place was nice - a bit older and stale, and it needs some major repairs and up keep. The spa and pool are were nice but crowed. IT WOULD have helped for us to know we were going to be one of the few AMERICANS on property and being able to speak Japanese was a big perk. They nickle and dime you to death and I guess paying for the gas grill was pretty cheap on there part. Get a rate and be prepared to pay even more upon arrival. PARKING is at a premium and you will pay up to $20 per day. The busses run to the shopping and a car is not really necessary.

This was a great hotel. One block from the main strip. We had a condo on the 30 th floor. It was roomy full kitchen and comfortable. The only thing we couldn't rate is the sofa bed. My 19 yo daughter found it very uncomfortable. We asked for another bed but unfortunately it was worse. The staff were very helpful though. All in all we would stay there again.

When we first arrived I was dismayed by the rooms. Very worn, basic '70's furnishings. However, once I got over that I was very pleased with the location and what the room had to offer. There was a full kitchen, toaster, pots, rice cooker, microwave, etc. We went to Costco and got cereal, buns, veggies, water, juice, fruit, salads etc. I also bought coffee and filters. Our room came with a coffee maker and two small tea- bag style coffees but I like a more robust cup to start the day. We bought coffee in the lobby the first morning ( two for $5.00) so the bag of coffee and filters saved me tons and kick started my day. The beach is a short stroll away. As far as locations go, this was as close or closer than most places. the zoo is a block away when you need a break from the beach. This hotel is a condo with hotel services. Daily room service , front desk, parking etc. beach towels can be borrowed ( signed out) from housekeeping and changed when ever needed. Noise was not an issue. Our room was right by the elevator but we heard nothing. This is not a fancy place, but the sheets were crisp and clean? It came with two double beds and a pull out sofa. I found the bed hard and the pull- out sofa was missing springs and not comfortable. ) the air conditioner worked well and it was easy to return to our rooms during the day and head back out again.

We found this place after reviewing many sites, Waikiki is not cheap.It's an older style 80's type apartment, but quite large , ie bedroom, lounge, balcony, kitchen, so great to spread out a bit. Free wifi is good and a car park. Good location for beach and shops etc. owner met us promptly with keys

First, you need to know that these are condos, each owned by private parties, which Aston (and a few other companies) rent from owners and then manages/ rents to tourists. Our unit was Aston. Décor is the same, as far as I could see. There are 2 towers, connected, with a parking garage. Maintenance is good. Pool, 2 small hot tubs and BBQ’s are on the 6th floor between the towers. Closes at 9pm.Our unit: Tower 2, 20th floor, corner unit, “Mountain View” - facing East, I think, away from the ocean. I see from my lanai (4’ x 14’) the canal and a golf course, set against mountains with residential areas on them. Very pretty at night with all the lights! Large! 14’ x 24’ living room with dining table at one end, hide-a-bed, chair, end tables done in light cane wood with nice “island” upholstery. Kitchen is narrow but usable, older, probably original cabinets and appliances but they work fine and the kitchen isn’t visible from the main area so it’s not noticeable until you’re in it. Bedroom has queen bed and full closet. Bed was a bit soft for my taste but comfy. Daily maid service, with linen change every 3rd day. They don’t touch the kitchen, though (except when you depart, they wash ALL the dishes, etc. for the next tenants). In the meantime, you clean your own kitchen.Our experience: Arrived at 3:15pm. JoLynn checked us in; very professional. When she handed me the “Amenity Fee Consent Form” (which, fortunately I had read about on my reservation print-out) it said $15 per night. My print-out said $10, and I brought this up to her. “No problem!“ she said and changed the form. “You must have booked before the new year.“ But then she became concerned - she couldn’t verify that our room was ready. We waited 15 minutes or so and she nicely asked us to wait in the coffee shop (like a small Starbucks, off the lobby). They held our bags for us at the desk. 10 minutes later JoLynn came into the coffee shop to find us. There was a problem and it might be an hour - but she refunded our “Amenity Fee” for the week. Wifey not happy, but 50 minutes later when JoLynn came to get us, with BellHop and bags in tow, he escorted us to our room and all was forgiven. Corner room on the 20th floor - awfully hard to complain about! JoLynn called 15 minutes later to verify that all was well. Kudos to her!Laundry room was across the hall; one washer and one dryer @ 6 quarters each. Apparently only about 13 units shared that laundry, so we had no problem using it.Coffee shop is excellent, and open 5am-7pm. Convenience store is great; open till 11pm.Parking garage on floors 1-4 @$12/day or $72/wk. (cheap by Waikiki standards)One long block from the beach (south end).We would definitely stay again!

The condos at Aston at the Waikiki Banyan were beautiful, clean, and spacious. We stayed at tower 1 on 17th floor. The staff were friendly and the service exceptional contrary to some reviews on this page. We encountered some problems with wireless connection and once we informed the front desk, the problem was resolved right away. The package includes maid service. Thus we had a lady that came daily to clean up our condo and to make our beds. We plan to return someday.

Stayed there for 1 week before "Pride of America Cruise". One bedroom Condo on 25th floor Room 22513 Tower 2 with Mountain view was very spacious. King size bed was very comfortable and plenty of wardrobe/cupboard space. Two way connecting doors from bedroom and lounge to very modern bathroom with large shower/toilet and vanity. Separate kitchen alcove with stove top, convection/microwave oven/full size fridge and plenty of cupboard space. Seating for 4 at dinning table and comfortable lounge/pull out. Only one block from beach behind Marriot with ABC stores on every corner so very handy for everything. Air conditioner wasn't used as we had windows and balcony door for fresh air. Excellent would definitely go back again. Check in staff were very welcoming and efficient. Room was kept very clean.

Do not stay here! The place is so run down it is embarrassing. The toilets don't flush, the bath tub does not drain. The beds & pillows smelled terrible, the mattress was too soft to sleep on. The paint on the walls was peeling, cracked & stained. I rented through VRBO, the unit was managed by Koko resorts. Their service was terrible. I would not rent with them again. I complained to the front desk and they said that there is nothing they can do since all the units are individually owned. This can not be true, since the drywall in the hallways is cracked and held together with blue painters tape. The lobby has been renovated but the rest of the building is falling apart. For the price I am sure there must be nicer places around.

We booked the condo for a two week holiday with our granddaughters - 10 yrs old and 15 yrs. old. Condo has been renovated and it was very clean. We were very comfortable for 2 weeks although it was only a 1 bedroom unit. The girls occupied the bedroom and my husband and I slept on the pull out in the living room which was very comfortable. You can also access the bathroom from the bedroom which was very convenient. The kitchen was very nice and with the stove top being situated on the counter facing the balcony you had an beautiful view of the ocean as you were cooking. Pool, recreation and BBQ areas were always very clean. We would definitely consider renting this again. The only downfall was that we could not get fresh towels, toilet paper, kleenex which we usually get when renting condos.

We had a great stay here and economical. We had problem with the sofabed mattress (Needed a new one), but it was quickly resolved. The condo/hotel rooms where cleaned everyday, nothing to complain about. They have been doing updates in the rooms, our room was a newly updated one. The Pool and pool area is cleaned everyday, so it was very nice. We had a late flight out (11:00pm), check out was at 12:00 (noon), so we checked our luggage with the hotel for the day (that was great) and spent the day just enjoying waikiki and caught a Shuttle from hotel to airport...recommend checking into airport at least 3 hours before your flight. The staff was extremely helpful with everything we required. Also, arrange for a shuttle pickup before you arrive on Oahu, so much more economical than taxi (we learnt the lesson). Also, if your going to enjoy any (Tour) adventures or activities highly reccomend going with the tour buses or pickup at hotel shuttles, not hopping a city bus...there are over hundred city buses apparently, so easy to get mixed up and finding the right bus to get back on. There are 2 for 1 deal and alot of coupons as well online or in alot of the tourist magazines. Just have to search them ut before u go or spend the first day walking around Waikiki Shopping area (along waikiki beach) alot of magazines and pamphet stands. Also, the only pay phones we phone were farther down by the HardRock Cafe, 6 or 8 in a row (No Phone Books). Every A & B Store can be different so check them out before you buy at the first one (they are a dime a dozen) one like it seems on every corner LOL... We went end of October an spent 10 beautiful days, excellant weather and 1 tsunami warning (which is rare that time of year), just our luck LOL... but we cant wait to go again to hawaii (Maui next time)...more layed back and not so tourist trap like....Check out Dukes Lane before you buy at the Intenational market (but check out the market) Aloha!!!

This was my second year going for the Pro Bowl! I stayed here last year and enjoyed it and this year was just at great!! We stayed in the North Tower this year on the 31st floor with a corner room! It was an absolute gorgeous view! Waking up to the ocean and being able to sit out on the deck in the morning was my favorite part! It's a great location and easy walk to the strip, and I love the spas! So nice to sit and relax in after a long day of exploring!! The kitchen makes it nice to get food from costco or safeway so you don't have to eat out every meal!  I do have to say the carpet was pretty dirty though! In fact I was afraid to take my flip flops off! :( Other than that I really can't complain, it came with such a great deal on orbitz and I didn't get any kind of foot fungus.... All I can say if please replace the carpets or have them heavily steam cleaned!! But I'm sure I'll be back next year if Oahu holds the pro bowl again!

First the good: It was a special occasion so I emailed and called ahead to ensure a good room. I had booked a deluxe 1 bedroom ocean view condo but understood some rooms were better than others. We were not disappointed! The room was on the 33rd floor of tower 1 and the view was spectacular. Also, the suite was clearly one of the newly renovated ones which was a huge plus. Robert on the front desk was excellent as was Corinna on the phone. Housekeeping was fast and good. It is only about 1 block to the beach and the onsite parking at $12 per day was reasonable. Now, for the bad: This property does not have a recycling program and it was painful to have to throw away items that could have easily been recycled with an extra bin or two in the kitchen to sort items. The $15 per day resort fee is too high for what you get. And, there was 5 days we could not use our suite because of really loud concrete cutting literally right outside our door on 3 days and all-day water shut-offs on 2 days. Typically, you would be out all day and this would not be a big deal but two members of our party were down with the flu and let me tell you it is no fun to have the flu and not have a bed to sleep in or quick access to bathroom facilities! I send an email to the Aston prior to posting this review and gave them my concerns (as well as the positives) but did not receive a response. Although there were many good things, the lack of a recycling program alone would be enough to make me not want to stay here again. That and the high resort fee.

My family just got back from Waikiki and we stayed here for our full 7nt vacay. The location is perfect!!! Just 2 blocks from the beach and away from the main strip, we'll be coming back here next time. Though it is very true that the rooms are out dated and a little old smelling, they are HUGE and great for families so it's not cramped!!The pool was nice and clean and my son (3 1/2) HAD to go play on the play ground every day!!Price was good and the staff were very helpful and friendly :)The beds were a little firm, but I was ok with that even being 6 months pregnant.Weather was AMAZING sun everyday, stayed from Jan 27th - Feb 3rd....wish it was longer!

As i have said in the title the hotel rooms are certainly a little dated and could probably do with some refurbishment, however that said the rooms are clean, spacious and have everything you need to make your stay comfortable. The staff were great and helped us with all our queries/requests. The location of the hotel is good only a few minutes walk from the beachfront and around a 20 minute walk to the main shopping area/restaurants. Parking on site is great and we used this as a base to get out and explore the wonderful island of Oahu.We stayed for 5 nights in this hotel in Aug 2012

This is our first Hawaiian hotel. We first visited Hawaii in 2002, we booked another hotel but the room was full when we arrived, so we were transferred to this hotel. We were very happy with Aston Banyan. The room is very spacious, it's a condo hotel, has full kitchen, save $$.On our 3rd hawaiian trip, we still picked Aston Banyan, the price is good, we booked 10 days, out of which 2 days were free. The hotel has a good sized swimming pool, kids playground, which my kid loved!The hotel is very close to the Waikiki beach, so during the day, we normally went back to our room and took a nap. Just so relaxing!The room has two double size beds, one sofa bed, so our family of 4 adults and 1 kid fit in very well. The hotel is not the high end hotel, so don't expect anything fancy, it's a good family condo hotel, very convenient, good for families.

My 2 kids and I stayed here Jan 14 for 6 nights. I booked through Booking.com and wanted a conveniently located condo with kitchen and a place to bbq. I got 6th floor corner unit in Tower 1.PROS:fair price for waikiki (1 block to beach), cheap laundry and parkingcentral location - bus routes, Food Pantrybbq area is clean, large pool, hot tubs, amenity floor is great for families (cook your dinner while kids are nearby), you don't have to feel like your kids are making too much noise for the young couples working on their tan (cause there weren't any - lol).unit/layout is a decent sizebathroom - sink is separate from toilet/bathtub - convenient for 2 userskitchen appliancess are all full size, well stocked no chipped dishes, pots etc (had to ask for frying pan, and they should provide you with a bbq set (ie. tongs, basket to move all your food/dishes down to amenity floor, table cloth, etc), corner units have a window in the kitchen but is galley style layout, no breakfast bargreat little convenience store in main lobby good maid service, although they do come later in afternoon (no worries about forgetting to hang the do not disturb sign)linens were clean, beds okay for pricecheck in check out was easy, never saw a line-upsmall gifts (water bottle and sand toys) for the kids on check-inno problems with air con or hot waterCONS:needs updatingnoisy if you are in tower 1 close to intersection (but this is waikiki)none of the playstation games worked (and the front desk knew nothing about how to get them to work)getting pool towels is inconvenient (Tower 2, floor 5, why not have in the snack stand by the pool?)getting games and dvd's is inconvenient (Tower 1, floor 5? - why not have in main lobby?)large gap at side of entry door (kinda seems a bit flimsy, deadbolt etc)2 hot tubs - 1 is super super hot and you can't immerse your whole body and the other is warmslow elevatorsI would stay again if they updated it (new corridors, kitchen cabs and counter top and take out the carpets) and kept the prices. They should fill in the old laundry closet with some shelves. If you have kids, Tower 1, floor 6 facing the pool would be extremely convenient.

We checked in on Monday jan 14 to the aston Banyan what terrible service. I have one toddler and an infant and the lady at the front desk refused to let us in our room because check in is at 3 pm (we arrived 1:45pm) so we asked her to get us once a room was available. Finally at 2:30 I walked up to her and she finally checked us in. Upon first walking into our room it was very very old needs a Reno badly and mind you we came here because they said it was under renovations but they were not being renovated at all only Reno going on was to the outside and that's another story. Rooms were terrible dirty and filthy need a deep cleaning to say the least. They also make you pay a 10 fee everyday for some garbage free wifi that never works! And a play station which is used for renting movies they give you and those never work in the DVD reader and most of the ones you want are always rented. What a waste of 10 bucks!!! The renos going on outside are extremely loud you can't rest or relax in your room. Very very disappointed in this place the only reason we booked was because it has a kitchen and bedroom. And housekeeping isn't done daily for some people and they are super slow I think our room was cleaned at 3pm everyday!! Wow the front desk people are just so rude and have a real I don't give a crap about you and your problems! It took me an hour to write this because wifi keeps going on and off. Never ever ever will I stay at any Aston resorts

We stayed here in July 12 with our 3 kids 16 11 & 9. We just wanted to get away from the cold aussie winter for a couple of weeks. Self contained units are good as you can cook in the room & save money eating out all the time. We had breaky & lunch most days in the room. Close in walking distance to the major strip. We walked everywhere bar when we hired a car for 3 days to to the outlets which are about 1/2 hr drive from town & to go to Hanauma Bay reserve. Rooms are a bit out dated & could use a spruse up but you aren't there all the time. Free DVD rental which was good or the kids at night after a big day at the beach. Basketball courts tennis court and pool was great for the kids as well to just relax and have fun. Front desk staff very friendly as we were building a new home back here in Oz & needed to send emails back & forth. All in all nice place if your on a budget but this was all we could get as it was the start of their summer so accommodation was in short supply.

In reading prior reviews, it seemed like a mix bag---either terrible or good. So here's my take.Check In was a breeze. The staff was always helpful We traveled with our 3 boys, so a total of 5 stayed in a standard 1-bdrm condo.We were on the 9th floor. We had a view of the 'canal' behind the resort, and an obstructed view of Diamond Head. But to us, the view didn't matter, since we were not spending a ton of time in the room. This (for us) was simply a place to cook some of our meals, relax after a long day and sleep.The room and 9th floor was outdated. But I know this building/individual units are privately owned, and only managed by Aston. So that being said, yes, you could end up with an updated unit, or a dated unit. Our 'outdated' unit was clean, the carpet-yes old-was clean. They put together 2 twin beds to make a king bed. Strange-well yes, but at the end of the day, I was thankful for a clean bed and cool room.The kitchen had plenty of dishes/utensils to make a meal for 5. They do not provide any type of seasonings---salt/pepper. I would suggest stopping at either a SafeWay, Foodland etc and stocking up there. There are no real grocery stores within the area.The walk to the beach was a breeze-2 blocks. We used parking for a few days, when we had a rental car. $12-yes, but much cheaper than most places around the area. It was somewhat of a pain to have to pay for each day-rather than paying up front for 3 days. **They only take cash**The pool was clean and the kids enjoyed this. We went to the activity deck a few times. My 3 year old enjoyed the play area. There's a little snack bar there too. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. The price was right for us. Staying a block closer at a more luxurious place would have costed much more....and what else would we have gotten for it? Modern decor? An actual king bed? You're in Hawaii, you should be outside enjoying the vacation. Not inside enjoying the color scheme laying on your king bed watching a large flat screen.I'd probably be inclined to stay again--if we came with the whole family.

We enjoyed our stay at the Aston/Banyan. The condo we had featured a full kitchen, king bed, and good "sunrise" view of Diamond Head. I would stay here again. The price was high, but it was high season. I would expect that the price would closely follow demand, since this type of condo is very common in Waikiki. The unit itself hadn't been renovated for awhile, but it was what it needed to be -- a clean, comfortable, spacious place to stay. Parking was $12/day, and the beach was less than two blocks away. Not the place you'd spend your honeymoon, but a great base camp for exploring Oahu by car, or hanging out in Waikiki. This is a safe bet.

Waikiki is not necessarily a relaxation, out of the way type place, where you can get a way from it all! It is a hustle and bustle type of place where you can do lot's of shopping, hang out at a beach for some basic surfing or just see and be seen by the many tourists that flock to this place.So hotels that are right on the Beach, that are affordable you really can't go past the Aston. It is clean, the rooms are nice (except for the carpets that are getting old) and best of all they provide a pretty decent "free" breakfast, that can also turn into lunch if you pack up and extra bagel or two!The $12 a day parking is annoying, but what do you expect at a place as busy and popular as Waikiki beach. Staff are friendly enough and most rooms have a nice Ocean view.Our tip, don't rent a car for the first few days, then organise for one and head one day to Hanauma bay for some of the best snorkling in the world. Then spend another day crusing around this beautiful Island. The Aston is perfect for this, for those wanting to stay at Waikiki Beach, want and Ocean view room and are on a budget.

Four of us rented a one bedroom ocean view room 12/10/12-12/12. It is located a few short blocks from the beach, and lots of places around it (stores, shopping, etc). We were on the 37th floor with a great unobstructed view of the ocean (off to the left) and some of Diamond Head. Nice little balcony to relax on. They had everything in the room we needed. If you need pool towels, you just go down to housekeeping and check them out, and return there. The pool and hot tubs were nice, but only went there once. Check in and check out were smooth and easy. My only complaint was the resort/amenity fee - if you don't use the games/dvd/internet, it is just a waste. My opinion is just charge more for the room - it's better than creating resentment. But overall- a really nice place.

Well what can we say about our stay at this hotel. Well to start we arrived at 11am and was told that we couldn't check in to at earliest 3pm due our carpet being shampooed. Well we just flown in from Oz been up for 36hrs and last thing we needed to hear. Then when we finally got into our room WOW its was a sub-standard room for our honeymoon. To start with no gifts for our special occasion,then we found rips in our bedroom curtains,the shampooed floor well lets say very stained floor,shoe marks on the kitchen floor, a rip(hole) in the tinted screen on balconey sliding door, the double bed was on a metal base, that was bigger then the mattress and you either kicked the end or when getting up you scrapped your legs on the base and the mattresses kept sliding apart as nothing holding the mattress together and also there was no headboard on the bed. The dressingtable with large mirror was falling apart as mirror wasnt attached at back properly. There was water damage on the ceiling and you could see how poorly the paint work was in the lounge room by the switches as just painted around them. The sliding doors of the wardrobe were water damaged and paint chips on the base and the doors kept falling of the hinges. And if your a smoker dont stay on the 37th floor stay on the 6th or lower. Oh we did get our honeymoon gifts next morning. A 2 glass bottle of champange and a box of chocolate coated nuts WOO HOO!!!!!!!.

$12 a day with in and out privilege is good for Waikiki parking.Someone left positive review about front desk Jason however I 've got RUDE attitude from him.I guess he treat hot guest differently.Very unprofessional.This is not fancy Hotel.Just avoid front desk.They are not helpful at all.

The recreation deck with the play structure was the best! My husband and I traveled to Honolulu to see our young grandson and wanted to be sure there would be a safe place for him to play while visiting us. We couldn't have been more pleased with the times we enjoyed with him on the recreation deck. It was very nice to have a condo to head to right up the elevator when he tired and snacks and some quiet time were needed. The furnishing were a bit dated, but very comfortable. The location is super convenient with the zoo close by and Waikiki beach just a short walk. Check in and check out was easy and it was extremely helpful to have the parking included in the room. We'll be back!

We stayed in a one bedroom (2912) with a nice ocean and pool view. Room was spacious, but dated. It was much more comfortable to sleep on the sofa than pulling it out into a bed. The first might they have us a white metal crib and our 11 month old got her leg stuck between the bars. The staff brought us a pack and play that hadn't been cleaned. Aside from that, it was a nice place to stay for 3 nights before heading to the north shore to relax.

This was a good centrally located property. Jason at the front desk was the best - so helpful and accommodating. The hotel was great with shortening our booking at relatively short notice due to a family matter at home. Nothing was too much trouble. The room was a little tired and could do with a makeover, but that aside, was clean and spacious and comfortable. There was not enough hanging space (half the wardrobe was locked for storage) and there should be two bedside tables and lamps. With some deft furniture manouvering we fixed this. The kitchen was adequate for two people, and it was great to come back to for a quick lunch or just have breakfast. Great location, not in the thick of all the beach hotels, only one block from the beach and close to the zoo and easy walk to diamond head. Overall an easy, good stay.

We stayed at the banyan for 1 week in nov,we loved it only 1 block from the beach,we had an ocean view 30th floor we had a corner room ,they are bigger than normal,new kitchen,we were on holidays so did;nt use it much,great view off the beach,the resort had a great coffee shop,selling lovely cakes fresh juice,salads small meals etc,closed about 7pm,the little supermarket next door to it sold every thing icecreams ,grog,milk breakfast cereal,the pool was lovely and clean,plenty of bbq's,my daughter,her husband and 3 children,also stayed as many hotels don;t cater for 5 people so it was handy for them,they let 1 child stay with us each night as we had more room,it was no trouble for the hotel to put in another bed,they were very helpful,we booked a surf bus tour to the north with Bree ann she was wonderful and very helpful,only saw her a few days then some guy was at the tour desk,he was not very friendly or helpful wait for Bree ann,we would go back at stay at the banyan again.The 1 and only thing we did'nt like was the curtains in the bedroom,they were to see through,the night looked like daytime

Beautiful Hotel just 1 block off the Beach!Rooms are super and is in a great Loaction!Room are large with a seperate Living Room and Kitchen area from the bedroom area! And you will get some sunsets that are second to none!

The BBQ and hot tub deck is superb, our room was great, but could have done with a kettle not just the filter coffee m/c. We were only on 17th floor and had spectacular, slightly interrupted views of Diamond Head.The big issue for me was the $10/day charge for their WiFi, although we could occasionally piggy back on some random unsecured routers.

We stayed there with an extended family group, fifteen people in four condos (ranging in age from 7 to 75). It was a great choice. Close to the beach but a little way away from the centre of Waikiki's craziness. The kids loved the pool and BBQ area. Our room (3310) was great - it had an ocean view, lots of space, and a great little kitchenette. I'd highly recommend this place for family travellers (especially those with kids)

We stayed at the Banyan with our 2 children (9yo/ 1yo) for 5 nigths. We found the hotel was clean and very tidy. The play area and pool were loved by the kids. The BBQ area was also cool as my family (staying at other hotels) could come have dinner with us. Having a kitchen was also a bonus as we were able to save money. The staff were very helpful! The Aston Banyan we will be back, hopefully soon! Thank you for an awesome holiday xAsia and Craig Jones

We stayed for 8 days and I loved it. The staff were so helpful. We booked our parasailing through the hotel so didn't have to run around. It has a small store downstairs which came in handy. The rooms were nice and the location was walking distance so everything, food, transportation, and shopping. I would only criticise the fact we had to pay to use the bbq and the fact the hot tub was so hot! Would recommend to families as its away from the noise on the main strip.

We stayed for 9 nights and we had a great time. It is very well located, walking distance from the best of Waikiki. To have a kitchen is definitely a plus. We had breakfast at the hotel, and some dinners too. It is very convenient because the farmers market is right beside the hotel twice a week for fruits and veggies, and some pastries too. There is also a cafe and a market inside the hotel. My kids enjoyed the pool very much, and we enjoyed the spa!We had a great ocean view. The room was not new, but it was clean.The staff was very welcoming and helpful for everything we needed.Overall I would recommend this hotel for an affordable family vacation.

We stayed here for a week and it was a really good decision that we did. The last 2 times we were in Oahu, we stayed at a regular, smaller hotel. It was really nice having a full kitchen because it allowed me to at least cook breakfast instead of paying all 3 meals the whole week. It's also great to keep your leftovers so you can eat it the next day. This property is relatively close to the beach, only 2 blocks away. It's away from the hustle and bustle of the main streets so it was pretty nice. The staff was really pleasant and helpful and welcomed us with the usual Aloha spirit. The room was adequate for a family of 4. I slept in the queen bed with my son and my husband slept on the pull out sofa bed while my daughter had her crib. We had a great view of Diamond Head and Ala Wai canal. If I come back to Oahu this would be one of the top choices I'd pick for our stay.

What a great, reasonably priced hotel this is. We fitted 5 people very comfortably into the family suite with plenty of room to spare even with 5 suitcases. The fully equipped kitchen was a bonus, even though we only used cutlery and plates.The location is the best feature though. Just a few minutes walk to the beach, bus stops, ABC stores etc etc. Would definitely stay here again.

Nice space with all amenities you would need. Pool was great and theres a playground for this kids. not a bad view for a hotel off the beach. Could have been better maintained. My husband got stuck in an elevator for 90 minutes and we were not offered any compensation for this. They acted like this was not a problem and just gave him an incident report to fill out which i think they should completed themselves as he was on holiday and not really interested in doing paperwork for them.Then the lift in question was shut down for the next couple of days with a sign saying it was undergoing preventative maintenance which seemed a little too late. Rooms didn't feel very clean.

This hotel was perfect for my family. The one bedroom made it easy traveling with a baby. Room was spacious and comfortable. The pool area is outstanding. We woke this morning to a fire alarm and within 3 minutes security was knocking on our door advising of the all clear. Wow ... Now that's responsive. The coffee shop downstairs has lots of goodie for breakfast, snack and lunch. The front desk and bellman were very helpful. If you want a great family hotel conveniently located in Waikiki, stay here.

Four of us ( 2 couples ) spent 8 days here in August. The 33rd floor had a great view of the ocean. At the price we paid , we were not expecting 5 star - unlike some other reviewers who I find want 5 stars at 1 star price - but we were definitely not disappointed. The units were clean, the beds were comfortable, daily servicing was spotless, the bathrooms were large enough for the average size person. The bonus was the full size kitchen - we prepared and ate meals here most nights , thereby saving heaps on dining expenses.Having to pay a "resort fee" of $10 per day was unnecessary...other hotels provide pools and BBQs for free...I know there was a childrens playground and a tennis court - but we didnt use them ,so shouldnt have to pay for them.Overall, highly recommended for people who want value and closeness to the quiet beach..

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Banyan for 3 nights. There were a number of people travelling to Hawaii for a wedding so we rented 8 rooms in total. Ours was definitely the worst (rm 3509). Although the housekeeping staff had done as thorough a job as possible, the room felt grotty. The carpet was pretty disgusting (I couldn't walk in bare feet and wouldn't let my children play on the floor). Exhaust fan in bathroom was full of dust and hair. Airconditioner was too noisy.The staff were friendly and helpful. The location is good.

We stayed at the Waikiki Banyan 3 nights, walked 1 block every night to catch the sunset, walked to the Honolulu Zoo that was 3blocks away. The things I did not expect where the $10/night (mandatory charge) for the amenities like wireless internet access and free dvd rental, $12/night charge for parking(now days you have to expect that at any hotel especially in Waikiki). The room we had was clean and really nice with kitchenette, separate room and a sleeper sofa. It was really nice for the price.

We were there Dec 2011...third stay but first with Koko Resorts. When you rent with them, you pay for cleaning, and their on-site office offers freebies (boogie boards, beach towels, beach chairs, port-a-cribs, etc). Each unit is individually furnished by the owners. 801 is a fine basic unit. We love the location!

We were very pleased with the location and size of our room with kitchenette. The room we had 1114 was as about outdated as they get. Carpet was filthy! We requested to change rooms about the third day and did not hear anything back until half way through our trip. By then my husband and kids did not want to pack everything up and switch rooms, so we stayed. Very little kitchen items to prepare basic meals, we had to call down several times just to get "necessities" like toaster, teaspoons, coffee maker. Beds were clean and comfy. The rooms are cleaned daily and vacuumed every three days, although we were there for 13 nights and only had our romm vacuumed once and then again when I requested. We were out before 9 am and many days came home after 3pm and the maid service was just starting to do our room. The BBQ area is nice as well as the hot tub and pool area. Warning..this is definately a family hotel as there are plenty of kids around. Cliff and Chika were helpful, Jason not so much. We needed late check out and he was less than accommadating! Maybe not Aston next time.

We stayed 9 nights in Waikiki and so wanted to have a kitchen, and Waikiki Banyan was a very affordable option.We arrived late at night and were not happy with our room, so called the desk who said they would make a note for the day staff to move us, and next day the desk knew all about this and we moved to a very nice room overlooking the pool area and we were very happy.Room spacious, full kitchen, and nice lanai. The service from hotel staff excellent and anything we needed was actioned very quickly.A small convenience store located on ground floor proved very useful.Nice coffee shop with WIFI likewise.It was a short walk to the beach, and bus stop for The Bus right outside.

The hotel has an ideal location. Just one block away from the beach. We had a deluxe ocean view room which had a very nice view of the ocean and the Diamond head. Some of the interiors need updating. We checked in and within 30 min a letter was slipped under the door saying there was no water the next day from 9:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. No mention was made of it when we checked in. It did not bother us since we were going to be out the whole next day. The cleaning service was less than satisfactory as at least a couple of days we saw the kitchen island dirty even after the cleaning service.

This is going to be a comprehensive review based on several factors. We paid for three units for a week each thru Interval International. This was only available as a getaway vacation not for timeshare exchange. We were pleased with our ability to get three units in one place in July. After we got there we discovered a few things that we did not know ahead of time.Let me start with the high points: The staff was very helpful even in areas in which they had no control. They were always very friendly when we spoke with them. The location is only one block from the beach which is great. It is walking distance to the zoo and several local places to eat off the normal tourist area.Unfortunately there were a few issues that really knocked this resort down. First was the statement we heard over and over again from the staff. That is controlled by the Banyan owners association and we have no control over this and this and that. This would begin with the cost of using the parking garage, paying to use golf clubs for miniature golf, and tennis rackets. Having to actually pay to use the BBQ’s, a new low among resorts we have stayed at over the years. Finally the association decided to shut the water off all day to a large section of the units which just happened to fall on the day of our in-laws 50th wedding celebration and their room. So they could not get ready and even shower we had to plead for another room to be able to move them into. The front desk worked hard and finally found us a room. Our room was very dated and showed obvious signs of damage, water, mold, etc. and had been cheaply repaired. The other two units were in much better shape so roll the dice on what you may end up with.Bottom line: Remember this is called an Aston resort but Aston does not really control this resort they only manage the rental units, the association runs the resort and they let you know every time you want to do something. I’m not saying don’t go there, just be informed when you do.

My husband and I stayed in unit 3504 in the 2nd tower. We really liked our space as it had a good bedroom area, great lanai and comfy family area with kitchen. It is very hard to find a good priced condo for under $150 a night that has a kitchen. We had ours for $125 a night and it was well worth it. Parking was free and the wifi was very good. The location of this hotel is very close to Kuhio beach and the hussle bustle of the Waikiki strip. We had no problem walking a few blocks to get to the beach or any of the ABC stores. It is also quite close to the FOOD PANTRY grocery store which helps if you are cooking.There is more noise in this area but not enough to keep me awake at night...The only major issue with this condo is that the bed was so hard, that it was extremely uncomfortable to sleep in.Inside the hotel area there is a nice little corner cafe that makes HUGE vegetarian sandwhiches and goodies, don't miss out if you want a snack. The pool was quite nice but cool. There are 2 hot tubs as well, one that is regular heat and one that is HOT. We really did enjoy our stay and will likely return to this hotel again in the future. Great deal, great view of the ocean as well. No washer or dryer in units...bring change to use the coin op on site

We just got back from a 6 night stay at the Aston Banyon Waikiki Beach. The hotel decor is dated, so make sure you ask for a renovated room. When we checked in, we were told we had an ocean view room, but when housekeeping came to bridge our twin beds into a king, he told us wevhad a mountain view. Ben at the front desk was very accommodating and immediately switched us to a high floor room with an exceptional ocean view. For me, the view was well worth the extra $15/night! All rooms have a full kitchen, and we liked having the option to save a few dollars making our own breakfasts and a few lunches because Waikiki is pretty expensive, The staff was great overall. The pool was average, and I didn't like the worn outdoor carpeting. Only 2 blocks from the beach, the location was perfect. This hotel is well suited for families, and offers great value for it's location.

Bedding was comfortable. I did find a few ants crawling around on different days. Otherwise kitchen equipped with Paper Towels and Dish detergent and most of the standard kitchen appliances you would have at home. A/C cooled comfortably although the A/C in my siblings room down the hall didn't cool as well. Room service was adequate as we were able to bump into house maids in between tours. The front desk clerks are helpful and provide any other necessities you may need (extra towels etc.). You can also rent out oversize beach towels on the 5th floor.

I have stayed at this hotel for two weeks now and have another two weeks. So far I have experienced significant issues with two rooms I have been in. Firstly there is no wireless internet so unless you have a computer to plug in your out of luck.The aircon unit was loud and required replaced, the fridge didnt go cold enough to maintain fresh food, the lifts to any floor above 10 takes forever. You can wait in excess of 5 minutes to get to a lift when busy. The rooms are well worn and show signs of aging like ripped curtains, stained carpet, stains on the walls etc. Carparking is expensive, $12/day. On a positive note the staff are super friendly and helpful. They do the best they can given what they have to deal with.

we rented an ocean view, twin bed apartment for 2 weeks.We got just what we wanted and thoroughly enjoyed the apartment and our holiday.The front desk and housekeeping staff were great. We wanted a relaxing time so were pleased the housekeepers didn't hassle us every day.The concierge helped with our car hire and itinerary around the islands.The building is just one block back from the beach (5 minutes walk) and away from the bustle of the main Waikiki night life which is about 10 minutes walk away.The apartment is a bit tired, 1990's decor but had everthing we wanted and in good working order. We wanted to cook in a few times which was great with a fully equiped kitchen.We'll stay there again.

Upon our arrival the staff was very accommodating in letting us check in early. We left our bags in the room and went to grab a bit to eat at a local restaurant. When we got back to our room there were ROACHES IN OUR LUGGAGE!!! I immediately went downstairs and asked them to switch my room which they did. I was given the keys to go take a look at 4 rooms (and they gave us a smaller room type then what I paid for) that all had a friendly roach or 2 waiting for me at the door. Ben the supervisor then began to get an attitude with me and all I wanted was a nice clean room. I asked if he could send me to a sister hotel and he wouldn’t so after begging him for a cleaner room he put us up in a DIRTY full/twin room w/o a pull out bed for the night, the sheets had gum on them and the sick and tub wouldn’t drain. This was my parents first time in Hawaii and they were sharing a room with my fiancé and I. After spending my entire first day dealing with the hotel issue I went down to the lobby in the morning and Milie was able to get us into the Waikiki Aston Pacific Monarch. How was a regular staff member able to do something Ben couldn't?!?!? This was when our trip turned around. They wouldn’t refund our parking (we paid a week in advance) at the Banyan but that was a small price to pay for all the drama that went on. I would never stay there again especially because Ben the supervisor doesn’t know how to deal with customers. I wasn’t expecting a high end hotel but I was expecting clean and they were not. The furniture was mismatched and old. I didn’t want to sit on their couches because it looked like there had been quite a few crazy nights on them…NEVER AGAIN!
user_name:
Jenny E
Sherman Oaks, California, United States

review_body: Stayed here for 3 night with my husband and two year old child in a one bedroom condo.We originally booked a superior, but were upgraded to a partial ocean view on the first tower and floor 31.The room had a full kitchen with huge oven and fridge and all kitchen utensils you could need – except for a kettle which for an Australian is annoying, but only providing coffee makers seems to be the norm in the US. The room had two double beds plus a fold out sofa bed and housekeeping brought up a crib. The lounge area was very spacious – a real treat in Hawaii. I didn’t take any photos of the room as it was exactly the same as all the other photos other reviewers have posted – standard Hawaiian hotel duvet covers and furnishings.The room itself was perfect for what we needed, which was a full kitchen with an area that we could close off for afternoon naps for the little one. The room was old and a little run down – but certainly no more so than other standard hotels I’ve stayed at in Waikiki, including the Sheraton Princess and the Ohana East and West hotels.The playground was great and fish pond provided good distraction for my child. The pool was very large, though not heated...yet the hot tub was really really hot.Overall, a fantastic location – close to beach and the zoo, away from the central business of Waikiki, yet close enough to walk to the hub at night.Note that later in our trip we stayed two nights at the Embassy Waikiki suites and for value for money and size of the room – I’d take the Aston Waikiki Banyan.Would definitely stay here again if I needed a good size condo in Waikiki.

old & out dated hotel.they charge for eveything & say its free.housekeeping needs to go back to housekeeping school. They never dusted or wiped down glass tables.The bathroom was cleaned half... Didnt change sheets or come for service on some days.we were there for a week. The sunset aston was better. p.s. they aslo charge for the b.b.q , crazy......................

As a group of 5 people we were a little worried about our sleeping arrangament and were so surprised when we learned that the hotel upgraded our room to the higher standard without any extra charges.We got a remodeled condo-like room on the 26 th floor facing ocean with all the amenities we needed.Both desk and cleaning staff were so nice to all of us.They let us stay little longer past check-out time without any charges as well.The elevators (4 of them)are fast and quiet.The swimming pool and hot tubs are kept well.In our opinion the Aston Waikiki Banyan was worth all the money.

We stayed at this resort for 2 nights, end of April. We appreciated the spaciousness of the suite, with sofa bed for my daughter. The suite was clean, a little dated, very small bathroom, nice pool area, although one hot tub was extremely hot and the other did not work well. Some updating needed also throughout the pool area. However, the location was very good, one block from the ocean and the staff was nice. Good value for our money.

I liked the pool and the proximity to the beach and zoo, and my child really liked the free Playstation games in the room. Had a corner room facing both Diamond Head and Waikiki beach, so the views were great!

I recently stayed at the waikiki banyan hotel, PLEASE DON’T EVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL... it started with a booking of two nights one month in advance. which by the way they debited out of my card right away. I was told thru booking on line that the remainder of the bill which was taxes will be collected upon check in. I was fine with this option. Friday May 11, 2012 arrived at 5p.m. As I stood inline to check in, couldn’t help but over hear gentlemen at counter complaining about extra charges and deposits that needed to be paid ASAP!It was my turn, as I stood there waiting for my keys to my room I was hit with a balance of $355.00! WHAT where did the $300.00 come from, was then told it’s a room deposit, I was like why wasn’t I told about this being I only brought $250.00 with me ( needed to cash check the next morning) I advised women at front desk I don’t have that money and was unaware of this extra charge. She said unfortunately they don’t tell you unless you ask at the time of booking.So now I’m having a disagreement with front desk , who then brings supervisor into the conversation. He tells me that I need to pay the money or go else where. He says he can refund me my original room fees. so I am upset at the fact that I was 2 hrs. into this argument, my kids are fussing and I’m in lost of words because not only I’m unable to find a hotel at this last minute notice , it will take up to 2 weeks for my refund to be received. so I ask for them to at least help me find another hotel to stay as a favor for putting me out the answer I got was “ we can’t do that for you!” UGH!as my boyfriend continued with the argument about inconveniencing us by the way its cussing already because we are so fed up! ( taking off of work, planning for months in advanced etc..) by this time I’m in tears so the supervisor say we can take half the deposit and let you stay for one night that’s the best they can do upon receiving the other half of deposit the next day after cashing our check. My plans for the night was shot, we missed our dinner reservations and the rest of our plans we had for Friday evening! not only that but I got locked out the room for goodness sake, as I went to the front desk to fix the problem I witnessed more complaints being dealt with at the counter of people checking in. I returned the next morning with the other half of the deposit. and was booked for the second night and was told that upon check out $300.00 would be returned to me .(sat night) was locked out again! when asked about this problem its their standard policy to do this to force customer to come down and make sure payment is received and that’s why keys are programmed to lock you after 24 hrs..just in case some tries to skip on the bill. Sunday check out – after waiting for receipts to be printed , upon signing out saw that most of the money was being given back when asked where my full amount of money was , answer I got was “I’m not sure “after several attempts of adding and subtracting I was then told that taxes were being subtracted, now is this the same taxes that you were suppose to take out at the time of check in.” umm yes, mam”WHAT THE HECK! yes, they did not take taxes out they decided to take taxes after check resulting in not getting my total deposit back. after this really bad ordeal, I asked for superior to call me back as I felt I needed to make a complaint and be somewhat compensated for bad service. I was told that hotel did their job according to policy.and that they were sorry for me having a bad experience. no compensation will be made or thought of, do you have any other questions, if not thank you and goodbye reason for bad experience and having done what they did was” because of previous guest spoiling it for the rest of you , we handled it this way”

We are a family of 4 so appreciated the room to move. It's a central position, close to everything you need in Waikiki. My one and only complaint is the bedding. I understand that some units are privately owned, however when you lay your head down at the end of a long day, a little comfort would be nice. The mattresses were springy and lumpy. My 16 y.o. son (who could sleep anywhere) was unable to bunker down on the divan. Don't let this review put you off, just enquire about the bedding in your room beforehand.

I will begin by saying that this hotel has both suites that they rent out and then a number of privately owned suites. We booked through KoKo resorts (a property management company) that manages a large number of privately owned suites. This review in reference to service and the quality of the condos we rented through Koko resorts. I can't speak for the quality of the suites run by the hotel. This was a family trip with three children, ages 2,11, and 14. I can't say enough good things about having booked through KoKo resorts. Staff was friendly and efficient, and accommodating right from booking through the holiday. One of the reasons I would definitely recommend booking though them if you want to stay at the Banyan is that they have an office on the 5th floor FULL of anything you could need for your holiday. You can borrow at anytime, for no cost and it is super casual. We saved hundreds of dollars by doing this. We borrowed surf boards, boogie boards, two beach umbrellas, a stroller, sand toys, chairs for the beach, snorkeling equipment,and tennis rackets! We stayed in two suites for the time we were there. We booked late and could not get one unit for the whole time. First 6 nights were in a suite on the 11th floor. Comfortable and clean. Older and not remodeled but no issues. You can take your towels to Koko resorts anytime and they will exchange for clean ones. There is no daily maid service. I have noted that often people complain about the rooms, or the hotel being older etc. The thing is if you want 5 star or luxury then you have to pay for it. This is not 5 star or luxury however it is clean and very good for the price. 90$ per night for a full condo with kitchen and a separate bedroom is very good value. koko resorts also provides blow up twin good quality air mattresses and playpen if you need. Again free of charge when many hotels charge extra . The last 8 nights we stayed in suite 2801 (highly recommend) It is fully remodeled, a corner unit, beautiful kitchen and it was only 120$ per night. The hotel is a short walk to the beach. It is a good location. Pool is nice and fairly warm with two hotutbs.My two year old had no trouble going right in. We made use of the barbecue (cost =1$ for an hour.We never paid as we shared with others) Never too busy at pool or barbecue. There are tennis courts and kids play area. Is it older? Yes. Could it use some renos? Yes, but it is clean and provides all the amentities. The only negative I will say is that the v desk staff was not ery helpful when they find out that you are not staying with the hotel and are renting a private suite. For example my son asked for change to use the laundry machine(another bonus, one on each floor) he was told they wounldn't give him the dollar because he wasn't with them. Also one night we ended down to the front area to get a cab to go to a restaurant. We then remembered that we thought it was closed. Having no cell phone we asked to use the phone and they were really rude. I asked also another time to borrow a phone book and they said no. So I am not sure if there is some sort of animosity between the two or not. So my advise...don't ask them for anything! Parking is free. At least it is when you book through Koko. Definitely a a bonus. Recommend the Zoo. Out two favorite places to eat. Lulu's and Irifune's. We rented a car for 4 days. We went to the ko'olina lagoons excellent place to swim with little ones. We went to Turtle bay resort to snorkle. Also good. Saw the turtles on the North shore and lastly went to Lanikea beach (so beautiful). Hope this helps.

booked an ocean view deluxe room and they were able to accomodate us to the very top floor (47th floor). great view of waikiki and oahu, especially at night. only building ruining the view is the Hinton Prince Waikiki across from it. otherwise you can see the waikiki beach, Ala Wai golf course and honolulu.room was pretty big and there was a sofa-bed so up to 4 can stay.staff is very friendly, walking distance to the beach, Oceanarium (our fav restaurant), the zoo, aquarium and shopping district.i would like to try the side facing diamond head/pool side next as it would provide a stunning sunrise view.oh and there's a parking lot on this building, $10 and it's good for 24hourswill definitely be back

We had a wonderful stay at the Banyan. First of all, I cannot say more about how fantastic, friendly, and helpful the staff was.
