Our rooms were clean, nice, quiet, and we had a beautiful view on the 28th floor. Having a kitchen was a nice touch to making our own meals. I loved how close of a walk it was to the beach and to all of the shops, restaurants, and entertainment. It was convenient to have the pool to hang out at if you did not go to the beach. Can you believe that out of all the hotels in the Waikiki area, that we had family staying in the same place, and we did not know until we arrived? And also another family that is from the same area of Canada where we are from were also staying at the Banyan.

After staying our first week at the Aston Waikiki Beach we were pleasantly surprised with the Banyan. It exceeded our expectations and we were sorry we didnt stay here instead of the Aston Beach. You may not be on the beach, but you are very close by and the view was excellent as you also had a view of all the high rises in Waikiki at night as well as the ocean view and hinterland views. This hotel is designed for families as it has a kitchen and a separated bedroom. The 4th bed is a pull out sofa, which would only suit a young child as I could feel the springs on the mattress while I sat on.We stayed in Tower 2 . The staff were very friendly (much nicer than the Aston Waikiki Beach) and willing at assist at any time. The television is small but holidays arent for sitting back and watching tv. The balcony was a good size. In fact the whole room was very spacious. We would have no hesitation coming back to this hotel again. For more details on what to do in O'ahu see my review on the Aston Waikiki Beach.

The Banyan is a large high-rise apartment style building in Waikiki. Everything is an easy walk in Waikiki, so unless paying premium rates to be right on the beach is important to you, there is a lot to like about staying at the Banyan. Three minute walk to the beach, five minutes tops to the Aquarium, Zoo, Waikiki Shell or Kapi'olani Park.You get a little extra space with separate sleeping areas, a living room and full kitchen. The unit I had had a great view from the lanai. The living room had an HD tv with built in DVD player. The kitchen can save you a lot of money and time by allowing breakfast or lunch in instead of overpriced restaurants. The facility has free parking, which is unusual in Waikiki where many hotels charge $20-$30 a day. If you have a car and are driving, the location allows for easy routes out of Waikiki. There is also an activity deck on the sixth floor with tennis courts, large grills, a pool and two small hot tubs. It's not a luxury facility but it's not designed to be. It does what it is supposed to do and it does it well. The price is comparable to some of the very average two star hotels that dot inland Waikiki along Kuhio and the Ali Wai Canal, but you get much, much more for the money. I would recommend the Banyan for corporate travels, families, or travelers on a moderate budget.

This was my 1st time in Hawaii and 4th for my parents. We wanted to stay in a place that had a seperate bedroom with a hide-a-bed and found the Aston Banyan. We stayed here at the end of Feb 2012 on the 37th floor of Tower 1 - It was very nice! Enjoyed the great views and the room was updated. Tower 2 looks straight out the the ocean (on the 1 side). Tower 1 faces more directly to Diamond head, but still can get an ocean view to the side. The regular beds were comfortable, the room was clean and cozy. The door separating the Living area is 3 sliding doors, 1 of ours did not shut, but that was ok, it was open most of the time anyway and the A/C was in the living room area so you would want the door open to get some cool air. The kitchen was nice to be able to keep some things in the fridge for breakfast & lunch. The microwave and coffee maker in the room were also nice to keep costs down. The elevators were very nice and speedy. The pool was warm and there were a choice of 2 hot tubs. We enjoyed the pool area. There is a movie rental kiosk available for guests which is included in the ammenity fee - this came in handy on the rainy evening we had there. This is a condo/Hotel with regular owners as well as vacationers. The staff was very nice and helpful. We watched it on a flat screen TV in the living room. I would definately recomend this Hotel and stay here again. GETTING AROUND - It was a short walk to the Beach and walking distance to Int'l market square (great for souvenier shopping and they definately bargain here and really try hard to sell you items) and the Food Pantry (grocery store) which has cheaper food items than the ABC stores on each corner. We scheduled a taxi (van) online (a8taxi) to pick us up from the airport for $30 which worked out very well - he was waiting for us when we landed and drove us straight to our Hotel. We also took the City bus for $2.50 to Diamond head. The ride back from Diamond head took a bit of a wait for the bus, but we used our transfer pass from our first ride, and it was free on the way back. There is a bit of a walk to the main entrance of Diamond Head where the bus drops you off at the bottom entrance to Diamond Head, but it wasn't too bad - it was about a 20 min walk. We scheduled a tour bus through the Hotel for the Circle Island Tour. I would definately recommend a circle island tour thru one of the tour companies, it is a good way to view the island. There are frequent stops at the overlooks and we also got a history of the island from our driver koko.The boogie boards are fun for the kids and you can find them at abc stores & others along the beach. We got one for $15 that my daughter used while we were there and then just passed it along to another family when we left. My daughter also had surf lessons on the beach from HOW (can't remember full name, but HOW is on all of their surf boards and they are located right on the beach across from Kealohilani Ave I think - or maybe a bit further North, but they were set up right on the beach with umbrella & chair rentals also. Anyway it was $60 for an hour and the instructor was very good and she go up right away. The water was shallow enough so I could walk out a ways toward where she was and get some good photos and then she also surfed right past me. She also could use the surf board after her lesson until she got tired out.COUPONS - There are Oahu Gold books all along the sidewalks which have some good coupons for activities, shuttles, taxi & food. We found a coupon in there for Limo service back to the airport for $31 which was quite fun. If you are on a budget for dining, there is a Denny's and an Ihop about 10 min walk from the Hotel. Int'l Market square is right next to Denny's. We felt safe walking aroung in day or evening - there are usually alot of people out walking along the main areas.

Old room, old dirty carpet, the tub backed up (every time), and the sofa bed was broke so my husband and I got to sleep on a roll a way bed and a twin bed on vacation...that was nice. Just low quality...

Just returned from 3 weeks vacation at the Aston at the Waikiki Banyon. It was our first trip to Oahu and we wanted condo type accommodation. This property fit the bill and delivered what it said on the tin! The accommodation was spacious, clean, comfortable and well equipped. The location, only one block back from the beach was ideal, a little quieter from road and foot traffic but very accessible to local supermarket, pick up points for tours and the local bus and trolley services. All staff were very helpful and friendly.I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting this type of accommodation and also for tranfers to and from the airport you would be hard pressed to beat Roberts of Hawaii. They met us at the gate, transferred our luggage and us with minimum fuss and when the return arrangements went a little awray sent a personal bus just for us to ensure a swift transfer back to the airport.

Aston Waikiki Banyan resort - Try to get an Ocean View rental because you can watch sunset and the beach from the balcony; We stayed on the 23rd floor, kitchen has everything that you will need, free internet access. Parking was free. Sleeps four adults comfortably. Concierge was friendly and DVD rental was also free, internet was free. We only paid $85.00 a night.It also has swimming pool, miniature golf and Jacuzzi; the convenience store and a restaurant onsite are

I recently just got back from Hawaii!! There was about 14 of us for the pro bowl and my father-in-law chooses the Banyan every year!!! It was my first time and I thought it was great!!! We stayed for 6 nights. The kitchen made it nice to get your own food and stock up the fridge with beer and rum! :) absolutely loved being able to relax and have a drink after a long day!!! The spa/pool area was also nice!! Some of the rooms are really outdated but a couple that was with us got a really nice remodeled room!! Our room was older and seemed a tad on the dirty side but still it was comfortable and with such a great location you really can't complain!!! I would definitely recommend it!!

Waikiki, Honolulu, Oahu, Hawaii ....a destination just beckoning, when Burnaby/Vancouver in Canada, sees its first snowfall on Jan. 14, 2012.WestJet got us there in 5-1/2 hrs for a 2-week most enjoyable stay at the Waikiki Banyan Resort Hotel. A comfortable suite with kitchen facilities, matched by glorious sunshine, 82F/28C during the entire stay, for beachbumming and tanning, was our lot. My reviews generally focus on perceived interests by our seniors, still active in their Golden Years and - my feedbacks bear this out - on getting value. Accommodation in Hawaii is expensive, and so is food. Travelers head for Don Quijote, Sam's, Costco, Foodland at Ala Moana Center and Food Pantry for supplies; restaurants for every taste and purse abound. The "strip", Kalakaua Ave. hugs the beaches and sees thousands of visitors and residents promenade all day shopping, eating, tanning, surfing.Forget about parking, instead obtain a card for "The BUS"; take the B Express to its terminus ($2.50 reg., seniors $1.00, exact fair), bring picture ID, get scanned and presto for $10.00 you get a 4-year card onto which you attach a strip for one calendar-month at $5.00; it's another $5 next time you visit. Board any "The BUS" anywhere, anytime, on-off as you please.Exploring Oahu island, 2 bus-loops offer themselves, at no further charge, one to sightsee the Eastern and Northern part incl. Waikiki, about 4 hrs., and the centre and Western Honolulu, about 3 hrs. There are plenty of sights to visit - let your wallet decide! And, when finally you must bid adieu, "The BUS" takes you to the airport with your card. Aloha! and Mahalo!

Where to start? Play equipment for kids was completely disassembled, we were told it had been that way for about three months, and it would take another couple months to finish a simple upgrade. We were not informed of this prior to arrival, and with three kids it was a frustration. One night the bbq we were using did not work, we were not reimbursed but rather told we probably had too much on the grill (2 steaks). 8 nights in, we realized our condo had bedbugs!We were moved to another condo for the remainder of our stay, only to have a suitcase stolen out of the laundry room with just a few hours unattended (it had clothes out of the condo with bedbugs that needed to be laundered, and the suitcase needed to be sprayed before I would take it into the new condo).We lost count of the number of people on the elevator that we noticed had bed bug bites after we knew what they looked like! Add to that hidden fees to be payed upon departure and parking not included, and we will be looking for ways to let people know to stay away from this place!

We were guests at the Waikiki Banyan from Dec 2nd to Dec 11th and absolutely LOVED IT!!!! We had 9 rooms in total with our group of 42 scattered from the 8th floor to the 28th. Every single member of our tour party loved the hotel. It was clean, hip, and just absolutely beautiful. We are a cultural group from New Zealand who alse had a professional photo shoot on the 6th floor in costumes and with our drums and all...and boy did we attract attention from the other hotels. LOL...The service was excellent! We will be staying here again next time. IF ONLY the Hotel Management had let us perform for the guests by the pool, the expereience would've been a 100/100! so therefore I rate them 99/100. Thanks Waikiki Banyan, look us up on Facebook - Forest View High School Polinetia Fa'atasi to see our photos. Mahalo ....SHAKA!

We spent 6 nights from Dec 18th to 23rd at Banyan. Our first room 1404 on Tower 2 was outdated with dirty carpet and noisy frig. Talked to the front desk the next morning. Jason provided us great service and very helpful. He helped us move to an another room on Tower 1, the room was beautiful and clean. We had a great stay at Banyan and Oahu. Thank you Jason! Cannot wait to come back!

This hotel has a great location, one block from the beach. Many restaurants are just a walk away. The beds were a little lumpy. The sofabed need to be changed. Great views. The people are very helpful. The pool didn't feel heated.

Great location, great service, great rooms. We have a large family and needed a good space with a kitchen. The Banyan has good sized rooms, good kitchen space, and is comfortable for large families. Location is also great. Just a block from a great part of the beach for young kids.

We stayed at the Banyan for 7 nights from 9th to the 16th November. We checked in to room 2503 in tower 2. It was a lovely room. It had a balcony that over looked the canal and into the hills. The room had a large king size bed, that was incredibly comfortable. The bathroom was a little small, but functional, and the water in the shower was always hot.There was a full kitchen with oven and cooktop, a full fridge, microwave, and a double sink. There is also a full dinner set for 4 with plates, bowels, coffee cups, glasses and wine glasses. There was also pots and pans and bbq utensils to use at the pool deck.The hotel has a pool deck with BBQ facilities and a pool and hot tub. I found it was always clean and tidy and there were plenty of deck chairs.The coffee shop and mini mart were handy too. The coffee shop has internet access and we had breakfast there each morning (coffee and bagels). The staff in the coffee shop were lovely and always greeted you with a smile.The hotel is one block from the beach, so it was not far to walk anywhere, two mins and you are in the main shopping district. The bus also stops on Kuhio Ave just at the front of the hotel to take you all over the island.Overall this is a lovely hotel. It is clean and quiet, and the staff are friendly. I would recommend staying here to anyone looking for a relaxing place to spend an extended stay in Waikiki.

I took my family (Dad, brother, sister and my two young children) for a family trip this past April to celebrate my dad's 70th Birthday. For the location and room types, The Banyan, was the best choice. It was my second trip to the island but a first for the rest of my party so starting off our trip with a great room was a must. I booked two rooms which by shear coincidence were not next together but still worked out great. Having the full kitchens allowed us to make breakfast each morning and lunch for when the kids tired out mid day. My room had the breakfast bar set up while my dads the rounded table. While we all would have been comfortable in the one room, having two gave my teenaged brother a bit of space and somewhere for the kids to go when they tired of mommy. My room had a good overlook of the recreation deck and a bit of the ocean. Overall we loved it for the location, amenities, and value. I am currently in the process of booking for a stay at the end of February for my husband and mothers birthdays and we looking forward to our stay.

We took a family vacation for 2 wonderful weeks in Waikiki. Booked this hotel as it was very convenient to a kid friendly beach, and the price was right. We stayed in a suite on the 9th floor. The property shows a little age, but we didn't expect the Ritz for these prices. We were very comfortable and the room was clean. The front desk was easy to communicate with and cheerfully met our requests. The Concierge was of no help, the woman I spoke with was not very knowledgable of anything. We were happy with the pool, play & BBQ area, though we spent most of our time on the beach, which was safe and clean. Best tip I can say is, if you want fresh fruits, go to the Saturday Market near the College, it is GREAT! There is also a small one where you can get local fruits and veggies in a parking lot about 100' to your right as you walk out of the hotel on Tuesdays. This was family oriented and we hope to return again some day.

The suite itself was nothing spectacular but it was great to have a kitchen and lots of space. It was clean, stocked with towels and toilet paper and the like, and had a beautiful view (facing north i believe... we could see diamond head if we looked to the right). The combination of the location and the affordability of the property was ideal. The property is one small block away from the beach and also one small block (in a different direction) from the local bus stop which we used daily ($25 for a four day unlimited bus pass easily took us to pearl harbor, dole plantation, north shore beaches, manoa falls, etc albeit rather slowly). The kitchen did not have any pots and we didn't know what to do with leftover cooking oil etc which we would have had to buy so we didn't do any real cooking. However, the microwave was handy for microwave dinners and the fridge was handy to keep cold drinks and fruit and to store restaurant leftovers which we reheated in the microwave. The expedia local concierge in the lobby of the property was also helpful and convenient to obtain maps and brochures and also to book excursions (yet booking online or with someone else may be cheaper). There is an activity deck with a pool and tennis courts but we didn't have time to make use of them. I'm surprised there were people using the pool at all since the beach is so close. Overall, it was a great stay and i would recommend it for anyone, however, the spaciousness and amenities would be especially suitable for groups of friends and for families.

We stayed at this property in late Sept. and then again at the beginning of November at the start and end of the our holiday. Each time for 4 or 5 days.The Sept. stay was on the 14th floor with a view of Diamond Head and the Nov. stay being on the 15th floor facing the city and ocean.The public areas were very clean and in good condition. The staff polite,friendly and helpful.The coffee shop has the best cream puffs which my husband is still pining over. Friendly staff in there as well.Our only problem was with the furnishings on the 14th floor condo having a very,very large worn hole in the fabric of the only chair in the suite. We did not think this reflected the Aston's standards and were surprised that they would let an owner continue to not address the situation. It should not require a wait for a total overhaul of the unit to repair fabric on one chair. Otherwise the room was made up promptly each day and it was nice to have the bedroom/kitchen/livingroom setup. The decor is a bit dated but I'm not interested in paying inflated hotel prices for stainless steel fridge, stove and granite countertops. We liked the location since it is a little quieter then most locations in Waikiki but still within easy walking distance of the beach. No unsavoury characters hanging around like we saw at other hotels when people were being dropped off during our airport shuttle drive.

Our room was on the 37th floor and had great views. My only complaint was the distance to the main shopping. The snack bar on the recreation floor was great when we were too tired to go out for dinner. I loved the idea of a door code to enter the room instead of a key.The room, itself, was okay - nothing to write home about. We rented from the Koko Resorts and they were great. They loaned us whatever we needed for the beach and the parking was included. A definite plus!

We were originally given a room that looked like it had not been updated for 30 years. The furniture was old and dirty, and the room smelled musty. We asked for another room, but the person at the front desk said that we would have to check the next day because the maid service had already left for the day. We went back to the front desk about an hour later and there was another guest complaining about his room. He was arguing with the clerk, so we spoke to another clerk about our room. He was more accommodating, perhaps because the other guest was already making a scene, and gave us another room which ended up being better.

I agree with the other reviews that this hotel could use some decor updates. However, it is a well maintained, clean property 1.5 blocks from Waikiki Beach and the center of all of the action. We stayed in tower 2- timeshare- Sweetwaters at the Waikiki Banyan. Parking was included with the timeshare. The view to the ocean and Diamond head was visable, but partially blocked by the other high rise hotels. Still beautiful though! The units have outdoor patios to sit on and enjoy the view. The bed was super comfortable as well! We also had a choice to stay at Mariott Ko'Olina on the west coast and I'm glad we chose to stay here. Again, while it doesn't offer the newness, or the "resort feel" of other hotels, we had no complaints whatsoever!!!

Good value for the type of accomodation,rooms are fairly large with an attached bedroom.The hotel rooms need some up grading as improvements seem to be put on hold.If you don't mind staying in a hotel that needs some upgrading but offers good value for what you get then this hotel is for you.Staff are very friendly.

I recently stayed at the Aston (Sept 11-13, 2011) and loved it!! The service is great and you can't beat the location. It is directly across the beach with pleanty of restaurants and shopping around. The rooms were a little bit small (3 girls sharing one room OFCOURSE it would be) but don't let that stop you, it's not like you will spend a lot of time in a room when in Hawaii. If you like your space, get a suite.We had 2 double queen beds and a nice bathroom. Our balcony faced the ocean, so it was great. This vacation was set up by HawaiiDiscount.com and everything they recommend was great!!

Had 6 nights here after a 3 week intensive tour of Continental USA and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Was central to everything and handy to beach. Facilities were beyond our expectation and view overlooking Honolulu was spectacular. Service and helpfulness of staff was very much appreciated especially the tourist desk. Would recommend for couples, both young and old as well as families.

For one reason or another, we needed to find somewhere to stay while our house was being fixed. I had won a couple nights in a standard room at this hotel. We got a standard room. It came with a full kitchen, a queen size pull out sofa, & 2 double beds the "bedroom" area. We were on the 6th floor, right across from the barbeque pits, pool, and mini putting green. The saff was very friendly and helped us out a lot. Self parking was a steal at $10 for 24 hours (this is waikiki after all, and parking can be Super expensive). When we checked in, the kids got a beach pail, shovel and some toys and a card with a coupon book to use in and around waikiki. We paid the $10 daily fee to have a newspaper and access to dvd/playstation game rentals. It was very easy to go down, and rent a video or game and keep the kids entertained during our down time. It was a great place to just sit and relax. It was close to a lot of restaurants, and only a couple blocks from the beach, the zoo and the aquarium. I would definitely go back with my family for another stay.

This was the 2nd time around staying at the Waikiki Banyan (stayed 2 years ago previously). If you have a family of 4 or less, with small children, then this is probably one of the best places to stay in Waikiki for the price, location and full kitchen. The rooms are 1 bedroom with a sofabed.The day we have arrived we checked into our standard room (booked with a package deal). Unfortunately, the room we got faced the pool. Literally, once you opened the curtains, people could look directly into your room. It was that close. Suffice it to say, I was not happy. Ok, yes, I paid for a standard room, but I didn't expect no privacy. So it was either keep the room and stay in the dark all 10 days or go see if we could switch rooms.Well, just our luck that the entire hotel was fully booked! So after spending almost an hour with the front desk to see what they could do, one of the mgrs said they could release one of the mountain view rooms the next day for us ( I was willing to pay for the upgrade at this point). So the next day, I asked if I could see the room they were going to give us, but to my surprise, they offered me a corner ocean/mountain view room for a small upgrade charge! The new room was fantastic and the kids loved it. For me, that's what I called great service. I just wanted a room with some privacy and ended up getting a great view (even though I paid a little more for it). Thank you to hotel management.Positives:- Terrific customer service (from front desk to housekeeping to bellhops)- 1 block away from beach- Full kitchen, fridge, microwave, stove, etc...- Laundry machines on each floor- Parking cheap! $10/dayNegatives:- Hotel and rooms are a bit worn down (guess it depends on which condo you get and what floor it's on).- Carpet felt weird and not that clean (keep slippers on).- Sofabed was barely sleepable. Good thing the kids aren't that heavy. Could feel the springs. (These sofabeds need to be inspected and replaced, even from our last stay.)- Elevators in Tower 1 were slow, but probably due to a full capacity.- small bathroom (really 1 person in there at a time, but sink was outside so that helped).- small pool and crowded all the time- kid's play structure (closed entire time we were there)So in summary, even though I listed the negatives, I would still choose to stay at this condo hotel based on the amenities and location even though the hotel is a bit worn. Lots of space for the kids and the option to cook instead of eating out everyday. Plus you won't be in your room most of the day anyways!

Every Labor Day weekend in September my husband's family stays in Waikiki for the weekend at least for 2 nights. It's the weekend of the annual Okinawan Festival at Kapiolani Park and we all attend and volunteer at the festival-the kiddies and parents, grandparents, cousins, aunts and uncles. So we need a place that is family friendly and we found that place at the Waikiki Banyan. The reservation staff and front desk staff tries their best to give us the best rates, rooms that have enough space to relax and even cook if we choose to and enough sleeping accommodations whether we need a king or queen size beds, pull out sofas, and roll aways. Sufficient parking is provided, there is a sundries shop and small coffee shop/cafe. One of the best features is the 6th/pool floor where there is a snack/plate lunch stand (ONO FOOD), bbq grills, outdoor eating areas, basketball/tennis courts and large pool and jacuzzi.

Just came back from a 1 week stay at the Waikiki Banyan. The location was excellent, the staff very helpful and friendly, and the room was a little old but very clean. We asked for an updated room when we checked in. The hallways are a little stuffy but the air conditioning in the room worked great. Furnishings were a little dated but the kitchen was new and well equipped. Parking was $10 a day which is a bargain in Waikiki. We never had a problem parking our car. We did not use the sixth floor amenities but we saw them and the people looked like they were enjoying themselves there. The location is the best feature of this hotel. Everything is within walking distance. The hotel is also on the "quieter" side of Waikiki so you're away from all the hustle and bustle of Kalakaua Avenue. Our bedroom had two full beds and three panel doors to shut out the living room. I was worried that it wouldn't block out the snoring sounds of one of my family members who slept on the couch...but I didn't hear a peep! I would recommend this hotel for budget conscious families. I will definitely stay here again. :)

Hotel was great! In our room the living room furniture was a little dated but very clean! We had a full kitchen, a lanai with a great view of the ocean and very comfy beds! We had two small children both under 5 and a teenager so the kitchen was pretty much a necessity! It came equipped with a very modern stove and side by side refrigerator it also had all the cook ware and utensils needed to prepare a meal. We had granite countertops and tile flooring also! (Not something one is used to seeing when on vacation unless willing to shell out the $) We were two (2) blocks from Waikiki beach. Also there is a swimming pool/play area for the kids, also bar-b-que grills and other stuff that we didn't have time to enjoy. I would definitely stay there again and may do so next year! Only downfall is the parking garage. It was kind of pricey to park and although it's connected to the Hotel it's not affiliated so if you stay here be prepared to pay a pretty penny for parking.

This hotel was well worth the money. The location was easy, the pool area was really nice. The coffee bar downstairs was convenient and they made a great latte. The staff was really friendly and helpful. The room we had with an ocean view was outstanding. We will most certainly stay here again.

My father retired and decided to take his kids, grandkids and their spouses to Hawaii, we had 3 weeks for all 22 of us to get booked. Dad decided to go to a travel agent and she changed his mind from the Hawaiian Hilton Village to the Aston Waikiki Banyan, she raved about it. I have to say she must have got some kick back for booking us there. Rooms run down, play ground closed (the hotel said all summer it has been closed), 1/2 the bbq'ers didnt worked, at times the a/c didn't work in 2 out of our 6 rooms, cheap bath towels, not so great room service. I do have to say the location was very good, having a balcony was nice, a kitchen was great to have but no dishwasher and maid service refused to do our dishes and the beds were very non comfy. Hot Tubs were to hot for just about everyone and the pool was just an average pool.

Everytime we go to Honolulu - The Waikiki Banyan is always our first pick for a place to call home. These are not hotel rooms you are getting - they are small apartments. They have a separate bedroom (with a sliding door) - full bath and a full kitchen, flu stove, full fridge, some even have dishwashers. There is also BBQ's that you can "rent" by the hour down on the pool deck - cheap and work great.Some people may be saying that - Hey I don't want to cook and clean while on vacation - I get that, but when you are in Honolulu for a couple of weeks at a time - you get pretty sick of eating out all the time. We usually do B'fast and lunch at home, and then go our for a nice dinner in the evening - you will be amazed at how the savings grow - just head to the Safeway ( a short cab ride from the hotel) and stock up on some groceries.The location of this hotel - is the best. You are a short block from the beach, the Zoo is a bit further - and all other attractions in the Waikiki area is a short 10 - 15 min walk at most. The area as with most areas of Waikiki is very safe - I have never felt unsafe in the area. The neighbourhood is quiet - not a lot of traffic or other noise. This property is a hotel/condo building - so you do have some folks that live there year round.The pool is a salt water pool - and there are 2 hot tubs (difference temperatures) - a putting course as well.You could not ask for better hotel staff- they are always friendly and smiling - and they remember you form trip to trip - since we have stayed there so many times - there is always a nice bottle of wine, chocolates and a welcome back card (hand written) waiting for us in our room.I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone that is visiting Honolulu - especially if you have kids (which we don't) - but the value for your money is just not found anywhere else.Enjoy your trip and ALOHA!

My Husband and I were given a trip to hawaii in May of 2010 from our Children for our honeymoon and this is where we were booked into for the week...I have to tell you..it was great.The room was so clean and nice,and it was nice to have the option for our morning coffee and tea in the room..We encountered only 1 issue and it was dealt with promptly..other than that..I'm hoping to book there for us and my Mom to stay in January 2011.The pool was great and I'm sure the hottub was too.although,as tourists,we burnt the 1st day and never really tried the hottub.as one can imagine..lol..I put September 2010 as the date visited..wouldn't go as far back as May 2010

we were blown away by all the amenities they had. A little store downstairs had everything you needed at reasonable prices. The recreation area was out of this world!!! 1 block away from the beach, helpful staff. The only cocern one may have is that most condos are individually owned and some are run down ask the front desk for rating of room before booking. We had a fabulous room, but i did see one that was BAD!!!! Our trip was a perfect 10

Some units updated more than others but all we stayed in were clean, neat and stocked with the essentials. Nice pool area, clean and well maintained. Ocean, city or Diamond Head views if you are on higher floors. One block from beach and the main boulevard with all the shops and restaurants! Garage parking for reasonable fee. Small store & coffee shop in the lobby. Laundry facility on each floor which is a plus for people like us who stay for several weeks at a time. Can't wait to book our next trip!

I would definitely recommend this place. For the price we pay, i think i got a five star. It's clean. the maid comes everyday to make the bed, change linen and vaccun q 3 days. we were on 33rd floor( I think 3334), we had a great view of the ocean and mountain. This condo is a block away from waikiki beach. there are convenient stores around. the international market is not very far @ all, in there has a food court with reasonable price

We spent a week here on our vacation to Waikiki with three kids - 6, 8, &14 yrs old. It was perfect for what we needed. The outside lobby is welcoming and the kids loved the Koi pond and waterfall. The Aston staff were all very helpful. Elevators were modern and pretty speedy. With four of them we never had a long wait to get to and from our room on the 15th floor. The rooms are a bit dated but, knowing that these are priviately owned condos managed by Aston, it's understandable that Aston can't simply update the condos on their own. They need the owners to provide the update. The condo had everything we needed. The large king bed was great but, the pullout sleeper needed a new mattress bad. It was not very comfortable. Full maid service is limited to every three days although we did get limited service daily (towels, TP, soap, etc.). No big deal. Aston also provides large towels for swimming which you can turn in as often as you need for fresh dry towels. Going out onto the lanai every evening with a book or glass of wine was nice. A/C in the room helped to keep it comfortable. The 1 block walk to the beach was also no problem for us. We used the kitchen a few times and had no issues; it was nice to have the option. Parking is convenient although we had a full size car and the spots are tight. Expect to pay for parking. For a family vacation we'd do it again with no hesitation. If you're looking for a more intimate couples trip, I'd go with something like the Royal Hawaiian or Hilton - something on the beach. But again, Aston Waikiki Banyan is an excellent option for a family on a budget.

Yes, all the reviews say it corrected - outdated. But it was relatively clean. We brought our 11 month old crawling baby who has the most sensitive skin to dust mites and he didn't get a single bite from the carpet in the week we stayed here.Our late check-in was smooth for the most part but the crib was missing when we arrived even though the lady at the front desk confirmed it was already in there when I asked at check in. It was promptly brought up. Not the nicest crib in the world but functional (white metal crib, a little creaky).I wouldn't call our one bedroom a "one bedroom" either. it's more a Junior One bedroom with banquet style hall dividers closing the bedroom from the living room.The location is wonderful, especially for those who are on a "foodcation" like we were. Tons of local spots to hit up nearby (diamond head - KCC farmers market, waiola shaved ice, leonards malasadas, ono hawaiian food, ono seafood, fresh catch for poke, iyasume masube, koa, etc) but also with the conveniences of a touristy neighborhood (ie. waikiki beach, shopping, ABC stores every block).The parking is so convenient. I heard other places make you valet which will end up costing you more money via tips. $60 for the week was great with in & out privileges.Pool was nice but breezy. there is a snack stand there serving up smoothies and hawaiian fare. I wish I had time to try the food there but I didn't.Our room 3306 was right in front of the elevator but not noisy at all. There is a laundry room on each floor with one washer and one dryer, $1.50 for each load. Convenient if you are travelling with kids and don't want to pack too much. Definitely do the load in the morning as the afternoon seems to be a popular time to do laundry.Beds - they were fine. definitely not luxurious, don't expect a pillowtop. no bed skirt or headboard either but this ain't the W hotel.Beach is so close - 3 min walk. Go right to see all the surfers or go left for more quiet areas.Night time - very vibrant with tons of buskers doing shows. lots of fun!This place sufficed quite nicely for the price. I'd probably stay again if I was working on the same budget.

Spacious rooms perfect for small families or travellers on a budget. This was our 3rd stay at the Banyan and every time we are happy with our stay. I like the fact of cooking a majority of our meals so we can cook healthfully- not to mention we get tired of eating out. When we travel with our children, we can put them to bed in the bedroom and stay up , have a drink/watch a movie etc. So much better than staying in a regular hotel room!! Love having our own lanaii !!Great location close to the beach as well as the away from the busy streets of Waikiki. Have always felt somewhat safe in the area. The coffee bar on the main floor is cute, has great coffee and treats. Friendly, over the top staff- always willing to help. We tried the bbq's (coin operated) and they took forever to cook on and heat up. Will not use them again really. Play structure is superb for our small aged children as well as the pool and hot tub/deck area are well maintained and nice. Some of the rooms could definetly use a facelift and update, but the way we look at it is that we are only there for such a small portion of our trip- I would rather spend my money saved on more shopping!!Will definetly stay there again!!

I stayed there last year with my husband & elderly father, it was fine as we needed an apartment. However I do feel we were too far away from all the action & would probably stay in a more central spot next time. Unfortunately most of the apartments for families were located in this vicinity of Waikiki. The local bus service was good! We had a pleasant room with a mountain view which was so pretty at night. The television was shocking no movies, only a few boring channels - take a book to read!

Overall, was pleased with this condo. Had an Entertainment Book coupon that got us a deluxe ocean view room and we ended up on the top floor, with gorgeous view of the ocean, Diamond Head, and the pool area (it was nice to see how busy the pool was before heading down). The room itself was pretty bare of decoration, which was a little disappointing - it was very white and lacked character, and the carpet obviously was a little dated. But it was very clean and perfect for the 3 of us (2 adults, one child). Hotel staff was friendly and helpful, and my daughter loved the playground, pool and Banyan Breeze cafe (where the staff were GREAT). Didn't charge us for Internet and overall the room was very reasonable compared to others I had looked at. The balcony was a nice size, too, and other than the street noise (which can be expected with all the streets and traffic in Waikiki) the hotel itself was very quiet, even during spring break season. The kitchen was full-size, which was handy. And it was only a few minutes' walk from the beach, a couple blocks from the zoo and about 15 mins walk from the Aquarium. Very kid-friendly!

Our overall trip to Waikiki was awesome. Our condo was average: kitchen was nice to have with kids on a trip, furniture was ok, beds were good. The toilet/tub area was small, but still functional. The sliding doors for the bedroom were very handy - a little cumbersome, but nice to open up the area. Our room had dark drapes, which were nice to block out night light and noise. Our balcony was nice - overlooked the pool, beach and Diamond Head! We had maid service every day, a newspaper every morning, and the air conditioner was perfect. I would suggest to anyone using the parking garage for six days or more to get the weekly pass, and not mess with the daily fee and late fees. Overall, if you are looking for luxury and pampering - this is not the place. But for a nice place to sleep and shower and snack for an affordable price, this could be it.

You couldn't pick a better location for teens who want to boogie board and surf board, for getting transportation, shopping and less crowded beach areas. I couldn't live without a kitchen for saving time and money instead of dining out and having food on hand for always hungry teenage boys. The pool/hot tubs & recreation deck and are excellent, expecially for younger children. The poolside snack bar with Hawaiian plate lunches is also a bonus. We supposedly got lucky with a "coveted newly renovated unit". Great if your priority is two flat screen TV's, Blue Ray player and heated "Washlet Toilet". We couldn't get the Blue Ray player to work but the TV came in handy because there was no night life for the teenagers. The carpet was too filthy and sticky to walk on barefoot . They did come and clean it with the equivalent of a floor polisher which didn't do much good and the "deluxe ocean view" was not so deluxe. Be prepared to put up with the noise of ambulances screaming by dozens of times day and night. There is no door to the bathroom from the livingroom besides the squeeky 3 panel sliding doors through the bedroom. The pull out couch is like a hammock made of chain link fence with a thin piece of foam on it. I endend up sleeping on the couch itself. The maid service was poor to non existent. I have too many complaints to even list. The rest of the front desk staff and concierge were great.

The good: price, location, price, cleanliness, price, pool/rec area, well-equipped kitchen,comfortable king bed, large roomThe mediocre: really really outdated room - exposed plumbing, tiny bathroom, worn fixtures, worn carpet, old tv, no movies, no wifi. Worked fine for us because we weren't hanging out there but it was a disappointment when we first walked in. There are upgraded rooms - do ask for one BEFORE you arrive because...The bad: service (aside from room clearning) was terrible - only answer was "No." or "Don't know," and we don't ask for much. I thought there were two queens but we had a king, a sofabed and a rollaway. The rollaway was absolutely horrible, tiny and all poking springs, and the sofabed was nearly as bad. The air conditioner was rattly and the toilet ran all the time and they would not fix either, guy just shrugged.The weird: parking ajoins but is not affiliated with the hotel. It is a great value, $10 a day, but you have to pay cash for it every 24 hours and keep track so you do not get behind.

I traveled with 2 friends to Honolulu, booking a package deal through the hotel that included airfare and car rental. A united with 2 beds had been requested, but we were given a unit with one king bed. We had planned to use the pull out sofa anyway. There was no unit available that night, so they brought us a rollaway bed for the night, at no charge. They said they would move us to the requested room the next day. The next morning I went to the front desk to confirm this, and the clerk could find no record of this. However, he was able to make it happen, saying our bags would be moved for us to the new room, to be done by 3pm, when we were to pick up the keys to the new room. It ended up being after 4pm before the new room was ready. Otherwise, we had a wonderful week. We paid for weekly parking, and had no problems. My only complaint, which was minor, was being charged for making a call to a 1-800 number. We had an over all pleasant experience, and would recommend the Banyan to anyone!

We stayed at the Waikiki Banyan for 8 nights. We are a family of four with two teenagers. We paid an average (including taxes) of $204 per night via Expedia for what seemed to be a standard “condo-style” room. The property is a hotel, but it appears to have some rooms that operate as hotel rooms and others that are privately owned (including some that are rented separately as condo rentals). We stayed here in 2008 and rented directly from a condo owner that time.The hotel is fairly conveniently located, about two blocks from the beach. It is possible to get closer to the beach and there are many hotels right on the water. But you’ll pay a significant premium to do so. Our room was somewhat older in décor and furnishings, but it was fine. It had a small number of minor annoyances. The electrical outlet in the bathroom sparked when we first tried to use it and it never worked properly after that. The “pocket” bathroom door did not close properly (so that it could be locked) because the door did not align perfectly with the door frame casing. One of the “shelf rails” on the door of the fridge kept falling off its mounting bracket.Our room had a full kitchen, as well as a bedroom that was separated from the main living area by a three-part sliding door. However, the bathroom was on the bedroom side of the divider (i.e., essentially making it an en suite), which could be inconvenient for some. We had an ocean view, although the view was really only “partial” due to the numerous other tall buildings between us and the water.We used the 6th floor pool and barbecue area a few times. The pool area tends to be a little windy. The barbecues are quite convenient for grilling dinner, although they are coin operated (electrical) and there were a few times when other guests put their coins in the slots but the BBQs did not work.I have few complaints about the hotel. It is not a new property and the rooms have not been updated. But they were functional and the price was competitive given our need for two separate sleeping areas. The hotel provides “free” wired internet access. It would have been convenient to have wireless access, because a single wired line was insufficient for the numerous laptops, netbooks and iTouch/Phone devices we had. We ended up buying a week of access on a wireless service offered by a nearby provider that was within range. However, the signal varied, which sometimes limited access.One pet peeve was the curtains/drapes. They were very thin and did little to keep out the light in the morning. As a result, we regularly woke up around 7:00 in the morning, which is not my idea of a good time when I’m on vacation. The windows were large and there was little extra bedding available to try to rig up any sort of additional window covering.We had a different parking experience than one recent poster. The $10 charge for parking is correct, and seems like a deal compared to what I pay to park downtown at home. However, we seemed to get a deal with the way the charges worked out. We parked (and paid) on evening #1. When we arrived back at the hotel on evening #2, the 24 hour period was not yet up, so we were not charged at that time. When we departed on the morning of day #3, I expected to be charged the $10 on departure. However, the parking attendant just waved us through. We ended up having a car for a hair over 72 hours and only paid $20 for parking three nights.We found the front desk staff very helpful. Our check-in was very quick and they were very helpful storing our bags and providing shower access on our departure day (our return flight departed in the evening). Housekeeping staff seemed efficient, although they always came by quite late in the afternoon, rather than in mid-morning, which seems to be the norm just about every other place I’ve been.I would stay at the Waikiki Banyan again. I would probably look for something a little more modern or right on the beach, but I wouldn’t pay a significant premium to do so and if I didn’t find anything in a reasonable range, I would go back to the Banyan.

I travelled with my husband and my young child. Having the kitchen was very convenient and saved us money. The room was comfortable, but needs updating - especially for the price they are charging. The staff were great. We also used the pool and the playground and my daughter had a great time. I do wish they were able to provide us with a late check-out and free shuttle.

We stayed over Christmas with a group of 10 of us, so we had 3 suites. Each suite was different, all were old and beat up. My first impression was 'oh gross' when I walked into the room. The rates were good over Christmas and the location is excellent, within walking distance to shops, restaurants and the beach. We did get used to our room and it was fine. We had no baseboards, the walls were damaged, all the furniture was marked up and old, the rug felt sticky all the time and the bathroom needed some serious work. All three suites were the same. But the location outweighed all that. If you rent a car, be prepared for the 'outsourced' parking company that is very sticky about even 5 minutes and will overcharge you at every opportunity. They are not the friendliest parking attendents either. Parking is $10 for 24 hours, and they mean 24 hours and not a minute more or they will charge you for another day. And if it happens that you are coming to pay for parking 5 minutes late, they will charge you an extra $10. For example, you pay at 12:00 the first day and on the second day you are leaving the parking lot at 12:05, they will charge you $10 for that 5 minutes. So when you come back in, say an hour later, you will have to pay $10 again for the next 24 hours. They are very nasty about it. Other than that, we had no problems. Like I said, if you can overlook the 'oldness' of the place, it is in an excellent location and our chambermaid was very good. We could get wi-fi in one of the rooms but not the others, and all had wired internet. One of the suites had 2 tv's and the others only had one. There are washer and dryers, $1.50 for each load and the dryer runs an hour which is awesome. We also left four boogie boards in the parking garage for someone else to use because they were given to us by people not wanting to take them home as well. Hope someone made good use of them, I know we did!

Attractive room, updated kitchen (even had granite counter tops), lovely tile floors. Comfy bed (would have preferred tile in this area too instead of carpet), dining and living room furniture are what you would expect to see in Hawaii. Overall, room was better than average, view was spectacular, especially at night. Lobby area very attractive, some rooms have wi-fi and you could certainly buy a cup of coffee downstairs and connect your laptop for free or you could use their computer for $2.50 per 15 minutes. We used it a little bit, afterall, we were on vacation and not working - printing up a boarding pass only cost 40 cents each-what a deal! Didnt hear noises in the hallway and only 1 night of the 7 we stayed there did we even hear someone overhead whom we assume were part cow. Housekeeping was very good but not excellent, missed a few little areas from time to time but overall, better than average - I'm not perfect either. Concierges very helpful, maintenance and housekeeping friendly, but the guys behind the reception/check-in desk acted like you were bothering them if you approached them. If you stay here, dont bother with a car, parking is expensive EVERYWHERE and traffic is awful. The trolly stop was only about 2 minutes away and we used them everywhere we went. Did a few tours and the tour bus picked up within a 5 minutes walk away also. 2 blocks from the beach and within 15 minutes of the zoo and aquarium.

Our 7th stay at the Banyan and still the best condo option in Waikiki. The units need updating but are clean, even daily maid service, and have a full kitchen. If you use the swimming pool it is in at least partial sun most of the day unlike the pool next door which is shaded all afternoon. Easy walk to the beach or family-friendly Honolulu Zoo.This time our mountain view room was a corner unit with a view of Diamond Head from bedroom, kitchen and even a small window in the bathroom. With all the cross-ventilation we hardly used the AC during our 5 night stay! The $10 parking is also a bargain compared to the 30 daily we paid at our next stop on the island.

My husband and I just arrived back yesterday from our dream anniversary vacation to Hawaii. Marvelous vacation! Our travel agent who booked our room requested a higher floor and mentioned our anniversary. Upon our arrival, chocolate covered macadia nuts and a small bottle of Korbel Brut champagne awaited us in our room - along w/a gorgeous deluxe oceanfront view (same as depicted on website) from the 34th floor. Granted the room needs updating - but it was clean (with the exception of the outside of the fridge door), comfortable, and practical. The layout of the room and lanai allowed for gorgeous ocean views. The bed was the most comfortable we've ever experienced. My husband suffers from spinal irregularities and struggles for a good night's rest. He said he's never slept more comfortably - no back aches! The air conditioner worked marvelously and was extremely quiet. Fridge worked great. Stocked kitchen w/basic housewares made saving $$ on food preparation easy. Staff was pleasant and VERY accomodating - especially with our late check-out, which we were allowed the last day free of charge. Having an extra 2 hours afforded us extra time on the beach before our frigid flight back to the midwest. My husband and I plan to return to the Hawai'ian Islands for another vacation and will definately consider staying at the Banyan again. We also plan to recommend the Banyan to all our traveling family and friends!!

This hotel location is ok, just two block away from beach and kitchen is quite convenient too.The services are poor. No Wifi in building or room. You can only find poor signal out side the cafe, you can get access only when you buy drink there.The worst is the parking. Not only they charge $10 a day (expensive than some hotels around which charge $8), the rule is also tricky. You may get charged for $30 for less than 48 hours even though they claim $10 can cover 24 hours.Their rules are ridiculous. You get in, they charge you $10 and put a sticker with expiration time (24 hours exactly). You can come out one minutes over that time, they will ask for another $10 but without any extension of your time! If you get back after sometime, another $10. If you drive in say, 9:00am on Monday, leave 10:00am on Tuesday and bcak in the night at 8:00pm on Tuesday and check out on 8:00am Wed, you will be charged for $30 for just 47 hours. The trick you need to take care is you have to drive your car out before it expires and buy another sticker.

I stayed in room 1805 Tower II. I was very impress with the room and pleasantly surprised that a room so nice was so inexpensive. I must say, I was expecting the worst. But it was wonderful. It was very spacious and clean. The kitchen and bathroom floors needed to be cleaned better though. The mountain view was beautiful. I loved the free parking which is rare in Waikiki and there were plenty of parking spaces open. one block from the beach, zoo and all of the great shopping was just fantastic..... I would for sure stay again.

We stayed here for a week, from 10/15 - 10/22/10. Most folks call this condo 'The Wakiki Banyan' and it's located just a block away from the heart of Waikiki - the beach, shops, great restaurants abound this neighborhood. And the bus stops one block away. In the event that you rent a car, the building does have a parking lot. Our apt included a car space (at no additional cost). The area was safe for a busy city with a lot of people. One of the condo's managers, JD, was excellent at organizing our stay. The photos on Interval International are outdated so it was a pleasant surprise that the building and neighborhood were really quite nice. We had an apt on the 27th floor and the view of the mountains were beautiful. The apt furniture was outdated though. All was very clean and the flat screen tv in the living room was nice (plus a tv in the bedroom). The living room has an extra bed (murphy bed) although we didn't use it. The regular king size bed in the bedroom was excellent and very comfortable. The AC worked well and the apt had a patio. Each apt floor has washers/dryers which is convenient if you need it (buy laundry detergent.) The kitchen had a large refrigerator, microwave, appliances, dishwasher, toaster, dishes, no stove though. Also had a kitchen table that seats (4). We ate out daily so we didn't use the kitchen much. The apt had a good setup and was very comfortable. We were on a high floor, we thought it was pretty quiet for a really busy area like Waikiki Beach. Every so often you would hear a EMS siren, etc., but it was very quiet overall. Every night we slept with the balcony door and apt windows wide open and we slept soundly. The neighbors were also very quiet.October in Oahu was awesome. It was hot enough for the beach (83-85 degrees by day - which was pretty hot) and around 80 at night. Waikiki Beach and the main strip is a 2 minute walk from the apt. The beach was fun and full of people and the shopping strip was great. A lot of great stores (Coach, Tiffany, etc) along with great hotels to pop into and have dinner or enjoy a drink (Westin). The Ala Moana mall was awesome. We rented a car for a couple of days (which you really need if you plan to go to other beaches and the north side of the island) and we used the bus for the rest of our stay. We took the bus and easily reached a lot of locations (ie. Pearl Harbor, Iolani Palace (highly recommend), etc. We were planning to go to a lot of places so we purchased the Oahu 'Go Card' which worked out really, really well for us. We purchased the 7-day card (you can buy a 3 or 5 or 7 day card) and for an all inclusive price and per card received: Grand Circle Island Tour (all day tour), entry and audio tour to USS Arizona, USS Bowfin, and Battleship Missouri Memorial, transportation to Diamond Head Crater, transportation and equipment for Hanauma Bay Snorkeling, 1 day Car Rental (per card), admission to Iolani Palace, admission to Queen Emma Summer Palace, Catamaran sail, daily Surf lessons, Daily beach chair rental, 4 hour Moped rental. If you don't plan to do a lot then the Go To Card is probably not worth it, but for us, it saved a lot of $ rather than pay for each individual item.Nice hotels to hang out and have dinner, drinks in the immediate area included the Westin and the Hyatt (Hyatt has some really nice shops too). There were so many good restaurants to choose from as well.For groceries, chocolates, sun lotion, beach towels, etc., rather than shop in the condo's mini market (on the lobby level) go to the ABC stores (All Blocks Covered). Literally, there is an ABC store on every block. You can get some groceries there and an inexpensive beach chair or roll up mat for the beach (we were surprised but the condo does not provide beach towels or beach chairs). On either Friday or Saturday nights, Waikiki Beach has a free Hula Show and it was great. The front desk can give you a map of the area and provide good tips as to some of the freebies going on.The Waikiki Banyan is in the heart of Waikiki Beach in Oahu and we will definitely return.

We were on a group sports tour so was fine for 4 blokes sharing a room as very affordable and in a good location. However would not advise for anything else! But then wouldn't really recommend Waikiki.Two blocks from the beach and has a coffee shop with free wireless with purchases. Though the coffee shop hours were restrictive they left the wireless on all night. Then the code is changed in the morning. There is a sign saying use during your coffee and if you come back please repurchase but obviously at night was a surprise to be able to use it.There was also free plug in internet in the room.On other reviews people rave about Bre-Anne. She was knowledgeable but we found some of her advice poor or cynically could suggest geared to her getting a commission! Ie telling us at this time of year the only way of seeing labs on the big island was to take a helicopter tour! We didn't take one but did see lava.

This place was affordable and the location was great! It was about 2 blocks from the beach and a short walk to all the stores and restaurants. The concierge Bre-Ann was awesome! She gave us the break down of all the great activities to do in the island. She is the go to person if you want to book your island activities such as snorkeling, luau's, island tours, etc. The hotel staff were friendly and always helpful. Checking in and out was easy.The only thing that was not so great was our first room which was tower 1 room 1012. When we first got into our room it smelled terrible!!! It smelled absolutely awful!! We talked to the front desk about moving us into a different room as we couldn't bare to sleep in the room with the funky smell. It turned out they were all booked up and wouldn't be able to move us for several days. I dealt with Jo-Lyn in reception and she was really good about situation. She had house keeping clean and freshen up our room until we were able to move to another room. The smell was still there but at least she tried to do something to make us feel comfortable until we moved rooms. We slept with the windows open to air out the room but it was hard to sleep with all the noise from outside. So our first week we didn't get too much sleep :(. We finally moved to tower 1 room 706 which was much better! Thanks Jo-Lyn for everything!The pool area/recreation area was good. There is a tennis court, bbq area, snack store, putting green, pool, hot tubs and sauna.All in all our stay was great! This is a great place to stay if you are looking for affordable accomodations that's not too far away from the beach, restaurants, and shopping.

We stayed in Room 2904 of Tower 2 in the Waikiki Banyan. This property is managed by Koko Resorts.PROS:- Excellent location - very close to the beach, shops, restaurants, tour pick-ups, zoo, aquarium. - Lovely ocean view - Tower 1 blocks the middle of the view, but lots of shoreline still visible - Good amenities - pool, hot tub, playground, snack bar, cafe, use of a playpen for toddler- Spacious kitchenCONS:- NOT CLEAN ENOUGH. Spots on all the faucets, dirty cups and pans in the cupboards, generally dusty. Worst of all, on arrival I found a large toenail clipping on the floor (gag!) and an INCH-LONG piece of GLASS on the floor! Good thing I found that before my 2-year old did. NOT IMPRESSED.- In addition to the visible dirt, the condo needs a serious deep clean or replacement of the upholstery, curtains, rug, etc. My husband and I both suffered from allergic reactions each time we spent any length of time in the condo - itchy watery eyes, congestion, sneezing. There is obviously a huge buildup of dust and possibly mold in this unit, because we rarely have allergic reactions like that in hotels, other homes, and certainly never in our own home.- Hot, stuffy elevator- Lots of urban noise on the balcony even at 29th floor- The bathroom is in the bedroom. We risked interrupting our child's sleep at nap time or in the evening when he went to bed before us. Not a huge deal in our case, but something to consider if your child is a light sleeper and not apparent from the advertisement. OVERALL:- We wouldn't stay again because of the poor cleaning and the dust causing allergic reactions- Great location, though, so I'd look for something else nearby next time!

When we booked our room here, we were told it was two rooms with a queen bed & two singles (which is what we'd paid for) but they put us into a one bedroom condo with a pull out bed in the lounge area. When we requested another room they tried to put us into one with two double beds that were as hard as a rock, also the room smelled of smoke & looked quite old & rundown. We asked if there were any other rooms available but were told they were fully booked! So we chose to stay in the first room with the pullout bed which our two teenage daughters had to share. Apart from that the pool area was nice enough & the cafe in the lobby area was really nice - probably the best part of the hotel!

I have stayed here 23rd - 31st August 2010 and it is also our first time in Hawaii. This is a condominium/apartment building with 2 towers with everything you could wish for to have on your holidays with the family. The cooker, fridge in the room is so convenient and the use of the rent a bar-b-que grill ($2/hr) on the 6th floor will save you a lot of money on meals (if you buy your food from Chinatown or outside the tourist area). Good size room and the sofa bed was very comfy. Housekeeping staff are very good as every inch of the room is cleaned daily, plenty of towel and amenity replacements. The free wired internet is a big plus for this hotel although there are times that the bandwidth seem to falter but no big issue. The reception staff always welcoming, helpful and attentive to anyone who passes by or stand around at reception area and the concierge (I forgot her name) was so lovely and will recommend the right activity/event for your type of family that would suit your pocket. 2 blocks away from waikiki beach and if you forget your beach towels the hotel does not mind you using their towels. Overall we had an excellent holiday and many thanks to all the staff of Aston Waikiki Banyan! Will definitely ask to stay here again on our return.

First I will state that our room was booked through WestJet Vacations in Canada and not directly with the hotel or through an agent for other privately owned condos. We were in 2-3408 and it was as previously discribed by others as being dated but very clean. The appliances were likely the originals when it was built in the late 70's (?) but considering that the fridge is the only appliance that gets used daily it would be foolish to throw away perfectly functional stoves just because they are old. The same with the kitchen cabinets however it would be nice to have handles on the cabinet doors. The cabinets were stocked with dishes and cutlery for 6 people along with typical kitchen pots, toaster, gadgets and knives. There was no can punch type bottle opener. We had a breakfast bar with no kitchen table or chairs which would be very poor for people with really young children. The floor in the kitchen area was fairly new ceramic tiles however the carpeting definately should be replaced soon. Walls were clean but could use a new paint and new artwork which is faded however this did not affect our stay in the room at all. The bathroom was tiny but the sink was outside of the toilet and tub area, which was a good idea. The three sliding doors that can be used to separate the large bedroom from the living room worked very well, but anyone using the sofabed must come through the bedroom to use the bathroom, which may be a bit of an inconvenience for others, but wasn't a problem for us. The beds were not pillow top but were more comfortable then they looked. The sofabed was more suited to a child. Pillows were medium density and there were two for each bed. We did notice that the sheets were replaced every two days and when the rooms are cleaned after check out we saw them actually taking clean bedspreads into the rooms to replace the soiled ones This made us very happy as you always wonder what happened on the bedspread in the past. especially if you have an infant or children crawling on them..Our check in was fairly quick and because I had contacted the hotel weeks in advance of our arrival to request a late check out it was on file for our room. Apparently it was not a late check out but a front desk extension and there was a cost of $90.00 plus taxes so that we could keep one room, as our departure time was 10:55 pm. I am going to suggest to the booking company that they should pre-arrange this for all their late flights as a convenience which would make it better. Typically late check outs are only assigned the day of check out and only if there are rooms available. As it turned out the hotel was full and no late check outs were available on our departure day. Had we not made this request in advance, we would have been gypsies for 8 hours, even though they offered to hold our luggage.The pool is fairly shallow with the deepest point being under 6 feet and both ends of the pool being 3 feet. It is a very busy pool especially on weekends when the local residents in the two towers have guests over for BBQ's. As for the BBQ's they are electric and do not heat up very hot. Fine for meats that cook at lower temperatures (chicken, and pork) but we could not sear our steaks, they cooked but it took a long time. Some guests from Australia also commented to me about the low temperatures. Cost is only $2.00 for one hour and it is a coin operated system. They are cleaned every day. The basketball/tennis court was not used very much and the putting green was the same. It may have been a better investment to install a deeper pool for adults and a spash pool for younger children so the little ones would be able to enjoy the pool more. Great play equipment for younger children. Sam's Kitchen which is located on the 6th floor has very tasty food and also sells items for BBQ,We did not use the front desk concierge but she was very very friendly always giving a big Aloha as we went by the desk. Parking is wonderful, easy to use and only $10.00 for 24 hours. TIP check out on line for Hawaiian Discount for car rentals. We were able to save about $70.00/day by prebooking our van in advance of our travel (and we didn't have to give a credit card number either). The beach is just a block away and it has a sea wall to prevent waves from hitting young children. It is very shallow (about 3.5 feet at the deepst point near the sea wall) but perfect for younger kids or timid swimmers with a sandy bottom little or no coral.. There is NO wave action here. If you want some waves to bounce in, then you have to walk further down the beach toward the police detachment.There are a number of homeless people on the beach and in the general area so you may be approached but in a gentle manner, we were never hassled. It is a long walk to the International Market and Dukes Lane. We found if there were more than four people, it was cheaper to get a cab than to take the bus down to the other end of Waikiki. The Bus is $2.25 per adult and $1.25 for children under 12. each way.We also walked the 1.2 miles to Safeway on Kapahulu and the cab ride was only $6.60 back. Go in the morning when it is cooler as it was very hot when we were there. Leonards (Malasadas) is a bit further to walk. It was great to have breakfast and lunches in the room with fresh fruit.The lobby is very pretty with the water fall. Banyan Coffe Shop - We did use the internet service to pre-check in for our flight home. $2.50 for 8 minutes and 40 cents per page. there are other prices for longer use of their computer or bring your own. The coffee smelled terrific and the staff was very friendly.Laundry Services - There is only one washer and one dryer on each floor so if you have more than one load (like at the end of your vacation) you may have to use machines on more than one floor - we did.Our room attendant was fabulous. We were travelling with our daughter and her family and we occasionally kept the baby over night or during the day. We always got extra towels and even an extra blanket to put on the floor for the baby, when the crib was in our room. We really appreciated her kindness in providing the little extras for us.The hotel provided shampoo/conditioner which was terrific and bath and face soap. No lotion or other amenities like sewing kits, etc. What they did provide was of a very good quality. There is no real reastaurant in the hotel other than Sam's Kitchen and most of the restuarants in close proximity were fairly costly. Soyou will have to explore and walk to find the perfect location for meals outside of the hotel. There are endless choices in Waikiki but many will involve walking a distance from the hotel.The only thing that I did not enjoy was the noise from all the sirens as the hotel is located very close to four major roadways (Ali Wai Blvd, Kuhio Avenue, Kalakaua Ave, and Kapahulu, which are used by the emergency vehicles. Keeping the windows closed did help somewhat, but the evening breeze was nice at night. Weekends were the noisiest as is the case with all big cities.If we travel with small children again this would likely be our hotel of choice.

Traveled to Waikiki with wife and three children 18 - 22. Check-in was fast and staff very friendly and helpful. Room had adequate sleeping area for all of us. Was a bit crazy with only one shower but it worked out. Parking was easy and the location was great. very quite

i just stayed at the banyan hotel this past week. the staff was friendly and check in was very quick. the room was spacious, but totally out dated. the couches and chairs were ripping, and the drapes were stained with something orangy-brown. if it would be updated, it would be a way better experience..... considering the space and the fact that there is a kitchen (which is very convienient!). sadly my boyfriend and i happened to see inside another room right beside us on the 24th floor...to see that that condo had a big screen tv, nice couches and an island with stools in their kitchen. ...while we got an out dated small tv, no desk and ugly couches. i understand fully that these are individually owned condos, but there needs to be some consistency. i highly doubt i paid any less than that condo that was on the same floor with probably the same view. honestly, next time i go to hawaii i'll probably stay in another hotel. stay at this one if you don't mind testing your luck with the room you will get.... and particularly if you have a family. if you're looking for luxury, it isn't here.

My family of 4 (2 kids: teenage girls) stayed here for 2 weeks and we were very pleased. The rooms were clean and the location was great. Parking was very reasonable ($60 per week) too. Check-In was very easy and quick. There was internet (no extra charge) in the room but it was wired only not wireless. It would have been nice to have wireless since we had to take turns getting online. We had a bug problem the first day but maintenance was up within 15 minutes to spray and we didn't have any bug problems after that. If you are a family and would like to have some space to spread out after a long day in the beautiful Hawaiian sun, I highly recommend this hotel.

The staff was very rude to clients; forget about the services we usually take for granted with other hotels. This place can easily spoil your vacation having to deal with attitude from the staff. In addition, the facility is very old and dark. The hallways have terrible smell and the laundry room is really run down and creepy.

The Banyan has now renovated all elevators. Being so close to the beach was wonderful and less windy. This is the quiet end of Waikiki but with lots to do and see. I would suggest renting from other than the Aston, better rates and better units. Our unit was totally renovated and beautiful. The full kitchen had all we needed. What a view from the 31st floor. Will come back to this unit again and again if available.

Be very clear about what you want for your Hawaiian vacation before making a reservation at this hotel. The first thing to understand is that this is not a real hotel. It is a condominium building where each unit is owned by a different person. Some of the rooms are then leased to Aston to be used as hotel rooms, so every room is furnished and maintained differently. Aston rates the rooms as A, B, or C. We were placed in a B room (816, Tower A) which is supposed to be a renovated room. Clearly, the standards that Aston uses to rate the rooms are pretty low. See the pictures. Here’s a short list of problems: No carpeting anywhere, water stains on the ceiling, clogged bathroom sink, dirty grout in the shower, uneven laminate floor tiles that looked like they were put down by a 5-year-old, burn marks on the laminate island top, caked food on the island, ancient appliances, sagging beds, faded curtains that had so many holes in them that it looked like a star show at a planetarium, and the overwhelming odor of burnt bacon. The staff at the Banyan was excellent. We did not want to move that night because the kids were exhausted after the long trip. In the morning, the front desk was more than willing to move us, but admitted that the room we were in was one of the nicer class B rooms. I’d hate to see a class C. For $20 per night more, they would upgrade us to a class A, and they let us look at the new room. It was well worth the upgrade. The new room on the 27th floor had a view of the ocean. The appliances were newer, and the bathroom was in much better shape. The bathtub drained very slowly. The bedroom was carpeted while the main area had ceramic tile. Again, not much skill at laying the tiles with grout stains all over the tiles, and some uneven tiles. The curtains were shears so at 6:30 AM, we were awake with the sun. All in all, this room, though far from luxury, was acceptable. Of course, we think Hampton Inn is fancy. If you plan to come to Hawaii and save some money by cooking your own dinners, this hotel is ideal. If you just want to be near the beach, come back to the room for lunch, perhaps cook a few meals during your stay, it can’t be beat. It is just 3 blocks from the Diamond Head end of Waikiki beach. If you want a poorly renovated room, get a class B room, otherwise upgrade to A. But remember, this is not a hotel. No business center, no ice machines, no dishwashers. You make your own ice with those old plastic cube trays. If you want a hotel room, after the cost of the upgrade, you can do better elsewhere.
