We stayed at the Waikiki Banyan recently for a family vacation. First off, the hotel and the room looked nothing like the pictures. The kitchen was dirty and smelled bad. The carpet was filthy and needed to be replaced, (you never wanted to take your shoes off), the bed was lumpy and uncompfortable and the couch in the living room was ripped and also very dirty. The shower curtain was dirty and the bathroom very dated. The hotel has no central air conditioning, only a very old & noisy swamp cooler air conditioner, which leaked and did'nt do a very good job cooling the room. The elevators were extremely slow and also not air conditioned. The hotel is situated about 3 blocks from the beach and about 2 blocks from a canal, which had some of the biggest rats i've ever seen in my life! The Waikiki Banyan Aston was simply the worst place I have ever stayed and I will never stay in this "roach motel" again.

We just stayed at the hotel this month. It was a little old fashion, but it was clean. Full kitchen, dishes, soap,everything you need to cook with. Nice pool, spa,bbq area. All staff was very nice. We forgot beachtowels, the hotel let us use theirs. Coffee shop and small store on site.It is a block from the beach and the main strip. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. I would stay there again. Again the staff was very nice.

Stayed in suite 612 managed by Koko resorts. Had plenty of room - no cramping or bumping into things. Had full kitchen with abundance of small appliances, dishes and utiensils - also a washer and dryer. Saved a bundle on meals. Excellent recreation area at sixth floor. Space was twice as much as most hotel rooms. Bed was most comfortable we have had in a rental.

I stayed at the Aston at the Waikiki Banyan for senior prom. I chose to have a big room because my boyfriend's brother was staying with us. Anyway, at check-in me and my boyfriend were all dressed up and already late for prom. They were really nice and nothing weird happened... until I got in the room. The sliding door leading out to the lanai was WIDE open, the room didn't look like what I ordered online, and it looked stupid because there were not enough objects to fill such a big room. Also, where there was suppose to be a nice bar area, there was a ratty and lawn looking table with straw/bamboo type chairs that had holes and tears in them. Well I wanted to call to complain, but I didn't have any time because I was already late for prom. So me and my boyfriend left while his brother stayed back in the room.Later into prom night we get a call from my boyfriend's brother and he said that there were dirty towels under the sink that were not from any of us!After prom we went back to the room and I called the front desk to tell them that when I went into the room before leaving the sliding door was wide open, there were dirty towels, and the room is NOT what I had ordered. He kept asking, "was there someone else in the room while you were gone?" I kept telling him that shouldn't matter because all of this happened BEFORE I LEFT FOR PROM!! He was so stupid!! I was trying to complain about the housekeeping and he just kept blaming it on "an intruder"!! WHAT??!! He wasn't apologizing for anything and it's as if he was blaming it on my boyrfriend's brother. I told him I wanted to switch rooms because this wasn't what I had ordered. He told me that he would just come up with fresh towels and make sure that my door was locked because there must've been an intruder.Half an hour after receiving my towels and making sure that my door was secure, I heard a couple people right outside my door. My boyfriend looked through the peep hole and saw the staff looking at the door and writing things down on a piece of paper. My boyfriend swung open the door and they stopped and looked at him and said, "we had a complaint about loud noise." I was just pissed!! They were blaming the noise disturbance on us when all we were doing was watching tv and talking story. When just down the hall was a family with little girls running up and down.I WILL NEVER GO BACK TO THIS HOTEL EVER AGAIN!! I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYBODY!! The ONLY thing good out of this hotel-- nice view.

My husband spent much time reviewing many hotels/condos for our vacation. We chose this condo and were not disappointed. Two blocks from the beach, the zoo, parks, Diamond Head and restaurants. The condo was clean, comfortable. We initally had one room, but when the sofa bed did not work, were moved to another room that seemed slightly bigger and was more modern in terms of furniture. First condo was more dated. Hotel staff stated they are encouraging owners to upgrade their condos. The condo is basic, don't stay here if you're looking for bells and whistles. Nice touches: full kitchen, big flat screen television, balconies facing the city, beach or Diamond Head, pool, hot tub and gas grills in common area, cheap parking ($10 daily) for Honolulu, free internet access in room. Cons: super small bathroom, limited maid service (general cleaning and making beds), hot tub wasn't all that hot, only one television and with 3 teenagers, it would have been nice to have a second television in the bedroom. Overall, very impressed with quality and service.

This was a great place to stay for our first time in Oahu. It's about 1.5 blocks from Kuhio Beach Park. To get to Waikiki Beach proper, you only need walk another 100 yards down the beach walk.While the lobby was gorgeous and could rival most luxury hotels, the building's interiors are very dated. I did though overhear one of the tenants in the elevator who said the owners are planning to renovate the hallways.We used the hot tubs and pool extensively and they were both fairly well maintained. The pool needed some skimming though.We stayed in Tower I. The unit was a little bit older in decor but it had marvelous views of the ocean and Diamond Head from the lanai . We had no problems with cockroaches as some others have mentioned.Overall, the price for the location can't be beat. We enjoyed our stay and would come back without hesitation.

We rented a Standard One-bedroom suite on the 19th floor. PROS: Our room was the next door located out of the elevator, which was very convenient. We thought that we'd hear too much noise as other tenants passed, but this was in no way an issue.Sofa Bed: Upon our prearranged request, we were issued a queen sofa bed for the kids to sleep on.As my spouse and kids couldn't get a flight out, we had to amend our reservations. We dealt with 4 different employees throughout our 5-night stay and ALL were empathetic and accommodating to our situation.We had a full kitchen with dishes, pots/pans, and a full-sized refrigerator. Dish soap and greenie-weenie were available under the sink. A 4-cup rice cooker and coffee maker were available too.Convenient store and coffee shop with internet access located in hotel. This store had mostly everything like bread, beverages, eggs, laundry soap and other supplies. During our stay, the cafe charged for internet access $2.50 every 15 minutes, or $8 an hour. Beach access: The walk to Waikiki beach took us about 7 minutes. As their add had stated, upon our request the front desk issued our 2 kids sand pails and tools.Laundry room: One each of washer and dryer is located at one side of each floor for 75 cents a load.Pool, hot tub, BBQ area, and Sam's Kitchen: The pool was located on the 6th floor. There was also a mini golf spot to practice your shot. Along this area, there were additional lounge chairs to sun bathe on. We did not use the BBQ grills, but there were about 6 available for use. Sam's kitchen sold dishes of raw meat to grill. At this grill, there were many Thai and local dishes that were extremely delicious! The red curry was one of my favorites!International night market: We were able to walk to the market in about 10-15 minutes. Along this strip, there are a lot of shops to browse through. As we had our stay in the middle of the week, it'd be safe to say that the market is available on a daily basis. Upon this strip, you can also find the gold, silver, and newspaper men - males painted or covered in such...with a monetary tip in the jar, they welcome picture taking.Laundry mat located same distance, opposite direction as the beach.CONS: Parking: $10 fee for 24-hour parking. You'd think that just being a tenant would pay your way to such a fee, but not for this hotel. If you stayed in excess of 7 days, you can pay a lower flat rate.Bedroom/bathroom: The sliding section to separate the bedroom from the main room was not able to be secured - a regular door would've been much better! The bathroom was located within the bedroom.No TV in the master bedroom.

This is a hotel of private condos. I stayed in a one bedroom suite with a kitchen, living area, and king sized bed. It was a little outdated but I was in tower 1 and was told the 2nd tower was being renovated. The location is excellent, only two blocks off of the main street and Waikiki beach. The staff was very friendly and helpful when trying to find locations or tours. The kitchen had everything necessary to make meals to either take to the beach or eat in the room. Overall this is a good value.

Most of the staff was very friendly, had excellent housekeeping staff, who were very friendly considering what they had to work with. The person who organized the tours for us was also very good, now my issuesFirstly the Banyan was a bit dated which I can live with but had to ask fora foam topping for the sofa bed which literally had springs coming out ofit.There was a strange odor in the room which I complained about butnothing done so I just bought bleach and cleaned the rooms myself. Some ofthe electrical outlet weren't working, the blow dryer didn't work nor did anything else we tried to plug in to certain outlets. Was scared of being electrocuted. Now the big problem. We were leaving on the 19th at 11:00 pm so I called the DAY beforetold front desk spoke with male, we would need a late check out and what do we need to do, he saideverything looks fine and we were OK to check out at 8:00pm at no extra cost,I even asked him again if he was sure we don't have to pay extra or moveinto a day room, he said no. The next day just happen to come back from thebeach to get something and the maid comes to the door to clean the room forcheck out told her we have late check out, she said sorry and left ,aboutfive minutes later the hotel reception desk calls told us we do not haveyou down for late check out , told him I called to confirm yesterday allwas fine he said,can you be out in 15 minutes......excuse me!! I said Ican't be out in 15 minutes my family is not even here and besides I was toldwe were taken care of. They let me speak to the manager who was rude toldme if can shower and pack in 15minutes for check out I could leave the bagsat the front counter. Told him no I can't do that nor am I willing since Iwas told it was taken care of and I did call to confirm. He told me no onewould tell me that?? Essentially calling me a liar, he said the room isbooked, told him that was now his problem, we are not leaving till we getpicked up to leave for the airport. He said he is charging us $165 forstaying plus charging us another night for the safe. Told him I'm notwilling to pay that, I said if you gives us time we can move to day room toshower and get ready for flight would be willing to pay $50 or so for latecheck out. He said no too late, I have your MasterCard printout and will becharging it $165. My husband came back later and themanager told him essentially the same thing but changed his story a bitsaid I couldn't tell him if I spoke to a man or women and that the roomisn't booked??Also I have been on trip advisor and have seenpeople comment how cooperative management was they also were leaving at8:00pm exact time we were and they only charged them $50??? I would never stay there again

We always stay at the Waikiki and have never been disappointed. Again this trip in March proved to be excellent. Our room was one of the updated ones in Tower 2. We had great house keeping service and a very clean room. Everyone that works here is always so pleasant and happy. A+The Bolings

I would recommend this hotel for families. We have 3 children under 6.Pros: close walk to the beach, lots to do for the kids, basketball, playground, pool, very clean. Suites have everything you need. We really like the daily housekeeping. Staff was very nice. Cons: Rooms need to be updated, Carpet and floors in the kitchen and bathrooms have seem better days.. I didn't like how they charge for everything, you have to pay to use the barbaque, basketballs, golf. It's quite noise on the street side, would recommend to be on poolside.

We stayed at the Waikiki Banyan on our trip to Hawaii. We were very happy to say that we had a very nice trip to Oahu! The condo was nice, the view was nice and the help at the front dest was excellent. We would like to take this time to say that Bre-Ann Krystofer worked the front desk for Expedia and she was remarkable! Her service and dedication to making the customer have a great vacation was well appreciated by us. Bre-Ann was very helpful on booking excursions, what tours to take, what sights to take in, and information and savings on our rental car. She was very patient and helped everyone out, while always keeping a smile on her face. Thank you Bre-Ann! We will definatley go back there and stay again. I do have to end this with the bed was hard, if the bed had a softer mattress it would have been even better! Thank you again! The Hendersons

Has pretty good curb appeal upon arrival, but once you wait 5-10 minutes with all your bags for the elevator the luster fades. The rooms are exactly what you pay for. They are all extremely outdated and quite unsanitary. We definately had to do a complete cleaning session before putting our personals away. Although the main beds aren't too bad to sleep in the hide away beds were extremely uncomfortable and not even close to being satisfactory to sleep in. For a family of 4 (2 adults and 2 kids ages 3 and 9) that meant we all had to squeeze into a king bed due to the lack of availability of another suite. The location was pretty good, we were only a couple of walking blocks away from the beach which made it pretty convenient with the kids. Shopping and dining were all close as well. So if you are not worried about overall cleanliness or if you are looking for a quick, cheap place to lay your head with VERY slow elevators (seriously slow) this is an alright place... But if its here you will stay for your entire vacation this is not a place i would recommend at all.

Hawaii was our last stop before heading home after 4 months of travelling. We were to stay 10 nights, paid a deposit for 2 nights, and left this hotel after the 2 nights. Check in was fine, you are given a small vinyl bag (more on this later) got to our room, had call maintenace to fix the air conditioner as it was making so much noise. The response time was quick. Breakfast - breakfast on the beach or so their website suggested. Breakfast is served between 6.30 - 8.30am. We are on holidays and want to sleep in. Well it doesn't happen at this hotel. The vinyl bag is to put your breakfast in. The food is served in small plastic containers, tea, coffee and u juice in foam cups...yuk! There are no tables and chairs to sit, only banana lounges and small low chairs. So we sat in these low chairs (if you have a bad back or knees you are in trouble), started eating and it starts to rain. Nowhere to go, but into the reception area where they tell you to move!! The lifts are so so slow, you walk up the 10 flights or so alot quicker. When we checked out after the 2 nights, were weren't even asked "why are you leaving". They missed out on another 8 nights of paying accommodation which can mount up to a lot of moeny, but obviously they didn't care. We found another hotel - The Outrigger Waikiki on the Beach...much much better. The location of the Resortquest is good, but that's the only good thing I can really say about it..

2nd stay at the Banyan. Still our favorite hotel/condo. Great for families, BBQ, tennis courts/Basketball, pool, 2 jacuzzi's. Nice ambiance, nice people, close to all in Waikiki. Newly redone fast elevators. Only one thing, bring your own food!!! Purchasing food stuffs from market/Walmart/Sam's is almost triple compared to the mainland.
All I can say it that there were bugs like crazy in this hotel. There are stains on the floor and ceiling and the rooms don't get cleaned very well. But the lobby is nice..

Great place for a family of five (us Families of Five know how hard a hotel to accomodate us all is to find!) My husband and I and our three children, aged 10, 8 and 8 stayed here for 10 days in January. The room was a bit dated, but whatever, that makes no difference. We slept the 3 kids in the bedroom, we slept on the pull out coach (yes, it was a crappy mattress, that's the only negative thing I can think of at this hotel). There was plenty of room for us all. Kitchen was nicely equipped, but did not have a baking sheet (wasted $7 on frozen fires that we could not cook). I did call the staff, but they do not have any there (I'd suggest to management to go out and get some so that they are available on request, a baking sheet is an essential!!) The pool was great, got lots of sun (from 2:30-4:45 ish it's in the shade), far more than any other hotels we saw. It was great to have BBQ's to use ($2.00 for one hour, you have to have quarters). Go to Safeway (a 15 minute walk there, $10 cab ride back with your groceries) and stock up. We spent $180.00 in food, ate out only a hand ful of times. At the pool deck you can rent basketball, tennis etc (I would recommend to the management that this should be FREE, it was $5 or something like that, common, we payed to be here, give people a break!) The hotel is close to the beach, 8 minute walk. GREAT LOCATION. This was a great hotel, we would recommend it to anyone who wants a place with a kitchen...Save your money for tourist attractions, not eatting out!!

So the Aston rents out privately owned condos. The result: you take your chances and our luck ran out this past holiday season. The pull out couch in the living room was so old and bad that we had to put the matress on the floor to get any sleep, and you could see tha plaster through the paint. And old tired, but over priced room.We will defintely never stay here again.

We stayed at a condo here for 2 weeks over Thanksgiving and into December. It was spacious, clean and well taken care of. Everything we ever needed was supplied in the condo. It had only 1 bedroom but it had a murphy bed which was queen size. Our son and daughter-in-law used that when they came to visit. The people were very helpful. The view was wonderful of the mountains especially at night. It was a short walk to a wonderful, quiet beach with great snorkeling. There was even a Farmer's Market held every Tuesday and Friday right behind the hotel. We would recommend this very highly - not a luxury place but very comfortable and wondeful.

I stayed at this property for 2 weeks with my 2 very young children (my eldest just turned 2 and my baby is almost one), my husband and my mom. The room was easily big enough to accomodate three adults and 2 kids without feeling cramped and the hotel provided a crib for the baby at no charge. The full kitchen was perfect for our needs and the room was kept very clean by the housekeeping staff. The furniture was VERY dated and in poor repair (major rips and tears on the sofa for example) but for the amount of time we spent in the room, I wasn't about to complain. Cleanliness was more important and it was kept clean! The pool deck was quite windy and the pool was cold for the kids, but why would you stay at the pool when the most amazing beach was just a few minutes walk away? The Aston at Waikiki Banyan is perfectly situated to a section of Waikiki beach with a wonderful breakwater, creating the most tranquil lagoon for the children. We could play in the water with our kids without any fear of surf causing undertows or sand disturbances on unsteady young feet. We'd go to the beach in the morning and not return to the hotel until later afternoon...and our 2 year old could EASILY make the walk to the beach, so anyone that complains that this hotel is far from the beach has a rather distorted sense of a far walk. The playground on the pooldeck was fun for the kids for a quick outting to keep them occupied, and the little restaurant (I think it was called Sam's?) on the pooldeck served really good thai food. My baby ate the PadThai every 2nd day for lunch, she gobbled it up!The front desk staff were very helpful with bus, trolley and selfguided activities and were very accomodating when arranging a late checkout since we had an overnight flight and didn't leave the hotel until very late evening on checkout day.There are free hula shows every evening near to this hotel; it's easily walkable to the hula platform at the beach, the Royal Hawaiian Centre or the Int'l Marketplace. Tons of free entertainment in this town - wonderful for small kids that aren't ready for a full-on luau but still want some evening activities showcasing the beautiful Hawaiian culture. We didn't rent a car and absolutely felt we didn't need it since everything was walkable from the hotel.Overall, despite the dated decor, this hotel was a gem and I'd happily return in a heartbeat. Wish I was still there!!!

My two sons (ages 6 & 13) stayed for 2 1/2 weeks. The room is spacious and the kitchen is perfect with everything you need. Location was good, away from the noise of Waikiki but a short 5 minute walk. We were upgraded to a nicer view when we checked in. The parking is so convenient-- $10 a day/ $60 per week, and there are always spaces near the elevator. The pool and play area were nice. There were no surprise extras on our bill when we checked out. We were very happy with our stay and will definitely stay there again on our trip this year 2010. The value for the money was perfect.

Thank you Banyon for a wonderful stay in Honolulu. We stayed on the 9th floor, which was classed as standered, therefore did not have a mountain or ocean view. We overlooked the barbeque & pool area, which was fine. Any view in Hawaii is wonderful. It was great having a condo to do our own cooking and to have the space to move around. My husband's favorite spot was the barbeque area, as we met so many people from around the world. It was a great social place to gather. Very reasonably priced at $2.00 to use the barbeque. The house keeping staff were great! Our room was always sparkling clean. The only problem we had, was that a few times our room was not cleaned until around 4:00 p.m., but once we mentioned this to the desk staff, they came earlier in the day, which was great! The couch and chairs were a little worn, but the plus's outweigh the worn furniture.If you are booking a tour, book with the agent at the front desk. She was fabulous and had us all organized. She definatley knows her stuff. I would not book a tour from one of the many people you see on the street, as the cheap price usually means there is a catch - i.e. sitting through a high pressured time share presentation or the tour not being legitimate. Once again, the gal with Expedia was Fabulous! The desk staff was wonderful and wanted to make sure our stay was enjoyable. Our flight home wasn't until 11:15 p.m., we so requested a late checkout and they were able to accomodate us for a fee of $50.00, which was worth every penny. We had the room until 6:00 p.m. The desk fellow called us and said he would extend our time for no extra charge, which was greatly appreciated, as we went for dinner at 5:30 and had no place to go later. Our shuttle picked us up at 8:15., p.m., so this enabled us to go back to our room after dinner and gather our luggage and freshen up.The only complaint I have is the phone charge of .75 cents for a call. This really added up, as we called home to Canada often to check on family. Although I used my prepaid phone card, the .75 cents added up quickly. I would recommend using the payphone in the lobby. We would definately stay at the Banyon again. It is a very well run establishment and is affordably priced. We will be booking at the Banyon again next year!

This was our 6th stay at the Waikiki Banyan and, while not fancy, they keep trying so we keep going back. They have the nicest housekeepers! Love the new look in the elevators and that we hardly ever had to wait for one this year. Our unit was better than some we've had, tile floor in living area, upgraded appliances in the kitchen and a comfy bed. Parking is easy and, for Waikiki, affordable. We like the quieter and cooler mountain view side of the Mauka Tower. The coffee shop is a great addition, and every time we walk through the lovely open-air lobby we know we're home!
People are open, warm, and inviting. Everyone is a cousin or auntie and the beach is a wonderful way to relax :)

#1 Don't use their phone for long distance. lIke anywhere else they are providing a service to make money. The conection fees are outof this world.get calling cards use the payphones on the main floor. My phone bill was over $300.00 DollarsPlace is great if you are out and about everyday. Great fast way to get out of Waikiki by driving. Safeway is a short drive away.You save lots of money cooking for yourself.The room itself was poor, but heck you are in Hawaii, but for the price I payed it was not worth it but it is about the any ok place to stay that has a kitchen. Can I say Rock and Hard place.The Carpet was dirty and old, the kitchen was under supplied. Had to go to Costco and walmart to get knives that would cut.... ECT there was lots of paint peeling from the walls, the shower room was a fright.the window curtins were torn threadbear and tattered, so sad, could only sit on 1 chair in the kitchen the rest you butt would have gone through the center and I'm only 155lbs because they were so oldThe pool is small and shallow ( designed for kids Small ones) The sun deck does not get much sun. But why go to Hawaii and stay in the hotel. Get a car explore the island. Drive 1.5 MPH in rushhour LOL I love it :-). When I come home I feel like my rush our is a sunday drive.This hotel is great if you are only going to sleep there and cook.If you want a nice place to hang out don't come here.The only great thing was one staff member of the houskeeping group. If I ever stay here again I will request to be on her floor. Because of the great customer service and Ohana we receaved from her I will concider staying at this hotel again. and my family goes to Hawaii at least once a year.Ps If you are driving in Hawaii they don't use the turn signal, so have an eye and watch the cars around you and read the car body language, that is how you know they are changing lanes. Also don't honk your horn they concider it quite rude.Costco is the place to get cheep food and gas. The Sushi is great there and get the made in Hawaii BBQ sause the one with the red white and green lable best stuff in the world( it is called the Korean BBQ I think).Eat at least 1 meal at buzz's in Kailua, so good.I enjoy my stay if I avoid the tourist traps like Waikiki.There is a gym close it is a 24hr fitness and you can run on a tredmill overlooking waikiki bay so cool.Hit Hawaii and have funCheers chris

We came to Hawaii to enjoy the sights and sounds of the island and to get away from the cold canadian weather.We got in late and found the room did not have a king size bed we had requested .Called the front desk who said they would see what they could do the next day. We made do by putting the beds together.As promised they had a king size available the next day but we chose not to change rooms as our room had a great view on the 26 floor of the 2 tower.The travel expert .hotel help ,coffee shop and store employees were very helpful .This hotel is quiet, and comfortable and we loved it .They certainly became our "Ohana" while we were there. Mahola!!!!!

Convenient to beach, bus stop, shopping and restaurants. Rooms were decent size. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Bedding was clean. Carpet and couch were dated. The couch was ripped in several spots. We liked having a kitchen as it opened up options instead of spending a lot of money for every meal. A good value for $99/ nite, but wouldn't spend more than $120. A good option for families or if there for other reasons, but stay away if you are on a romantic getaway. Also, the convenient store downstairs does not offer convenient size goods for short stays, i.e. bread, condiments, so plan accordingly

I would highly recommend this hotel, especially those with children. We stayed there for 5 nights and wished we were there longer. We were fortunate enough to get a renovated room, which was fantastic. Although they are only one bedroom, they are very spacious and easily fit our family of four. Nice and clean and wonderful views. Having a kitchen is a necessity as far as we're concerned as it allowed us to make a few meals in our condo without having to spend a fortune on eating out all the time. The facilities are great - just perfect. It's location is superb - close to the trolley bus stop and only a block back from the beach. I really couldn't recommend this accomodation more highly and will definitely be staying there again upon our return to beautiful Waikiki. Thank you to the wonderful staff who helped make our stay so enjoyable!

We have always wanted to stay at the Aston Waikiki Banyan and we finally did. It has a full kitchen and bath and even though we were in a standard room we had a great view of the ocean. Apparently many of the rooms are being remodeled and they look great. There is a really nice pool, 2 spas, play equiptment, tennis, basketball and barbque's. It is only a block from our favorite beach in Waikiki. We will usually go to Oahu every year and we will definitely be staying here again next year.

The hotel is well maintained and since we have little children (7 & 4 yrs old), space is our main concern. The room is spacious enough for my kids to run around also we enjoyed very much on their hot tub/spa for family and the playground.
The room was very nice and clean. Location is excellent - walking distance to beach, restaurant and International Market. The mountain view from our window was outstanding.

This was our second year staying at the Banyan and as last year everything was perfect, the staff was super friendly and the playground and pool very convinience for our daughter, I will defenally stay there again next year!!!!!

Supposedly, when we were making our reservations, we were not going to have a view of the ocean, but lo and behold, we did, and it was a great view! I loved the room, It had plenty of room for the family. All of the staff were so helpful and nice, and one of the staff recommended who I should rent a surfboard from, and who I should take my small brother and sister to for surfing lessons. It was a fantastic and reasonably priced recommendation too! I was a little worried about the location, because I didn't want to be too far away from the beach, but it was great. Far enough back that the traffic and noise was significantly decreased, (but that could have been because I was on the 27th floor) and it only took a couple of minutes walk to get to the beach. Thanks for a great stay!

We originally had this hotel booked for 5 nights, but ended up staying for only 2. Why? We would have made it only for 1 night, but the other hotel that we wanted to switch to was all booked. We were quite shocked and disappointed in the room. The beds were so small, and extremely uncomfortable. They were so hard! Since there were three of us, one of us had to sleep on the the sofa bed. And that was on the other extreme of terrible! It was so soft, and springy. Man. Everything in the room was very old and outdated. The bathroom was very tiny, with a sliding door concept , and the wallpaper in the bathtub was ancient. The sink was very low, and that takes into account someone like myself who is 5'2. I felt like a giant leaning over to use the sink. Hilarious. And of course, who could not forget mentioning the television. It was like 30 years old. And the buttons didn't even work properly. We couldn't flip channels up and down, only up. You would think they could get modern, coming of age, new t.v.'s for the rooms seeing that they are so darn cheap now. We didn't even want to turn on the t.v. I would say that the only up side of staying here is the space, and that you have a full kitchen to use as you please. If you don't think the bed is the most important item for overall hotel satisfaction, and don't care what you sleep on, i.e., a rock, by all means go for this hotel. And if you really must stay here, I wouldn't recommend getting a room any higher than the 20th floor, or more. We were on the 37, and it was terrifying just sitting out on the lanai. Well that's another story, if you don't care for heights. The elevator was my favorite part of the hotel. It was new. But, then again it took so long to get up to our floor....So in conclusion, go for the Waikiki Circle instead. It's tiny, but it's right across from the beach. It was the same price as this one. The view takes your breath away.

Located conveniently a block away from Waikiki beach, my condo at Waikiki Banyan was clean, spacious and had a nice mountain view (they upgraded me at no cost). The roll-away bed was less tha ideal for a teenager. The furniture and TV are dated but acceptable for a short stay (3 nights for us). We walked to the beach and the international market. Parking was only $10 a day with in-out privelages even though spots are rather small. After checkout, we were provided towels and access to showers to change before heading back to the airport for evening flight home. The pool is small, unsupervised and full of rowdy kids (during my stay). I suggest sitting in the balcony with a nice drink and enjoy the view instead. Ask for a room on the higher floors with mountain view.

This was our second time staying here because of the package deal we had with Alaska Airlines. The room was clean when we arrived. I expected to have the same look from our stay last time. We were in Tower 1, on the 36th floor. Had a beautiful view. This time we were located on the 14th floor, Tower 1 again. Wasn't bad. However, the outlets were hard to plug in any appliances. The housekeeping staff were excellent and very accommodating with friendly smiles. It was my daughter and grand-son's first time in Hawaii. So they enjoyed themselves. Not far from the beach and the shopping areas. Mahalo... Liz D.

Hotel reservation was for the Aston Pacific Monarch, one bedroom, ocean view, queen bed. Went to check in and were told we were randomly switched to the Aston Waikiki Banyon and were assured to get the same room type. At the Banyon we were told to come back at check in time (3:00pm). When we came back, we were put in a room with 2 double beds. Went back and said our reservation was for a queen bed. They didn't have any available. After spending over 1/2 hour trying to get into the right room - they finally pushed 2 twin beds together to make a king bed. Our feet hung off the ends!The carpet in our room was filthy! It needed a steam cleaning! Feet turned black after walking on the floor, made sure to wear shoes. Furniture was also dirty. No one would sit on the chair or the stool cushions, because they were so dirty. The bedroom curtains were tattered. There wear tears all over them. Some of the electrical outlets didn't work either. The view was nice, and the kitchen was convenient, but the room was just disgustingly filthy. Location was nice, lobby was nice, staff was pleasant, however we would not stay here again due to the lack of cleanliness of the room.

We stayed at the Resortquest banyon near waikiki beach. It needed at least a 10 minute walk to get to the best spots in honolulu. The place its self was pretty and relaxing however we didn't feel safe at night and caught taxi's home each evening. Ala Moana Shopping complex kept my wife and teenage daughters busy for days. Pearl harbour was very emotional and we are Australian.

We spent nine nights at the Waikiki Banyan after booking through a UK travel company. The first thing to say is that it is in a great location and we were lucky enough to be able to see the ocean, which is just a couple of minutes walk away, from our 17th floor balcony. As other travellers have said, the rooms are starting to show their age but we had no serious complaints with ours in Tower 1, which was kept spotless by the housekeeping staff. There is a safe in the wardrobe which proved very useful to us, although there is a charge of over $2 per day to use it.The staff at reception were always friendly and ready to try and answer any inquiry and we also made use of the Expedia rep who shares 'front of house' with them in order to book various trips and activities, which were by and large very good value (if you've never tried quad biking before, book a trip to the Kualoa Ranch - it's tremendous fun).I wasn't sure I would like Waikiki after watching 'Stephen Fry's America' but the resort won me over with its vibrance, cleanliness and joyful Aloha atmosphere.One final tip.....if you want to hike to the Manoa Falls, take some rainwear!

Am posting here, but really we 'cheated' and booked through homeaway. Advantages are that you 'see' the unit you're getting, threre's free parking, and the owner left lots of 'extras' like boogie boards, beach chairs etc. It had the feel of someone's holiday home and we were very impressed. We stayed in 1214, which was a corner unit with a queen bed in the bedroom, queen sized sofa bed in the lounge, and owner left inflatable bed with extra bedding, as kids don't like to share! There was a laundry opposite the room, and being at the end of the corridor it was very quiet. We only once encoutered llift problems when two out of four were out of service, but this was fixed within the morning.Great location - easy walk to beach, bus stops outside, trolley bus stops outside next door hotel. Yes, this is the family end of Waikiki, so don't expect upmarket shopping, but hey, you can have that if you want to pay twice the room rate and stay further down the town. All walkable from hotel anyway. Pool a bit small (but the ocean is pretty big, so...) and the recreation area is a good size, with enough BBQs to service everyone who was there. Excellent for a family holiday if you want to self cater.

Only good thing to say is it is two blocks from Waikiki Beach other than that we hated this hotel. Rooms are dated with 1970's furniture, bedspreads are acrylic, carpeting is made of fiber that when you walk on it it gives the same sensation as nails on a chalkboard. The wall in our bathroom was damaged previously damaged and instead of trying to fix it they spackeled over it and tried to cover it up with paint, but it doesn't work, there is still a large indent in the wall. No shade near the pool, No restaurant nor lounge to have drinks in while waiting for members of your group, No room service. No fans in the rooms to circulate the air. Air conditioner is a huge unit in the wall off the lanai. Overall a miserable place to stay.

Just got back from 8 days in Waikiki and really enjoyed the area although it can get a bit hectic at times. If you are looking to get away from the rat race you are in the wrong area. I enjoy the energy of a big city so I didn't mind it at all. My family all got separate rooms so we sort of had a cross section of the one bedroom condos. We all reserved standard rooms but all got a free upgrade which was a nice surprise. Each tower 2 condo was a carbon copy of each other but the little touches here and there made all the difference. Our condo was the one made of sticks, my sister's family (2 adults, children 14, 11) got the one made of brick, and my dad and brother got the straw house. Sister's (floor 35) had a larger tv, ceiling fans in the kitchen, and access to the bathroom from the living area. My family's condo (2 adults, children 20, 17, floor 27) was serviceable and exactly what you would think you would get. Not fancy or classy but like staying at your friend's who had no interest in dressing the place up. Dad's (senior and my younger brother, floor 16 with ocean view) had a bare bones condo. Probably exactly how the place came when they built the place in the 80's (my guess as far as decor). Nuts and bolts: Pool area and hot tubs are nice but seemed overrun with the kiddies. Parking ($10 a day, $60 for a full week) was reasonable and quite possibly the cheapest in the area. Internet access is now free but is not necessarily wireless. Bathroom is small but the living area and bedroom were roomy enough. Beds were pretty cheap and minimal, sofa bed was probably even worse although the kids didn't complain about it. Balcony iwas narrow but enough room to sit and put your legs up. Mountain view had a nice breeze in the evening and lights were quite beautiful. Dad's ocean was nice during the day but didn't get the trade winds that cool off the evening. Probably need to be over 28th floor for really nice ocean view. Bottom line? Try and preview your room first and remember expectations might be met but probably not exceeded. I hope I don't sound too negative. Did I mention we all had a great time?!!

Stayed here for 3 nights before our cruise aboard the Pride of America. Picked this place on the recommendation of my brother who had stayed here before. Shared a 1 bedroom with my partner and my mother. My brother and his family also had a one bedroom. When we arrived, we asked to be placed in one of their renovated condos. Our desk clerk (Cliff?) told us all the condos have been redone and we have been upgraded to oceanview. I mention that it was my birthday and was promised chocolates that I never received. We were given two condos on the 24 floor in tower 1. It seems they were the only two rentals on that floor which was fine with us. We always seemed to be the only ones getting on and off on that floor. Room was clean, well kept and everything was in order. There was no a/c in the bedroom, just the living room. My partner and I slept on the very uncomfortable sofa bed with it's thin mattress. We awoke with back aches each day. The front desk was very nice and eager to please. Be sure to use your free travel bag coupon at the expedia desk. The bag came in handy our entire trip. The coupon is given with your room key. Parking is $10 a day. Watch out for the clearance in the garage. . I was afraid our minivan roof was going to hit the top of the ceiling. All in all a good stay.

My family and I stayed at the Banyan about 5 years ago in three different condos. Since each of the units are individually owned and maintained the condition varied but I was able to get an idea of the different locations, views and conditions of the building.We stayed there again recently and I was surprised at the condition of the three units. All were in very good condition and were very clean. We all had 1 bedroom units, which consists of a full kitchen, living room (with sofa bed), bedroom and bathroom. The bedroom and living room were separated by sliding doors. Nice to have that since the kids went to sleep before us and we were able to not have complete lights out.We stayed in tower 2 and it seemed that the elevators were renovated recently as well. The reasons why we stayed there included location to the Waikiki beach (about a 1.5 blocks), a kitchen and a reasonable price.The beach closest to the Banyan is behind the breakwater wall. It’s great if you have young children that can’t swim yet and can’t handle the waves. Staying in a condo is great since we normally don’t eat a large breakfast, we were able to easily prepare breakfast and a few light meals that otherwise we would have bought. There is a very new Safeway about a mile away so we were able to stock up on groceries very easily.Banyan has paid self-parking within the building. Very convenient if you are planning on renting a car though it’s a typical lot in a big city (spaces & navigation are quite tight!)Banyan is very close to the Zoo and aquarium and is a few steps from everything that Waikiki has to offer. It also has a pool, play structure and tennis courts. Its different than a typical Waikiki hotel but many conveniences make the stay enjoyable.

We arrived at the Banyan about nine o'clock in the morning. Knowing that check in time was at 3pm, we were very surprised that we got an early check in to our unit. We had originally booked a 1bedroom standard room, but were given a free upgrade to a 1bedroom ocean view room upon check in. We stayed in room #3307, which was a renovated unit & was beautifully decorated. Cherry wood cabinets in the kitchen & bathroom, granite counter tops, & new carpet. From the balcony, we could over look waikiki city, diamond head, & a good view of the ocean. It was very convinient to have a kitchenette too, saved us alot of money for breakfast. The front desk were always very kind & jason had printed out directions to get to pearlridge. I'll definitely be returning for the 3rd time next year. Mahalo Waikiki Banyan for a great stay! ;)

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Banyan for 10 days at the end of May/beginning of June. There were 4 of us, including 2 kids (ages 7 & 10). In our opinion the condo could do with a makeover as the furnishings and carpet are a little old. However we found that the room met all of our needs. It was great having a full kitchen - we saved a lot of money making breakfast most mornings. The beds were comfortable and we didn't have any trouble sleeping!The resort is in a great location - close enough to all the hustle and bustle of the main part of Waikiki, but far enough away that the noise didn't bother you.The only complaint that we had was that the pool closed for 5 days for "urgent" maintenance 3 days after we got there. Considering it was the beginning of the summer season, we thought that the timing could have been a bit better. It would have been good if there were arrangements in place for guests to use another condo's pool close by. Having said that, the ocean was a block away so we still got to swim. With young kids, we found that it was easier "popping down to the pool" for an afternoon swim, rather than going that bit further to the beach.We hired a car for the entire time and we found this really useful. Although the public bus system is great, we were in a position to do what we wanted, when we wanted. Parking cost around $10 a day and you could also get a weekly rate.This is a really good place for families travelling with kids ... as long as the pool is open!

Just came back on Tuesday from Hawaii. Travelled with my sister and parents after getting a great deal. Must say that I was a little nervous after reading a few of the reviews, but was pleasantly surprised. Yes, the hotel is a little dated, and if you're looking for super luxury, this may not be your place. But for us, it was perfect. The kitchen made it easy to cook which lowered our costs significantly (even if groceries do cost more over there). The pull out couch wasn't exactly comfortable, but we made due. The staff was very nice and helpful. But the best part for us was the location. A block away from the beach, a few minute walk to the International Market, and pretty much steps to anything else. This was very helpful since my parents like to take walks in the morning. They were able to get some coffee and watch the waves at sunrise. We would definitely stay there again.

We stayed 2 weeks during Christmas time. Very satisfied. Everything is close (few minutes) beach, zoo, restaurants, grocery, etc.. There is an outdoor food market in the parking lot of the kindergarden twice a week. We eat at the Blue Shrimp Truck (delicious), International Market (a lot to choose from and cheap), Ono Hawaiin Food (a little bit disappointed), Rainbow Drive (very good), Orchids (if you want a special evening). The zoo and Diamond Head worth a visit. We did the Island Tour with Enoa Tour (excellent) and we finish with the NCL cruise for the third week. An exceptional trip, Something to do once in your life.All the employees at the hotel did a good job.If you want something luxury, pay twice and go in a more upscale hotel.

After reading several "negative" reviews on the property, I must say that anyone who wants to stay should do so first hand before you take the word of a few! The place is nice, peaceful, great service, wonderful location, and the best for families and those who want to be able to have the comforts of home!The property is going through upgrdes and room renovations and according to the staff, things are coming along well. The rooms are not dirty or not well maintained! They are very clean and accomodating which our family really enjoyed. Don't forget to try the Internet Cafe in the lobby! The food, service, beverages, and of course the tropicaal fruit smoothies were excellent! The recreation deck was also wonderful and we also liked the snack bar which hd all sorts of goodies including plate lunches, sandwiches, snacks, and shaved ice!In closing, our family had a wonderful stay as we always do at the property and we just wanted to say thanks again to the employees who make this place such a greaat place to stay when we come to Waikiki!

This Condo was rented for business purposes; I was attending to business in Hawaii. Staying in this Condo was awesome; the full size Kitchen was a god send. I had choices, the ability to eat in after an exhausting day or I could go out to dinner at the multiple choices I had to pick from. The Condo was / is beautiful. I had workspace to use my laptop with the provided high speed internet. I also had the option to sit out on the Lanai (patio) to do work. I didn't try it because I know I can't work while I'm staring out at the beautiful view. I also had the joy of watching sunsets from the Lanai or really anywhere in the condo. Being on the 21st floor was great because I slept with Lanai doors (with 8 - 10 foot opening) open every night. Another wonderful thing about the Condo has nothing to do with the condo is that I was about 5 minutes from the beach. Being a Cigar smoker I enjoyed smoking cigars while walking in the surf or the boardwalk (concrete Sidewalk) along Waikiki. I think this was the most relaxing business trip I’ve ever been on. By the way parking was a breeze, behind the building there is marina parking at $.25 an hour. So if you park your car there for $6.00 a day. Screaming deal.Thanks Charles for the ease of use and the ease of registration. I enjoyed every bit of my time in your Condo.

It seems as if the "locals" have found a free place to party and us the facilities. After speaking with a few they said, "Oh yes, this is great we rent one room, then invite all our friends and family to party. We usually use all the picnic area and pool. Bring all our own food, and their are sometimes 20+ of us. Too bad if the paying quests get mad we are here to stay." I counted 16 people in the jacuzzi at one time, soccer being played on the putting green, kids climbing in the trees and very little supervison. The security for the building were hiding in their office and feel they will insult if they ask for room keys.What does this say for building secuirity? When I pay and can't use the facilities and know no on else is paying it makes me mad. Rather not return

This place ticked all the boxes. Great location, great staff and great value for money. The staff at the front desk we're alway most welcoming and were always happy to help, with smiles on their faces. Its also in a great location, its not right on the main road, so its less noisey, but a easy 3 minute walk away. Our room with the kitchen was a great size and the pool area was really enjoyable. Great coffee shop also! Very helpful when it came to booking up trips and excursions.Can't wait to return next year!

Yes, the property is a little outdated but we found that everything was functional. The location was great. Had a super great view from the 36th Floor. The hotel staff that I dealt with were very friendly and answered every question that we had. (Still wondering about the pay coin-BBQ never seen that before). Now for the wife, she could have used a wider parking space but that's another story.

Wow, if your looking for a 3rd rate motel with 36 floors and 2 towers, you won't be disappointed. This place is very outdated and poorly kept. The smell of orange disinfectant is in the halls, rooms and elevators. Our DELUXE rooms were bad so I can't imagine what a standard room would be like. The carpets are grungy and even though we chose this place because it had a kitchen, I wouldn't have eaten anything prepared from the place. We had six units rented in our party and 4 of the 6 were in the same condition. The staff also let us view other rooms and they were all much the same... YUK... Our best DELUXE room, I took photos of and am posting. For an extra $10 per person per night, we moved across to the Marriot Beach Resort, which is a beautiful hotel. It is clean and well kept.

I am here now, much to my distress. The carpet is stained and dirty. There is a strong smell of not being clean, even though they tried to cover it up with a strong orange smelling deodorizer. We looked at 5 rooms until we had found the least offensive. The beds are hard and lumpy. The couch is dirty. I am here because Travelzoo had advertised a special. We had to pay for the room when we reserved it. I may go sleep in my car rather than try the bed. If you want to stay in a nasty hotel, then come here.

We were a little disappointed with the Aston waikiki Banyan as it came highly recommended by a friend. Our accomodation voucher stated "Newly renovated unit" on it, but there was no way the unit we stayed in was newly renovated (except maybe in 1980??). When I contact the staff I was told that none of the units were newly renovated, and when I requested we be moved to another unit, the response was NO. The unit was very dated, and a little grotty. The location of the hotel is good, but it seems it is luck of the draw as to whether you get a nice unit or not. Pete on the tour desk was extremely helpful, but the rest of the staff were a little unfriendly. Wouldnt stay here again.

After booking our stay at the Wakiki Banyan, we weren't sure what to expect as first-time travelers to Hawaii who had read a few of the negative reviews on TripAdvisor. From the moment we checked in until we left seven days later, we were throughly and pleasantly surprised with our stay. If you're expecting a five-star hotel, look elsewhere. But if you're seeking a clean, comfortable and affordable location to stay while you enjoy Oahu, this is the perfect spot. The room may need some updates like new curtains and better furniture but we didn't come to Hawaii to stay in a room and look at curtains. We had a mountain-side view but did have nice view of the ocean from the kitchen of our 12th floor room. The kitchen was a huge plus even though we mainly used it for breakfasts and for drinks and snacks when we came back to the room at night. The parking garage rates at $10 a day and $60 for the week are cheaper than other places we found in Waikiki. The staff was friendly and helpful. At check-in, the clerk asked if we were visiting for a special event like a wedding or anniversary and it said it was our anniversary. He asked what day it was and on that evening when we returned to the room a bottle of champagne and a box of chocolates were waiting for us. What a great gesture to make hotel guests feel welcome. The hotel is about 3 blocks to the beach, which didn't bother us that much because we didn't spend a lot of time there. We were out seeing other parts of Oahu. It is on the far east side of Waikiki and away from most of the shops and restaurants. It is a bit of a walk if you want something good to eat, but I would suspect that it's also in a quieter location. We didn't experience any problems with noise at all. The recreation deck seemed very nice. We spent a couple of hours out there one night after the pool had closed and it was very quiet and relaxing. We thought the Waikiki Banyan was a great value. We were able to save some money for other activities while we were in Oahu and still came away with a good hotel experience. We'd definitely stay again if we return to Oahu.

This is a good place to stay if you are looking for roomy accommodations at an affordable price in Waikiki. It was off the beaten path, but just a short walk to the beach and center of town. Our 1 BR ocean view unit was in average condition, but was clean and well stocked. Although the second tower of the resort blocked the view directly in front of us, the view was still quite nice – Diamond Head in one direction and downtown in the other. The pool area on the 6th floor recreation area was nice, and there was also mini-golf, tennis and grills available. There is a very nice café in the building that we took advantage of several mornings. This was not a resort we would want to spend our whole Hawaii vacation at, but it was just what our family of 5 needed for a couple days on Oahu.

Bayan was a wonderful suprise for us. This is the first time we stayed in a condo in waikiki, it made a huge difference to the pocket book having a full kitchen and being able to save money on the resturant fair. The condo was spacious and had a veiw of everything, Ocean, Moutain and City view. One block from the beach in tower one ( which we stayed in ). Everything was close from ABC's stores to the food pantry. We had daily room service which they did such a good job we did not need it every day so let them do it every second day which was more than enough. The Bayan is very convieniently located along the public transit route on Kuhio avenue which is the most economicaly way and environmentaly friendly way of transport. ABC store's will sell you a unlimited 4 day pass for $ 20.00 dollars,( other passes available for longer terms) or you can pay $ 2.00 adult fair each time. Specially thanks to our housekeepeking staff, very friendly and did a great job.

This was the first time to Hawaii for everyone in our group. We all had an excellent time and were impressed with the hotel. It is a little dated, but we got a great deal through our travel agent. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. The room was clean even if dated and we could get clean towels whenever we needed them. The concierge, Bre-ann was amazing and so helpful. She gave many great suggestions as to what to do and where to eat. We liked the fact that the hotel had a full kitchen. We were travelling with a young child and it was easier to be able to have breakfasts in our room.The hotel was in a convenient location and was very quiet.Overall, it was a great experience for our first time to Hawaii and because of that, we would definitely come again!

We were lucky enough to stay here for four nights in March, 2009.I am so glad we stumbled across KoKo Resorts' website. It is a small, family-owned management company just getting started in Waikiki. The service was excellent; the check-in was super easy and borrowing beach gear for the day was never a problem.We checked in the day we arrived. They were kind enough to spend the time showing us the different units available, even though they knew the first unit they recommended was the best. The location was perfect for us, away from the construction and traffc noise yet close enough to walk to anything. Parking was included and we never had to worry if there would be a space available, day or night. It was also a relief to see the spaces were roomy enough so there were no worries about other cars causing damage getting in/out of the garage. Internet access was also made available.The building is very soundproof. Even though this unit is right next to the elevators, we never heard them. Perhaps it is because tourism is down, but the reputation that they were exceptionally slow did not hold true during our visit. Even if they are slow, so what, you should be on Hawaiian time!The room was spacious and the kitchen was fully stocked with all utensils, pots/pans coffee maker etc. There are lovely ocean and golfcourse views from the livingroom and bedroom. The bed was comfortable and I really appreciated the selection of pillows. It made getting a good night's rest a breeze.We did not use the pool, spa or bar-b-q's so we can only say there were those that did and they seemed to enjoy themselves.If you want the best value for your money, with friendly staff to deal with, this is it.

This resort had the most beautiful view of the beach. The rooms were spacious and the location was perfect. However, the elevators had no air conditioning in them. We went in August when the heat was at it's highest! It took almost 20 minutes to get to the top floor that we were on. The elevators were always crowded; they need more. And by the time we got to our room, we were sweating from being in the stuffty elevator! The pool had a snack bar...that was nice.

We recently stayed here for 6 days, I traveled with both little kids and teenagers and had a great experience. The hotel staff was amazing, Pete helped us find things to do at a drop of a hat! The rooms were yes...a little outdated, but so what! we didn't stay in them too long. We had a mountain view room and a beach view room, and had no complaints at all. I was worried about bugs...saw NONE!!! The rooms were clean, and spaceous...the beds...our king matress was really hard, but amazingly we loved, the twin beds, got no complaints from my teenagers. The pool playground and bbq area was great, not too busy. The location was of course PERFECT. Just an overall great experience! They even let us check out late to accomidate our Red Eye Flight.... THANK YOU! We have no complaints what-so-ever..will surely recommend to others!!!!!!!!! P.S. rooms were good and quiet.....

Our family ages 12 to 79 now, were very happy to make a return visit to the Banyan after 4 years. We were hosted in 2 rooms on the 34th floor of Tower 2 with incredible views of the Pacific Ocean. Once again, the property didn't fail to impress. From the housekeepers, to check in staff, to management, its a great, friendly team! There were none of the elevator or insect issues others have mentioned. The entire hotel was very clean! I would once again recommend this family friendly destination! Mahalo!

We stayed at a rented condo unit at the Waikiki Banyan for 1 week. The walk to the beach is a "long block" but at the end of the block on Waikiki is a prime spot for families with children called "The Ponds". This was our first trip to Hawaii and we're planning on returning in August this year (to North Shore this time!)The Banyan has everything you need, pool, spa, ABC store just a short block away and most importantly, parking! It is an absolute must that you get a parking voucher if you rent a car.Not all rental units will be "stocked" with basics, so make sure you buy things such as dish soap! Some owners better equip their condo units with "kitchen basics" than others. Ours may have been the exception, but we did not even have salt or pepper. The rooms are incredibly quiet, no neighbor noise heard whatsoever.We ate dinner out every night, and all the restaurants that I made advanced reservations were within walking distance. I highly recommend both Tiki's and Duke's Canoe Club for dinner. ($$$) or Cheeseburger in Paradise on a "budget" night.We swam with Sea Turtles on a Mai Tai Catamaran snorkeling tour (2 hours) and I highly recommend this cat and its crew. They were terrific! our boys (ages 10 and 13) spent a full hour swimming with sea turtles just 10 feet below the surface. Be sure to give the sea turtles plenty of room (5 feet min per federal law) and do NOT buy the Mai Tai cocktails that this outfit sells, they do not contain much, if any, alcohol! :)Enjoy! If you're on a budget, and want a great place to stay with young children, the Banyan is it!

Aloha,I am a reitred airline employee and my husband and I travel to Hawaii twice a year with or without our children. Hawaii is our home away from home. We have stayed at the Outrigger, Ohana and ResortQuest chain of hotels which are all economically priced. Our most recent stay was the Aston at the Waikiki Bayan. For the price it was really a great deal. We had and ocean view on the 37th floor that was absilutely breath taking. The staff at check in were very professional and friendly and the maid service was great. Our room was a bit outdated and the mattresses were very uncomfortable and 2 twin bids were put together to make a queen bed which was disappointing. For the price. it was clean, the elevators were fast and the pool area was nice. The hotel is approximately 5 blocks from the beach and away from the the shops. If you are looking for an area that is less conjested, this is the perfect place. We are going back to Hawaii for 6 days in May but will look at other accomodations because the bedding was too uncomfortable. If they upgrade their mattresses this would be a great place to stay! Aloha and Mahalo

I had originally booked 2 nights at Aston ResortQuest Wiakiki Beach. When I got to the checkin desk, I was told I didn't have reservations. The attentant checked with other ResortQuest hotels and found that my reservation was moved from the Wiakiki Beach to Pacific Monarch. They then moved me to The Wiakiki Circle. I was not happy at all. I had stayed at the Wiakiki Circle in the past and thought the hotel was ok at best. I thought I had made an upgrade. To my surprise, ResortQuest had made the change for me. On top of that, I could have booked this hotel for less per night that what I had paid. I order to stay at my original requested hotel, I had to pay an additional money. Since I was dropped off, luggage bags in hand, I had no choice. Shame on you, ResortQuest. Never again.

The staff couldn't of been nicer.Once-- the manager was on his way out and we asked a question about transportation and he came back and got maps and out lined routes to take etc. He was exceptional -I think. Our rooms were great ! fully equipped kitchen,(with coffee and coffee pot) big eating bar +table and chairs, living room, lanai, bedroom w 2 dbl beds that were VERY comfortable. The room was neat and clean.-staff cleaned everyday. Newspaper delivered every day, washer and dryer @ end of hall on ever;y floor. From our lanai you could see the pool area which stretched from one end of bldg. to the other. 2 hot tubs,pool,playground,tennis court,putting green,grill area. snack bar which i would call snack "restaurant " I had the thai chicken which was delicious and the menu had @least 20 other restaurant items. The coffee shop opened @ 6:00 and had wonderful muffins, rolls and they made a great ham,egg, cheese crouissant breakfast sandwich.+ computers we used to print tickets to tours we booked. They even had a little convenience grocery store to stock kitchen,and we were only 2 blocks from waikiki beach and all the action on the main "drag". The beautiful lobby is open to the street which made for a nice breeze all the time. Hotel is in the midst of everything so its easy to walk everywhere and pop back to hotel to change and go back out.

My wife and two small children stayed here and were pleasantly surprised. The room we had was very clean (minus the carpeting, which had some stains so we kept our slippers on). But beyond that, the bathroom, kitchen and sleeping areas were very clean and neat. The room was very spacious for a family of 4. Hotel staff was very friendly and parking was cheap and not a problem. The only downside as with most hotel/condos, the elevators took a long time during peak hours (8:30-10am), (4-8pm). All in all, we will stay here again in the future.

We recently stayed at the Waikiki Banyan Tower 2 (timeshare part called Sweetwater at Waikiki) and we did not have a pleasant stay. The first part was the Timeshare Management. They were rude and were not helpful or accommodating. Every time we tried to go to the office or call them for help we were unsuccessful at reaching them. Towels are only exchanged mid-week, IF, YOU go and exchange them. The place was so outdated I don't even think my parents would have enjoyed their stay. I will say that the kitchen had been updated and considered that a plus until the cockroaches showed up. Disgusting and unacceptable. We received a "Mountain View" room, when we had requested "Ocean View". When I questioned this, I was told "No views are bad in Hawaii". Are you kidding me?! So rude. Thank goodness the beds were at least comfortable so that we could sleep. The dining area was large but was dirty and had caked on layers of I don't know what. The shower was hot and had a good shower head. The elevators in Tower 2 were fast. The elevators in Tower 1 were extra slow.

We stayed at the Waikiki Banyan from Feb. 5th - 14th and our stay was great. We rented through VRBO and our units (for 2 families) were great. One was alittle dated but still great and the other was very nice with all new upgrades. All the people at the front desk were more than willing to help with any questions that I had, Excellent Service... The overall hotel (condo) building was clean. For what we paid you could not have asked for more. We stayed at the Waikiki Beach Hotel last year and decided on a unit with a Kitchen, excellent idea especially the laundry on each floor. I would definatley stay there again, no five stay but a great place.

We booked two condos and based on the internet pictures, it seemed like a reasonable price for a "dated" but clean establishment. Upon entering our units it was clear we would be looking for alternative accomadations. The units were absolutely disgusting, stained carpets, damaged furniture, lumpy beds, bathrooms in the condition of a 3rd world public washroom, holes in the curtains, dirty walls, dirty furniture, dirty floors and the list goes on. Needless to say, it was extremely disappointing to arrive after midnight only to discover the condo was not acceptable for your family to sleep in. We have been encountering issues with the condo board in that they do not want to refund our money - which they processed two days prior to our check in (against policy) even though we did not spend a night at the Banyan. Found accomadations at the Aqua Coconut and it is fantasic. All the same ammenities as the Banyan (bbq, laundry facilities) in addition to continental breakfast, lovely fitness facility, microwave, large fridge, dishes etc. You won't be disappointed.

Hi there,My family and I stayed at one of Jackie's condos at the Waikiki Banyan. I found her web site, hawaiianvacationcondo com while searching for a place to stay in Waikiki. We stayed in the 29th floor room. It was spactacular! The pictures don't even come close to the reality of this room. Everything was exactly as Jackie said it would be. The room was clean, well decorated and fully stocked with anything and everything we needed for our stay. She even includes high quality beach chairs as well as boogie boards and beach towels. There were even sand toys for our children to play with. Jackie was a big help too! She responded to my many emails promptly and with due diligence. I would highly recommend contacting Jackie for your stay in Waikiki.

After receiving a recommendation from a relative I decided to give this place a chance. I viewed the idea of having a kitchen at my disposal a great way to avoid eating out too often and making the trip more budget conscious. After arriving at the hotel quite late at night I was impressed with the lobby and greeted by a good front desk clerk who quickly gave me the hotel room access cards and also directions to the hotel parking which is adjacent and was $10 a day. I later found this not to be necessary as there are ample free parking spots on the streets surrounding the hotel which is a treasure hunt in itself!I stayed in a room on a high floor and with an ocean view. Although the view was obstructed to an extent by the Tower 1 building (which is part of the complex). The room itself was very dated, the furniture was quite old, the carpet was worn and needed cleaning and the bathroom was also quite worn and disappointing. The force of the shower head was absolutely terrible. The lamps in the bedroom were working sporadically and the TV in the main living area had terrible reception. The beds were also very lumpy and hard and during the whole stay, myself or my family members did not have a good nights sleep. There were also cockroaches throughout the unit and even though we had it sprayed by hotel staff they returned! Frankly I avoided returning to the unit for the very fact. Considering this is a $250+ hotel room (US Dollars), it was very disappointing indeed.The hotel had a good recreation deck with a pool and two hot tubs (both extremely busy all of the time!) and the sun hits the deck allowing for great sun tanning opportunities. Unfortunately the outdoor barbecues were quite dirty and not to mention barbecuing on them was a very time-consuming process! The hotel complex also included a small fast-food shop on the rec deck, convenient store on the main floor and a coffee/expresso shop (I still prefer the chain coffee though!). The location in a quieter area of Waikiki was also a plus, and its only a block away from the beach. I tried to keep balanced in my review but I probably will not stay at this hotel on my next visit nor would I recommend it to others. The notion of a kitchen area may be a plus but I realized after going on this trip that there is a big trade off in the overall quality of the room. Next time, I will put up with the extra costs of eating out as a means of getting a good nights sleep and I know my family members agree!

My husband and I recently returned from a 9 day stay at the ResortQuest Waikiki Banyan. We were searching for an alternative to a hotel room in Waikiki and were not disappointed in our choice of the Banyan. We requested a deluxe ocean view room and the hotel put us in a room on the 36th floor of the 37 floor tower. Although the room was a bit dated we had an unobstructed view of Diamond Head, which was very impressive. The location was also very handy for a morning walk around Queen Iolani Park and close enough to the beach at Waikiki so a car would not have been necessary. There was a Food Pantry within walking distance for larger grocery purchases, and we had laundry services at the end of the hall on our floor. A small convenience store in the hotel was surprisingly well stocked.The pool and barbeque area were on the sixth floor, and although we didn't use it, there was a take out window service for food and drinks which seemed to be quite convenient. The area also had a playground area for younger children.One concern we had was that other reviewers mentioned the slow elevator service; however we only encountered a bit of delay one time. We found the check in staff and hotel workers to be very friendly and helpful.We would recommend this condo/hotel to others looking to be in a quieter part of Waikiki, and we would definately stay there again.

We just returned from the Waikiki Banyan spending 6 nights there starting December 3. We are a family of four with 5 and 6 year old children. At check in the kids were given pails with shovels, squirt toy, crayons and coloring book. This was a wonderful treat as we did not have to spend extra money on sand toys. We were in tower 1 rm 2705. This room is right outside the elevators and we were concerned at first but over the seven days we never heard a sound. The view was wonderful(diamond head and partial ocean)and chairs and table on the lanai were a pleasant surprise. The room was clean and bright. This room looked like it had some work done on it as the carpet, flooring, and paint looked new. The bathroom had lots of storage and there was enough storage for clothes as well. The king size bed was sooo comfy (pillow top, possibly new).We had contacted the hotel before arriving to request a DVD player for the kids and it was there hooked up to the TV for us. The kitchen was well appointed with everything you could need for a weeks stay. Was nice to be able to make breakfast each morning in the room and save money for nicer dinners out.The 6th floor rec area was wonderful with the kids. There is a playground with pool and hot tubs and picnic/BBQ area. A couple of evenings as we were on a bit of a budget we used the coin op bbq's (worked very well) while kids played and swimmed then had a picnic outside. It was cost effective and fun!! For free you can sign out big beach towels to use during our stay which was nice as well as money saving.The hotel is in a wonderful location to everything. The beach has an area that is blocked by a wall so that there is no waves and is good for children. As the water is very calm here you can easily see many small fish and the kids had a good time trying to chase them. The general store on the main floor seems to have anything you could need and the info desk in the lobby is very helpful if you are a first time visitor. We also found all of the staff to be very friendly and attentive. A couple of times we left the do not disturb sign on our door and housekeeping always called later in the day to see if there was anything we needed or if we would like them to come right away to clean anything. If we ever get the chance to go to Oahu again we will definately stay here!!!

I stayed here for a week (29Nov-6Dec). Did not even rent a car like what I did in Maui and Big island the week before I came here. Transportation is so convinent, bus stop is just meters away., we travel by bus to thos famous place like pearl harbour, Diamond Head, China Town...we even travelled to Dole pineapple plantation and North Shore to watch the surfing cmopetition by bus. Not to mention the Waikiki beach is just one block away, which ,my wife and I spent almost every night strolling the beach and the shpping area...Easy access to the shopping district (Kuhio) by foot.The room is spacious with kitchen and 2 TVs.Evrtything you need is almost there....we bought the food from ABC or Foodland and cooked ourselves.

Our family gathered (18 of us in 6 rooms) at the Banyan for a fun week. We chose the Banyan because of its location at the quiet end of Waikiki, the one bedroom units fit our families and the 6th floor recreation deck has a pool, kids play area, and community barbeques (can be hard to find one of the 7 BBQ's available though). The rooms are individually owned condo's and varied greatly in decor and overall condition. The rooms are clean and well serviced but even the better rooms are showing wear, particularly in the floor coverings. Our room was an ocean view, corner unit, the largest with the best view and highest price ($155/nite) but really needed new carpets. I mentioned this to the front desk and was able to view several other available rooms to find a better one. None was better.The staff were very nice and helpful, the snack bar on the sixth floor is poor. The food is not good, is expensive and the place is pretty run-down.
