It is not bad for ice cream cones but they are $4.50 for a small one. The mini mart on the main floor is small but well-equipped and run by a friendly family.There are many good restaurants nearby. Make sure you try the Mac 24/7 on the main floor of the Hilton Prince Kuhio next door. It will a nice surprise that you won't forget. Look for the 'Aloha Spirit' in the Hawaiian people, they are wonderful!

Excellent location near Waikiki beach - just across the street from the Prince Kuhio Hilton. Great price. Huge rooms with full kitchens. Reasonably clean. We were only here one night, but I think this would be a great place for a longer stay. They have a convenience store but no reastaurant. Even on the 16th floor, there was considerable street noise with the windows open early in the morning.

Our family of 5 stayed at this condo hotel for 13 days just before Christmas.We opened the door to our first room and was greeted by a white cloud of pesticide. We did not realize we were breathing all that in until we saw stunned cockroaches on the counters and kitchen floors within two hours. We have three kids, one with asthma and a heart condition and we were angry at the hotel for letting this happen without telling/warning us. We were given a choice of 3 other rooms later that evening. The elevators are very slow. Small convenient store in hotel. Water-pressure was good. TV has all local channels. Free local calls. Housekeeping was 2-3 times a week. Washer and dryers are community style on every floor. Location was great, just two blocks from the Waikiki strip. Front desk is always unfriendly or maybe it was the laid-back style that the Hawaiians always talk about. Nothing was prompt so don't expect to walk in and walk out right away.I would consider returning just because we will have 4 kids soon and condos are the only way to go when travelling with so many kids. Two blocks from the sheltered beach (the waves are blocked off by a cement wall) the kids had a blast without being smashed by waves!

I thought I had submitted a review from the hotel coffee shop a couple of days ago, but not seeing it posted, I decided to resubmit. I really feel the need to relate the positive experience my friend and I had at the Banyan.It started at check-in, which occured at almost midnight. We had originally booked a Superior City View with twin beds. Somehow, during the booking process, the "a" was deleted from the end of my first name, leaving the masculine version of the name in place. There was an apparent assumption that my friend and I were a couple, and a room with a queen size bed was assigned! The error was quickly identified and rectified and we were then assigned an Ocean View room on the 22nd floor, with twin beds.This was my fourth trip to Waikiki and the fifth property I have stayed at. It was my friend's first trip. We were both very impressed with the accommodations. The room/condo was spacious, clean and well appointed, the appliances were modern and appeared to be new. The furniture was clean and comfortable, although I cannot report on the comfort of the hide-a-bed in the living room as we did not have opporunity to use it.If I have any complaint at all, it is that the mattresses on the beds were a bit on the soft side for my comfort. As mattresses are very much a matter of personal preference, it would be difficult for any property to please everyone, I am sure.The pool/recreation area was a delight. The pool had great exposure to the sun, lots of deckchairs, a little snack bar (with a great assortment of smoothies available), tennis court, putting green and "pay-for-use", coin operated gas barbecues in place.The area is very family-friendly and indeed, the entire property appears to be family oriented. Any property or hospitality based business venture is only as good as the staff, and in my estimation, the folks working at the Waikiki Banyan are top knotch. Prompt attention and courteous responses to our queries or concerns was the norm. Cliff, one of the desk clerks, Candy, our housekeeper, and the young woman working at the Expedia desk come to mind as being outstanding and memorable. Along with the outstanding accommodations, these folks have helped determine my opinion that the Waikiki Banyan is my new favourite in Waikiki and this will not be my last visit with them.

I was a little worried about what to expect after reading some of the previous reviews but all in all we had a pretty good stay at the Waikiki Banyon. Staff were wonderful and very helpful!The room we were in was on the 34th floor in the 2nd tower so we had a nice partial view of the water and Diamond head. I suspect lower floors don't have much view as surrounding buildings would block much of it. The room was in great need of updating!! The kitchen cabinets and carpet are the original 1970's-80's decor and many things are marked, chipped and old. The housekeeping staff I am sure do their best to keep things clean but the majority of the hotel (at least our room) is in need of updates. We didn't have any problems with elevators as other visitors had but our visit was in November, not high time.The location of the hotel was a bonus, a short 2 block walk to a nice part of Waikiki beach and all the waterfront shopping. I did enjoy sitting on the lanai in the evening watching people and traffic below. Parking is extra so if you are renting a car please be aware if this.We would probably spend a bit more money and stay somewhere else next time, not because of the location but because it was not quite as comfortable as we had hoped.Mahalo

My husband,son and I stayed at the Banyan for five nights and it definitely was not what they advertised.Everything was outdated even the stove was broken,we did report this and it was never fixed or replaced.Our room was in poor shape from the stained carpet and the stained furniture to the water damaged ceiling.I even awoke to dirty blankets on the bed.I can not understand how Resort Quest can get away with such false advertising.We do not recomend this property you will be disappointed for the money you pay it.

We were hesitant to book the property because of the reviews and am happy to report, no roaches! We had just stayed in the cottages at Turtle Bay (VERY nice) and decided on cheap & cheery in Waikiki for the remainder of our trip. We needed a kitchen so the Banyan was on our short list. Randy in reservations was very knowledgeable and genuinely helpful. We had an oceanview 1 bedroom corner suite on the top floor (38th) in Tower 2 and it was more than what we expected in terms of size and location within the hotel. Although dated (the owners could put a few thousand into the room and it would make all the difference) it was clean and comfy, and the views were amazing: sweeping panaroma from Diamond Head to the Waikiki beaches.Parking was easy ($10/day) and the beach and good surfing was a quick 2 minute walk.Compared to the price of other properties right on the beach, without kitchens and subject to more traffic noise, we thought the Banyan was great value. Would we stay again? Maybe, unless we had the dough to stay at Kahala, where we attended a wedding and fell in love with the location and luxury.

we spent 10 days at the Banyon and had a nice condo/room that was dated but clean, not a sign of a bug as others might report. we were in tower I on 10th floor. rooms were cleaned each day, towels very clean and fresh, staff was extremely nice and polite. didn't mind the block and a half to beach, there is a walled area on this side of waikiki that serves to give a swim area perfect for children and we seniors - minimal wave action and no bad fishes, although we did have a couple days of jelly fish warnings but never saw one. we'll be returning in the spring to recoup from our cold canadian winter and will be booking into the banyon again.we esp liked the coin BBQs and pool area, excellent for children. Hot tubs are nice.

My family and I stayed at the hotel for 8 days during August with no complaints. The hotel was a little rough around the edges and a bit dated, but we enjoyed our stay and were very comfortable and happy. The room we had was in tower 2 (2307) with a fantastic view over the back of Waikiki, looking out to the mountains. The location is great, down the Zoo end of Waikiki one large block behind the Marriot close to the beach, restaurants and shops. The staff was very helpful and willing to help where possible. When we head back to Hawaii we would defiantly stay at the Banyan again and would recommend the hotel anybody.

My husband, two kids (age 6 and 8) and I just returned from a stay at the Waikiki Banyan (tower 2). I was a bit nervous about what this hotel would be like as I had read alot of negative reviews. However, i am very happy to say that my worry was in vain! We had a fantastic stay at the Banyan, it was close to everything, the room was great, the pool and recreation area was great and the staff were great! Yes the room decor was probably a little outdated, but who cares! The main thing is it was very very clean. The tour desk in reception was excellent with a very knowledgable lady who could offer advice and book your activities. There was a coffee shop with internet access, a mini mart and a great snack bar out in the pool/rec area. I would gladly recommend the Waikiki Banyan to anyone looking for reasonably priced family style accomodation.

I have just come back from a terrific time spent in a one bedroom condo for 14 nights. Excellent accommodation and I was fortunate to be upgraded to a deluxe condo on the 16th floor with a fantastic view of Waikiki from the kitchen window, and great views from the balcony. The staff are excellent and cleaned the unit thoroughly everyday. I especially liked the no noise rule after 9.00pm and also around the pool area during the day when the children got excited. This is a fantastic condo/Hotel to stay in for either one person or a family. I will definetley stay here in the future. I am planning on returning if not next year but the year after.There is a great childrens area and bbq area for families who wish to get together and have a party. I found the condo very roomy and big, as I have stayed in much smaller condo/1 bedroom apartments in Australia. Kind regardsSueMelbourne Australia

We chose to stay at the Waikiki Banyan because it was a good value, family friendly, had guaranteed parking, and most importantly was in a quiet location but close to the beach. Resortquest, the managers of most of the units in the building, didn't have a unit available for our selected dates. I did some researching and found Koko Resorts also manages some of the units in the WB. What a gem they are!! The unit we stayed in (Tower 2-907) had a decor theme that can best be described as "Grandma's place"; this wasn't a surprise as we had previewed pictures of a few of the units and chose the least attractive... and cheapest one.... our plan was to be outside most of the time. After reading reviews on this website about other units, I was worried about bugs. NO WORRIES!! The unit was super clean but if mismatched dishes and older appliances would ruin your vacation, this is not the place for you. There are other units to choose from and the property managers will go to unbelievable lengths to make sure you're happy with your stay. From booking to check out, they gave us 5 diamond service all the way. Elizabeth, the reservations agent, promptly answered all of my emails and advised me when she would be unavailable and another employee would handle my booking. We had a couple of special requests that they promptly confirmed and followed through with. Check in was smooth as we had the combination to a lock that was left on the door which contained our key. Guests of KOKO Resorts don't have access to the front desk at the Waikiki Banyan. Instead, Koko Resorts maintains an office on another floor that is open from 10-4 weekdays (not sure about Saturdays & closed on Sunday). For after hours emergencies we had a cell number to call. We visited the office a few times and each time we were greeted with a friendly welcome from the managers and staff, and answers to our questions. We also had access to boogie boards, surf boards, beach mats, umbrellas, binoculars, etc.. It would appear that the gear is available on a first come, first served basis but it was way beyond what we expected when we booked the unit. When I was researching accomodation options, I told the res agent that I was choosing between one of Koko's units and another unit managed by someone else. She told me that Koko Resorts was a relatively new company (started in Jan./08) and that they really wanted our business and would do whatever they could to make our stay enjoyable. From our experience, this philosophy is shared by everyone at Koko. Matt, the onsite manager, went to great lengths to make our stay enjoyable. Without hesitation, I would recommend Koko Resorts at the Waikiki Banyan! After the service we received, I wouldn't even consider booking elsewhere in Waikiki.

I just returned four days ago with my husband and two daughters from a 12 night stay at the Resortquest Waikiki Banyan. This was my 6th time staying at a Resortquest property, though we have primarily stayed at the Maui locations. I was somewhat skeptical of this property after reading other reviews but we decided to stay here anyways because of the play area, pool and proximity to the beach. Our experience with Resortquest has been to ask upon check-in to view two rooms and they have always complied. That is exactly what we did on this stay so that we could see if one was more outdated than the other. At this property, all units are individually owned and can vary depending on what the owner has opted to do. We went to our first two rooms in tower 2 and were disappointed. The beds were hard and everything was clean but outdated. We returned to the front counter and we were able to view another two rooms. The last room is what we decided to take because the carpeting was new, the bathroom was upgraded and the pullout bed seemed as if it had not been slept in. The queen in the room, however, was a different story and we had blankets sent to the room to provide more cushioning and that was fine. Our room (see attached photos) was tower 1, #3604. When you walk into the room, the kitchen is directly to your left. It had a bar area that seated 4. It was equipped with silverware, glasses and plates for 6. It had a microwave, stove and refrigerator- no dishwasher. Then came the family room and there were three doors that could be closed or stay open into the bedroom. In the bedroom was the bathroom. We also had a lanai with a partial ocean view. My parents were in tower 2 #3801 with a mountain view/ alawai view and I had other family in tower 2 #2802 - full ocean view and they had adequate rooms as well. We never saw any ants or cockroaches at the property the entire time we were there. There are laundry facilities on each floor with one washer and dryer. They were $1.50 per load each.It is interesting to note that when you walk in, there is an open air lobby, a beautiful waterfall with koi and the rooms do not convey the feel of the lobby. Yes, the elevators are being worked on. Three of the four have been upgraded in each tower. Since there are 38 floors in tower 2 and 37 in tower 1, we consistently joked about the elevator waits. I think that since there is 800+ rooms here, this would be an issue with only 8 elevators (though 6 were working while we were there). The parking garage recently increased rates to $10 per day or $60 for 7 day blocks. This is operated by a different company than Resortquest and you must pay cash (no credit cards). We booked directly through Resortquest and used our entertainment card, which has provided us a great discount whenever we have stayed with this company. Enjoy your Hawaiian stay.

Ok..there were 13 of us that went on our once in a life-time family vacation, 4 children and 9 adults. We rented 3 units..that went from alright, to ok to awful. The first room actually had a headboard etc with a king size bed, but it was also suppose to have a pull out sofa bed. It was not there. So instead that room received a cot that looked worse then a hospital bed. The stove would either get really hot or the element would not even heat up and not all of them worked. The bathrooms are super tiny and the utinsels smell old, and this was the best room out of the three. The second one had a queen bed which was fine. Very oudated though. The pull out sofa bed was awful!!! I can still feel it in my back, we eventually asked for extra blakets to soften it but that didn't really work. Then came the cockroaches...we came in one night and my husband thought he got both but in the morning when he went to go throw them out one was gone so we had our room sprayed and then they all started coming out...The third room was suppose to have a pull out sofa bed, however it had a nice label stating "BROKEN", the king size bed had no head board, the shower would go from hot to cold, the lamps did not work.....the carpet was from the 70's and even the stove was ancient...it was awful (room 801 tower 1), and they had little ants all over the counters..Well I can go on and on but I will stop there, the pool was good and the kids play area was nice and the lobby was nice. The housekeeping staff was also very nice, however I would never ever stay there again

My husband and I took our grandson to Hawaii for his 12th birthday. We stayed 5 days in Wakiki being tourists and the headed to Kona for 9 days. While in Waikiki, we stayed at The Banyon. Great place!The Banyan is located a long block from Queen's Beach in Waikiki. You can get to ANYTHING you need in 5 minutes. It's a perfect location. You must go only to the ABC stores for anything you need. There is practically one of every corner, and the prices are very reasonable. (Our grandson said these stores were one of his favorite parts of Hawaii!)Our room was on the 33rd floor, room #3310. From our lanai we could look left and see the beach and ocean, look right and see the mountains and valley. We had a one bedroom condo with kitchen and bath. The bedroom had a queen and single, perfect for 3 people!The Banyan is NOT glitzy. If you are expecting a super-resort, you will not find it here. But it is a very nice hotel, very clean and has a lot of character.You can get internet service in your room for a fee. I think we paid $29 for a week. There's also free WiFi in the new coffee cafe downstairs.The pool is small, but do you really go to Hawaii for the pool? I do recommend the EXCELLENT snack-shack at the pool. You can get all sorts of local food and hamburgers. He also has delicious ice cream and shaved ice.Yes. As warned, the elevators are incredible slow, but they are putting in new ones. They work on one at a time, and this slows down the others. Just relax and be prepared to wait. What's the hurry?Would we go to The Waikiki Banyon again? Absolutely!

We stayed at the Waikiki Banyan last year and because we enjoyed our stay so much we came back again this year. Our whole experience, overall, was again wonderful. The ladies we that we spoke with in reservations were great. Very helpful and cheerful. The room we got this time was not what we'd expected. After speaking with the Front Office supervisor, Len, we discovered that there had been an misunderstanding regarding the room type. The condo was full at the time, and room changes were not available at that moment. We understood that and were asked to wait for the next day to see what they could do. We were fine with that. The room we had been given was great, nice, clean, etc - it was just our view preference that we were requesting to change. Len handled our request the following day and to our surprise he was able to get us in the same room we had been in the year before - and totally not expected. BONUS!! His effort and professionalism were very appreciated. We had booked a tour that day we were to move which was no problem, as the staff just asked us to have our bags, food, ready and when we came back - everything had been moved for us. Bags in the room, food in the fridge - perfect!The condo is a little worn, however, well maintained at the same time. Various kinds of maintenance was occuring in our tower - always a good sign. The elevators were being worked on while we were there. We didn't have any issues about the wait times - we were on vacation, after all, and in no rush for anything. We never waited more than a few minutes. The computer room was unavailable this year as the Banyan Breeze was being worked on. The Front Office staff kindly offered to print out our boarding passes, etc for us while this room was unavailable. The rooms were clean, and attended to promptly every day. We enjoyed the fact that we were able to fix quick meals and save in that area so we could use our money on other things on the island. We found the new Safeway (behind the canal - a few blocks back). We took The Bus (not sure what number) which stops right there, and had Safeway call us a taxi on the way back.  We used the Internet service in the room and while there was a nominal charge for the service, the convenience far outweighed the cost.  We liked the location of the condo. It is a block from the beach in the quieter area of Waikiki. Nothing is too far - and we soon learned the convenience of the The Bus and used it often. Will be go back? There are 'rumblings' in our home of returning next year.... again. It's almost becoming our 2nd home.

My family which included two children (12 and 14 yrs old) came back to the Banyan after exactly 20 years since it was our wedding anniversary. We had a great time, check in was easy (and friendlier than the Waikoloa Hilton that we travelled to next!).Good things: clean and comfortable suite, regular clean towel delivery including pool towels, good TV channel selection, convenient to the beach and transport, clean pool, great views, handy for Starbucks and McD's! Overall a good deal for the price.Could be improved: a more modern bathroom would be nice, it would be nice to have a small real milk carton for coffee when we arrived, noisy air conditioning unit, the lifts were slow (although to be fair they were being upgraded at the time). The small snack shop was really hot inside, we pitied the poor shop keeper who could tolerate with the heat. Where was the aircon?As a family, we really like the Banyan, and will come back. It is a real hotel staffed by real people not a plastic pastiche of Hawaiian culture, so we felt comfortable.

I stayed here with family in 2004 and went back in 2006 with my boyfriend...trust me....it won't be my last either! It's conviently 1 block fromthe beach (Waikiki beach,one of the worlds most famous beaches) and theres SO many shops and mini cafes and little mom and pop restaurants (eat at Seaside Bar & Grill [-----], best meals 4 under $10! breakfast and dinner.)if you need groceries its a short walk from the hotel and there are ABC Stores litteraly every 3 to 5 blocks around (it's like our Walgreens!) The concierge is exceptionally nice and helpful with tourism guides and I love walking into the hotel entrance and seeing the pond and waterfall in their lobby. It has two towers and I've stayed in Tower 2 both times and had a BEAUTIFUL view of the Ocean with a sunrise EVERY morning! Almost all the rooms have balconies as well and if you're not crazy about salt water, have no fear, they have a nice size pool and jacuzzi, and tennis court and playground for your children. There's even a little mini mart in Tower 1 near the parking garage. Really....its worth the money. The rooms are like little condos with a sink. stove, microwave, and mini dining room if you choose to do your own groceries and cook your meals a couple of times a week (saves you $$$)..Hope this help...Mahalo!

Near diamond head, it isn't the "party scene" area of the beach, and it is a great hotel for families with young children. We were on the 37th floor (there are 38 floors), with a wonderful ocean view (the Marriot Hotel kind of blocks the center view, but it worked for us). Small condo style rooms made it comfortable and being able to cook anything anytime was great. (The price of groceries is high, but still cheaper than restauranting it every day) There's huge new Safeway on the same road as the zoo, not far but too far to walk. Clean rooms, housekeeping came everyday (they don't do the dishes). Pool, jacuzzi and play ground were clean and handy. The staff was very warm and hospitable. We had no problem extending 2 days. I would definitely stay here again.

So, my family and I stayed at the Waikiki Banyan on June 4th to June 6th. First impression was pretty good. Seemingly clean kitchen, clean floors, and clean bed. TV reception was no good though with every channel being fuzzy and at times, I couldn't even tell what was on. Overall though, everything seemed to be ok. So why the one star rating? The last day there, my sister ended up with very bad bites all over her arm and leg. Then I realized, I also had tiny little bites all over my arm and leg in clusters. Bed bugs. This is just so unacceptable. BED BUGS?! I am so disgusted right now with the hotel. I have never stayed at a hotel that has given any of my family members bed bug bites before. Do yourself a favor and spend a little extra on a hotel that's clean and free of creatures roaming around on the bed.

Large, clean, and well stocked rooms. I experienced no delays in the elevators. The pool was closed the entire time we were there. It is closer to Diamond Head than I like to be. The price of parking is going up I believe in June and it was already $8.00. There is no restaurant, and there are alot of catchs to the kids eat free. But over all I enjoyed the stay here.

Recently returned from our stay at the Waikiki Banyan (11 days). We stayed in Tower 1, 36th floor. The view was spectacular and the room was fore the most part, very comfortable. The only exception was the sofa sleeper which was un-useable as a bed. The mattress on it was so thin and worn out that the bars were right against my back. I ended up sleeping on the sofa itself rather than unfolding it and risking back injury.The unit was clean and well stocked. A few of the towels, however, had a sour smell. Elevators were slow.The small coffee shop was very convenient and the staff there were very friendly.I would stay at the Bayan again if I had use of the bedroom and did not have to resort to using the sofa sleeper. Good value.

I was pleasantly surprised at how nice this hotel is. I read the reviews prior to going and was somewhat nervous about some of the things other guests have experienced. I DID NOT SEE ONE ROACH the whole time I was there. I expected to see a few since I read a few roach encounter reviews but my room was roach free. The room was very spacious and the full kitchen helped keep the cost of food down. Also, the elevators were fast and efficient. I stayed in Tower II and one elevator was down but we never had to wait long for one. My daughter loved the pool and play area although I wish they stayed open a bit longer than 9pm. Staff were kind and helpful

The room had a mildrew smell when we first arrived but I had air freshers to help with that. Three of us stayed in the room and it worked out great for us. We were disappointed that the pool was closed the week we were there. Luckly the beach is just a block away. We took a few tours and it was great to have the bus/van pick us up right in from of the Banyan.People in Hawaii are very nice.The Banyan is in a great location and we would stay there again.

I just returned from a weeks stay at the Waikiki Banyan and was extremely disappointed. I had read many of the reviews on Trip Advisor so I had seen a couple that had mentioned roaches, but I had hoped that these were the exceptions and that I would be lucky enough to avoid this problem. Unfortunately, this was not the case.Our first room was in Tower 2--room 3510. It was infested with cockroaches in the bathroom and the kitchen. It was sprayed but that did no good and we had to spend 1 day of our vacation packing up all of our belongings (for us and our children) and moving to another room and then unpacking again. The second room was also Tower 2-room 2610. This room was infested with small ants in the bathroom and kitchen as well. Housekeeping sprayed twice but that also did nothing. We did not want to waste another day of our vacation moving so we lived with the ants.We were told by one person at the front desk that this problem is common and well-known to the staff and that they can't control it. My question then is why do they keep putting people in these rooms if they know they are full of cockroaches and ants? Are there some people who like to spend their vacations with bugs in their rooms, their food, their beds? I doubt it.I can say that the front desk manager that helped us through this was wonderful and apologetic and helpful as he could be. He did credit us some on our bill, but I can honestly say that I would not stay there again and I would not recommend the property to others. It is unfortunate because other than the bugs, this would be an ideal property for families on a budget.

If you are looking for a good/great value stay at a location close enough you can walk most anywhere for shopping, eating and active entertainment, this is your place. Adam and the crew were GREAT, provided great service and addressed any questions we had with professionalism and accuracy. Thanks so much. You made our week stay in Ohau memorable. We would stay there again. The room was clean, the servicing was daily, the bed was comfortable and the accomodations very adequit . Now for the down side. The TRAFFIC! Well, also the "dated" but clean furnishings. But and however, this seems to be the same general conditions here, at Maui, Kauai, and Orlando,Florida - for the price range. I think the humid/tropical environment has much to do with the conditions. So unless you want to spend big $$$ for sleeping guarters, the Waikiki Banyan is the place to stay!!! Also,Thank God we brought our Garmin 650. Again, Thanks Adam! And, room 8, Tower 2 on the 20th floor provided a limited ocean view without all the street noise. :-)

Good: Location near beach volleyball, boogie board beach area, within walking distance to zoo and aquarium. Decent location relative to shops, activities, and shopping. Staff are nice and helpful.Not so good: They are busy fixing / replacing elevators, and it needs it. too many waits for the next one... Stay on the lower floors so you can take the stairs down, and elevators aren't a problem. Also good to get to and from the pool / BBQ deck. The deck gets pretty windy, but this didn't bother us too much, the sun also tracks around pretty good during the day, and you have to shift around to follow it.We had no troubles walking anywhere with our three boys (17, 15, 12), and they really enjoyed the boogie boarding, surfing, and jumping off the dock (learn from or watch the locals first!). We had great times playing around and shopping the strip in Waikiki. Lots to see and do, and the action picks up in the evening too. We even walked to and from Diamond Head, but you'd better be in shape and ready for a slurpie when you're done! Our kids really enjoyed the hike once we got there, but they wouldn't do the walk to the crater again.We were on the 7th floor, and would highly recommend it (or the 6th) as we could easily get to the pool deck and BBQs without waiting for an elevator. We always used the stairs to go down as it was very quick. We also parked on the highest level of the parkade (5th), so we could get to our car easily.We had fun at the water slides, the North shore, cruising the East side of the island, but mostly Waikiki. We should have rented surfboards at the North Shore, but the waves were a little big for our liking.We would recommend the Aloa Moana Mall for shopping, and the 1$ theatre about 4 blocks West of the mall. They run 2nd run movies, and we went almost every night just to get out. The theater has free parking in the parkade if you get your stub validated at the theater. Hilo Hatties was kind of a disappointment, as we were expecting larger, and more stuff, but this shouldn't mean you shouldn't go, it's just our opinion.Hanauma Bay was very disappointing, as there has been such a big change since we were last there 20 years ago. Very few fish, too crowded, and you can't feed the fish anymore. I guess the tourists have spoiled it over the years, too bad.We should have taken more opportunities to snorkel, but we didn't do any research first, and our kids just wanted to play anyways.My first choice was to go to Maui, but my wife convinced me there would be more to do / see for our kids in Waikiki. She was probably right, and we were very happy with our trip.Sorry I can't give any restaurant advice, we ate in our suite almost every time, and packed lunches on our excursions. We chose to spend our money on other things. There is a smorg / buffet 5 blocks West of the Hotel, and I wouldn't recommend it as it was underwhealming to us. We have been to a lot of All-Inclusives, and this buffet doesn't carry a candle to most we have been to.Costcos are in the area. One just behind Hilo Hatties / Dole Pineapple factory, and the other is East of Waikiki just before Hanauma Bay area. Good for food, waterslide tickets, Booze, and boogie boards / snorkleling gear. Safeway is the nearest, and variety isn't too bad for a smaller store.The boys liked to feed bread to the fish in the canal, and they followed us as we walked along. Kind of neat! We also went to the Swap Meet at the Aloha Bowl stadium, it was pretty good, but a lot of repeat vendors / goods.Cheers!

We returned about a week ago from our wonderful stay at the banyan in waikiki!!! and it was lovely!! before our trip we read several disapointing reviews but when we arrived we got way more than expected.. the rooms are clean service is great attendants are nice.. It was 4 of us all in our 20's and it was wonderful. nothing compared to the reviews.. we do recomend that you book your activities once your in hawaii they are much cheaper....And you might want to rent a vehicle and drive out to the north shore, it's just breathtaking, wonderful. we have nothing but good memories of the north shore. Sunset beach is great for snorkling..The Scenerie is wonderful. And turtle bay is just wonderful. Enjoy your stay...

We stayed in a deluxe cityview 1br on the 27th floor from 4-21 thru 4-26. The staff was great.The hotel is one block from the beach which has two swimming lagoons protected by a sea wall, which is great for small children it's like a pool at the beach.The recreation deck and pool on the 6th floor is great for early monring swims before you head out for tour or drive.The best thing about the hotel was the expedia desk downstair which was able to give information about various tours and activities around the island. You can also purchase tickets there saving time on lines. The woman who helped us had the inside scoop on alot of tours as to whether or not they wre worth doing.The room itself was exactly what you see in the pictures, one bedroom, living with foldout bed, a dinette, and most importantly a balcony with a great view where the kids 9 and 6 spent most of their time in the room. Would recommend to anyone with kids.

I'd have to advise people to avoid this place...while the location is great, the apartment was very outdated, although somewhat clean. The pull out bed was simply a mattress of springs and all night the water raced up and down the walls in the pipes. we were on the 6th floor - i heard that higher up is nicer but the 6th floor was so noisy with street traffic and the water in the walls. not enjoyable. they were pretty nice on letting us store our luggage and use the pool as we had a late flight but i would try and look elsewhere first!
good hotel.Only compliant for that room was that the room curtains were too shear for a 4:30 sunrise.

We booked a condo through the owner on www.vbro.com which I've done a number of times. The condo was very nice - full kitchen, bath, living room, bedroom, lanai with a mountain view which was spectacular in the evening.We stayed in Tower II. Nice pool and hot tub.The location of the Banyan is great. Just two blocks from the beach, the Catholc Church just a block away and the Food Pantry (Grocery Store) about 3 blocks. In the lobby is a small convenience store but pricey. But works in a pinch.I would definitely stay here again.

Just came back from a week at the Banyan with a group of 17 couples and I think I can speak for the group in saying we enjoyed our stay. Yes, the elevators are slow (being worked on), yes the hallway carpets are dated (big deal-who goes on vacation to look at carpets) but the Rec Deck is great, the location is superb and the staff were very friendly and competent. It was everything we expected and good value for the money for our group. No roaches other than one on one day and the traffic on Kuhio can get a bit noisy but that isn't the hotels fault,Great stay-If I went to Waikiki again, I would stay here.MahaloSteve

If you are planning on going to Waikiki, this is such a great place to stay for the money. You are in walking distance to everything, the wakiki beach is 1 minute walking.Can't wait to go again!!!!!!!!

I stayed at the Waikiki Banyan with my wife, 2 little kids and my mother-in-law. The room was very roomy and could accommodate all of us comfortably as they provided a crib for the littlest one. If you are looking for luxury, look elsewhere. The lobby is quite nice but our room was I think typical and was quite dated, although very clean. They provide maid service every day and the whole place was very clean. The location is very good, being a mere block from the beach, shops and the zoo.The recreation area is great for kids and adults. The pool and hot tubs were clean, they offer BBQs for a small fee and a good play structure for little ones.Parking is $50 for the week.Staff was always very friendly and helpful. On the downside, be careful with long distance calls, they are extremely expensive (big surprise...), and the internet costs $40 for the week (wired). Overall very good value, clean and has good amenities.

We have just returned from a week at the Waikiki Banyan. The hotel has a great view, great location and the customer service was very friendly and accommodating. We were a party of seven with two apartments close to each other, both with kitchenettes and stocked well with all the basic items. Housekeeping came everyday, cleaned and tidy our apartments. Oh yes, I did spot one cockroach, but it didn’t bother me to much. The furniture is a little out dated, but still quite comfortable. I really didn’t have a problem with elevators; with 38 floors to trek it wasn’t all that slow. We only cooked one night and enjoyed the outdoor BBQ, which is located near the pool. Overall the Banyan is good value and I would recommend it for families especially with teenagers who loved having their internet service (provided at a price of course). We would definitely stay at the Waikiki Banyan again.

We have stayed here before and knew what to expect, plus have been to Honolulu four times previously. The hotel is old like most in Waikiki, but clean and well maintained. The location is exceptional, close to beach and attractions. One of the few hotels that can comfortably accomodate a family of 5 and has a kitchen. The view from room was great and the restaurant on the pool deck is exceptional. The pool is okay, but who cares when the beach is right there. The elevators are very slow, but they are working on upgrading them. Room had new carpet and fresh paint, new counters and NO bugs at all. We love it so much we may buy a unit. Some recent reviews say there are bugs. We have stayed here twice and have never had a bug in our room. I did have some bugs at other hotels I stayed at though. You are in Hawaii and a few bugs or Gecko's may wander in. We have never encountered any at the Banyan though and neither did our friends. Eat at the pool deck restaurant/kiosk, the food is delicious.

We have stayed at various hotels in Waikiki and the Banyon suits us best. We like the suite type accomodation, despite the fact that the hotel is not on the beach and that the building is like many in Waikiki, 30+ years old and a bit frayed at the edges. It is great not having to eat every meal out and the Banyon's location and adequate parking make it easy to have a car for excursions and short trips outside of Waikiki. With a teenager, I found the extra room a big plus. The slow elevators drove the mildest of guests to mutter. They are being replaced, but who knows when they will all work and how much of a difference they will make. If you are used to business hotels, you may not like the nickel and dime skimpiness of the Banyon. I received a newspaper only once, but looked for it every day. I found the $3 to bounce a basketball each time a special irritation. But I must say, all in all, I enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere and had a good vacation there. I expect we will stay at the Banyon again.

We just got back from Hawaii and spent one week at the Banyan and were very disappointed.The hotel is average and the room was full of cockroaches, the room was sprayed down 3 times in one week, they were even on the beds. The room was kept clean however furniture was average.The location was great and the staff was very good.The elevators were very slow as they are repairing them the wait was more than 10 minutes on many occassions.I would not recommend the Banyan.

This is quite a hard review to write as on one side a lot of people may be put off by the fact that this hotel needs updating but I'm going to concentrate on all the positives and there are loads.It is such a friendly place to stay.Very clean, large apartments - plenty big enough for our family of five. A proper, very well equipped kitchen with a large fridge/freezer and full sized cooker/oven.The apartment was serviced daily.The rollaway was waiting in the apartment for us - no requesting, waiting etc.The pool was just lovely as were the two hottubs, the poolside snack bar and the numerous barbecues.There was a computer room and wifi access as well as internet access in the apartments.The lifts were slow but not too slow.All in all I loved this resort, we all did and in a way I'm hoping it isn't updated any time soon as when it is I'm sure we won't be able to afford it!!
Had a Superior City View room that was very clean and serviced each day. Was our third stay at this property dating back to 1992 and the standards have not changed in all those years.

Read reviews prior to holiday, sort of knew what to expect. Felt sorry for those who had unpleasant experiences but for us we had a great time. As a family of 5, we had two condos, both were cleaned every single day and were well equpped. Used the bbq area, local shop, The Food Pantry and we were more than happy with the location. Near the beach, bus stops and convenient shops and restaurants. Lifts ok, no real problems. All trips booked through Expedia rep who was very friendly and informative. The Cultural Centre day out is a must. Visited Big Island, Volcano trip, which was well planned and good value for money. All in all a fantastic holiday. Staff and every one we talked to were extremely friendly. Have recommended this holiday to friends and family in England and we would not rule out another trip in the future. Excellent.

We stayed @ the Banyan for 6 days in January. It is a great place to stay when you have kids along. We used the BBQ area almost every night. This was a great way to save some money and not have to worry about the kids @ a restaurant. We spent less money @ Safeway for a week's worth of food than what we spent for the first 2 meals we had when we arrived in Oahu.  As for the atmosphere, our room was nice and clean. It had a fun decor a la 70's surf and a nice mountain view. The maid service was just ok but they were quick to bring extra items when asked.  The elevator service was a bit slow but we were located on the 35th floor so it was to be expected. From what I understand, they are replacing all of the elevators so that they will be faster but hey....just remember to be on island time and it'll be no big deal.  The location was great! Close to lots of fun stuff. We only used the rental car a few times and never had a problem with parking.  We would have no problem recommending this condo to friends and family alike. Aloha!!!

Well I stayed here for 3 nights in 2006 and I enjoyed myself. I went with my college and paid less than 400 bucks for the whole trip...including airfare, so I wasn't picky at all as far as accommodations. Anyway, I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were nicely decorated and it had a bedroom, separate living area, and a full kitchen. The lanai was average. It was a 10 minute walk to the beach, but I liked the location anyway. The lobby is open aired and beautiful. I didn't try the pool/play area/or bbqs. The elevators didn't seem to take a long time at least not long enough for me to notice. The staff was nice. The Expedia desk was helpful in arranging activities. We did have "issues" using the shower the first time. Anyway overall a pleasant stay...highly recommended for families. I liked this property, but I do prefer the Waikiki Beach Hotel down the street.

Stayed here for a family vacation a few months back. First time for me in the USA. Love it!Hotel wouldn't let us check in a few hours early, and made up pay for an extra night's accommodation which we weren't too happy with. There was no other way around it though, as we needed our room for sleep, especially with twin toddlers after a 11 hour flight from Australia!Room had very old furniture in it (looked lived in, so we assumed they were privately owned) but the furniture was oh so comfy! We had housekeeping come in and not only clean, but tidy up every single day! The rooms smelt lovely and it was heaven on Earth to come home after a whole day's outing to a clean and tidy room. It really felt like a holiday. Great recreation deck for the kids. The pool does need some kind of shade area. The guy who runs the kiosk on the rec deck was always helpul anf friendly.I read a few things about the elevators/lifts taking a long time. We did have a few days where we had to wait a long time. But hey, we were on holidays, not business so it really didn't matter to us.Overall, the stay was very pleasant, and surprisingly good! I would stay here again, but...there are so many places in Hawaii that I could be tempted to try some others.Our apartment rate was very affordable though!!!

I recently found this rental while searching for a last minute, affordable place to stay on Waikiki (tough to do ...). Upon finding the rental via the internet, I contacted the person listed and found him to be very professional and accomodating. When I arrived at the property, it was as described. No fancy bells and whistles, but the rental was clean and comfortable. They were even willing to make the two twin beds into a king to accomodate my needs with children who wanted to be close to mom. When I had questions, I was able to make contact with those who could take care of my needs. As a mom who travels often with young children and wants somewhere clean and comfortable, I would stay here again.

We just got back from a 10 day trip to Hawaii, 7 of which we spent at the Banyan and were very disappointed. We a have week at a timeshare in Key West, Florida, that we traded for a week at the Banyan. The place in Key West is a Hyatt, which is smaller and very nice so we were expecting to find something comperable. No such luck. The Banyan is more like a Super 8 than a Hyatt. This hotel is just okay. Not terrible but certainly not great either. If it were a budget hotel we'd paid $60 for, I would have felt we got our money's worth. The rooms were clean, but not spotless (and crawling with roaches). The furnishings were acceptable, but not exceptional (the bed was actually very hard). Overall, you could do better for you're money.The nicer features of the hotel are its location, the kitchenettes, and the staff. The hotel is very close to the beach, though the view of the ocean is blocked by larger hotels around it. But it does have a nice view of the moutnatins. Though the rest of the room was old, the kitchen was recently renovated. The staff was very friendly, particularly the concierge. But we had serveral major issues with the Banyan. First and foremost, they were painting and doing other maintaince on our floor. This is an understandable issue in any hotel, but being woken up at 8am to sanding or people talking and playing radios in the hall is never enjoyable. One morning, they wanted to paint the doors and frames and to put some bug control treatement (which didn't seem to work) down the sink. About 9am, someone knocked on the door and let themselves in without waiting for a reply. 9am isn't that early, but we were on vacation, and still in our PJ's. It was incredibly awkward and emabarassing. What if one of us had just stepped out of the shower!!! Once open, the door had to be left open for painting and drying for hours. Security was provided for this time, and the maintaince staff was very poliet about it, but it was still incredibly unpleasant.The pool was also a major disappointment. The facitilies themselves were actually nice enough, with a pool, two hot tubs, tennis courts, and grills for bbq-ing. But the entire area was constantly overrun by kids. Nothing against kids, but when you don't have any, you don't usually want to spend your vacation with them. The pool and hot tub areas were particuarlly annoying. There are two hot tubs. One is too hot to sit in comfortably, and the other is barely luke-warm. Both are filled to capacity with kids jumping from one to the other. This is probably a great place of families with kids, especially young kid, but not for young couples, singles or older travelers. The elevators were also impossibly slow. The once they arrive, they are so crammed you can barely get in. We ended up taking the stairs to our 12th floor room as often as not. If we had been on a higher floor, I don't know what we would have done.Overall, I would not recommend the Banyan. You could find something much better for the price.

We just arrived home from an 8 day stay. We had read previous reviews and although they were not all flattering, we decided to stay here as it would accomodate 5 people and had a kitchenette. We realized the first day that the refrigerator was not working and called down to get it repaired. Response was quick with a replacement refrigerator. However, I believe that this is where our problems started. We noticed a cockroach on the kitchen counter the next day but were not too alarmed as we thought that this was a one off occurrence. Over the next few days, we noticed more cockroaches and therefore called housekeeping. They came up and sprayed behind the refrigerator. Because of the smell of the insecticide, we left the apartment and came back two hours later. The insecticide worked as we found 8 to 10 dead cockroaches. We threw out all of our food that we had placed on the counters and in the cupboards.The next day we continued to see smaller cockroaches. We spoke to the manager and asked that he consider rebating us some of the price of our stay. All he would do was credit back one day of internet fees and two local phone calls (total of $11.45). I was persistent and on our last day there, he said that he would get back to me. However he never did. I left my home phone number and am still waiting for his call.

We just arrived back home from our stay at the Waikiki Banyan. After reading these reviews, I had to write one of my own. I booked our room through a rental site where these units are rented out by their owner and not through the hotel. The one we stayed in was great! Clean, very well decorated and wonderful views of the ocean. What I have learned is, these units are all privately owned and the ones rented out by the owners are the ones that are kept up to date, clean, well decorated etc.Maybe for someones next planned trip, try renting through vrbo, vacationrentals, etc, you will be much happier.

my fiance and i stayed at the waikiki banyan dec. 11-16. we were aware of the problems listed by other travellers and had somewhat low expectations -- that way, you're not utterly disappointed.for the most part, the banyan was fine. we had a nice clean room. yes, it was old, but we expected this. we had 2 twin beds, when we requested a queen, but we just pushed the 2 together instead of asking for a different room. the amenities in the room, such as the kitchen and bathroom were all satisfactory, as we didn't cook during our stay.i was a little disappointed in the bed cover of my side of the bed. it smelled like mildew...and being on the bed for a few hours, it made the pillow and sheets smell. but they had extra pillows and sheets, so no worries there, and by the second day, the maids changed our sheets to a king size as we had the beds together.we didn't take in the pool as it was super windy, and besides, the beach was 2 blocks away. and yes, the elevators did take a long time -- sometimes. one's being refurbished while one of the 3 that were supposed to work was always down. but no big deal. everyone was very friendly and the lobby was quite pretty. would stay here again for a cheap escape.

Our unit at the Waikiki Banyan was clean , quiet and air-conditioned with a full kitchen and bathroom. It was close to the beach and the park. The complex has an excellent rec deck with tennis courts, pool, hot tubs and playground. The hotel is close to the bus stop. It is within walking distance to the Food Pantry and a brand new Safeway. It is located next door to a twice weekly Farmers' Market with fresh, reasonably priced produce. We have stayed at the Banyan before and will do so again.

Price is cheap and you get what you pay for. This hotel is definitely one of the older hotels and needs remodeling. We killed a total of 6 small cockroaches in our kitchen area and 2 small cockroaches in the bathroom area. I wasn't too terrified as I have read of other reviews about this hotel having a cockroach problem. This hotel didn't offer any type of room service however they do give you a book that has restaurants that deliver to the hotel however all the restaurants listed stop deliveries by 9pm. The good points in the hotel are that the rooms are spacious. Kitchen area came fully equiped with utensils, pots & pans, bowls & dishes. However we didn't cook a single meal due to being grossed out about the cockroaches. Our room came with 2 full size beds and one fold out couch that turns into a queen bed. The swimming pool was salty and slimy, not sure if it just missed a day of cleaning or what. Overall I can't really complain because it was cheap. Next time I will definitely fork some extra money to get a better place.

I won't go into length since there are apparently almost 200 reviews for this hotel. I'm writing this just to keep it current.Our party consisted of 4 separate families who rented 4 separate rooms for a week. All in Tower 2. Believe most of what's been said here. The furniture *is* a little old. The elevators *are* slow. etc.. But for the price it is a very decent and even nice hotel to stay at. (We got ours at around 108USD i think) You get a roomy condo type place with everything you need to make your stay comfortable and affordable. Plus a great location. Short stroll from the beach, the glitzy Waikiki streets as well as all the bus and trolley stops.If you're the type who can forgive the obvious fact that this is not a luxury hotel and can appreciate the very reasonable comfort and affordability of the ResortQuest Waikiki Banyan then take the advice of most reviewers here. Book now.

We recently returned from a month long trip to Hawaii, which our first stop was 6 nights at this hotel. It is in a really convenient location for the beach and shopping, just 2 blocks. There are no proper supermarkets around Waikiki but of course the ABC's are everywhere. We mainly ended up getting takeout most nights and eating in the room. The kitchen had most basic items, but ours only had plates and cutlery for 4 when there was 5 of us. Not a big deal. We stayed on the 9th floor and the room's carpet and curtains were pretty stained and worn. The furniture was sufficient. we did get a shock in the elevator on the second day when we were confronted by two massive dogs and their owner. Being Australian and not used to this, we were kind of grossed out by dogs in the hotel room, maybe it was an owner of a private apartment but it was very weird. As most people say the elevators were slow, especially on the morning we checked out it took over 20 minutes wait. The staff neglected to give out the kids packs on arrival and I had to ask for them later, they also didn't send up champagne as ordered for arrival, I had to call down to remind them. We didn't really see any other staff as we were out all day, but the rooms were always clean and tidy on our return. So to sum up the location is great and price was good for a family of five and the facilities were acceptable.

We arrived at the Banyan absolutely bedraggled after having no sleep.Though it was early we were able to get into our room (courtesy of Thomas Edwards, I think his site is 'stayatwaikiki'). To see it so spacious and welcoming and filled with light (a corner unit) was wonderful. My husband and I desperately wanted a 1-bedroom as we were with our 13year-old son and they seemed difficult to find. This was great value. Yes, the lifts were slow but it is close to the beach and we really enjoyed that gorgeous Waikiki lagoon, also the Banyan's large pool and spa tubs. The pool was noisy our first day but then, we were only on Floor 8. The noise those buses make when they start up! also impinged on our sleep. Our kitchen didn't seem very well-equipped. There was no kettle or teapot, we had to use the coffee-maker. Overall though with the size and a great bath, comfy sofas and chairs, the large lanii and Jeff (Thomas's associate) being so accommodating - we would definitely recommend it. I ran up and down the stairs anyway!

We booked a room here and was a little worried because the price was so low, BUT we loved our stay here! Our room had 2 full size beds and a queen sofa couch. The kitchen was well equiped with everything that we needed (2 pots, frying pan, knifes, cups, plates, bowels, tea kettle, ice trays, baking pans). It was great because we went to farmers market and got lots of food for cheap and ate cheaply the whole week.I would reccomend not having a ocean side view. The hotel is blocked by most other buildings. The hotel is located one block away from the zoo, the beach and many ABC stores. If you are a runner, from the hotel and around diamond head is a good five mile loop! The lobby area is outdoors and very nice. Parking is $50 a week, but a lot cheaper than most other places which can be up to $15 a day! We were always able to find a lot of parking and the parking lot is well attended. There are two hot tubs that have varying temp, which is nice because i don't like it as hot as other people.The elevators were pretty slow, but that is also because one of the elevators were out, but a little wait is definitely worth it. There is also a little mini mart in the downstairs lobby. It has a lot of things and can sometimes be cheaper than the ABC stores.The house keepers were great and super fast when we called them for extra things. I would definitely stay here again!

I stayed for 13 nights staying with a girlfriend from UK, I arrived early and was hoping for a early bookin but it was booked out so no worries, I walked around the beach and just waited. I have to say the staff where wonderful and understanding they get a 5 star from me. Our room was clean, big kitchen and bathroom. It was big enough the only thing was the sofa bed wasn't working but it was no prolbem for them to fix! next day we had a call to say have a look at another room it was a upgrade and on level 25. Yes the furniture isn''t 5 star but people if you want that go somewhere esle!!! You have a pool with BBQ area enough sun lounges. Yes the lift a bit slow but so what we are on holidays and the most time was spent waiting 10min!!! and they are fixing the prolbem.So if you want a good hotel close to the beach, friendly staff, nice pool area with snack bar that is open til 9pm with takeaway hot food and clean rooms for a good price go for it...

Yes, some of the rooms have soft furnishings that are a little tired, but this hotel is perfect if you are travelling with young children and need somewhere that provides large rooms and great kitchen facilities.We travelled with a one year old and it was essential that we could have some meals in our room. All kitchen equipment that we could have needed was supplied and the lounge area and bedroom were very spacious. We stayed on the 33rd floor in tower two and booked mountain view rooms, so we were looking back over the canal and golf course. We were really happy with the view (we have a water view at home, so it was refreshing for us to look at something different for a change). We had two rooms next to each other, one for another family member and the second room had been recently refurbished and was much more modern looking.The hotel location was perfect for us - a two minute walk to a child safe beach, close to the zoo and aquarium and a really easy walk to the shops and marketplaces of Waikiki. Traffic noise to our room was minimal and we were not woken by any street noise (and we slept with our windows open).So all in all, I'd definately recommend this place if you want an easy family holiday.

Ok, I've read most of the negative reviews on here and all I can say to most is get over yourself. This hotel is what it is.If you are looking for a hotel that is top of the line, fancy furniture, plasmas, hotel staff kissing the ground you walk on and being able to have all that you need at your fingertips, this is not the place to be.If you want a place to relax, sleep in, do whatever you want to do, have a kitchen to save some money on food and cook when you want to, and overall just be left alone, this is the place for you.We found this to be perfect for us. We've been to Hawaii twice before so we weren't looking for a luxurious place. Be honest, you are in PARADISE, why do you need luxury and all of the perks when you should only use the hotel to sleep and bathe? Yes, the furniture of this hotel is a little out dated, but you have everything you need.We had an ocean view room on the 38th floor. When we came in, the room smelled incredible and it was very clean. The room was by far the largest suite I've been in. It was easily a liveable space for 4-5 people. So for two, it was beyond what we needed. The kitchen had all the utensils we needed and then some, from plates, pots, pans, forks, spoons, bowls, you name it, they had it. The counters were clean and useful for eating, the living room had a sofa bed that was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was clean and spacious. Great lighting, HUGE bed that could fit 3-4 people easily. A Fabulous view (albeit it is two blocks from the beach). The only thing missing from this place was the usual phone calls or visits from hotel staff. But this was PERFECT for us. We wanted to feel like we were home. There is no need for someone to call you every hour asking if everything is ok or always be knocking on your door. This felt like our apartment and for once felt like we were l iving in paradise.The ammeneties are great. Awesome secluded pool area, great saunas, tennis courts, golf area and GRILLS! You can actually buy some meat and cook it on the out door grills! The front area is all out doors so you get that nice island breeze when you are checking in or waiting for cars. The area is great, is secluded enough from the traffic, yet close enough to the beach.Overall, this place is great for the people who want what I described. Again, if you are looking for luxury and pampering, go somewhere else. If you want to feel like you live in Oahu, stay here.

Just returned from the Waikiki Banyan. I met AU friends who arrived a few days before me. We had two rooms directly across from each other which worked out wonderfully since there was one bath per two women (four of went on this trip). 1202 was the better of the two with a nice water view and a larger space. 1201 needs the carpet replaced badly but had a nice nighttime mountain view of the lights on the hillside. Overall I would definitely consider the Banyan again since it was a convenient three blocks from Waikiki and the shops so great location. The rooms were clean but no frills. The full kitchen and the generous space including a lanai made it very comfortable and daily maid service was nice. Banyan--the units need blenders! Great cheap place to eat--pick up lunch or even dinner for a beachside meal at the Hyatt Regency snack bar on Waikiki Beach. Great value ($5 burgers, $6 chicken katsu) and huge portions makes this an absolute must. Closes at six however. Go to the Tiki Grill for nachos with kalua pig for $14. It will feed everyone, but also ask for the taro rolls with the banana-vanilla butter--heaven!

We booked our stay at the Banyan through Travelocity and paid about $100/night including taxes. Parking at the hotel's attached garage was an additional $8/24 hours. We didn't expect much, just a room with a queen bed and a balcony. What we got was essentially a 1 bedroom condominium with full kitchen (including cooking ware, dish towels etc.) and a view of both DiamondHead and the ocean. This kind of room was not guaranteed, but was not considered an upgrade. Although the room needed to be refreshed with new carpet and decour, it was clean and comfortable and an incredible bargain for the cost. The elevators were slow (we were on 26th floor) and you have to share them with service staff doing cleaning/removing garbage etc. - so this is not a fancy hotel. But it is only 3 blocks off the beach and super convenient to everything. I highly recommend this hotel for a great value experience. It even has a large pool (not on the beach, but with a view since it's on the roof of the 6th floor). You are in Hawaii to enjoy the beach anyway, so save some dough and stay here comfortably within walking distance.

As one of the top Travel Agents that sell Hawaii, I decided to visit Waikiki in September the same way my clients would. I did not take advantage of any Travel Agent discounts, nor did anyone know I was a travel agent. I booked my 4 night stay the same way I would for all my clients. I pretty much experience the same thing that most of you consumers did. However, I must say that if you are booking a condo that is rated 3 star...you get exactly that.I am used to staying in 5 stars so I was not expecting much at the location.It's not as bad as some say. I took my husband and my adult children with me. So the 4 of us in a 1 bedroom.The negatives: bedrm/bth not large enough for us.(especially with 3 women in the room)Not as spic and span as we are used to(remember this is an old building)The positives: Nice sized kitchen, all the utensils/dishes provided, fridge clean.What a treat was when we arrived a bottle of champagne in the room with a card for my daughters saying Happy Birthday and two boxes of chocolate macadamia nuts.Now I know what my clients get when I book them at the Resortquest.If you don't mind paying more then stay at one of the newer properties(it won't be a condo)...I did a few hotel inspections while there. I really liked the Hyatt, the Wyland, and the Moana Surfrider...okay so you will have to pay the price for those properties.All in all...Hawaii will be expensive no matter what.

My husband and I went to this resort for our honeymoon. We understood prior to going that it was not on the beach, but that there appeared to be good reviewsabout it so we decided on this location....never again....I can't say that it was all completely horrible, but for a special vacation, it was really disappointing. The first room they gave us was listed as the 'superior' room and it was far from superior....the best way to describe this room would be 70's ghetto....it looked soooooo old and dingy....we immediately went downstairs to ask for a better room and the man appeared shocked that we were not satisfied....he then moved us to a 'deluxe' room, which at least appeared to be a little better in its decor....the rooms were kept clean which was the only the plus to all this....the location is also a plus...for a regular trip, not too bad, but if you want something 'special' this is not the way too go....

We spent 11 days here in September for a Family holiday with friends. We researched the location and this seemed to be the best for the price and we were right.The location is 2 blocks back from the beach which is close enough to walk and away from the noise. Be prepared for the room size, they are small. We stayed with 5 of us, one area has 2 queen beds together close and the other bedding is the fold out lounge. If you want the larger more established hotel chain type rooms you will of course pay the premium but this is what we expected, and wanted. The time we spent in the room is sleeping and changing, we spent all the time walking around and swimming/surfing so if it's this type of 'base of operations' room rather than one to live in, this is the place for you.It has a great pool, spa and barbeque area and internet access along with a car park, which we did not use.The location is quiet and safe and a short walk to the beach and the strip. It is the perfect mix of cost, room and location.The only downside are the lifts, you can wait 10 minutes (not exaggerating) for a lift and all three of them will turn up together. They are old and slow and is not helped by the staff using the lifts to travel one floor. There were 4 lifts and one of them didn't work for the entire time we we there. We were in Tower One and although the rooms are old and dated they were clean but in need of an update in the near future.A good all round hotel and if we were coming back, yes we would stay there.

We stayed for 4 nights at the resortquest waikiki banyan in Honolulu. The property consists of two 30 story towers each coming off of the lobby area. Lobby:Positive: The lobby area pleasantly surprised me, it is quite nice. It is an open concept lobby (as I see most are in Waikiki) with a nice pond with fish in it. Front desk staff were helpful, and my two year old daughter enjoyed the kids gift (bucket, shovel, sunglasses, stickers). Negative: First problem then presnted it self, the wait for an elevator was looooong, like 5 minutes. Only 3 were working, and by the time it got to the lobby it was like a cattle call, depending on where you were standing dictated if you got on the elevator! Room:Positive: The room was large, and adequate for our needs. The full kitchen is nice, with plates, utensils, bowls, pots and pans all provided. The view from the balcony (lanai in hawaii) was quite nice, watching the sunrise in the morning was nice. Negative: The carpets were very worn and had numerous stains throughout. When we booked our room, we were told that there was a hideaway couch / bed, however when we went to open it, there was a sign stating that it was broken. Housekeeping brought a single sized cot to replace it, however the person sleeping on it was too big for it. There were a number of ants throughout, but no roaches that other people complained about. Overall the property is nice, with a nice location to Waikiki...far enough way from the hustle and bustle, but close enough to go swimming, shopping, etc. For the price, it's a decent property, and I had no qualms other than that listed.

We stayed here by trading in our week at our home timeshare resort. The building itself is not bad. There are several companies that rent out the condos in the Waikiki Banyan building. We were with Hawaiian Sun Holidays. Our room was suitable but it was really old and ugly. It was a one-bedroom with a closing sort of wall that separated the room from the living room/kitchen. It's pretty small for what we're used to. We were on the 10th floor. I was told that the rooms higher up were nicer- ours was definitely not. However, it was livable. On the first night we were there, after a 12hour+ journey through air and land, the fire alarm woke us up at 4am. After about an hour of false alarms and telling everyone to stop calling the office to ask what it was, it finally stopped.They conveniently forgot to mention that the pool would be closed for maintenance on the week we were there. When the pool finally opened, we realized we didn't miss much- the beach is much nicer. They have a little playground and basketball/tennis court by the pool with a little stand that sells some food and toys. The kitchen had a full fridge, stove, sink, and pretty much everything you needed to never have to eat out.The location, however, is fantastic! Just a block from the best part of Waikiki beach. Walking distance to almost everything in Waikiki. The front desk was helpful and nice. The Hawaiian Sun Holidays staff was also very nice. They had some old books and videos (VHS) available to borrow on the honor system. Not very impressive, but nice. Overall, it was decent. We would probably never stay there again unless we had a nicer room. You have to walk by the Marriott Waikiki whenever you walk to the beach and it's just kind of a depressing reminder of what your resort/room is not.Oh yeah, and Teddy's burgers around the corner (across from the zoo) are absolutely delicious and inexpensive.

Our family stayed at the ResortQuest Waikiki Banyan for 3 nights in July. We had a wonderful stay. The hotel is about 1 1/2 to 2 blocks from the beach and there are restaurants and shopping along the beach area. Everything is convenient. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The airport lost our luggage, but the hotel left a message for us once it arrived. The hotel has a parking garage if you have a car, and there is a small store by the elevators should you need sun screen, toothpaste, something to drink, etc. I loved the lobby area with the waterfall and Koi fish pond. Our room had a city view from the balcony and an ocean view from the bedroom window. The kitchen had plenty of dishes, silverware, etc for cooking. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. It's not the Ritz. The furniture was worn, but it was a great place to rest with the family and enjoy the beach. My 14 year old enjoyed the pool/hot tub area. There is also a playground area and bbq grills for a family cookout.We would absolutely stay at the Waikiki Banyan again.

Kia ora.... We had a group of 35 and found this a really nice affordable option, lots of space and perfect for our needs. we had 4 to a room and still had plenty of space. Kitchen in rooms great, had laundry on each floor as well, and bbq down by pool area if you wanted to do group bbq. Snackk bar on the 6th floor where you could buy cheap breakfast, snacks and laundry powder. Close to other restaurants as well, including 24hr restaurant at Hilton Hotel directly across the road for those late Air NZ flights. Other resturants also within blocks ....including Tiki Restaurant on 2nd floor of Waikiki Beach hotel on the beach front. Catch bus around the corner from the banyan and ask at reception for a list of buses and shoping ideas.... Although a long 1hr plus bus trip, Suggest the $2 fare is well worth going to Aloha Stadium Flea market first, and do all your shopping for Hawaiian Souvenirs and TShirts. You can catch a VIP $5pp shuttle back to the Banyan.... try $2 bus fare again and go to Ross Dress for less for bargain shopping and Alamoana Shopping Mall or Pearl Ridge ... otherwise use bus to get you to any of the tourist spots ....We had a blast, and i'd certainly go back to the Banyan again ....Stayed at Waikiki beach resort ont he beach front as well... although it was lovely and had some extras with it ... we would chose Banyan for the space and quiet ....For those of you's catching Air NZ flight home to NZ suggest you book a late check out and pay the extra or book another day so that you have somewhere to rest and shower before leaving at approx 9pm for 11.55 pm flight home to NZ......Hope this helps ...

This was booked for us by a friend who lives in Hawaii and it turned out to be a good choice. The room we had was more of a studio apartment than an hotel room. The little kitchen meant that we were able to cook simple meals in the room some nights when we didn't feel like going out to a restaurant. The hotel is five minutes walk to waikiki beach and close to main bus stops too (if using public transport).It was clean, quiet and the staff were all pleasant and helpful.There is a nice pool and a terrace with barbecues for cooking your own barbecue food.We were on the twelth floor and one morning we had to wait 11 minutes for a lift. This was the only time though, usually it was about 1 or 2 minutes wait.

Wife, teenage daughter and I stayed July 21-29. I rated the stay above average because our expectations were met and in some cases exceeded. Please note...our expectations were not the Ritz or the Four Seasons...they were more along the lines of a Marriott Residence Inn. Our 1 bedroom condo was on the 24th floor with a city view and a lanai. It was clean, never saw even one bug all week, and everything worked. Location: two block walk to Waikiki beach. Tons of places to eat and shop within just a few minute's walk. Parking was $50 for the week in the hotel garage. The condo was decorated in furniture that was dated but not really worn or broken. Bed was comfortable although I would have preferred a softer mattress. Elevator waits were reasonable. Bath looked like 1982...but it was clean and had good water pressure. Service was great. If you want an upscale, romantic place, go elsewhere. If you want a well-located, fully outfitted condo that will meet a family's needs for a week and offer the adults some privacy, this is the place.

We spent 8 nights at the Waikiki Banyan July 07. I had read all the reviews- after our travel agent booked us in, just before we left for Hawaii. I was very worried as so many of the reviews were quite negative- particularly with the possibility of cockroaches in the room, as our daughter has a phobia about these creepy crawlies. However we enjoyed our stay there and had no issues with cleanliness, bugs, staff, lifts or any of the other negatives listed in earlier reviews. We were in room 3206 in Tower 1. We had paid for a deluxe Ocean View room and thought this was worthwhile as we often ate breakfast sitting on the balcony. You are side on to the sea, but definitely get a great view- as well as city lights at night. The carpet looked pretty new, and while the outfitting of the room is a little dated, it was clean and provided everything we wanted. Yes the bathroom is small, but entirely adequate and access for a family is no problem.
