Parking our rental car in the attached garage was no problem and the $8 per 24 hour period seemed a reasonable cost. Location is fine- while you are at one end of the Waikiki strip, the walks did us good and ensured we explored more thoroughly.Staff were always helpful and room servicing was probably more than we would expect for a self contained apartment. The recreation deck is basic if compared to a 5 star resort, but considering the cost and style of this accommodation, it was quite good. One thing though- they lock the BBQs at 9pm- which we found out the one night we were very late cooking dinner!Would we go back? Based on our experience yes. We also spoke to several people in the lifts who had returned to the Banyan year after year and who had no problems. The other reviews still leave me a little nervous though!We had booked our holiday through Qantas/Viva holidays. I do not know if they have some arrangement with the property that ensures their customers get good rooms- leaving poorer rooms for those who book last minute or individually, but we have no complaints about our accommodation or our trip to Hawaii!

We had a one day lay over and stayed here. It was fine, clean, nice location close to the beach, reasonably priced and we could fit five of us in the one bedroom which was nice. The lobby people were very nice and friendly. Only negative comment would be the pocket doors separating bedroom from living room are kind of crappy, difficult to slide and don't provide any noise barrier, also air conditioner did not work very well.

My family stayed here in a 1 bedroom room which was seperated by pocket sliding doors which did offer some privacy. The room was clean and big enough for us to spread out. Having a kitchen with a big refrigerator and all of the appliances was great for buying some food and drinks to save a little bit of money. The pool area on the 6th floor was nice and never really crowded. The was only 1 instance were the elevators were slow but seeing as how it was a holiday week it was understandable and wasn't enough to bother us. This was our 2nd trip to oahu. Last time we stayed at the Pacific Monarch. Both times we booked rooms through a vacation rental website. Bang for your buck, I highly reccomend this as you will save alot of money (I believe the average price for the room we had is $200/night, we payed $125/night). You still get to use all of the things that regular hotels do. The price of our room also included a parking pass. The parking deck was always open and never completely full. This hotel is on the quieter end of Waikiki near Kapiolani park. It is only 1 block from the ocean and the bus and trolleys stop next door at the Hilton Prince Kuhio. If you don't want to be in the thick of the crowds and still be near everything, stay here!

IMyself and my brother stayed in the waikiki Banyan for 7 days in June 2007. It was much better than I thought it would be and I would highly recommend it. They are condo style rooms. Rooms were very spacious - I had the bedroom and my brother took the fold out sofa bed in the living area, which he thought was very comfortable. The condo had full kitchen utilitys and the bathroom area could be accessed from the living area or the bedroom, so you wouldnt be disturbing the other person in the night. It was very clean and from the balcony we could see the beach, which was less than a five min walk. It was very convienent to everywhere. Also the recreation deck and pool was very nice too. It is busy at times as noted in previous posts but I normally was just there in the evening just chilling out a bit after day on beach or trips. We did book this through a private rental and not through the hotel itself- we booked it through Captain Cook resorts and found them very good to deal with. They met us with key at the condo when we arrived. So i suppose i cant vouch for the quality of all the rooms but some of my family did book in for a few days in another room and it was pretty similar , our one was probably decorated a bit better ( but it is someones home ) and you have to walk through the bedroom to get to the bathroom- but really I don't think thats too much of a big deal. They had no complaints apart from a few ants in the sink - but the peolple at the desk sorted that out. Its best too to book a room on the higher floor- we stayed on the 30th floor- much nicer view. some of the rooms face the recreation deck too , so get a sea view if possible. Overall all very pleased with the space in these condos and would go back there again.Oh and great value for money too , compared to price of some of the hotels in the area- and with them you just get the room .

My family and I stayed at the Resort Quest Waikiki Banyan in May 2007, we found the staff very friendly and helpful. There is a short walk to Waikiki Beach and the Internation Market Place, this hotel is right on the bus line. During our stay we did The Paradise Cove Luau which we highly recommend we also did a tour around the island. This is an older place to stay and base yourself but it is in need of renovations (painting, new curtains as the old ones have holes in them). we stayed on the sixth floor and our room had no double bed only 2 singles and the pull out sofa bed was uneven and lumpy, room was kept clean and it was great having a kitchen to cook in.

Recently stayed at the Banyan for two weeks - had previously read all the Trip Advisor review comments and must say that I was a bit apprehensive about this Hotel. Previous stays (6) in Waikiki were all at the Ohana East but this time we were looking for family accommodation I was pleasently surprised with the quality of accommodation and saw this hotel as excellent value for money for a family vacation. Most negative comments that I read related to room cleanliness, staff attention/service, the slowness of the lifts and its location however I did not see these as a real problem - some people must be hard to please !!.The only drawback I found was the location that added 10/15 minutes each way to our walk into the centre if Waikiki. At first it didnt really bother me but when you go in and out 3/4 times a day it certainly added to the miles travelled by foot.

I've read all the reviews for the Waikiki Banyan and don't know what people are talking about when they say it's a dump. I thought it was great - sure, it's not the Royal Hawaiian - but that really doesn't matter. There were two of us staying in our room. It was spacious - there was a full kitchen - and the balcony was great! But, we didn't spend a lot of time in our room - who goes to Hawaii to hang out in their hotel room, anyways? I spend enough time at home doing that. And as for the rec floor - only made it there once in the week to check it out - but didn't have time to use it. Once again - way too busy for that!! The Banyan is close to the beach (about a 2 minute walk) and close to tons of restaurants. It's about a 40 minute walk to the shopping mall (if you're adventurous) or for $2 you can take the bus. I didn't have any problems with the staff at the front desk, I found them to be friendly and accommodating.I would definitely stay here again!

We stayed at the Banyan between 5/25 and 5/30 and were extremely disappointed with EVERYTHING. We checked in at 5pm whilst the lady on the front desk was on a personal call and could not be bothered to check us in correctly so much so that one of her co-workers asked her if she needed help. All this was happening as I was holding our 11 month who was beginning to get upset because it was approaching her dinner time. We were given our room and upon entering it looked like a set for a porno movie due to the REALLY dated/dirty furniture, the dirty carpet, chrome bar stools and to top it all off the mirrored wall. We did not expect to stay at a 5 star resort with what we were paying but we did expect something a bit better than this. The lifts are a nightmare and one of the lifts was out for repairs for the whole duration of our trip. The washing machine and dryers are always in use as there is only one per floor and you have to pay to use these. The only positive I found was the location. Thank goodness this wasn't our first time to Hawaii but it will definitely be our last time to the Banyan

Just got back, we stayed here May 19th to May 29th 2007.There were 5 girls staying in a 1 bedroom. Probably wouldn't do that again as the bathroom/toilet you have to access through the bedroom so this made is very hard for people getting changed in the bedroom and when people were asleep at night you would wake them up by going to the bathroom. I would say it is geared towards families. It is a little old but not too bad. It had an oven, microwave, large fridge, everything we needed. I would not pay to use the safe. I think it's done on an honestly thing as the key is left in the door. I think this is wrong to be charged for the in room safe at $2.62 a day. We used it after the maid had been just incase she monitors if it is being used. I found the staff to be very rude and not helpful at all on front desk. We did see 1 cockcroach in our room on the first night. I would not waste my time and get an ocean view room again. U have to go out on balcony to see it, we were in tower 1, I think Tower 2 would have better views. Elevators were slow at times. THe 4th lift was always out being repaired. Sometimes the lifts would stop on Level 22 for no reason. No one pressed the button but it would stop here and just open and shot the door a couple of times. Very strange. Sometimes we would press our level - 34 and the light would be lit but it would go straight up to Level 37. Strange but overall not too bad.The beach is close by and the zoo is a 5 min walk. Bus stops were a 1 min walk.Pool was good, 2 hot tubs, lots of BBQ's. Found the pool deck was windy and didn't get alot of sun while we were there. It is value for money but in saying that I would not come back again.

The hotel is pleasant and room size adequate for a family of 4 and still ok for a family of 5 so long as some of the kids are willing to share a double bed. We went for the dual single room configuration which was good for the 5 of us.Good daily room service and reception helpful.Pool and spa area lacking a resort type feel due to any real bar/cafe. This area also very windy.Hard to get time on tennis court as its shared with basketball.Whilst the hotel is only a couple of blocks from the beach, its still a way south from the main action. Although, close to parks and zoo and enclosed beach area.We stayed in tower 1 overlooking pool area, some beach views and volcano. Nice outlook from a reasonable balcony.Overall - would probably spend a bit more and stay more central, but can't fault this hotel for value for money - especially on the stay 10 pay 8.

Our family of 5 (parents, 3 teenage kids) stayed here for 3nts in mid-May. We had a 1bdrm on the 38th floor. The decor was fine - not new, but not really old either. The size of the apartment was adequate for us. The lift always arrived within a minute or two of us calling it.The only problem we had was that the toilet blocked TWICE during our stay - which is a problem when there's five of you using one bathroom. The first time, we called downstairs and maintenance were sent up within 5mins to fix it. The second time, was early morning and when we phoned downstairs, they said that maintenance was not available until 8.30am. My husband had to go downstairs to the front desk and collect a plunger and fix the toilet HIMSELF! Unbelievable!We wondered if they have that problem regularly with high level apartments? It seemed that they weren't surprised, and the fact that they have a plunger available at the front desk indicates that this is not unusual???So, we liked the hotel, but would be wary of staying again on a high floor?

My Aussie family and I stayed at the Waikiki Banyan for 8 nights starting on 3 May 2006. It was excellent ! We miss Hawaii already.The one bedroom apartment was newly renovated and very spacious, much bigger than a standard hotel room. There was a full kitchen, living area with a couch (which opened up into a sofa bed), a separate bedroom and bathroom. The Waikiki Banyan is close to the beach (1 block), and close to the bus stops. You can take the bus to virtually any place in Oahu - very useful indeed. It was a short walk from everywhere.I booked the apartment directly through the owner (Thomas Edwards) through a website that I found on the internet: stayinwaikiki (808-221-1311). It was excellent value and Thomas was very helpful in providing information. When I go back to Hawaii (which is a matter of when, not if) I will definitely stay there again. I would recommend anyone booking with this owner.There was no problem with elevators, no sign of cockroaches and in our apartment had no dated decor. The apartments were quiet and accomodated all of our needs.For all travellers considering visiting Waikiki and Hawaii, I would highly recommend it ! The beaches are clean, the people are friendly, great big serves of food, good tours and places to visit. I only went for 8 days which I found a little short in time because it is a great place with so many things and other islands to visit. At a mimimum, go for 10 days to ensure that you get to experience all of the wonderful places that Hawaii has to offer.Just another word of note, we flew Jetstar from Melbourne to Honolulu which is the first time that we have flown with this aircarrier and it was a great airline. The stewards were great and the whole flight experience was very enjoyable. All in all, we loved our first visit to Hawaii. We will definitely return and next time, also visit another island.

Good family hotel. There with wife and 2 teenage sons. Close to the beach and attractions. Kitchen facilities. Large rooms (bedroom wand sitting room with fold out couch, kitchen). Concierge at hotel was excellent. Helpful staff. Close to restaurants, shopping, beach. Hotel was a little worn down and needs a refit (which I think they are doing). Good pool facilities. Very good for the price.

My family and I stayed at the Waikiki Banyan for five days in April 2007. Overall we think that it was a good value for the money. I think that each condo unit has individual owners so I'm guessing that the room quality is not consistent. I believe this is so because I met some of the locals that live in the Waikiki Banyan Condo. The good things about the condo are:1. The location. The condo is at the far east side of Waikiki but still within walking distance of all of the attractions. It is located two short blocks from the beach and happens to be in an area of the beach that has sea walls in the water which made it a wonderful place for my toddler to swim. Someone commented that they did not care for the neighborhood. I found nothing wrong with the neighborhood and I consider myself to be somewhat picky. The condo is right behind the Marriott and you know that a Marriott would not set up shop in a questionable neighborhood.2. The room was quiet. We were right next to the elevators and we did not hear a sound at night.3. The front desk was very accomodating. I had to receive some faxes while I was at the condo and it was not a problem....although they did charge me for it of course.4. There is a playset for the children. I thought that this was a nice touch. My son enjoyed playing on the equipment.5. There is a washer and dryer on every floor.6. The bed was comfortable.7. There were no roaches in our room. I was a bit alarmed when I read some reviews that talked about roaches. Luckily we did not come across any in our room.The not so good items:1. The pool has a tile bottom which is very slippery. The pool is also salt water. After the first time in the pool, we chose not to go back since we tended to "slip and slide" when trying to walk in the pool. Who wants to go to the pool anyway when you are that close to the beach?2. The room cound have used some updating. The furniture, carpeting, bedspread, and curtains were a bit worn and outdated.3. Most of the nicer restaurants were a bit of a walk. It seems that most of the restaurants nearby were the fast food type.4. We paid for an ocean view and were put in tower 2. If you lean over our balcony and look to the left, you can see the ocean with buildings blocking it. So much for an ocean view. It was more like city view with partial ocean view.Overall, we thought that the condo was in a great location and was a good value. We'd stay there again.Note: If you are in the area, walk a few blocks west on Kuhio and you will come across the Food Pantry. In Food Pantry, you will find Beard Pappas which makes the best cream puffs we've ever tasted. The filling is a mixture of pudding and whipped cream. We bought a dozen and easily ate them within three days.We have been to four of the Hawaiian Islands and we really enjoyed this latest trip to Oahu.

Aussie family, we have stayed at the Banyan 3 times now. Most recenlty looked for somewhere else but couldn't find the same features. 1) Great location 2) Self contained so can cook 2 meals per day 3) Rec deck improved so BBQ OK since 2004.Main points - we have come here three times with two families (teenagers) with sep rooms - one of the best places in Waikiki to stay self contained - car accom OK too $8 per day.If I could buy here I would , I recommend getting into tower 2 rather than 1, Diamond head view is why you come here!PS Best Italian Auntie Pasto on Beretania, Best Steak at Chucks on the beach -- you will find it. Even Aussies will be amazed by the SIZE of the HUUUUUGGE feeds at the Cheesecake Factory. Last thing if you are from Oz we assume you know about Waikele...if you dont... forget about it...NOT....find out and it will will fund your trip.Sorry one last thing, make sure you go north to Haleiwa on the north coast and have coffee intown - youu'll find THE place.Dont forget the Diamond Head Walk - best trip on the Island! Costs about $5 per family. PS Make sure mum carries the video camera, you'll find out why when you watch it at home.

start off by saying that this hotel is good for families. i took three kids,15,12, and 3. i am a travel agent and do approve of this hotel to anyone. it is not fancy by any means but very livible. it has a small kitchen with all the utensals needed. this is great because you can cook any meal needed with large fridge to put lots of water and other drinks. each room can be different as i looked at several and choose the one i liked. one might be newer than the other but they all have a little something different to offer. i declined the newer one for a corner room because they have more room. they all have different sleeping arragements as well. the pocket doors are a little aggravating and also when closing them at night it get a little stuffy in the bedroom because the air conditioner is in the main part. great views of the city and of the mountain and ocean views depending how high you get and in with building. within one block of beach and very save for your teen age kids to walk back and forth if they desire. waikiki beach to me is too crowded and dirty compared to the carribean but it's worth it to rent a car and explore the island and visit the north shore where the beaches are beautifull. the waves are biggest from dec to feb and in the summer months they are bigger on the south of the island. plus if you have a rental you can go shopping for food to bring back to the room. this is a home away from home. i would return to this hotel. other hotels look better but are twice the cost. if it was just the two of us i would stay somewhere else maybe and fly to different islands in hawaii because rates are cheap($30) round trip. hope this helps.

We arrived at the hotel and was sent to the 4th floor "REWA Office" I dont know why it was different from the rest of the hotel. There we found a ederly Lady who was the rudest person we meet in Hawaii. She was very unhelpfull and almost made us change hotels there and then. If we had not just stepped off a 10 hour flight and had 3 kids in tow, I would have left. I heve never been treated like that in any hotel world wide. We were on the 11th floor and the hotel across the road was being renevated so it was very very noisey and we were all awake at 6am each morning with construction traffic. The room was old and dated the toilet flooded the floor almost daily. This must happen regularly as the lino was lifting on the floor and the supplied plunger was well worn. Apart from that the recration deck was very good and the kids loved finishing off the the day there. The location was good. We got a good price on this hotel but in hindsight I would pay more to go else where. We were just not comfortable with the noise and the flooding toilet.

We were there for ten days and learned to appreciate the hotel. The first room we were assigned was not what we expected, definitely below standard. When I spoke with the front desk, we were immediately switched to a better room. Very clean and acceptable. Service was great. Elevators are terribly slow. The mini-mart at the hotel is the best value in Waikiki. The hotel is convenient walking distance to some of the quieter beaches in the area. Easily accessable via the east entrance to Waikiki. Would definitely recommend for all travelers; families, business or couples.Can't wait to go back

we stayed from Feb 24 - Mar 03 with our 2 year old. The hotel was everything we could have needed, with having a seperate closed off area for our child to sleep and the full kitchen for making meals etc ... one elevator was down for a few days so elevator service was extremely slow, but once it was up and running things were fine. We were on the 36 floor of 37 floors and had a partial ocean-view, it was beautiful. Rooms were o.k, nothing fancy at all. Could definatly used better maid service, it was only a light cleaning a couple times during the one week. Vacuuming daily would have been nice. The hotel is not super central but is about a 10 min walk to the most central area.

My family of five spent a week at the Waikiki Banyan. The hotel staff were all very helpful and nice. The room was fairly clean and comfortable. It was really helpful having a full kitchen so that meals could be prepared in the room. Everything needed to cook is provided. The kids really enjoyed having a pool and rec deck just downstairs. There are grills downstairs and plenty of chairs and tables to sit at. We had a wonderful view of both Diamond Head and the ocean from our lanai. It was conveniently located. Just a short walk to the beach and the international marketplace, not to mention Cheeseburger in Paradise. The only thing we didn't like were the pocket doors between the rooms and in the bathroom. They were a little difficult to close and open. With all the other things this hotel/condo had going for it, this was just a minor annoyance. When one of the lights went out maintenance was there within minutes of being called to fix it. Another plus was the lack of noise from other rooms, it was extremely quiet. All in all it was a great, comfortable place to stay.

I stayed here from March 7 thru 12th. I stayed in Tower II of the 36th floor. For what I paid for a discounted location, I was happy with this hotel. There was ample parking and the rooms were decently clean. The Banyan isn't a regular hotel but more like an extended stay place, meaning, there are pots and pans and towels (no additional towels), a fridge, microwave oven, etc... but you don't get room service and maid service costs extra. However, the location was nice (closer to the zoo away from some of the craziness towards mid-Waikiki) and amenities were clean. There is a guard in the parking garage - good to have since Waikiki does have crime and weird individuals. This place is probably better for families and you'll see kids and babies around the pool. If you're single person, you won't find others of your ilk here. I could see east toward the beach from where I was, but much of the view, even from the 36th floor was obstructed by other buildings. When in Waikiki, prepare for the touristy side of HI, paradise it AIN'T. But you'll like the water, sun and scenery.

Last week we stayed in Banyan for 4 days. It's very clean and and good view of the beach. It's very closer to the beach too. It had all amenities that you can think of. Laundry in each floor was really helpful. Only thing the A/C was not good enough for the entire area, especially a bit of discomfort in the bedroom. A very good choice for a longer stay with kids.

Best holiday ever. No dissapointments here, spacious, clean and great daily maid service. Stayed close to top of tower 2 and had fantastic 3 way views ie mountains, city and ocean. Wouldn't hurt to update the furniture but that is the only critisism. Although from Sydney, Australia booked holiday on line with Hawaiian based company (maybe that's why we got upgraded to such a great room whilst paying lowest price, gotta love that) Awesome recreation deck for kids, plenty of room and deckchairs even though busy tme around 4th July. Maid service was great and nothing was a problem, got plenty of extra coffee, etc. Wouldn't even look at anywhere else to stay next time (and I plan on there being a next time)

Waikiki Banyan - just got back on Jan 14 - 80 degrees in Honolulu, 15 above here in Minneapolis -need I say more!!!This is a condo set up on the east end of Waikiki area and two blocks off the beach - seemed less crowded to me than closer to west end , near the Sheraton,Outrigger or Hilton complexStayed in Tower 1 - room was what I expected - we used the place as a base to travel out and do all the tourist things so staying right on Waikiki wasn't a top concern - this place fit the bill. Maid service was fantastic -need more towels ??you got em.Elevators were not a problem, never a long wait. Front desk folks were great for answering questions. Located right on the bus lines and right near the pickup points for the big tours. Pool and hot tubs were fabulous - great place to chat and make new friends. Kitchen set up was ideal for family of four - could prepare a meal there if you wanted vs fighting the rest of the folks looking for a place to eat. Our safety at the place was never in doubt, my teenage daughters made several trips on their own to the beach - two blocks away. Lots of people always around so I didn't worry to much. Use the in room safe - you won't have to carry around all your valuables and cash all the timeHere are some things I learned - my opinion only!! - Don't rent a car, there are enough shuttles and buses close by to get you where want to be. If you booked a trip that includes an orientation breakfast - do it!! This took alot of the guessing out about what to do if you really don't have a planned agenda - we selected several 1/2 day or all day trips - they did all the driving which was great . Be carefull not to select a tour that gets back late and then have another one start the next day at the crack of dawn -spread them out if you can - we were there 10 days .Food - expensive but we went to FoodPantry, 3 blocks away,or Food Land at the Ala Moana mall - Wal Mart is two blocks north of the mall and has some basics - The mall is about a 20 minute bus ride away - $2 bucks per person and get a ransfer that is good for 3 hours. Lastly there is the always available ABC stores that seem to be on every corner - they have alot of basics but at a higher costOne thing that took me several days to figure out -on the main drag down by the beach ,if you don't want to be approached by tour peddlers, time share guys or other hawkers of stuff -walk on the beach side - the peddlers stick to the business side of the street, not to the beach sideWe did the Cirle Tour of the island -makes a big figure 8 of most of Oahu and they do all the driving - you see a lot of things plus see how things look outside of Honolulu - normal livingHike to the top of Diamond Head - but be forewarned - the hike is not a piece of cake - wear shoes not flip flops as1/2 the trail is very rocky or natural. Good view though once on topHonolulu Zoo - 2 hours max - and can help keep smaller kids entertained - nice bird exhibits, not a ton of animals though.Pearl Harbor - get up early as tickets can run out - must see place and give the survivors that might be there a big THANK YOUPolynesian Cultural Center -all day trip but great place to see many of the S Pacific island cultures - SUPER show at night!!!If you go horse riding - at Kualoa - ther is quite a bite of down time if you select the 1 hr ride- only bummer of all the toursAll in all - great place to visit and see - overall experience met or exceeded our expectations. Never met any rude people but how could they be - they live in paradise!!!

We recently returned from our trip to Oahu. We stayed at the Waikiki banyan and it was a fantastic resort. They treated us all very well and for families traveling with children it's the only place to stay. I think our kids wore out the recreation deck!!! I have to admit I read some reviews online about it after we had booked and I was a little scared after some of the reviews I read... but upon arriving I was pleasantly surprised with our room. Honestly I could not say nothing bad about it. We had daily maid service (our maid was the sweetest woman) the sheet were changed regularly and the carpets were shampooed before we arrived. The view was spectacular, we had a view of the ocean and diamond head to wake up to every morning. And the best part for me was having a full kitchen to make my children breakfast and lunches every day which cut down on some of our exspenses. I will for sure stay here when we return to Hawaii!!!!!! Thanks to all the staff for making our holiday wonderful

I booked a room for a family of 5 and when we arrived from Vancouver, we 'upgraded' our city view room to a mountain view room for only a few dollars more and got the top floor in Tower 2 with a fabulous view. The service was great. Despite having heard that the elevators were slow, we found they were quite adequate even when one was being serviced - and we were on the 38th floor. The room was clean, we saw no insects at all. The only thing that could be an improvement is to have a closing door on the partially separated bedroom! The hotel is one of only a few that has rooms for 5 people and it is close to the beach and the International Marketplace. When we return we will definitely go back there!

Our stay at the resortquest waikiki banyon( Dec 5th to 12th) was excellent. We stayed in tower two on the 7th floor. Our room was well taken care off(no complaints) we did have to do our own dishes. We found the staff very helpful and always polite. We did find the elevators to be slow the odd time. The Banyon is one block from the beach and shopping( the international market is a good place for deal hunters). We rented a Harley from Big Kahuna Rentals (Larry) and toured the island we recommmend this to any one who would like to see the island (parking at the banyon is $8 a day or $50 a week and is run by an independant company) The streets are cleaned nightly(you can go barefoot anywhere). Captain Bob's Snorkling is a great time you get to feed tropical fish in the middle of the ocean. Germaine's Luau was very entertaining and the food was great(you get 3 drink tickets with your meal we recommend that you buy the souvenier glass as you get more in it). Kobe's steakhouse was not worth the money and was our only disappointment.Limited menu high price. Our week in hawaii was a true holiday. The grocery store(the pantry) is only 4 blocks away but is more expensive than the one in the Ala Mona Mall. Beware of street venders selling cheap activities as you may not ever see them or your money again( this did not happen to us as we were warned of them).We would stay at The Banyon again.

We booked our unit through Captain Cook Resorts. We were in unit # 2404 (Tower 2) - didn't see any bugs by the way). Lovely unit with a great view - the kitchen was a big plus in terms of saving money on food. I have no compliants about the agency that we booked through or the room I did find that the staff at the front desk of the Banyan were abit rude and short with us. I thought this might have been because we rented the room from the agency and technically they have nothing to do with the room but I have read other reviews about the staff being unfriendly so maybe it wasn't just us. The pool area is pretty good, really crowded though I think the entire 2 weeks the least amount of people I saw in the pool was about 5 and that was on a cloudy overcast day. The internet room is good for checking your emails and printing out travel reservations etc. It is expensive though - 15 cents per minute, which really does add up when you are reading mail etc.It's true the lifts are slow but your on holidays and usually not in the biggest rush so I didn't bother me too much. The Banyan is about 3 blocks to the food pantry which is where we did most of our groccery shopping. Reasonable prices great selection.TheBUS was GREAT make sure you get yourself a timetable from your local ABC store (on every corner - failing that there on the corner after that - there are like 30 something on the island). The bus stop is just on the corner of the Banyan so its an easy walk from drop off.Overall I liked the Banyan if I went back to Hawaii I would like to stay someplace more upmarket (Hilton Hawaiian Village looks spectacular) but if you are watching your pennys this one is for you.Any questions please email me:vanilla_chick18@hotmail.com

The elevator problems at this hotel still exist. Don't let any thoughts that they may be getting fixed fool you. When we checked in, we waited nearly 15 minutes (I timed it) for an elevator, then had to stop at nearly every floor to let people out because the thing was so backed up. On the way down, much of the same. If you use the elevator early in the morning, it isn't a problem, but that's because no one else is using it.It might not see like a big deal, but waiting that long for an elevator with 30 other hot, sweaty, impatient people gets old real fast.I wish that were the the worst thing about this hotel. Nope. The roach traps under the sink should have been my clue to leave. My little buddies started coming out right about bedtime and partied all night and into the morning.Other than the elevator and the bugs, the check-in staff was completely uninterested in their job, the beds are uncomfortable and the a/c is loud. The pool smells funny. The place isn't aweful. The room was clean except for the nasty bugs. The view from our room was better than expected. Parking for only $8 is a bargain. The check out staff was friendly. The rate was fair for the area. But I would never stay here again. Not even for free.

We checked into the unit about 12:30 Nov 10. Check-in was fast becasue they had an available roolm for us. It was a 2 double-bed room with queen sofa. There were 4 adults and it was large enough for us. I guess I stayed in an older room because the air conditioner was in the lanai sliding door and it leaked to the outside. We had a really good view of the ocean and the kitchen facility was adequate, except no dishwasher. We cook all our breakfasts and one dinner. The room was large enough for us. The best part of this condo is the location. It is directly behind the Marriott resort and a 5 minute walk to the beach. Also, the parking was right there, but I didn't like having to pay for parking daily. The hotel wouldn't put parking on our bill and pay at the end. This was inconvenient! The only option was to pay every day or pay 7 days in advance - $50.00 for the week or $8.00 a day. For shopping and location this was a good place to stay, but it is an older complex with average amenities. But for 4 people the place is better than a simple hotel room, and you can save some money by cookinf your own meals if you want.

My wife and I took our first time trip to Oahu (September 2006) and we don't reget for a moment staying at the Waikiki Banyan. This place was the all around best pick for us. We aren't big fans of the overwhelming crowds and noise of the Waikiki area but we wanted to enjoy the vicinity, the shops, and of course the beach. We stayed here for 6 nights in 1-bedroom/1-bath condo, superior city view. I booked only a standard room w/ a single queen bed but on arrival they gave us a double. The staff was good about accomdating our needs and upgraded us for free to a superior city the next morning. The new room had nice renovations to it - new kitchen cabinets, new kitchen appliances, and the view was better. Impressive. The room had a remote controlled A/C unit which is a plus, unlike some other places that don't even have A/C to speak of. The upgrade was much better than the first room, which had more dated furinshings/carpets. Open air lobby has a nice waterfall w/ coi fishes. There's even a mini-mart at Tower I.The goods:- Location, location, location. It is near the Diamonhead end of Waikiki, less busy, less noise. Beach is literally 2 blocks away. They have two towers, request for accomodations in Tower II if you want to stay away from the main street to avoid the noise- Staff was very friendly.- Room was clean and maid service regular- Parking garage was easy to access- Mini mart at tower IThe bads:- Coming back to the room midday some construction/renovation noise going onOverall, pretty good, we'd come back again.

Just returned with my family (2 adults and 2 kids) from a 7 day stay at the Waikiki Banyan with mixed feelings since we were expecting more. We have been visiting Hawaii every year and have stayed in many hotels.We were there for the big earthquake on our second day but supprisingly, we faired much better than friends staying at some of the higher priced, full-service resorts. All electricly was out but 2 out of 4 elevators in each tower were running and there were periodic announcements from Security to try to reassure guests that nothing was know at the time and we were free to do as we like. We heard of others having to walk 28 flights of stairs and no announcements during this ordeal.The hotel entrance way was very nice with dark wood paneling and tasteful Hawaiian decor. On one side of the open lobby was a rock wall that had water cascading down into a Koi pond. Front counter staff were all very friendly and helpful...except the Concierge who we tried several times to contact via different methods unsuccessfully. Over the course of few days, it turned into a challenge to try to get help from the phantom Concerige. First day he was out to lunch so we made plans on our own. Then the next day we tried calling down but never got an answer, then I tried to call the front desk to ask a callback but never was contacted so finnaly I went down to directly try to get help but was told very bluntly by the person behind the concerige desk that he could not talk...too busy.The point is plan to make your own travel plans if you stay at this hotel.On the positive side, we had both a mountain and ocean view that was nice. Room was big with full kitchen and big entrance way. Note for internet users, connection to internet costs $$ but free wireless access was available from nearby with a very good connection from anywhere in the room.On the negative side, bath was Very small and the exhaust fan was Loud. We complained to the front desk that our reservations stated that there were 2 full size beds, but we were told that the second bed was the sofa bed...which was no cost! The sofa bed-frame was bent out of shape and Very bad so we had to put the Very bad mattress on the floor for a Very uncomfortable bed. There is no restaurant on the premise except a snack bar by the pool. There is a convinience store on the first floor but a full Grocery store is a good 20 minute walk away. For just about everything, we were told to go next door to the Marriott.As for location, don't be decieved, this hotel is on the edge of Waikiki and not at all central...to anything.As a conclusion, the Facility was nice for families and clean but very old. Next time we plan to pay a little more and stay elsewhere.

My husband and I and our 3 daughters just returned from our stay at the ResortQuest at the Waikiki Banyan and we had a wonderful experience. Our check in did not go smoothly but that was the fault of our booking agent. The front desk staff was incredible, particularly Marlon, who went out of his way to make it up to us. We were in Tower II with an amazing view of the mountains and the Ala Wai Canal. Our room had two full size beds and a queen-sized sofa sleeper so we had plenty of room. The housekeeping staff did an excellent job and our room was always clean and stocked with fresh towels. The pool area was very nice with a snack bar, BBQ grills, basketball and tennis courts, a play area for younger children, two hot tubs (hot and hotter) and plenty of lounge chairs. It was always very clean and well maintained. The hotel has a nice little market on the first floor near the parking garage in Tower I and we were amazed at the prices, which were comparable (if not cheaper) than any of the other markets nearby, and they carry nearly everything you'll need for your stay. There is also a computer room equipped with computers and a printer that you can use for a nominal charge. If you bring your laptop and a wirless card you can access the internet at no charge, but you have to either be in the computer room or on the benches just in front. Our two teenagers would run down with our laptop while the rest of us were getting ready to go out and jump on-line to say hi to friends and check e-mails. We had no problems waiting for elevators, but we were there during an off-season time. The only "negatives" I can offer would be a lack of storage and, initially, late housekeeping. With 5 of us (2 adults and 16, 14 and 11-year old girls) we could have used a bit more storage space than a closet, a tiny 3 drawer bureau and a small night stand. We had no where to store our luggage and the bags remained out the entire stay. Also, the first two days of our stay we had returned to our room around 4:00 or 4:30 and housekeeping had not been by yet. However, I simply called housekeeping and requested an earlier visit and after that the room was always tended to by noon.Overall our stay was awesome. We have been to Hawaii several times (and even spent our honeymoon - 19 years ago - at the Prince Kuhio across the street) and the accomodations here were perfect for a family. There's plenty of shopping and dining within walking distance and the beach is only a short walk away. The staff was polite, helpful and friendly...we would definitely stay there again.

Got a room on tower 2.Room was not clean but was smelling. Kitchen floor was sticky throught our 5 day stay. Had to ask twice for kitchen soap.Remote for TV was not working.This is a hotel in a beach resort, so you would at least think they had an idea how to hang beach towels and bathing suits? NO, had to improvise on the balcony. No light in the 6 sq. foot balcony.Sofa in living room was dirty and smelling.Try to stay away from this place it needs urgent renovation. For a few more dollars you can do a lot better.

We just spend 10 days enjoying the benefits of Waikiki living at this hotel. Large (for 2) 1 bedroom rooms with full kitchen for the price of a standard room elsewhere. Friends stayed at the Marriott (100 yds away) for over $100 a night more with a much smaller room. Yes, they had a full service hotel, but we had a nice pool, BBQ grills, tennis on the 6th floor. Having a full kitchen was a huge benefit in keeping costs down. With parking only $8/day (reasonable for us as we come from major metro area where parking is easily $15/day) we made good use of our car. This hotel is only 1.5 blocks from the famous Waikiki beach - home of the much pricer hotels. BTW very few have direct beach access, so we were not at a disadvantage there either. Our room on the 25th floor had a nice view of Diamond Head and the ocean. Our only small complaint is the slow, over worked elevators. Only 4 for a 36 story residential tower.

I stayed at this hotel with my wife and three teenage children, it was ideal for us, the children loved it, we had a one bedroom apartment and a wonderful view of Diamond Head, we had a full kitchen which we only used for breakfast and snacks but it was so convenient to make breakfast and have it on the lanai, we used the swimming pool once but found it fine. The location is excellent five minute walk to the beach and for the price we paid for this hotel you couldn’t go wrong $200 a night for a one bedroom apartment within a few minutes form Waikiki Beach, it works out at less than $40 per person. In my opinion this is an ideal hotel for families and groups. If you wanted to be negative and pick holes you could say the carpet had some stains on it but it is a self catering apartment and a darker carpet might be more practicable. The room was cleaned everyday anyway. I would defiantly stay here again if we return with our children and I have already recommended it to family and friends.

I've been to Honolulu 4 times, and 3 out of those trips I stayed at Waikiki Banyan. Its a great hotel, affordable, great decor, fresh and spacious. It has a kitchen which is great, especially if you are on a budget- that way you can make your own meals now and then. I truly loved this place, and recommend to all Travelling Families!! Its only couple of blocks to waikiki and the Internation Markets......I would definately look at staying again when taking my kids, or on a budget!!

We enjoyed our stay at the Banyan very much.Very nice room on 29th floor with beautiful ocean view.The maid service was very good as well as the desk staff.This was our first visit to Hawaii for our daughter's weddingand we we will be back and staying there once again!!We had a great time!

My family stayed here August 22nd-29th for a family reunion and we had a blast!! We had a room on the 11th floor facing the city with a view of the beach which was great. My Brother-in-law stay at this location too and we were able to be right next to each other. Our room were very different from each other. He had the nicer room with more amenities. This hotel is in a great location and very close to the beach. Staff was very friendly and helpfull. The hotel/condo made our trip to Oahu a wonderful experience and we definately would stay here again! Maid service could be alittle better and faster. There were several days that we came back to the hotel in the late afternoon and no maid service has been done.

My Wife & I with our two children 14 & 10 stayed at the Banyan from 23/7/06 to 4/8/06. After reading all the reviews before we travelled to Hawaii were very concerned about the quality of the hotel & the room. We were booked into room 3413 which was a deluxe one bedroom ocean view with kitchen in Tower One . We arrived at around midday and were blown away by the view as soon as we opened the door. We found the room to be a great size. The bathroom people seemed to complain about in previous reviews about being small, ok it was small compared our bathroom at home but u dont spend your holiday in the bathroom. And for a normal size person its quite ok. We found everyone to be helpful and polite, the lifts were a little slow on one day out of eleven...who cares your on holidays... the room being up so high was quiet. We didnt hear a single person in other rooms at any stage. During the nights with the air conditioning on we could hardly even hear the traffic below. The bed was comfy, the kitchen well stocked with cutlery and the room cleaned every day by a lovely cleaning lady.The only thing i could fault was a $40.00US phone call back to Australia for under a minute which was made through reception. I couldnt justify that expense at all. We have stayed at Fiji, Whitsunday Islands Australia, Surfers Paradise Australia and others and the kids rated this as their best holiday. If you want an excellent place to stay with a family without breaking the Bank stay here. All you Aussies thinking of somewhere reasonable to stay u will be happy here....Hull Family Dubbo Australia

We stayed at the Hawaiian Sun Holidays of the Waikiki Banyan during the week of July 22-July 29, 2006. This was a timeshare exchange through ---. You have to know that this is located at the same address as the Resort Quest of the Waikiki Banyan. The room had a great view of the ocean. We had a kitchen without a dishwasher. The queen size bed had a hard mattress. The air conditioner was not able to keep the room cool. The location was very good. We were only a block away from the beach and zoo. There is so much to do on the island. A rental car is a must so a person can check out thewhole island. You feel like that you are in paradise, there are flowers everywhere. We met some very interesting local people.If you want to go to Pearl Harbor and the Hanamnma Bay go before 9:00. I liked the hot tub, swimming pool and grill area and the Waikiki Banyan has a great koi pond and waterfall in the main entrance. I would stay here again.

As advised by previous posters, we requested renovated rooms, which we received, plus a free upgrade to an ocean view room. We stayed in two rooms in Tower One. One room (the last room at the end of the hall) was larger than the other and had a nice view of Waikiki Beach. Both rooms were relatively clean - no cockroaches! Furniture is a bit dated, and carpeting in one of the rooms was worn. Air conditioning did not circulate well to the bedroom, as the unit was in the main living room. Beds/mattresses and pillows were comfortable - seem to be new. Elevators were slow and became stuck at times. The trick is to physically push the doors closed if the elevator does not move. The parking lot is not designed very well, but parking is relatively cheap ($7/24 hours, with in and out priviliges). Did not go to the pool so cannot comment on these facilities, but appears to be well maintained. Staff are friendly and helpful. Location is convenient, very close to the beach. All in all, it was a decent hotel - a true 3 star, and nothing more.

We stayed at the Waikiki Banyan June 25-July2. Overall, I would rate this hotel a good choice for families travelling with children. It is by no means a luxury hotel and is short on amenities such as a coffee shop or restaurant but by and large, we enjoyed our stay. The best features are the the separate bedroom (sliding doors but a good size and nice to have the privacy), kitchen, generous seating area with a hide-a-bed couch and two chairs.. plus a large lanai. We didn't cook at all but we could have and it was great to have a table and chairs where we could eat a light breakfast. It was also good to have a decent-sized room to come home to and relax in at the end of a long, hot day on the beach or out sightseeing. We walked around Waikiki a lot and got a look at many of the finer hotels and yes they had shops and restaurants but when we checked them out on this website before coming, you could see the rooms were lovely but not very big, unless you got a much higher-priced suite ($400 plus).After reading a review right before we left, we called and requested a renovated room on an upper floor. We got what we asked for and stayed on the 32nd floor and were very glad we did. We could see that other floors (and therefore rooms) were very much in need of upgrading. And yes, fellow travelers, the elevator was a wee bit slow and very hot but it's very hard to complain when you're in Hawaii.I'm not so sure I would stay here if it were just the two of us on a romantic holiday getaway but for 2 adults and a (large) teenaged son, it was just fine. Most Honolulu hotels, especially those in Waikiki, can't accommodate 3 adults comfortably or privately in one room and many are far more expensive than the Banyan. As one of our fellow hotel guests observed, he'd rather stay somewhere more modest and spend his money on adventures like snorkeling or sailing. Our room was cleaned daily (and no, we didn't see one insect) and we always got fresh towels. Plus, the hotel staff were helpful and tried to meet all our requests. It was also within walking distance of pretty much everything. The beach is 5 minutes away - 3 minutes if you run.Again, request a renovated room. That was the most important piece of advice we got. (p.s. if you're looking to rent a car in Honolulu, book well ahead of time. Rental cars are at an absolute premium there and we couldn't get one for 2 days after inquiring. Plus, I wouldn't bother having a car for more than 1 day and only then so you can drive around the island yourself and stop when you want.))

My family and I stayed at the Waikikii Banyan June 15 - 20. First we were on the 7th floor of Tower 2, and every time we came back to the room/ woke up in the morning, there were cockroaches all over the kitchen. We decided to change rooms, and they moved us to the 8th floor. We thought this room would be better since the furniture looked better, and we had an ocean view which was nice. But before we knew it, we saw cockroaches in the kitchen AND the sofa/ living area! The front desk was not helpful and said they were working on the problem. Also, this hotel does not have a separate "service elevator" - so the elevators are always filled with the housekeeping carts, hotel employees, etc. Once it took over 10 minutes to get an elevator! The only thing that was good about the Waikikii Banyan was that since it had a kitchen, we were able to bring breakfast items from the grocery store and not pay that much $$ for food. If you can find another hotel that has a kitchen, dont stay here!Other than that..we LOVED Waikikii and went to the Polynesian Cultural Center, hiked up Diamond Head, went to Pearl Harbor, Hanauma Bay..oh and dont miss the Blowhole Lookout point - it was beautiful. Have a good trip!

I am going to dispell all the negative rumors. After our 7 night stay on the 26th floor in tower 1. I am pleased to say our stay was great. NO BUGS (dead or alive) The view was incredible. I requested a pool view & got that along with a great view of both the mountain & the ocean. This came along with the superior city view. The nights were quiet with a siren or two for that back home feel. My 11 year old daughter enjoyed the pool, although it stayed crowded most of the time and my 19year old daughter enjoyed the jacuzzi & basketball court. I enjoyed the jacuzzi, tennis court & the barbeque grill. The rec deck was nice with plenty of chairs with umbrellas. The room, in addition to a view to die for had 2 full size beds & 1 Queen size bed, along with 2 TV sets. The entire floor was newly renovated it appeared & the carpeting, fixtures & drapes were all in excellent condition. They did have roach traps discretely placed through out the room, we never saw any roaches, ants or anything else. The hotel is a short 1 block walk from the beach (less than 5 minutes) the zoo was about an 8min walk & the aquarium was about a 12 min walk. A bus stop is right outside the hotel doors & is $2 for adults & $1 for children to go ANYWHERE. Once you learn to manuver around on the bus, a rental car would be an unnecesssary expense. The kitchen was fully stocked but if you intend to bake, bring your own baking pans, as none are supplied. They supply beach towels & also have a mini golf course . The staff was very helpful & pleasant most of the time. I could not ask for anything more from a resort/condo. The price could not be beat. Excellent value. Great location. Very peaceful. The balcony is quite spacious. They exceeded our expectations. Some rooms have not been completely upgraded yet, but the stay was well worth it.

My first stay at the Banyan was in July 2003 and I've stayed there at least 7 times since. My mom liked it enough to invest in their timeshare and exchange program. Don't go in here expecting the Sheraton, Hawaiian HIlton, or Hyatt. You're not going to be totally impressed... but it is one of the better hotels in the area. Our last visit to Waikiki Banyan was in March 2005 for my wedding. We were in Hawaii for 3 weeks in preparation and for after our wedding and spent the first week at the Banyan before moving to the Hyatt in an effort to make our wedding budget. We had guests staying in hotels all over the Waikiki area with about 15 families staying in the Banyan. The Banyan by far had better reviews by our guests than some of our other friends and family that stayed in area hotels. The rooms are clean although, the decor is a bit dated. But as long as you don't mind the silk flowers, you'll be okay. They have put in updates since our first visit, all new appliances, countertops, carpet and paint. They could have used new and more comfortable beds and bedding... but maybe they're still working on it. The view is tricky. I've stayed in rooms with the view of the golf course and the ala wai canal which is nice, a room with a great view of... the Marriott. And we've stayed in rooms with a view of the recreation deck and a peek a boo view of the ocean. We've asked to change rooms because we didn't like either the room or the view, which they have accomodated.Location, location, location. Although it is not directly on the beach, it is exactly one block from the sand and water. There are ABC stores, restaurants, and nightlife in every direction within walking distance. The international market and high end shopping are also within walking distance. Unless you're staying at one of the 5 star resorts, the Banyan has a great recreation area. The pool is better and bigger than the one at the Hyatt or the Marriott, with more beach chairs and access to tennis courts, putting green and bbq's. There are laundry facilities on each floor that are handy. There are small kitchen areas in the rooms which is kind of nice to have. I personally don't like to cook when I'm on vacation, but some people like it. The pots and pans aren't the best quality, but it get the job done, I guess. Sometimes as you're walking down the hallways, you can smell what other people are cooking. The staff was helpful everytime we went down to the front desk for directions and had convienient area maps. It is located in a safer area of Waikiki where we could spent late nights walking to and from area bars and restaurants and didn't have to walk past prostitutes and drug deals like where our relatives stayed at the Miramar with their children (our ring bearer found a bag of weed in the lobby on the floor there! YIKES!).Overall, in my opinion, I think the Banyan is a good deal with more pros than cons.

We arrived March 28..two families two suites..we both booked the Dlx Oceanview rooms non smoking. We were delighted to be on the 34th floor with rooms directly across from one another. Our DLX OCV room was 3402..well we walked in and the stale nasty cigarette smell was just awful..we called the front desk and they advised us they were full but would send someone up..they did..she came with a can of air freshner..oh well..we left the balcony door open most the time..and if you lean over the railing and look to your left you can see some of the ocean..our friends room which was directly across the hall 3401..was better..seemed cleaner and didn't smell of smoke. Ask for Mountian View,it's better than OCV and probably cheaper.Pool is nice,just don't let the security guard see your kids having fun and jumping into the pool or they will threaten to kick you out of the hotel..security not tactful at all..Mini-mart in lobby is convienient and has good selection of drinks and snacks and the staff very nice there. Elevators slow most the time..but it was busy and there are lots of floors..not a big deal...hotel location is great..walk to waikiki,International Market,great restaurants,beach...nothing more than a few blocks. Rent a car for a day or two but you wont need one unless you are going to the other side of the island. In review,don't expect alot..I think the rooms are hit or miss..but the pool is nice and the location is great.your pretty much get what you pay for..my kids loved it there and so we were happy.We couldn't swim in the ocean due to sewage spill and rain so thank goodness we had a big pool to swim in on the 2 days we did have sun!

We were a little hesitant to stay here based on a lot of the negative reviews. Especially about the lack of cleanliness. Well for my husband and I with our three kids (4,9, and 11) it was the perfect hotel. That being said, it was perfect for the value (every 5th night free). The carpet was the biggest disappointment. It was stained and not too inviting. The rest of the room was great and actually quite clean. Our cleaning lady was more than helpful. The beds were ok. Don't rent a cot - only springs! The space was great. We had a corner unit and would definitely recommend it. The recreation deck was awesome. The pool a nice temperature and the hot tubs were nice too. Yes the elevators break down occasionally and can be a little slow but we loved it here. Just a quick walk to the beach too!!! Maybe just for adults, I would recommend a bit different hotel, but for families it is wonderful. All you could ask for. We would definitely stay here again....

Nice facilities for kids, nice playground, its good to have a kitchen/2 rooms when traveling with kids...That being said, this place is a real dump. The furniture is filthy, the room was dirty when we checked in. The supposed "king" bed was two twins pushed together, and so you could not sleep in the middle with your spouse. The drapes had holes, everything was faded. The elevators take forever.The lobby looks really nice, it surprised me how trashy the rooms are. I thought maybe we were just on a bad floor or something. The location is pretty good, but I would never stay here again.Be careful of prepaying through travel sites because you will be stuck!!!

This condo/hotel is great with kids. We loved the two separate rooms and the play area & pool. The kitchen was great for space for breakfasts & the odd lunch. Complaints were minor - first night we got in late & the non-smoking room requested was an ashtray. The front desk promptly fixed that for us the next morning. We did end up moving an addtional time due to room availability, but ended up with a gorgeous ocean view room on the 28th floor. As for room decor, each unit appears to differ based on ownership as some units are time shares & others are vacation rental homes - not a true hotel.The elevators are slow only at key times - due to heavy use, i.e., 7:00 am & 5:30 pm - people leaving for the morning & returning at night & leaving for dinner.Best benefit was it was a competitive price & it is so close to the beach. Also, the public parking is very inexpensive for those days when you do want to rent a car - or there is free street parking on AliWai.We'd stay again.

We stayed there for 5 nights in tower 2, 31 st floor. Nice staff, nice lobby, great location, beautiful view, but our room was dirty and very run down. Dirty walls, dirty furniture, smelly carpet, old blankets with holes in them. We asked to change to a better room but we were told this was one of the the best ones...Would never stay there again.

BOTTOM LINE is this is a no-brainer for families with children looking for good value in the under $200/night range mainly because of the better than average (for Waikiki) pool area with playground and tennis/basketball court and the good location.This is our second year staying here. (Actually originally decided to splurge this year and initially checked in to a 2-bdrm at their other property, the coveted Beach tower for 50% off rack rate which is $388 (rack is $776!) and were mortified at the poor value - see separate review of thisproperty.) So I quickly scrambled and got us a 1 bedroom at the Banyan and got the heck out.The Banyan is all about the luck of the draw regarding how your particular room is furnished and situated. Some will have slightly different layouts and newer TV's, etc. THE KEY: Don't be afraid to ask to see other available rooms.The pool area has a nice open feeling too with partial view of Diamond head where other buildings a few blocks closer to the center of Waikiki will have a more packed in feel (like the Beach Tower). This can also make the pool area a bit Breezy though.All rooms will seem dated as most all condos in Waikiki were built in the 70's and most look like they did back then - Banyan is no exception. If you can get past that, the Banyan is actually a superb value (we paid $130 Entertainment rate for a 1-bedroom [1/3 the rate we paid for a 2-bedroom at the Beach tower] which is more of a cross between a 1-bedroom and a studio as the bedroom as a slider usually and not a door. It's a small 1-bedroom.)I believe the best rooms are on the upper floors (25 and above) in Tower 1 where you either get a Diamond Head with partial ocean view or a City with partial ocean view (the units on the city side have a bit better view of the ocean but not by much - I like the Diamond Head View best.) side but I imagine the oceanside rooms in the upper floors of Tower 2 are good too.This year we got one on the City side (36th floor, 1 floor from the top in Tower 1) which actually isn't too bad. Had to switch rooms though (from 34th to 36th same unit) as we got a unit were they installed a shelf in part of the opening to the bedroom so the A/C wasn't going to cool the bedroom much.IMPORTANT: Don't plan on having much privacy in the bedroom unless you don't mind sleeping in a hot stuffy room, you need to keep the sliding doors open to get some of the A/C. Also good to get a room with the TV on a roller cart so you can roll it around to face the bed in the bedroom while the kids sleep on the sofa.Bed's are not comfortable in this place, especially if you are sensitive to this sort of thing. Prepare to invest in an inflatable cushion or egg crate foam unless sleeping on concrete or springs is okay with you. Again, it is the luck of the draw though some units may be just fine and those use to staying in places with poor beds will probably not complain.Staff here is friendly. Location is superb, 1-1/2 blocks walk to the less crowded, most protected (called "The Pools") section of Waikiki Beach.Elevators are only slow at peak times. 4 high-speed Internet computers near the lobby ($1/5 min.) Small convenience store also in building. No restaurant, but there are PLENTY within a very short walk.If you have a couple children and your budget is under $200/night, THIS IS THE BEST VALUE IN WAIKIKI right now (The Sunset would be a good value too as it is similar but I give the edge to the Banyan - I toured the Sunset rooms and the only advantage is that you can get a 2-bedroom/2-bath there but the pool area at the Banyan is better, especially for kids.) The keyword is VALUE not LUXURY.I actually give it a 3.5 (3 for the property itself, 4 for the value, 4 for the pool area compared to other similar properties in the category.)

We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. We were both really impressed with the rooms, they were large one bedrooms, each had a kitchen, lounge area and the bedroom could be closed off. Had a great view of the ocean. I thought the hotel was excellent value, it was clean, the rooms had all the necessary facilities. The pool area was fairly average looking but was well maintained and clean. Would recommend this hotel to anyone for the price

Just came back from Oahu 11/17-11/20. See my (lengthy, but hopefully helpful)notes below. I was on a budget trip and found that the hotel exceeded my expecatations.I wanted to check in earlier then 3pm, and called every hour on the hour beginning at 12pm, but the room was not ready.Room - we stayed in room #2001 and found it was very large, full kitchen with dishes/pans, coffee maker, toaster, even a rice cooker! Great view of Diamondhead and a bit of the ocean. Cleanliness - the shower could have been cleaned better and the dishes were not cleaned so we left a tip at the end of the trip for them to take care of. Design could have been updated - found one broken lampshade next to the bed, but it didn't bother me too much. Large TV on a rolling cart so we could watch from bed was nice. sofabed pullout was also a good touch and shows you how big the room is. Service - Found that the front desk could have been more helpful when the concierge was busy. When I called to ask the concierge for questions on street parking she said she didn't know and then got sidetracked and asked me to hold. Didn't put me on hold, but put the phone down to talk to another guest visiting her desk for 5-10 minutes before I hung up. Comparison to pricier hotel near by:We had friends staying at the Radisson across the street - although newer and had complimentary business center/internet use and a hospitality suite for showers after checkout, the rooms were by far very small, compared to ours. More expensive and the service was pretty good, especially the bell men. Bar in the lobby and by the pool were both nice.Location: at the end of the waikiki strip on Kuhio, but close to the zoo and Kapiolani Park, and walking distance to the beach. We parked in the garage for $7 / day 24 hour access w/ in out privileges. Radisson was $10. Street parking is 2 hour max, meter run .25 per 10 mins. Meters say 7am - 6pm - we parked at 5pm on Friday and did not get ticketed even when we checked the next day at 9am.
user_name:
Joy S
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here in October of 2005 for a week. It was a good hotel for what we paid. We needed a suite because we had 3 adults and 2 young kids.The hotel is nothing fancy but it is a fine place to stay. It does need some updating, the decor leaves a bit to be desired but who really cares about that? It's basically a good place to sleep and maybe prepare a few meals.We had a room on the top floor and the view was really amazing. Lots of windows and a bright atmosphere. There was everything we needed in the room and lots of space. The bathroom is pretty tiny though.The only big issue we had was that the A/C unit is in the living room so if you close the bedroom doors at night, the A/C will not reach you and it gets awfully hot in there. If you leave the windows open, it is noisy from traffic below.The rooms are very quiet. We never heard anyone below or next to us. This was great since we have children who needed their sleep.Housekeeping was very nice and polite. They did come pretty late in the day and so we just asked for towels. But I think it may have been that we were on the very top floor.The playground for the kids is so nice to have there. We did not use the pool because the beach is so close. But the pool looked really nice.The beach is literally a 5 minute walk. So nice! Lots of shops nearby too and a coffee place closeby.We were really impressed with the treatment the kids got on check in. Plastic pails and shovels and lots of little goodies which they loved.We did not have to wait for the elevator at all. This was just not an issue for us.

You could probably do quite a bit better than this condominium resort BUT you could also do a whole lot worse. Just returning from an 8 day stay at this resort where we had a one bedroom condo just a short 2-3 minute walk from Waikiki Beach. It's an older condo resort which needs either renovating or at least a really good cleaning. Come to think of it, if it was renovated without reinstructing the housekeeping staff on what constitutes clean, what would be the point of the renovation? Nevertheless, it's a good value, close to the beach, you can cook in your room (as long as you clean up the kitchen first - don't forget to spread the kitchen table apart and clean before you eat on it. We had to ask the hotel reception desk to have the housekeeping staff spend a little more time trying to remove the mold build-up in the bathroom. This resort - and I don't know why they call it a resort, there are few amenities one associates with a resort, is walking distance to everything at Waikiki. We'd stay there again, but would want to preview our room first!!

My husband and I have been to Oahu several times and each time we have stayed on the beach. This was our first time staying at the banyan-although it was not "on the beach" that was actually ok w/us. We had our two young children (6yo/3yo)and everything worked out perfect there. The room which we stayed had a small kitchen area-w/everything; which was very nice w/children. The stay is only a block and a 1/2 from the beach, shopping and restaurants. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean-needed a little updating w/decor-but that was really no big deal. We plan to stay here again next year!

The hotel room was quite spacious, with one twin bed, one Queen bed and a pull-out Queen-sized sofa. The bathroom was small, though, and the water pressure in the shower was not very strong. Lighting in both the living room and bedroom could have been better; primarily lamp lighting is used. The lighting wouldn't be good for reading novels. The large sliding doors to the lanai and windows in the bedroom gave a beautiful view of the Ala Wai Golf Course and residential areas beyond. We wish we had reserved an ocean view room with such large windows available. The rec area was large, with tennis courts, a small putting green, a pool, two jacuzzis, a BBQ area and snack bar. However, it's weird that you have to pay quarters into a coin slot in order for time to use the BBQ. Also, the golf clubs for the putting green should be complimentary instead of $3 per hour. The pool was scheduled to be closed for 5 days, from Sept. 26-30, but because a child threw up in the pool on Sept. 24, the pool was also closed on Sept. 25. We were only renting for one night, so it was a great disappointment that we weren't able to use the pool. The hotel should have allowed us to go to their "sister" hotel across the street to use the pool. The front desk said they couldn't allow that for liability reasons unless we were renting a room at the "sister" hotel. I'm sure they must have an umbrella liability policy for all the "sister" hotels (or if not, they should procure one), and they should have let us use the pool at the other hotel. The elevators took forever to come, even though there were four elevators for each tower. Also, the hallways and the elevators are super hot on humid Hawaii days!! The only air conditioning is one window unit in the living room. There should also be a unit in the bedroom, so you can shut the sliding door between the two rooms and still feel the A/C coolness. All in all, it was a pretty good value for the amount paid, considering that the room is in Waikiki and the hotel is conveniently located. The front desk staff could have been friendlier upon check-in, though, and the keys didn't work the first time we tried (on the 38th floor!), so we had to wait forever again for the elevators in order to go back to the front desk to get the card keys re-keyed. That was a hassle that should never have happened.

Tonight, I asked one of the front desk clerks to let me know the phone number of a certain hotel where my friend was staying. She checked the phone book and just said the number to me, knowing I didn't have a pen and a piece of paper. When I asked her to use her pen and give me a piece of paper, she said, "You don't even have a piece of paper!" I was so surprised at her rudeness. In every country, front desk clerks would write the requested phone number down for their customers, right? She was really rude to me and I will never stay at such a hotel like this, where third-grade front desk clerks are working with no common sense. I really felt uncomfortable staying here!

We have stayed there three times. Our idea about this condo-hotel is changing little by little. The first time we had a very good time. Then this summer we must think about our idea. Parking a lot: This may be very pool, depending on when you are visiting. We came here late in the evening. We were tired of flying from LA. We drove to the parking a lot next to this hotel. At the entrance, a parking guy told us that you were not able to park your car although you were staying here because they had no place to accept any car at all . We wonder why we could not!! Then we got out of it, we rushed into the chech-in counter.We won`t forget what they explained to us. ``We have nothing to do with the manegement of this parking a lot. So we have no resposibility for your request.`` OH, Come on!! It took a lot of time to let them know this stupid progrom. You know, we were so weary after all. Hotel service: used to be, they were nice. But this summer, it seems to be changed. The room they gave us was completely different from what we requested. The room has no couch. Everyone can tell what this room needs.Is this room enough to make us confortable after a long flight? We asked them what it was. We could not believe what we asked for. Is it a hotel you should pay for? Someone came to us , checking out what it is. Then they came to understand it. But they said there was no room for you and you should stay there one night. We were tired of their poor service. The next morning they called us . But they did not know what is problem. We had to explan what they treated us again and again. At last, they offered the new room. But it was too late, unfortunately.In conclusion, the hotel price looks pretty reasonable. The room view would be nice , as always. But we think we should pay for this serivice although we used to enjoy staying.

Stayed at the Waikiki Banyan for 6 nights but could have stayed for ever. Great value in a great place. Rooms are spacious with excellent facilities. Apartments have daily maid service which is just fantastic. Walking distance everywhere is perfect because it gives you automatic excercise!Will stay again.

Ok, let me get all the negatives about this motel/condo out of the way.First, when you drive up to check in, there are no luggage carts available and only 1 bellhop that we could find. Check-in went ok, elevator ride up to the 34th floor was a nightmare as there is no ventilation in the elevator and it was like an oven! The room was well appointed but the furniture was not in tip top shape and should have been replaced. No dishwasher, no ice maker in the fridge and only 2 ice trays, no blender and none available, no broiler pan for the oven. Glassware minimal. TV ---- as you only get a handful of channels with no premium channels at ALL! Sofa was comfortable though. Nice view of the mountains. When you close the doors to separate the bedroom from the living room, the A/C window unit can't cool it so that is a problem. Also, a real negative is they close the pool and spa at 9PM what the heck is up with that? The "laundry facilities" consist of 1 washer and 1 dryer on each floor! No ice maker or soda machines or anything anywhere in the hotel. Mini mart on lobby level is expensive as heck, and the ATM will only dispense $100 a day. Make sure you pack food as you won't want to buy it, the prices are outrageous! Make sure you bring things like dish soap, laundry soap, etc, from home as it is 5 x more in Hawaii than on the mainland.Now, for the rest. The pool is large with lots of lounge chairs.
