The BBQ grills are electric and cost $2 an hour to use. The 2 spas aren't big enough to accomodate everyone who wanted to use them. One is luke warm, one is about 98 degrees, the better of the 2. You are only a 2 block walk to Waikiki Beach and this place is conveinent to all of Waikiki. The parking garage is $40 a week. parking spaces are hard to get! Since this was my first trip to Honolulu, I know now not to stay on Waikiki. It is too busy and congested and the traffic in Honolulu is horrible! Stay on the windward side of the Island or on the Northshore, MUCH better!

It REALLY depends on what room you get. When we checked in at 10 p.m. on a Sunday night to a room on the 34th floor. I was MORTIFIED. Despite our paid upgrade to the ocean view room - we could see it if we craned our neck to the left of the lanai. The room was old, there were no pictures and it felt like a dump. I told my husband that I was going to check out other hotels the next day. I called, the staff agreed but they had nothing else available and asked us to check back the next day. The next morning we asked for another room. WOW. A clean room, new appliances, full microwave, beautiful view of Diamond Head and the Ocean on the 32nd floor. It was like a different hotel. The maid service was good but sometimes not till 5 or 6 p.m. at night. Also, coffee is only complimentary the first day... ???... I thought that was a little cheap. It was GREAT to stay here with our 4 month old, because we couldn't hear anything so we were certain no one could hear us. The microwave and full kitchen was hand for cleaning bottles, storing breastmilk, etc. Our floor mainly had permanent residents - we were one of the few tourists there. The parking was cheap, $7/day or $40/week. Pay the weekly fee if you are going to be there more than a few days just for your sanity. If not, you have to physically go down and repay every 24hours --- if you don't they'll charge you and additional $7 plus the cost of a new 24 hour ticket. The parking garage is NOT owned by the hotel. I'd stay here again - ONLY if I was guarenteed the same room or one just as nice... I'm not sure that's a gamble I am willing to take for our next visit. This was our second visit to Waikiki beach in less than two years.

We just returned from Hawaii, we are staying at a different hotel on each visit. This year we stayed at the waikiki banyan. The staff was great, loved the open check in area with the koi pond in the entrance. The room was a bit dated, the sofa bed was completely uncomfortabe to sleep in, the beds in the bedroom were equally uncomfortable..we ended up purchasing inflatable beds at WalMart which made the rest of our stay comfortable.The room is definetely not a one bedroom but a large studio with three doors separating the "bedroom" from the living room. The kitchen was nice however the faucet in the sink kept on leaking...I was dissapointed with how worn the carpet was, worn and torn in some areas and the curtains were in need of replacing...but we were there to enjoy waikiki beach, diamond head, north shore, hanauma bay, kailua beach, etc....and outside of the minor things it was actually a really nice place to stay at...quiet..there are a significant number of owner occupied units here but they are very nice. Most likely will stay here next family vacation in 2006.

THe Banyan was close to the beach and a lot of shopping. The staff were excellent and very helpful especially the event desk. I would recomened the Banyan to everyone. Good clean hotel with that Aloha Spirit

We stayed at the Waikiki Banyan for a week. We chose this hotel because we were traveling with a one-year-old and needed the kitchen for convenience. We had a beautiful room with an ocean view on the 36th floor. Staff were very helpful, hotel was clean and in a safe location. We really enjoyed our time here and will definitely choose this hotel again.

After reading reviews on this site we were a little nervous about staying at the Waikiki Banyan, but upon arrival found a very nice lobby and reasonable room. Our family situation was 3 adults and 2 kids 9 and 12. The room had wear, chips and gouges in walls, carpets worn but relatively clean. Saw none of the bugs that we read about before going, and didn't get the bed bugs either! The pool area and recreation deck were great and once we asked for pool towels they were huge and very nice. THe staff was available and very polite. We flooded the bathroom and needed extra towels and they were there in minutes with fresh ones. We had about a 3-5 minute walk to the beach and we had a view of the ocean from our 29th floor suite. The elevators going 29 floors were also very fast. All in all it was not the best or the worst we have stayed in, but was clean for our 11 night stay.

I have mixed feelings about this hotel. I stayed at the hotel for 8 nights, and it was a so-so experience. The room: it is not nearly as nice as the pictures! It surved its purpose, but nothing fancy. The TV has less than 25 channels. The Kitchen is OK- has a small microwave, full stove and oven and a few pots and pans. No dishwasher. The maid service was good- but they get a little hostile if you leave the "privacy please" sign in all day. Most hotels would leave you alone and just not clean your room, not here! They call you and ask- and when I said "no, no service is needed" she started to question me- so much for a quiet day!Parking is $7 a day/40 a week. Not too pricy for Oahu!The hotel is 3-4 blocks from the beach, nice walk!As for me- I am not sure if I would stay here again. I would concider it if the price was good. But I would also go to another hotel if they had a better price. I would give the hotel a 6 out of 10!

I stayed at the Banyan last May and I thought it was a great place to stay. There were 3 of us girls and pleanty of room. The kitchen and living room area was quite large and the bedroom and bathroom also had lots of space. For 3 girls who were there for 10 days....lots of luggage etc the room had plenty of space. The room was cleaned and made up everyday and althrough things were a bit dated (which most hotels in Hawaii are) it was very comfortable. Our room was on the 26th floor and faced towards the ocean....BEAUTIFUL! Yes there were buildings obstructing some of the view but other than that it was amazing. The pool area was very bright and sunny most of the day, the bar bq area was really neat and the playground for the kids ideal. This property was perfect for families. Location was perfect to, I never ever felt scared walking around by myself in that area let alone every where I went in Hawaii. I liked it and would for sure stay there someday when I have a family.

I would highly recommend staying at the BANYON, as it is a reasonably priced accomodation for families. Our room was modestly decorated, with two new queen beds, new linens, new carpeting and a very comfortable pull-out sofa bed. The kitchen was clean and well-equipped, and was separated from the living room by a large island and four very tall bar stools, which might be cumbersone for little people - a table and chairs would have been so much easier. Definately workable! A convenience store can be found on the Lobby level and offered a wide range of foods and souveniers as well.The nearest grocery store (food pantry) is three long blocks away and can be accessed easily by a number of buses that pass right by the Banyon. Enjoyed the 6th level of Tower ! and 2, being the recreation level: tennis courts, salt water swimming pool and two very hot (and relaxing) hot tubs. They also offer dining in the form of a picnic area with electric bar-b-ques requiring $2.00 in quarters for 1 hour of service. Snack-bar during daytime hours. EXCELLENT!Transportation to and from ANY ACTIVITY can be found right out the BANYON. theBUS system is $2 for adults and $1 for Seniors to ANYWHERE on the ISLAND with a free transfer of 2.5 hours. We did the Circle Island Tour (4 hrs) for $2 and had a picnic at Sunset Beach, using our transfer to get back on theBus to return home.Hotel staff were above and beyond! Housekeeping bent over backwards to serve us and the cleaniness of our room was greatly appreciated. An Activity counter at the Front desk can arrange tours with a huge supply of brochures, and can recommend sights for you to see. We booked our luau through them (Paradise Cove-exc value).A computer lounge is available to Banyon guests, requiring $9/hr to use, but we were able to easily bank our time and spend our minutes over several days. All in all... highly recommended. Corner units are more spacious and if you get the chance to upgrade to ocean view - do it! It cost us an extra $10/day for an OCEAN view (not a corner unit though) beyond our upgrade that they gave us for having a senior in our party. Next time, we will look for a rental from a private owner... I met a gent who was paying $70/night through a private deal. Or purchase through an Entertainment book (available in all major cities).ps: a great Italian restaraunt is half a block away twoard the beach: Ara-something di Marie... amazing! Aloha! and Enjoy...

We just got back from a week in Tower 1 on the 22nd floor. It was a 5-minute walk to the beach and there were dozens of restaurants and shops within easy walking distance. The Waikiki beach area is very densely populated with high-rise condo and hotel towers everywhere so it was a little intimidating for the first day or two. By the end of the week, though, we had become thoroughly 'urbanized' and really enjoyed all of the things going on and places to go. Our teenagers loved it. The pool deck was very nice with two hot tubs, a 'warm' hot tub, and a 'hot' hot tub. There was also a tennis court but we forgot to bring tennis rackets. The front desk had a basketball, though, that we used on the hoop on the tennis court. Our condo had a view of Diamond head but not the beach but it was still pretty good. Security was good in that there were video cameras scattered around and a safe in the room (which we never bothered to use.) There does not seem to be very much, if any, crime in Waikiki though from what we saw. The sidewalks were filled with pedestrians from morning to night and we never saw any police cars or sirens or anything. Waikiki is a pretty mellow place. There is a little store on the first floor that sells the basics. For other stuff, there was a Foodland four blocks down the street on Kuhio Street that had a pretty good selection. The only complaint is that there was a $.75 charge for every call made from the telephone, even 800 and calling card calls which seems excessive. Good things we did while there: snorkeling in Hanauma Bay (get there before 8:30 am if you want to park), hike to Manoa Falls, Arizona Memorial, snorkeling in Turtle Bay, Kailua beach, and the Dole Pineapple Plantation. Bad things were the Polynesian Cultural Center (the center is great, the luau food was great, but the luau show was dull unless you like to watch pretty girls dressed in burkas) and the small Waikiki beach waves.

We just spent two weeks at the Banyan. I would recommend this condo for any family spending time in Waikiki as eating out 3 times a day can become very expensive. The patio and BBQ's are great on the 6th floor. The pool receives sun most of the day, there is a small convenience store on site and a food vendor in the pool area. Vry good location, close to all amenities. It is not fancy but adequate. I found the room to be clean and staff to be very friendly. The tour desk is excellent in giving suggestions. Security on staff 24 hrs a day. Internet and laundry are available. Many people live in this building year round.

Front desk staff very friendly, nice lobby, good location. Had a one-bedroom condo facing mountain - very pretty view; liked having the full kitchen, but room was horribly outdated, worn out, run down. We had four people and needed to utilized the sofa bed. It was intolerable and we actually ended up sleeping on the disgusting stained floor. Pool deck was very tired as well. Kids area ok. Pool was in the shade most of the day!!

We stayed in tower 2, floor 26 on the corner overlooking both diamond head and the ocean. The view was amazing, although 26 floors up is alittle scary. The room was quite large, but we looked in some of the other (non corner) rooms, and they were quite small. The neighborhood was great, quiet, and easy access to the rest on honolulu. The pool was very busy with children (so if you don't have children, its quite a negative). Something to be warned about. Soon after arriving, I broke out in hives, what we thought was a heat rash. We discovered our last night they were bed bug bites (we found the bugs!) and it was quite gross. We weren't compensated for the inconvience... (it was terrible!) and they didn't offer to move us, in fact, at one point we were accused of bringing them in (which I was offended by) They said they were going to fix the situation after we left, but it didn't help me and my bug bites. A woman I met the next morning had said she had coc roaches in her room, and they said they would remove them after she left, so nothing would be changed for her. So, watch for bugs, cause although its gorgeous, if there's bugs bothering you, they'll do nothing about it!

This was the second time we stayed here within the past year. It is a great place. Both times we had awesome rooms (lots of room for the 5 of us). I like the room we just had over Christmas better because we had an ocean view. The rooms are clean and very spacious (everything you and more). The staff are very friendly and helpful. We will be staying here again when we go in 2007. Great place!!

Just returned from 7 nights starting Dec 21, 2004 at Aston at the Waikiki Banyon and we were very pleased with our ocean view suite on the 28th floor. The staff were excellent and always helpful. The 6th floor barbecues, tennis, pool and hot tub areas were great and the pool towels were very large and looked like they were new. We had two large family barbecue parties and the area was always very clean, with seating area beside it. The kitchen area of our suite was well appointed with full size fridge and stove, a microwave and garburator in the sink. The bedroom and living room areas were comfortably furnished. We received a complimentary newspaper each day and had coin laundry facilities on each floor above the 7th floor. The property is situated close to great restaurants, the beach and good bus services and grocery store. I was also able to attend church services on Christmas Eve two blocks from our hotel and was made to feel very welcome. We would highly recommend this property.

Must have been a fluke with the previous two reviews but this is my second time returning to the Banyan within the last three months. When I booked my first reservation, I had mentioned that I stayed at Aston properities previously and they upgraded my room to an ocean view, had chocolates in my room and nice note from the hotel manager. My second stay, the same thing: received an upgraded room, a great personal note from the manager and complimentary chocolates. My particular room was clean, well decorated and had all the basic needs I was looking for. Staff was friendly and attentive to my needs when I needed them.

ASTON AT THE WAIKIKI BANYAN HOTELLOCATION: Honolulo, OahuREVIEW: Would not stay there again or recommend to others.ROOMS: Unclean. Got some sort of foot infection from the dirty kitchen floor which is still being investigated by doctors.Before I left they had to spray some sort of pest control.Front desk staff unfriendly.

When we first arrived in Honolulu we asked our driver from the airport and one of our tour guides about their opinion of the WB. We didn't receive any rave reiviews, which disappointed me since I had read so many positive reviews before. The lobby was nice with open air setting and koi pond and waterfall.Here are positives from our stay. We did get a room on the 23rd floor with a partial view of the ocean which was nice. Only a couple of blocks from the beach and Kalakaua Ave(lots of shopping).Negatives:The furniture & carpet were outdated, worn. The carpet needed a real good cleaning or be replaced. The same could be said of the bathroom, needing a real good cleaning or renovation.We found a dead roach. We were hoping not to find others and did not.

We enjoyed a wonderful 6 days at the Banyan in June of this year. Our apartment style (condo) accomodation on the 33rd floor with good views of both the ocean and downtown Honolulu was spacious and very clean. The fully equipped kitchen was magnificent and we especially loved the 'Hawaiian' decor throughout the condo. Travelling up and down in the lifts would always take quite some time as they move very slowly. The air conditioning system was quite noisy and we would frequently turn it off for peace and quiet. The staff were efficient, but not particularly friendly, however, we found this to be the case almost everywhere in Waikiki. We would have preferred to stay closer to the beach, the Banyan is a 10 minute walk away, however we left Waikiki with fond memories of our stay at the Banyan.

We have just had ten days at the Waikiki Banyan (Darmic). These are unserviced apartments and were great. Wonderful views, clean and fully equiped. Just like a motel and what a New Zealander would expect. One Block from the beach was a big plus. There was also a lovely pool complex complete with a great barbecue area which was a gathering place for our group in the evenings. Buses were right on the doorstep so getting around was easy. Our hosts were fantastic, but they are Kiwis too so perhaps I am biased.I would recommend this place to fellow travellers who don't want or expect a five star unit but want a comfortable, convenient place to stay.

After reading some of the reviews of the Banyon we were worried as to what we'd find. We were pleased to find a very clean room; no bugs, mold, walls that needed cleaning/repainting, or carpet that needed replacing. It should be noted that we did not go thru Aston for this room (1 bedroom/sofa sleeper in living room and full kitchen), but an agency that operates property in several condos.We found the location within easy walking distance to the sights along Wakiki Beach, although the walk back from Lewers Street took a bit.With the exception of the room needing a splash of color and the A/C unit removing a bit more of the humidity (room was cool enough) we'd go back next trip, especially at less than $100.00/night

We stayed at the Aston Waikiki Banyan from August 13-20, 2004. It was great. We requested a higher-level room per Trip Advisor and received a Mountain View 37th floor one-bedroom unit that was functional and breathtaking. The sunrises are spectacular but also sleep disturbing. Black out curtains would significantly improve the bedroom. The bedroom had sliding doors and there is only one TV on a movable cart for the whole unit. The high rise is just two blocks from the beach. Our kitchen was well equipped, even included a rice cooker, although the refrigerator had a strange smell which we eliminated with a box of baking soda. The pool was small but fun for the kids although it was generally always crowded. The mini-mart in the first floor was surprisingly cheap as far as Honolulu standards. The Astonishing Kids deal saved us a bundle (discounts at Sea Life Park, the Creation Luau and the Dole Pineapple plantation). The bathroom was small but had a separate vanity and sink. The lanai held two chairs. The air conditioning unit in the living room was strong enough to make it too chilly at times despite 90-degree temperatures. The parking attendants were great for directions and the desk staff was always helpful. We encountered a few minor problems that were quickly resolved by the staff (Missing safe key, broken TV remote control, clogged kitchen sink and sticky shower door). The rooms are well insulated, we did not hear a peep from the other rooms or the adjacent elevator shaft. The laundry facilities are limited, just one washer and dryer per floor, precluding multi loads, but it was always available when I needed it.

We stayed here at Waikiki Banyan for a week, May 29 - June 5, 2004. I highly recommend the hotel. We got 2 one-bedroom condos on the 34th floor with ocean-views. The view was excellent and we could see the city and diamond head. We were located on the corner of tower 2 and had no problems. The only drawbacks of the place was no ice machines and the tv had very few stations (not even Disney or AMC!). We were close to the beach and night entertainment. The house cleaners were very friendly and came daily. Please email me if you want more information about our experience.

We arrived at the Banyan from New York on June 4 2004. Were were in Tower 1 on the 29th floor. The room met all our expectations and it was good to have a self contained kitchen so we could cook in if we wanted. We had a view of the ocean and happily sat on our balcony most evenings and enjoyed the view.Our room was serviced daily and was presented very well and was very clean.The Banyan was well appointed being only a 5 minute walk to the ocean and shops etc. We would certainly recommend it to anyone wishing to have a clean,close place to stay.

My wife and i stayed in Tower 1, 11th floor. We arrived June 5-10. We would not stay there again, Roaches all over the room and kitchen area. They sprayed the room. The cleaning lady went through my luggage everyday and items were missing. Management was not to concerned, Aston Resorts customer relations sent me a letter saying sorry. This place is a dump compared to other resorts. I recommend Prince Kuhio accross the street or if you cn afford it, Hilton Hawaiian Village.

The Aston Waikiki Banyon was great! Great rooms. Everything was tidy when we got there. Great location - close to the beach, shopping strip, and the mountains. The kitchenette was really good too. Had a lot of utensils and cooking pots. The only things that lack was the little things. Such as room service. That took awhile or nobody came to our room when asked to. Housekeeping was good though. What wasn't that great was that if you accidentally broke something (eg: plate) the charge was ridiculous!! it was over $40 USD for a plate!!But other than that, highly recommended, especially for families and groups of friends!!

We just returned from an 8-day stay at the Aston Waikiki Banyan and had a great time! Not only was the 1-bedroom unit spacious, it was clean, well maintained, and properly kept up by housekeeping during our 8 days in residence. Being a corner unit, we had even more space than units that were not corner situated. We did not intend to reserve a corner unit, but we were very glad to receive one! Also, we were told that the unit would have 1 queen size bed and 1 queen size sleeper sofa. To our surprise, we had a king size bed and a king size sleeper sofa! Plus a kitchen large enough to prepare full meals, well stocked with virtually every gadget you would want, from a microwave oven to a coffee maker. All the little kitchen implements were present, too. The 35th floor had a breath-taking view of the mountains and Diamond Head, which we woke up to every morning on the large lanai. The recreation deck on the 6th floor had a large heated pool, a nice size children's play area and elaborate play structure, lighted tennis courts, and a really great bar-b-que area that was spotlessly clean. Furthermore, the lobby was an interesting open-air entrance space that blended into the courtyard and street environment with a large koi pond and waterfall. For the money we spent we could not have gotten finer lodging accommodations in Waikiki. Very pleased with the property, the staff, and the unit itself. I would definitely recommend this property to others!

We have just arrived home after spending our holiday at the Banyan, we were there for 9 days with two teenage boys June 04. We first read the user reviews of the Banyan before we left and were a bit worried what to expect but were pleasantly suprised at what we recieved. Yes the room had a little wear and tear but was clean and well presented. The staff were excellent and housekeeping did a wonderful job whilst we were there. The Mini mart had a good selection and the prices were in some cases better (bread, milk) than the Food Pantry a few blocks away. The Banyan is only a block from the beach, a very easy walk. The recreation area was excellent as our boys used it alot and the pool or though not huge was more than adequate. We found the kitchen to be a big plus but it didn't stop us eating out as well, as there is plenty of eateries only a few blocks away. We didn't find walking a few blocks to get to anything a problem but the local transport was always there when you needed something to get you further at a good price, $2 to most places by Trolleys or "The Bus". Overall our Holiday was one to remember and we won't hesitate to recomend it to anyone.

Memories of the summer of '2000, everything within a short walking distance, and at a great price for a family of five. From our 23rd floor room, we had a great view of the ocean front and surrounding areas of Waikki. Were going back for summer '2004.

We just returned after spending 10 days at the Aston Waikiki Banyan. Had a room on the 34th floor with spectacular views of the mountains, city and partial ocean. We took two teenagers with us and the hotel is located in a great position.. one block from the beach. The kids had a blast... they enjoyed the surf and all the excitment of Waikiki. Also loved the full kitchen and the BBQ's so we could grill fresh fish etc. etc. Definitely recommend this facility for families.

My friends and I stayed there the last week of May 2004. We were completely satisfied. If you are looking for the Ritz, by all means shell out the bucks for the hotels on the beach. If you are looking for decent accomedations at a moderate price this is a great place to stay! The staff was very courteous and helpful. The room was large and had a kitchen with all the necessities. The room also has a safe. This place is only one block to the beach and close to several fast food places if you don't feel like cooking. The recreation deck was great. There is also a convienence store on the premise that had all the little necessities we needed to pick up along the way. I would definately recommend this place and would come again. It would be a great place to stay for families!
Nice room well equiped, loved the pool area and BBQ, met some real nice people.

We stayed at the Banyan in April 2004 for 10 days. I had some reservations about booking here due to a couple poor reviews I had read. My fears were for the most part, unfounded, as our stay at the Banyan was just fine. The rooms are spacious with full kitchens and a pull-out couch - great for people traveling with young kids such as us. Our room was minimally furnished and seemed not to have been updated since the 70's. It was pretty clean, however. While not on the beach, it is a quick 5-minute walk to the closest beach, with breakers - again, great for the kids. Our one complaint was the maid service which was unreliable. Some days, the cleaning person didn't show up until 5 PM or so and on a couple occasions, didn't show at all. It was great to have laundry machines on our floor... we were on the 34th floor with a gorgeous mountain view. While this hotel is definately not the Ritz, we found our accommodations to be quite adequate for a young family such as ours. No frills - but clean - my biggest thing. I would stay at the Banyan again.

We were at the Aston Banyon for 16 days last Christmas / New Year break and found the location great, the staff excellent and the room more than adequate for the money. We went to the food store only 3 blocks away and had a roast turkey dinner in our own condo for Christmas and had a great steak bbq down at pool level. The pool area was great for the kids and they were there every morning at 8 am while my wife and I read the supplied paper and had fresh Hawiian orange juice on the balcony looking out at the pool area and the ocean only one block away.  We met some people who were staying at the hotel between us and the beach and went a couple of times to their room and although the hotel was more plush, they only had two queen beds and a small bar fridge and were paying $130 US per day more than us, they also had a nicer pool with a bar but the draft beer alone was $5 US per glass. I found that we were all glad to get back to our "home" at the Banyon which was much more kid friendly. We can hardly wait until we are able to return to the beautiful city of Honolulu and will be staying at the Aston Banyon and hope to get room 1225 again.

Our family of 7, (ages 7-74) stayed at the Waikiki Banyan in April of 2004. We used the Entertainment Book, so got the 3 rooms at 50 percent off the regular rate. We were very pleased with the condition of the rooms, even on the 7th and 8th floors in Tower-1 we had views of Diamond Head or partial of the ocean. We stayed here because of its proximity to the 'kid's beach' and the Banyan's own pool. The rooms were kept clean, the beds were made and towels changed daily. Its not a five-star hotel so don't expect a macadamia nut on your pillow every night! But for those on a budget or with kids, I'd recommend it! The only downside of the trip had nothing to do with the hotel. We had reserved a limo with The Cab company and it never showed to take us to the airport and we almost missed our flight home.

Just got back from Honolulu and I'm a little dissatisfied with the accomodations at the Waikiki Banyon. Maybe I was on the tower that hasn't been renovated yet, but the room I stayed at was horrible. It looked like it was 50 years old. The paint was peeling from the walls, there were scratches everywhere, and the carpet was a complete mess. There were stains everywhere. To the staffs credit they cleaned it immediatley after I complained about it. It looked better, but still pretty nasty. Another thing was the smell. Apparently we got stuck in a smoking room and it wreaked. We asked to move to non-smoking but they didn't have any available, so they put an Ozone machine in the room that they said would clear the smell. It didn't work. Overall I thought the room was just dirty, I wouldn't dare walk around bare-footed in that room even after they cleaned the carpet. However I thought the staff was great, they really tried to make it better. Fortunately we didn't spend much time in the room so we were abel to tough it out.

Stayed at the Banyan in July 2002. Nice hotel for the price. We had booked a room at the Pacific Monarch and confirmed it the day before leaving and were pretty disappointed when we got there and they didn't have a room. The Pacific Monarch transfered us to the Aston at the Waikiki Banyan. We found the room to be clean and roomy. The barbeque area was nice but they were renovating at the time so that was kind of inconvenient. Nice pool. The check in staff were pleasant. For the money this hotel is great. The location is a bit out of the way as you have to walk a bit to get to the International Market Place area, but the beach is only 1 long block away.

We were a family of five and stay at the Aston from Dec.31,2003 intil Jan.6.2004. I loved the room we had on the 26th floor and had an awesome veiw of the beach and Daimond Head. The only thing we were disappointed in was that it rained the first two days there. But my kids still enjoyed the pool even in the rain. Everyone was great and when the sun came out Hawaii was like a peace of Heaven on earth. We were only a 3 min. walk to the beach and the hotel was easy to find driving. We had rented our own car. I did not find the garage that hard and just purchased a week pass for $30.00 . It was fun exploring the island and we saved allot of money on meals having a kitchen in our room. We will be staying at the Aston at the Waikiki Bayon again!

We went to Hawaii in October 2003 and we found the Banyan to have a lot of pluses. The renovations look great, they double up-graded to an ocean view. The little mini-mart didn't look like much but their prices were as good as FoodLand's. The deck was great. Tennis, basketball, playground, BBQ's and a big pool. Oh yes, the pool, the only really down fall. The security was so strict at the pool that the sign should have read, "No Fun Allowed". But for my dollar I got a great deal and we say thanks.

We were Four Families traveling together. There were 17 all together kids ages ranging from 7-18yrs. We had 4 rooms with great views. We were there for Christmas and stayed right thru till New Years weekend. It was great! The kids were able to go to the pool and the playground area. We were able to go down and have a cook out and have a birthday party for one of the kids. We really felt as if we lived there for 16 days. We had maid service every day. Our kitchen was great we had home cooked meals in our room which saved us a great deal of money. We shopped at a grocery store out side of town where it was cheaper and even signed up for their bonus card. The really only complaint that we could think of was that there was no resturant in the hotel. But, we did know that before hand. Which come to think of it may have saved us more money. I would with out a doubt stay there again.

I have stayed at the Aston Waikiki Banyan every year for the past 3 years. I totally recommend this place, especially for families. They have a really great pool area, tennis and BBQ. The rooms were clean and provided everything you needed to prepare your meals. I take a group of High School graduates every year and they love it! Bathrooms are little small, but still a fantastic deal! One year during renovation it was a little distracting, but still an awesome place to stay.

For our honeymoon, we decided to get a room with a kitchen at the Banyan, as we were staying in Waikiki for 12 nights. They did give us 2 nights free and a fairly good rate. We arrived late in the evening and were given a mountain view room )which was really shabby) when we had paid for an ocean view. On relocating, the room we were in was not alot better. There was stained and worn shag pile carpet, an incredibly noisy air con unit, stained sofas and sheets on the bed which did not fit, so they came untucked all of the time. We left a note for the maid to change the sheets and we ended up with sheets which were still too small and with rips in them.The other problem was the curtains did not block out any light, so at approximately 6:15 am every morning the sun streamed through and we were wide awake every morning.The pool was OK, but the area was being renovated so for most of the day there was someone drilling on the hotels lanais.In all, I would never stay here again and would not recommend it, even for families. On complaining to Aston, I got the standard "we will pass your comments on and advise you in due course." I am still waiting after 12 months.....

We were absolutely thrilled with our accommodation at the Waikiki Banyan. The rooms have been refurbished (hey, even the sofa bed was comfortable!), and was kept clean and neat by a friendly housekeeping staff. Having a full kitchen in the suite certainly helps to cut down on expenses. Close to everything. Front desk staff very helpful. The VIP Aloha Tour desk (located at the front desk) was most useful for booking outings/tours. We couldn't have been more pleased, and will certainly stay at the Waikiki Banyan on all future trips to Hawaii. We highly recommend this family-friendly hotel!

We had a one-bedroom suite on the 29th floor with an awesome view of the ocean and the city. The room was clean and well maintained. The bellhop was pretty slow when we arrived and we lugged our bags ourselves. The desk clerks were very helpful and friendly. I prefer staying directly on the beach, but for a place to stay, it was pretty nice.

This place is a dump. Cleanliness is a major problem. The carpet was stained and dirty, and the ceilings were stained from water leaks. I stayed there because of the kitchen and family room, but it certainly wasn't worth it. We had to cover the couch cushions to set on them. Whatever you do don't stay on one of the lower floors - the sound of the busy street corner below will keep you awake all night. The lobby was being remodeled - what was done looked pretty good. I honestly cannot say anything good about the room. One of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at.
